Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: crockyphil
Reviews.Content: We certainly chose the right hotel for my partner's birthday week! Location is as good as it gets, wonderful terrace for breakfast - in glorious March sunshine - comfortable rooms, and extremely helpful staff. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartineVei
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after seeing the reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel is very nice, looks like a private mansion. The room was neat, quiet and functional. A complimentary bottle of sparkling wine was waiting for us over ice, which is a very nice attention. The bathroom is small but clean. I missed a coffee machine or at least a boiler for tea. The breakfast food was great; A lot of choice, pastries, fresh fruits, eggs and bacon, cheese and ham. Several type of juice. The staff is very nice, serving you coffee, hot chocolate or cappucino. We had a drink to the bar, but did not ask for the room service (food). There is no restaurant per se in the hotel. The terrace is great, the view is beautiful. There was several good restaurants around, not too expensive and friendly staffed. The hotel is situated just a few minutes walk from the coliseum, and the metro station is just across the street (from the coliseum). We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. the staff is very helpful and caring. We appreciated the warm welcome and felt like in a friend's house.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first anniversary weekend and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I had told the hotel in advance that it was our anniversary and we got a bottle of proseco sent to our room from the management on arrival stating have a great anniversary. The breakfast choices were great and varied each day. The location is virtually on top of the colosseum and you can see this from one of the roof terraces. To be able to eat breakfast inside or out and utilize the roof terrace after a busy day of sightseeing is great and a rare treat in most city breaks. Our room was a lovely size with alegre comfy bed and free wifi. The staff are all very helpful and friendly - especially the staff in the breakfast room who helped families and couples alike. There are many cities in the world still to see but if we came back to Rome or knew friends who were coming we would happily advise this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel for a Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lungipiedi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is named after its side street very close to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum and Palatine. It is handy for the Colloseo Metro station and convenient bus and tram routes across the city. A taxi rank is nearby. The hotel is elegant, stylish and the room was spacious, clean and well appointed. The beds were very comfortable and the temperature was well-controlled. The street is unusually quiet for Rome and the hotel was also free from noise. The breakfast room is on the top floor with a terrazzo giving fine views towards the Colosseum and beyond. The breakfast buffet was abundant and excellent. The hotel reception staff are friendly, helpful, notably multilingual and have deep local knowledge. They very readily telephoned ahead to attractions to see about opening times and tickets and had suggestions for alternatives. There are at least three good local restaurants within three hundred metres so there is no need to return to the city centre to dine out. The hotel is elegantly Roman and caters well for Italians and visitors without being touristical. The district is refined and not at all crowded, with genuine local facilities such as restaurants and the farmacia. My wife and I very much enjoyed our stay and would like to come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra247Chorley
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed for 4 nights at the Capo d'Africa after a lot of research on my part and helped by the great reviews on Trip Advisor...... we wasn't disappointed. I had booked through Expedia as this gave us the best price for the Hotel,Flights and Transfers. It is easy to get either the bus or train from Fiumicino Airport but as my Mum is 81 I knew it would be more comfortable if I booked a shared return transfer. On arriving at the hotel in the afternoon a Twin Room which we requested wasn't available until the following day, however they put a spare bed in a Double Room for us and we were happy with that. The following morning we headed for the Coliseum, I had already pre-booked one ticket for myself as Mum was entitled to free entry, you collect the free ticket when you get there just remember to take ID with you. When we got back to the hotel late afternoon our twin room was ready for us. The room was a great size, as was the bathroom, with a bath and overhead power shower, plus toiletries, bathrobes and slippers, brilliant mattresses, we were at the front of the hotel practically on the ground floor, there was a little noise disturbance but only on a couple of mornings when the dustbin men were doing their rounds which is to be expected especially if like me you sleep with the window open!! The 4th floor breakfast room was extremely welcoming and bright and we sat and had our breakfast on the terrence on a couple of occasions, the food was brilliant, all fresh and always being replenished, and you couldn't ask for a more welcoming atmosphere from the staff and a great start to your day. We found ALL the hotel staff extremely helpful and knowledgeable, they were all very solicitous especially to my mother and were very concerned when I had hurt my foot and provided me with an ice pack. The decor of the hotel is modern, bright and contemporary and extremely well maintained and clean. It is few minutes walk away from the Coliseum and either Metro Line, there are plenty of restaurants within a few minutes walk which are authentic and unspoilt by mass tourism. I would most definitely stay at the Capo d'Africa again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: oscarspet
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 3 nights in April & we were pleasantly suprised with this little gem. The staff were very helpful & friendly and the rooms were just right. We booked the Ancient Rome walking tour via the hotel web site, & this was the highlight of our trip.Our guide was great & as it was just the 6 of us, it was a highly informative experience - well worth the cost. The staff at the front desk recommended local places to eat & each one was better than the previous. I highly recommend this little treasure for a short break, but avoid the night illumination tour - it was terrible - the windows on the coach were so badly fogged up due to broken seals, that you could not see a thing & when we left the tour early & complained, they did not really care at all. On saying that, Rome is a fantastic city and Capo D'Africa a true find.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel Service, Clean and Attractive”
Reviews.Author: LeeAuburn
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 4 nights during our Italy vacation. We were very pleased with most all aspects of our stay. The front desk staff were all very friendly upon arrival and helpful during our stay. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was one of the highlights of the hotel. The variety of options for breakfast were plentiful and the service staff in the breakfast terrace were phenomenal. They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Breakfast was included in our room rate so there was no additional charge. The one thing that did not go as planned was that when we arrived we were not able to get a room with twin beds for our kids as requested. They only had a double bed that was adjacent to our room. This was a slit disappointment but we got over it. Otherwise, our stay at d'Africa was great. Wifi is available in rooms at no charge which was great for us. Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: snowbiz100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 2012. Its a very nice, newer hotel in a quiet neighborhood with an excellent staff. Breakfast was excellent, the rooms are comfortable, There is a bar in the lobby that seems to be open at all hours for a drink or a light snack. The hotel recommended " Il Bocconcino" for dinner ( Via Ostilia, 23- 00184). It was excellent. It was casual and the service and food were very good. We strayed from their recommendation one evening ( ate at one of the nearby restaurants, where are always hawking from the street) and were sorry we did. OK, but overpriced food plus a charge for bread! They offer a great fitness center. The location is a few blocks from the Coliseum, however its not central. You need to take a cab or metro to get to the Vatican or attactions in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in an Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: Kerrytravelagent
Reviews.Content: I had looked at about 10 hotels before i finally decided on the Capo. I am so glad i did as it was out of this world. Such a great hotel in a brill location that really made our trip to Rome. Quick tip to anyone who is going to Rome and doesnt want to pay the 40 Euro transfer fee that some tour operators charge. Dont pay it. When you land in FCO it is so easy to get into the city centre. There is the train which takes only 30 mins and costs 14 Euros each way or the Coach costs 4 Euros each way! If you are doing the coach make sure you book a return at the same time so you get it at 8 Euros as if you just do the single for 4 Euros it will cost you 6 Euros to get back to airport!! The coach takes about an hour but it is a nice jorney and you get to see lots of Rome as it arrives into Termini. When we arrived into Termini we just hopped onto the metro which was two stops away from the Colosseum and cost us 1 Euro Each! Brilliant! When you walk out of the Colosseum metro stop you are right opposite the Colosseum and about three minutes walk away from the hotel. The hotel is located on Capo D'Africa street and is very close to about ten restuarants which are very well priced and have great menus. The hotel has a lovely reception area and the staff were brill when i checked in. They even gave us a map and pointed out all the tourist sites etc and explained how to get to them all. The Room didnt have an amazing view but the room itself was fantastic. Clean, Modern and had a lovely robe with slippers. The bed was great and very comfertable. The bathroom was a great size and again very clean. Another tip for Rome, Make sure you book your attraction tickets to avoid the long queues! If anyone has any questions on which ones to book etc and what to do please just send me a message and i will happily help you. I booked the Colosseum, Hop On Hop Off and Vactican City. The hotel breakfast is worth every penny and has a lot of choice and is very well presented. The morning staff were just as good as the recpetion staff. Overall a brill hotel and have now sold it to three of my customers and i am sure they will enjoy it just as much as i did.

Reviews.Title: “Best (city) hotel I know!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other city hotels in Europe before, including in Rome, and Hotel Capo d'Africa is the best one so far. When I return to this wonderful city (for the third time; I simply must), I'll definitely stay at this hotel again! The location - near the Colosseum and metro 'Colosseo' - is excellent: the Forum, the Palatine Hill, the Colosseum, the Basilica di San Clemente, San Giovanni in Laterano, Piazza Venezia, Piazza Campidoglio, etc. are within walking distance and almost all other sites in Rome can easily be accessed by metro or bus. Moreover, the staff at Capo d'Africa are very friendly (both the receptionists and the breakfast staff), helpful and speak more than enough English. Breakfast is great as well and the rooms are extremely spacious, clean and comfortable. There are also a lot of great places to eat in the neighbourhood, e.g. the fabulous Naumachia Ristorante.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Christopher G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new, nicely done, with spacious rooms, fast wifi, and a nice location. It is very near the Colosseum of course, but don't miss the lovely little Parco Celio at the top of the hill, full of children playing, elderly strollers, young lovers, and gorgeous trees. The breakfast buffet is good, with very nice fresh fruit and real scrambled eggs, albeit somewhat limited in variety, but the rooftop terrace is lovely. The gym is one of the most spacious I've seen, and deserted, with good equipment, but again, a bit limited. The staff is very good and on hand 24 hours/day. As others have noted there are many restaurants tucked away on nearby streets. I have only one very minor complaint, which was the shower/bath was a bit dark and a little cramped. But I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service on a side street near many sights.”
Reviews.Author: Sharksss13
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, comfortable hotel, with a relatively large room by European standards. The bathroom was clean and modern. The bed was comfortable and on the firm side. Excellent blackout curtains. One downside on the rooms is the lack of a do not disturb sign. They use an electronic indicator, triggered by a light switch. But if you leave it on after you leave for the day, the hotel staff assumes you did so by accident and services the room anyway. The staff is extremely friendly and responsive, and the speak English relatively well down to the bell hops. The breakfasts that everyone raves about in these reviews was, in fact, a very nice continental breakfast. It is also not included in the room charge and there is no sign up telling you that. So enjoy the lovely rooftop, outdoor dinning, but keep in mind it will show up on your bill. For us, it was certainly worth it and was a very pleasant way to start the day. The hotel is situated on a quiet side street near the colosseum. While not a pretty neighborhood, it's a safe area, free of tourists. We walked almost everywhere from this central location, although there is a subway stop about 15 minutes away. We unexpectedly discovered that the hotel is near several gay bars (a few blocks away). This may be an added value for a same sex couple. We would certainly stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near ancient Rome and lots of good local restuarants yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: AileeLongnoUK
Reviews.Content: Stylish with helpfully staff Local restaurants which were recommended were reasonable authentic and good quality. Good location for ancient city but in a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful staff, great breakfast and location!”
Reviews.Author: JBennett29
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right near the Colosseum and two metro line stops are in easy walking distance. There are lots of nice restaurants near by too. The rooms are simple, clean and have to amenities you would expect from a 4* hotel. It was great that the housekeeping staff came twice a day while we were there, morning and evening. Breakfast is also great, wide selection and something for most people. The terrace is also a really nice spot in the evenings. Staff were really helpful and recommended places to eat and offered really good directions. Would recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in good location”
Reviews.Author: Goodsy
Reviews.Content: We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to friends family etc. pristinely clean, attractive rooms, staff so friendly and helpful. breakfast buffet just the job, with really broad ranging choice of fruits, breads, meats, cheeses, cakes etc. If you're a mega fan of cooked bfast was same trio of scrambled, bacon and mini hotdogs, but really the rest of the choice is sooo good you may be converted! Room on 3rd floor a good size, quiet, comfy and roomy enough. 2mins walk from colloseum and good selection of bars, cafes and restaurants. Think may find this place hard to beat without paying out a lot more money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish, modern. Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: nytemare1979
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the Colosseum in a nice neighbourhood with great restaurants. The hotel itself was clean with great amenities and excellent front desk and concierge service. Breakfast spread was wonderful, and if it wasn't winter it would be a perfect location to enjoy a start to your day with a beautiful view. The hotel is also located outside the ZTL which makes getting to and from it easy for travellers driving to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “January Trip”
Reviews.Author: Stephen M M
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel, situated close to the colleseum and forum. The best thing about the hotel is its distance from the touristic rome. Nearby are many restaurants, which have beautiful food, wine and service but you simply feel you are in a typical quarter of town. The hotel itself its perfectly maintained with lovely staff. Enjoying a breakfast - with a newspaper - cafe au lait - beautiful views and brilliant service is a real treat. I'll look forward to my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Chris E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon, and was blown away by the Hotel. The breakfast is great and the room was well presented and very big. All of the staff are friendly and welcoming. Location wise this Hotel is fantastic as it is righ next to the colisseum. Thank you for making the trip extra special

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in this great city.”
Reviews.Author: SteveNorthampton.UK
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself, along with four other couples stayed here for a friends birthday celebrations. So we didn't choose the hotel. But we are glad our friend did. Just three or four minutes walk from the Colisseum up a quiet side street, it's a very modern looking building in an historic city. The reception / bar area is very clean and tidy in both appearance and design. Although the bar appears to close not long after midnight. But the Irish Bar just down the road certainly doesn't!! Our room (212) was directly opposite the lift doors. But not once did we hear anybody making any noise. Or even the lift doors opening. The room was a good size, and featured the most comfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel. If I was to give a bad mark. Then it would be for the lack English speaking channels on the TV. Just CNN and Sky News. I'm not sure if the Porno's were in English, or just contained grunts and groans. A decent sized bathroom had a sower over the bath, a toilet, and a decent are with wash basin and mirrors. Breakfast is taken on the top floor (the fourth). From where you can actually see the top levels of the Colliseum. When we were there it was very busy around 9am, and this menat some folks had to wait for a table to become available. But the food was very good and varied. There is a terrace area outside of the breakfast room. On a warm summers evening this would be a lovely spot for a drink or two after a tiring day in one of the worlds great cities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Patrick P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels in Rome. The Capo D'Africa was far superior (the other hotel was Radisson Blu). Room size was very large by Rome standards. Our room had a king size bed that was very comfortable. Hotel was clean, modern and staff was very friendly/helpful with perfect english. Location is great - really close to Colosseum with lots of good restaurants nearby (try il Boccocino just around the corner for great service and awesome food - no english menu but they will explain everything on the menu). Close to the subway, making it easy to get around to all the attractions. It is also in a good neighbourhood that is very quiet at night - we slept with windows open. They provided a beautiful crib for our 9 month old. Morning breakfast was beautiful on the outdoor roof top terrace overlooking the Colosseum - although the staff thought we were crazy since it was "Winter" (more like Spring for us)... coffee was very good (compared to the crap we drink in Canada!) Only complaint is that we had to leave. Stay here - you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern clean great location but just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworldcs
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked the hotel. I really can't complain about it except it is a little pricey and I like going to smaller more intimate hotels. But you won't be disappointed here and the breakfast is the BEST I've had anywhere in Rome if that is important to you. I was there for Easter last year and they served a wonderful Easter breakfast/brunch and most was baked on location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and stay”
Reviews.Author: Brusselsdude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend in Novemeber for a weekend. I was very happy with our choice. It was just around the corner from the Colosseum and the Forum, and only a 20 minute walk to Piazza Navonna. As there is a metro stop at the Colosseum, it is quite easy to go to the Spanish steps and the Vatican. The service was excellent and the room was clean. I would have no objections to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: geordieboy58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this wonderful, well located hotel in July 2011, on the recommendation of my best friend, who had stayed here previously. Well, he was spot on the money with his recommendation. The room was modern, clean and tastefully decorated. The staff were most obliging, attentive and friendly, willing to assist in any way possible. We enjoyed a tasty breakfast each morning on the rooftop, the waiting staff also being keen to please. From our hotel we were able to walk to all locations in Rome, excepting St Peter's Basilica. Nearby restaurants abound, offering a range of quality offerings at a moderate cost. When we return to Rome, our hotel choice has already been made. In fact, my son and his fiance plan to stay at Capo D'Africa later this year while on their honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with staff to match”
Reviews.Author: cathtom
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early (10.00am) but were met with a charming helpful receptionist who gave us plent of information about getting round Rome, tours and a map of Rome. We were shown to our room with no comment (as we have found is usual) about check in times are 2.00pm. I agree with other reviewers that the rooms are small but spotless with a lovely bathroom, towells and products first class. The breakfast was far better than expected with both hot and cold buffet. Even better than the excellent breakfast were the staff who could not do enough for you. As it was my husband's birthday a bottle of complimentary Champagne arrived in our room on his birthday along with an English newspaper which was a lovely touch. This hotel is a bit of a walk from the main attractions but that is the only negative thing that we could say about it. One of (my husband's) best finds in Rome was the bar just down the road from the hotel call "Treefolk's" where they serve real ale - Thornbridge Kipling the week we were there which was excellent. Two restaurants in the vacinity which were also excellent Papagio (almost next door) excellent fish and pasta and (recommended by Treefolk's) Li Rioni Santi quattro (via SS Quattro) fab stone baked pizzas and inexpensive (27 euro 2 large pizzas and wine). We would certainly go back to this hotel and recommend it especially for its customer service - thanks for making our first visit to Rome so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Me and my girl over new year had a great break!”
Reviews.Author: JamesKathryn
Reviews.Content: After reading the most recent reviews and looking at the website we decided to book for three nights over the new year, review as follows; On arrival the receptionist was brilliant, we didn't get her name but She was so helpful, as novices to Rome she helped with the sights to see and handy hints for travel around the city. Now, we are thirties And didn't mind walking to the centre and beyond (even the Vatican is just over a hours walk), this hotel is slightly out of the way but check it out on the map where the colosseum is beforehand in relation to other attractions and don't moan afterwards!! The room was quite small with a not so great view but really clean and both me and my lady loved the fact that the staff came and turned your bed down before you returned in the evening or in our case late night! We are not the moaning type of people and just get on with things but if we did have a few negative points then; Kathryn said the hair dryer in the room was poor! The shower was not hot in the morning or it seemed at peak times And one morning we had to queue for breakfast for a few minutes because the terrace was not open and the breakfast room is small for the number of rooms (I assume this is not an issue in warmer climate) but breakfast and the staff were good. Overall if we were to go back to Rome then I would stay here again as we liked the hotel and location, for the price I think that it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern hotel, tastefully furnished, very close to the Colosseum. Great location - really convenient but on a quiet side road with some nearby restaurants. Comfortable rooms - we were welcomed with a bottle of local sparkling wine and shown to the room by a very friendly porter. The breakfast room on the roof has a nice open air terrace for the Summer - not a great attraction in December. The breakfasts were simple but pleasant. The 'hop on, hop off' bus recommended at the reception was poor - certainly by far the least frequent of the three available, all of which ran the same route at the same cost. Check out took an age, while the receptionist studiously avoided us for over 5 minutes to sell tours to a recent arrival. His manner was less than helpful, bordering on downright surly - this took a little of the shine off what had otherwise been a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location andtaff”
Reviews.Author: abacohen
Reviews.Content: all was good and had a great trip great location and helpfull staff

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel,location and staff”
Reviews.Author: RuthSJ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights here in a Delux room. The hotel is amazingly clean, décor is modern luxury, rooms have everything you need. The quality of the toiletries are excellent, and include things you don't normal get like face toner and make up remover. Bed was extremely comfortable! Breakfast great. The hotel is so quiet at night you cannot here a thing, which considering the traffic in Rome is a massive plus. The location we found to be perfect - 2 minute walk from the Colosseum so right in the heart of things in the old town. We explored all other areas and were very glad we stayed here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. In the local area are several Pizzerias, and we only ever ate good food. Can especially recommend Naumachia round the corner for excellent value food and great atmosphere. If and when we go back to Rome we won't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect rome weekend trip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cenk O
Reviews.Content: Was there a couple of years ago. Only a few minutes away from the colosseum. Very clean and modern hotel. Breakfast on the top floor was just excellent. The street, despite being so central was quite at night, didn't hear a thing at night in the room. Friendly staff. Taxis had no trouble at all finding this hotel. Only good things to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: happytrails94
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. My room was large, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The location was good, easy to find and get around the city. I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Halkidiki44
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Rome and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Capo d'Africa. We received a cheery greeting on arrival at reception, were shown to a lovely large room (204) by a very smiley chappy and then we had a very well prepared room service meal. We were even given a free bottle of bubbly to have with it. The room, indeed the hotel, was very clean and comfortable. There is free wi-fi around the hotel and in our room. All we had to do was ask for the code at reception. Breakfast was in a light and airy room with terraces either side. The choice was very good and, once again, the staff were great - attentive without being intrusive. The location of the hotel is perfect for visiting the Colosseum, the ruins and heading into the city for some shopping. We walked about 28-32 miles over the two and a half days we were there, as we wanted to take in the atmosphere of the place. By doing that, we found some smaller independent shops and good cafes. There's a particularly good restaurant near to the hotel (Martini's - see separate review) and we made the most of it on our way back in the evenings. The Capo d'Africa is a great place to stay in a good location. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days in November, 2011. Rooms are large, spotlessly clean, nice amenities, and the hotel is within walking distance to the Colosseum, many inexpensive neighborhood restaurants, grocery stores, post office, ATM, etc. Wi-fi free in breakfast dining area, terrace, and large lobby/bar. The buffet breakfast offers a large choice of foods, or you can order room service. The hotel can arrange tours and private guides to suit your preferences. We were set up with an excellent private guide, Silvia, for a tour of the Vatican and St. Peter's. I highly recommend Silvia if you need a guide for any of the sights in and around Rome. The staff at the hotel are very kind (especially the breakfast staff) and really go out of their way to be helpful and make sure you are well taken care of. There is a nice bar in the lobby area. I would highly recommend Capo d'Africa and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Forum”
Reviews.Author: Mazda5Sue
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel sited within 5 minutes walk of the Colosseum. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a bath with shower over. There is a pleasant bar area. The breakfast room was light and airy: dual aspect. It had an outdoor terrace which was available on the first morning of our stay when the weather was dry and sunny. The breakfast buffet had plenty of choice and was replenished regularly. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The area around the hotel has a choice of bars and places to eat but it is not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights under a program "The Best Years of our Lives". When I booked this, I emailed them and called them to request that since I was a light sleeper could they please book me a room that was quiet. I also asked for a non smoking room which I did get. I live in the USA so this was not a cheap call but I wanted to make sure of my request. So what did I get? A first floor room on the street in front and overlooking 4 garbage dumpsters. Now I get go back to the front desk as ask for help but this was the same group that when I asked about the package they gave me this; Web site stated this Under The Best Years of our Lives you were to get this package; The rate includes: 2 tickets valid for the Archeobus tourist bus, to discover Rome a new prospective 15% off on the Best Available Rate when booking (BAR) Complimentary Room-service breakfast for 2 people An upgrade to a Deluxe room depending on availability at the check-in time Vat and service So what did I get? They had no bus tickets and told me to book my own tour, I of course had to pay for that. In room service breakfast, they don't do that anymore. I also asked about the free glass of wine coupon I was told about in a email, I had a copy with me, they don't do that either. I paid for an upgrade to a deluxe already, so there was nothing there but I got the 15% off for only two nights not three. So what did I learn? Well the garbage dumpsters, smell all the time, they get used almost all night long and they get emptied on Sunday between 6:30 and 8:30 AM Added bonus as that it was just below a street light that was so bright you could lay in bed a get a tan. When we checked in, they told me they charged my credit card for the full stay. So what did I do? I lived what it but you do not have to. There are lots of good hotels in Rome, just do not expect much with this one. Now before everyone claims I was rude or something and thats why I got what I got. I travel a lot, I am a million mile customer with one of the airlines. Being rude gets you nothing. I lived with it Now the hotel is clean, the breakfast is very good and the breakfast staff is very friendly and I got a bottle of bubbly. Thats my story, good luck out there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable with friendly professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Wombatsmum
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a long weekend - lovely modern decor - clean in all areas, nice bar and lounge area and really good breakfast included. Friendly, helpful staff, the hotel provided a bottle of bubbly as it was a celebration weekend. The location is close (2-3 blocks) from the coliseum, & palatine hill and one block from San Clemente church. The area is quiet in the evening but there are one or two nice restaurants close by, otherwise a longish walk/short taxi ride back into the centre. We quite liked the fact we were away from the tourist traps in the evening but in warmer weather it may be nicer to be in the centre for an evening stroll. A couple of negatives - we had to move room because we were next to the breakfast room initially and were woken up by clattering plates at 7am - staff were impeccable when handling this request. Our first room also had the tiniest of wardrobes - not enough room to hang clothes for two people for one weekend- there was a full size wardrobe in the second room but the shower wasn't as powerful. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an excellent location with very attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: LiviCarr
Reviews.Content: We went for our 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel is in a good location being quiet whilst only a stroll away from some lovely bars / restaurants. We found the distance from the attractions suited us perfectly. We were pleasantly surprised how much we could visit in a day. Roof top terrace was a god send.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, classic & beautiful & close to the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: krizzooo1
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hotel, tucked away from the hustle bustle yet perfectly close to the colosseum & other attractions, good choice or bars and restaurants near by. Great base to see Rome. If you like walking, explore the area on foot, there's much to see, tucked away down side streets and such. Friendly staff, clean facilities, very comfy beds! I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: WeLuvTravel33418
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a well priced hotel in Rome that was In a good location but quiet. Sounds like an impossible task, but we found all that and more at Hotel Capo D'Africa. Tucked away near the Roman Forum and related sights, you'd never find this gem without an insider. Rooms are a nice size and the staff are friendly and helpful. The Terrace on the top floor serves a great breakfast. Many good restaurants within walking distance. It would be hard to find a better value in a hotel that met all of our criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: melbur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise and loved the hotel. We had the studio terrace with a great view of the colosseum and lovely private terrace. Proximity to all the major sites was great and we chose to walk everywhere (7 hours of walking the first day!) Beds are firm but comfortable. Would stay here again. Staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but eat and drink elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: IBthere30062
Reviews.Content: As a hotel we only have good things to say about Capo D'Africa. The staff were great and the room was very clean when we arrived and thoroughly cleaned everyday. The shower was small as some have noted but from what I have read on some other hotel's reviews it seemed better than most (again very clean) and you must understand that you are not in the US. I would definately recommend this hotel if you want to be able to break away from the noise/bustle of the major tourist areas but still have several attractions within 5-10 minutes walk (including Colosseum and San Clemente), several restaurants and bars within 5 minutes walk, and be able to feel completely safe walking around at night (except for the usual feeling that you are committing suicide when crossing a street in Rome). I would not recommend eating in the hotel in the evening as the selection is limited and not good value when you have so many other choices near at hand (2 steaks + starter without drinks or tip were Euro 75 or US$110). The breakfast was fine since we are not into the huge american breakfast - and a couple of cappuchino's and a pastry/croissant + fruit was all we needed. Also be aware that a mixed drink (eg Gin & Tonic or Rum and Coke) were 12 Euro's each (US$17). Rome is expensive to eat/drink and you should expect this anyway when you are in a tourist area (locals in London or New York avoid the tourist areas too due to cost/value for money) but charging $17 was a bit unrealistic even compared to the restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Better the Second Time”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of Hotel Capo D’Africa during the past year. My first review rated it 4 stars with complaints, but this time it’s 4 stars with praise. Despite some annoyances the first time, I gave it another try. All the good points remained true: clean, well decored, high ceilings, phenomenal location, standard room amenities, and – best of all -- complimentary breakfast buffet on the rooftop terrace. Some of the gripes also remained true, but with notable exceptions: wireless internet is now complimentary (though you had to know to ask the front desk), the air conditioning was superb and there was no street noise so I slept like a baby, and the staff was more pleasant. I had a better room rate, too, at €175. Also pleasing is that my companions and I arrived quite early in the morning from the US and after only a short wait, we were checked into our rooms. Oddly, they assigned me a fourth-floor room literally next to the restaurant dining area and across from the elevators and restrooms – possibly the worst room location in the hotel. I asked for a different room and received a much better location. I can’t give the place a 5-star rating because I think the rooms are a little lacking in amenities and nice touches, but it was definitely an improved experience over last year and I enjoyed my stay. I would need a good reason to choose a different hotel in Rome. Hope this helps. .

Reviews.Title: “Strange departure, but a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BedBugsAreBad
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a 4 night stay. Very clean, nice, modern hotel. As many have said, the hotel is extremely convenient to the Palatine Hill, the Forum and the Colosseum. I like to be able to grab dinner, people watch and stroll around with gelato in the evenings in Rome. However, the hotel is quite a walk to some of the best neighborhoods for this, like the Piazza Navona, the Parthenon and the Trastevere neighborhood. You need to be willing to pay for cabs or be ready to walk for about 45 minutes both to reach these pedestrian friendly zones. Not a big deal to us as it helped me justify the pizza margherita and gelato, but I would probably pick a place closer in proximity next time. The hotel staff was very friendly. The only strange occurence was when we left. We had a morning flight and as such, checked out at 6:30am. The front desk clerk called a cab for us and printed our final bill. The cab came immediately, but unfortunately when we went to open the front door, it was locked. Apparently they lock the front door at night, and the bellman with the key was nowhere to be found. He showed up after about 10 minutes. Unfortunately, that meant the cab's meter was already at 10 euros before our trip to the airport had even begun. Additionally, I find it quite alarming that if - heaven forbid - a fire or emergency should break out, the only exit is locked and only a single bellman has the key! Surely that's a fire code violation. And... 10 extra Euros out of our pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate a 50th birthday”
Reviews.Author: Lesley H
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel bases on it's location and good reviews and were not disappointed. We had informed the hotel that this was a trip to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday and had a quiet lovely room and a bottle of fizz curtesy of the hotel on our arrival. Great base for 4 days in Rome. Good for access to most places we had hoped to visit and the staff gave some good recommendations for places to eat. Particularly loved the roof terrace which we took advantage of every day and finished each evening there with a drink. Staff very helpful and friendly. Would certainly recommend and use again if we returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mtomasso
Reviews.Content: I had to stay there for a night after losing a train to Pisa so it was a last minute booking. As I was alone and carrying lots of documents I felt like staying somewhere safe and at the same time close to termini as I would leave early next morning. The hotel was far more expensive than I was willing to pay, but considering the condition in which I had to look for somewhere to stay it was ok. The staff is very sympathetic and gave me a warm welcome, althouh it was a friday at 11pm. The room is quite clean and the view is amazing. I didn't have the chance to try the breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms in a tiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: Todd R
Reviews.Content: Rooms are absolutely tiny if you are used to American hotel rooms. This was our honeymoon, and we were treated poorly due to our age (we are in our late 20's). Everybody in their 40's or 50's was treated much nicer when they interacted with the hotel staff. The included breakfast was mediocre, not much of a selection to choose from. The location is also very poor. We thought it would be great to be near the Colosseum, but it is very far from every other attraction in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gregg350
Reviews.Content: My wife and recently spent 4 nights at the Capo d'Africa. We had a great time and the staff was excellent. The room was clean, quiet and very well furnished. The staff was helpful and we appreciated the breakfast every morning. We highly recommend this hotel and would return on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “We had a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Tickner
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the evening 17 September and stayed for six nights. It was dark upon our arrival but first impressions were good. Drove past the Colosseum and up a lane to come to the hotel which was all lit up. The marble steps leading to reception made the place look rather grand. We stayed on the first floor. The first thing we noticed is the air conditioning worked very well, whilst the room was cold we soon came to appreciate it with the heat. The room was spacious with high ceilings, the decor in the room was a little plain but clean and presentable. As you walked in the bathroom is on your left which had quite a spacious built in shower (it wasn't overly powerful but efficient) to the right a roomy wardrobe with a safe. The room supplied toiletries a hair dryer and a mini bar under the TV (which was not a flat screen). What I did find strange is that you were not supplied with a kettle or coffee etc. We went to the bar in the reception area to get coffee and took it back to our room which saved on room service charges of 7 euros. Of an evening you could go up to the 4th floor for the BBQ, We had x2 evening meals there which were both very good and of reasonable price 29 euros per person for the meal and glass of wine. Each evening your bed gets turned down, a sheet placed on the floor with a pair of red slippers. Breakfast was again on the fourth floor. If you sat outdoors to the right you had a view of the Colosseum (there are only x2 tables with chairs). Whilst the view was amazing it was more shaded and could get a bit chilly so preferred to sit outdoors the opposite side in the sun (for which I found the view to be just a good). For breakfast there was the option of Eggs, Sausages, cereal, fresh fruit, tinned fruit, yoghurt, bread/rolls, meats & cheese and variety of croissants/doughnuts/muffin/tart. The location was perfect the area was peaceful with beautiful views, very close to the Colosseum and blue metro and a pleasant walk from which ever direction you come from. The staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke English very well. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: JadeNug
Reviews.Content: Ideally located a stones throw away from the Colosseum this Hotel will ensure you have a lovely time in The Eternal City. Enjoyed a 3 night stay here with my partner where we found the room and its amenities very luxurious and comfortable. Roof Top Breakfast was freshly made and appertising where I can ensure you your likely to make return trips to the counter for seconds or thirds! Staff were very friendly and are eager to promote the ideal locations you shouldn't miss. Did not have car rental and I belive you would struggle to find any appropriate parking beside the Hotel although the location speaks volumes as you can happily stroll to all the favourite tourist hotspots.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jpuso2001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem...walking distance to Coliseum, great restaurants etc. The breakfast at this place is awesome. Roof top breakfast with fresh pastries. The rooms are very nice and staff was helpful. Parking was a bit of a bear though.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bondiii
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic four night stay at this hotel. Clean and comfortable hotel with some nice touches. Our room was more than adequate, much bigger than some other hotel rooms we have stayed in. The bathroom a little on the small side, could do with a light and shelf in the shower. Helpful staff on reception, providing maps, directions and recommendations of places to eat nearby. Excellent pizza restaurant around the corner, cheap and full of the locals usually a good sign. Small supermarket on the next street useful and much cheaper for buying water, soft drinks etc, Good breakfast choice, excellent coffee served by cheerful staff. Nice to sit out on the terrace and take in the views. Do bear in mind Rome is a walking city, yes the hotel is a little way out of some of the famous attractions eg The Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc., unless you are in a rush its lovely to amble around the side streets stop for a beer or an ice-cream and take in the ambience of it all. Use the Metro, its cheap 1 euro a trip. Beware of prices in bars especially around the famous attractions they are very expensive. Go later in the day to the Vatican, although we pre booked tickets there were no queues. Wear comfortable shoes, your feet will suffer if you dont.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Natalie T
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break in this hotel and can't praise it enough. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean and the beds were turned down every evening. There was a safe in the room for our valuables, a television and minibar. Our room was right next to the lift and was not disturbed by it at all. In fact we didn't hear it once. The breakfast was served in the restaurant on the roof and we ate with a view of the Collesium every morning. The food was excellent and the location was perfect. A few yards away was a bar that served real ale which other tourists have travelled a great distance to get to. Hightly recommended to anyone wanting a break in Rome. I would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NXOTucson
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the Colosseum! But just one block away is a gem - the Basilica San Clemente. This has two buildings underneath undergoing excavation. The lower was a pagan temple. Truly a step back in time and view of religious history. In addition, Capo d' has the most wonderful rooftop dining room. Breakfast on the rooftop patio is divine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SaraK64
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great hotel, great location on a quiet street. The room and bathroom were a nice size and all the amenities were great. Hotel is located a few blocks from the Colosseum and Ancient Roman Forum – a bit of a walk from the center of Rome - but without all the hustle and bustle! The breakfast buffet that was included in our meal was very nice. The biggest complaint that we had about the hotel were the restaurant recommendations given to us at the front desk. Although the restaurant they sent us to was delicious, it was very expensive and had a limited menu. The bed was very comfortable. Staff was great in helping us with directions to sites and restaurant locations. Also, gave us great directions to get us to a specific area of Rome, by walking or metro. I would highly recommend this hotel, however I would avoid many of the restaurant recommendations given by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: cmsuk
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome with a family group of 6 and the Capo d'Africa was recommended to us by a family member who had previously stayed there. It was all we were hoping for and provided a perfect base for exploring this beautiful city as was within easy travelling distance of all major attractions. Reception staff were very friendly and happy to advise us on the best way to get to places as this was our first visit to Rome. The rooms were kept immaculately clean and were of a good size. The view from the room was not great but this was more than made up for by the wonderful view of the Colosseum from the breakfast terrace! Breakfast was also excellent with a varied choice. The area around the hotel had plenty of restaurants but it is advisable to listen to the recommendations of the reception staff as they definately know which ones have genuine local food and ambience and which ones are better avoided as too touristy. Would certainly stay at this hotel again on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: wavewatcher31
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels in Rome with connecting rooms for families. We had a great set-up.....2 bedrooms with bathrooms and a connecting passage. Perfect for the adults and kids. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Widetraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a nice, quiet sidestreet only three blocks from the Colosseum (!), with some excellent local restaurants (non-touristy) only a block away. Can't get more convenient than that! I walked everywhere. Parking is the only issue, but that's the case in all of Rome. There's a lot up the hill, two blocks away which sometimes has spots. Better off just taking a taxi from the airport (or the train). The hotel entrance, lobby and rooms are beautifully decorated, plenty of A/C, king size beds, lots of space, and the roof has a terrace with a beautiful view and a pleasant buffet breakfast. The staff is overall super friendly and attentive (a couple are a bit snobby at the front desk but no big deal). WiFi signal is only strong in the lobby and fair on the roof, weak in the rooms. I will definitely return to this hotel on my next trip - a great find!

Reviews.Title: “All we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: Wished to take my wife to Rome to celebrate her birthday. Was recomended this hotel by friends who had stayed there before. It was perfect for us and although spotless was perhaps not a 4 star as we would know it but more a 3 star+. Location was great and easy to get around Rome from. The staff were so friendly, from the bell hop to the chambermaid. I booked a superior room and it was very comfortable indeed although the en suite was a little cramped. However the shower was brilliant - huge area and piping hot water. Towels changed every day and bed turned down at night with complimentary slippers laid out for us. Even though our room was at the front of the hotel, the street was very quiet and there was no noise at anytime during the day or night. Breakfasts were more than adequte with a good selection of cereal, dried and tinned fruits and yoghurts, cold meats and cheeses, boiled eggs, bacon, sausage and something between scrambled egg and a failed omelette which was delicious, pastries and coffee to die for (least I felt this way, not being able to drink it anymore on docs orders and tormented by wife's ooing and ahhing over it, not to mention the tantalising smell of it!). However, tea was great with a good selection of different types on offer. There was a barbeque on offer every night but we did not partake, preferring instead to exit the hotel and turn right to the first junction, turning right again and completing the 100 metres to a pizzeria on the left at the next junction. Food there was VERY Italian, full of Italians, and excellent (When in Rome..... I can eat a barbeque anytime). Receptionist booked a taxi to the airport for us. It arrived in 5 minutes and price was fixed at 30 euros. Great service. Would I use the hotel again? Most certainly! Would I recomment it to a friend? Absolutely! We can't wait to go back to Rome and we will try to book into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Rome....Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: BenMac81
Reviews.Content: My wife very kindly paid for our first trip to Rome for my 30th Birthday and she could not have picked a better Hotel. Ideal location....10min walk away from all the hustle and bustle!! When we arrived the member of staff on the desk was very efficient checking us in and even gave us a map and marked down all the places of interest which I thought was very helpful. We had a room on the 4th floor. No complaints about the rooms at all. Very spacious, tidy and good air con. My wife had got in touch with the hotel before hand to let them know it was my birthday while we were there.....and I got a very nice surprise with a knock on the door. There chef had made one of the finest desserts I think I have possably ever tasted with a couple of candles on top and 2 glasses of Prosecco. My wife had offered to pay for this but was told they would be on the house. A really nice touch!!!! We stayed here for 5 nights and would have no hesitation staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Italian holiday”
Reviews.Author: AuntKer
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for 3 nights and enjoyed everything about the hotel, from the rooms which were good sized, smartly furnished and spotless, to the staff who were friendly and helpful, to the location which was excellent. We especially enjoyed our morning and evening visits to the roof terrace which is a lovely place for breakfast or a drink. Good value too. Taxis were readily available and inexpensive or the Metro was handy. Virtually all the main sights are within walking distance, and ancient Rome is on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “I love Roma! Will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: klarebear
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this hotel! Out of the 6 hotels we stayed at during our stay all over Italy, this place was our favorite by far! Amazing hotel with such a helpful staff. Very clean room with a clean bathroom. Very high class hotel that's evident from the minute you pull up to the stairs that lead you to the entrance. Very roomy as well. We were greeted into our room with a platter of an assortment of fruits and nuts. Our room didn't have the best view but we weren't in the room half of the time anyway so that was fine. This hotel was also the only one that we stayed at that had an American outlet in the bathroom, which came in very very handy when our international adapter broke a day before we were to arrive back in Rome from Sorrento. Such a lifesaver. The staff also let us borrow an adapter of theirs as well that we returned at check out. Very very close to the Colosseum and bus stop, which we would walk by every day. We walked everywhere from here since it was all so close. At nights we'd go out to the Trastevere area for dinner and wine and then on another night we took a cab to Camp de' Fiori and had cocktails there. Later we went to a club called Bloom that was nearby and had a great time there. Great music! We spent one of the nights on the hotel's rooftop terrace where we had wine and bruschetta, which was absolutely delicious! We realized we were still hungry and even with the kitchen already closed for the night, the staff was so accommodating! They brought us a platter of cheeses, bread, toast and Nutella. I definitely plan to go stay at this hotel when I visit Rome again. I absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: ThePelikans
Reviews.Content: First off I would recommend you do not drive in Rome. It is extremely frustrating. Anyway the staff graciously let us park our rental car in front of the hotel overnight until we could return it the next day. This was so helpful because there was no parking to be had anywhere close to the hotel. The desk staff were very helpful in providing a map and answering questions and directions to the subway. (note the subway is a decent walk away) Rome was the last stop on our journey and the front desk also coordinated a cab to the Airport at a fixed rate for us. This was well worth the cost. We didn't have to deal with our luggage on the crowded subway or trains, and it saved us a lot of time and effort. I highly recommend it. The breakfast was very good. The hotel overall was very clean and our room was plenty big and nice. The colosseum is just down the street. (hint get your own free audio guide online for all of Rome's major sites. Saves a lot of money and very interesting) There are several good affordable restaurants within the surrounding blocks that were filled with locals. The area seemed a little sketchy at night, but probably only because it wasn't lit well and a bit dirty. This was a good base of operations for our Rome visit, and we will probably stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with rooftop views”
Reviews.Author: Miriam H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The staff were excellent and spoke good English. The room was of a very high standard. We looked forward to breakfast on the roof-top terrace every morning. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and We"ll be back”
Reviews.Author: Alexdallas
Reviews.Content: Very nice appointed hotel, near to the major historic sites, Roman Forum... The room were clean, nice furniture and cozy. The breakfast on the terrace was very good. Very good restaurants are walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mariangela62
Reviews.Content: My husband , two teenage daughters and I recently stayed at this hotel and loved everything about it. It is a beautiful boutique hotel very close to the colosseum. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were well appointed (we had 2 rooms right next to each other). Breakfast was served on the top floor either inside or on the terrace with a fabulous view, even the wait staff at breakfast were terrific, remembering every morning what we drink and bringing it as soon as we walked in. We will most definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jimymac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa and had a wonderful time. The staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was to much trouble, from the maids (who kept everything spotless) to the hotel management who were excellent. The rooms were spacious and well presented, we couldn't find fault with anything. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is thinking of visiting the beautiful city of Rome. The location is approx 200m from the Colosseum, so outside the main hustle & bustle; with some lovely restaurants within a 5 min walk to wind down after a full on day seeing the sites. We will definitely stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mk54
Reviews.Content: Well appointed. Great service. Lots of amenities.Great breakfast. Wonderful terrace (should be open later.) Great little neighborhood with several good restuarants. The only 2 negatives (for SOME people) are it is a little "too Americanized" (listening to Rolling Stones at breakfast on the terrace?) and no restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Quiet Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: curlyoz
Reviews.Content: Even though the Capo D'Africa is close to a major attraction (Colosseum), it is in a lovely, quiet neighbourhood, away from the madness of all of the tourists. I totally enjoyed my stay at this hotel - the room was lovely & the staff were very friendly & helpful. The breakfast was nice & in a beautiful location on the roof. I would happily stay here again. There are 2 things that could be improved: 1) The recommendation of Ciao Roma as a good hop-on, hop-off tour. I think this is the worst "tour" in Rome. Please see my review of this company in TripADvisor. In summary - dirty, broken buses, unprofessional staff, few buses. 2) Iron & Ironing Board - I requested one to iron something that I wanted that evening. They said that die to fire regulations they could not provide one. My alternatives were to wait until the next day & send it to their laundry or go to the laundry a few streets away. Both of these suggestions were not acceptable. I'm not sure why all other hotels can provide an iron but Capo D'Africa can't.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel in historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: Macfak
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from staying a week in Rome at the Capo D'Africa Hotel both feel so lucky to have found this gem of a hotel. The hotel is situated a block away from the colosseum (in fact you can see the colosseum from the hotel roof terrace) and is within easy walking distance of the majority of attractions in Rome. The surrounding area itself is quite quiet (if you want bustling night life on your doorstep this area isn't for you) but has plenty of good restaurants nearby for you to choose from and the hotel has a BBQ on the roof at night. The room was very clean with modern fittings and very high ceilings. The AC was a godsend after walking in 38 degree heat, though we did need to ask reception how to work it (does + mean more cold or more heat??) The inclusive breakfast was lovely especially as they have a number of tea blends available for the non coffee drinkers. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the reception staff who helped us sort out and book all our trips. We'd definitely stay here again if we return for another holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JV101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July 2011.... Location is nice-- quiet neighborhood just steps from the Colloseum. The other Rome attractions (Trevi Fountain, Vatican, Spanish Steps, etc) are not very close but it is really easy and really quick to catch the Metro to the more congested and touristy part of Rome (5 minute walk to station and 10 minute ride). It was nice every night coming home to our quiet hotel tucked away in a charming neighborhood. It felt like we were in a different city. Staff was top-notch. Front desk staff in particular was helpful, accomodating, and offered superb advice on attractions, transportation, etc. Great English. Also the Housekeeping staff was absolutely fantastic. Cannot say enough about them. Breakfast is served in a nice roof-top restaurant and terrace and offered a decent selection and great wait staff. They also serve food on this terrace in the evening but we found the menu really overpriced. Other positives: 30 minutes a day of free wireless internet usage in the lobby area, nice fitness room on the ground floor, large rooms with "black-out" curtains for early sunrises, very nice bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: cindysk
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 3 children, ages 20, 16,12, we had 2 rooms. Location is 2 blocks from the colosseum. Quiet at night, our room faced back of hotel. Great service at breakfast with great food choices. The view from the rooftop terrace is the best. Hotel is newly remodeled and the rooms good size with larger than average bathrooms for European standards. Great hotel definately recommend good value for $.

Reviews.Title: “Did not find what we were expecting to”
Reviews.Author: Corinnexmartin
Reviews.Content: After reading most reviews I decided to book in the hotel, I now recommend please not only read the first ones but the reviews at the bottom too! because I can now relate to the bottom ones (the bad ones)and support them. The rooms were very small, I asked to change twice till I was able to get a better one with big windows. The carpets are stained and showers are not great. It is an average Holiday Inn type hotel. The service is regular, one night I asked room service to bring hot water to drink a medicinal tea, the answer was that we had to go to the bar to look for it, my husband had to get dressed to go and came back to the room carrying a tray with a cup and a pot with the water. The internet they offer is a code you have to fetch in the reception that expires every 30 minutes so if you intend to use your computer for a longer period of time you have to go on asking and fetching new codes at the reception. We one afternoon came back to the hotel and asked for a sandwich, we had to order in the bar and then wait for somebody to take it to the terrace. As it was summer we showered more than once a day but were never able to get extra towels , so we had to let them dry and use them again, this is not a cheap hotel! it is expensive for the service you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Twickerama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June, and were really very impressed with the hotel, particularly the service. The restaurant recommendations were excellent too (there are several amazing restaurants within walking distance). Good breakfasts too. My only complaint is that we had a room near the restaurant (4th floor), so were woken very early by breakfast noise.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a refreshing oasis in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LPepp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a fantastic week+ the latter part of May in the Hotel Capo D'Africa. We were a lil' concerned as first time travelers to Rome about the living situation of any of the hotels we may have chosen, reading so many comments both good and bad about hotels in Rome. We chose Hotel Capo D'africa because of the numerous positive reviews we read and the online photos depicting a place commensurate with our desired place to stay. Well we were not disappointed in the least and were so glad we chose Hotel Capo. To kind of outline our feelings the Pros and Cons were: PROS: Very nicely decorated hotel, Very clean throughout, The staff throughout the establishment were very friendly/helpful with welcoming smiles, FANTASTIC location - only about 3 blocks from Colosseum and within walking distance of most major sites, The food provided on the premises was very good, both breakfast and the evening dinners offered via the Rooftop Restaurant. CONS: You pay for what you get - The hotel is a lil' costly but the comfort and peace of mind afforded by staying there made it livable, The rooms are not the biggest (in comparison to American Hotels), but they were superb in cleanliness, the beds were firm but I cannot say I had one uncomfortable nights sleep in them. In summation, I thoroughly endorse staying at the Hotel Capo D'africa, especially for first time visitors to Rome. From a cost standpoint, other servicable options may be available....but it was nice having that Oasis to return to or freshen up in during the day while my wife and I trekked around Rome and its' surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Guru57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Capo d'Africa for 7 nights this past May and it is an excellent place to stay in Rome. The hotel is located on a quiet street near the Colosseum, very close to the Metro and around the corner from the Basilica di San Clemente al Laterano (a must see). We reserved the De-Luxe room which offered more space, a bottle of bubbly on arrival and daily mineral water. The bubbly was nicely chilled and waiting for us however the daily mineral water never appeared and I had to go down to the bar each day to pick up a bottle. The "free" internet is free for 30 continuous minutes only and once a day ( these were the only two minor irritants during our stay). The front desk and service staff are very friendly and welcoming. A generous buffet style breakfast is served on the top (4th) floor where you can sit either inside or on the patio. Many very nice restaurants are located in the area catering not only to tourists but locals as well; Le Naumachie and Li Rioni are two excellent restos in the area. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, like one from the states”
Reviews.Author: jlpsquared
Reviews.Content: I have heard horror stories about hotels in Rome and since we were with a 2 year old, I wanted as close to a US hotel as I could get, and here they do not disapoint. My kid actually threw up in the middle of the night, and the little old cleaning guy who didn't speak a word of English helped us a great deal. It is little walk to get to the sights (past the colleseo) but who cares, you are there to walk!.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Modern....American style hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbarrea
Reviews.Content: Stayed last 3 nights of honeymoon in Italy. Very clean and modern hotel. Looks like one from the States. Very pleased with overall experience. Staff was great in helping book excursions. Most expensive hotel we satyed in, but not dissapointed or mad after. Hotel near by the Coliseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome and good value”
Reviews.Author: EricGu
Reviews.Content: We spent a week-end in Rome for tourism and chose Hotel Capo d'Africa. Check-in was straightforward and the receptionist spoke French and English. The room was large enough and nice. Everything looked clean. Bathroom was a bit small but that was ok. Internet was expensive; I still can't understand rates with breakfast included but not internet...Breakfast was very good and the staff nice. I enjoyed breakfast :) In addition, there is a nice view from the terrace (although we had breakfast inside as it was really cold) The location is excellent, very close to the Coliseum and easy to go everywhere. The staff was helpful. I sent them by email the museum bookings I did and they printed them for me. A few months later I booked the same hotel for my family who is not used to travel, and they were extremely happy with their stay. The hotel made a mistake in the booking but they very quickly fixed it and apologized for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Rome. We'll stay here again next time!”
Reviews.Author: iluvrocko
Reviews.Content: Hotel was absolutely perfect for my stay in Rome. The location was ideal to the Colosseum and Roman Forum; located along a quiet street. The staff was very friendly and gave us some great information, as well as anwering all our questions with a great attitude. The lobby is comtemporary and charming, and the rooftop terrace was quiet and relaxing. The rooms were outstanding. We had a small foyer when you stepped in with a good size bedroom with king bed to the right (and it was large by European standards) and the bathroom was straight in from the foyer, with a good size shower. The shower pressure was a bit lacking, but still a nice set-up with area to sit in the shower. To compliment everything, they hotel room even had wonderful robes and slippers for your use, as well as turn down service each evening, with the slippers placed bedside with foot toweling. The beds were excellent, and I was tempted to take off the bottom sheet to see what type of mattress it was. This was the most superior hotel I have ever stayed at in Europe, and was very impressed. When I visit Rome again, I plan to stay at this same hotel. Good job Capo d'Africa!

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention to details”
Reviews.Author: writerteacher001
Reviews.Content: Maybe I hit them on an off weekend, when their staff was at a low ebb due to the May 1 weekend. However, the days I was there the service was off. First, there are outside steps to get into the hotel's lobby. My husband got to carry up the luggage for five people because their doorman/bell hop was on "break." Yes, they only have one, which even when he is not on break creates issues if other patrons need him. Be aware that there is an outdoor elevator to the lobby/rooms in the event that you have a disability and can't climb those stairs. However you will need that one guy to let you use that elevator, so hope he is around. Upon first entering our room, it struck me as sort of drab. This is not due to any lack of care or maintenance. Rather I realized it had to do with the finishes and decor originally chosen for the place. Lots of medium neutrals and medium woods make it look less fashionable, I guess. At over 250 euros a night (a special rate, mind you, since we stayed for three nights. Our one return night prior to flying home it was even more), one would like to be dazzled a bit, not think "meh." The housekeeping was uneven. The toiletries were not complete (perhaps they ran out because it was a holiday weekend? Or a shipment did not arrive? On a return day a week later prior to flying home, suddenly there was conditioner and a nice package of facial treatments that were not produced the three earlier days.) We had a host of little issues with our rooms. Two examples. A clogged drain had to wait until Monday to be fixed--no such work possible on the weekend. A safe never closed properly. Each time the staff was alerted, but that safe never worked, for example. The front desk seemed surprised when these things were mentioned on check out, but no consideration was offered, which for the clogged drain really should have been since it made the shower unusable (the offer of a room change was made when it first happened, for the next day when rooms became available, I should mention. Rather than deal with the inconvenience of repacking and moving, the shower in another party member's room was used). My biggest complaint, however, had to do with the climate control. Although it was cool outside our first days in Rome it was also very damp and the building itself was not cool. Nor could one open the window at night without letting in the street noises. On Sunday the sun came out and things warmed up considerably, especially on the western side with the afternoon sun. I asked about air conditioning and was told the management had turned it off and it could not be turned back on with the manager gone that day. Our last day, a Monday, I was told that the manager said it was controlled by some central thermostat keyed to outdoor temperature and could not be affected, which is nonsense. My conclusion is that management decides what the patrons will have to live with according to their own reading of the weather, and too bad if it doesn't work for you. There is good news too, however. First, this hotel has some of the best soundproofing I have found in a hotel in Europe, especially an old one. The hotel was full our first night but we heard nothing from other rooms. Also, they have superior sound reduction windows so that even with a room over the street, nothing penetrated, not even those motorcycles. This is not a small matter if you are not used to city noises. The breakfast room is well managed and very pleasant. The buffet is fine, and fairly typical of hotels of this class---scrambled egg and bacon, rolls, yogurt, cereals, cold cuts and cheeses, fruits, juices, etc. They had the roof top terrace open, and it was delightful to start the day up there. One man is clearly in charge and he keeps the staff on point. The rooms are of decent size for Europe. The two bedded rooms are noticeably larger than the ones with one bed. The showers are small, but not the tiny ones you find in tourist class hotels. If you know what I am talking about, these showers are about half again wider, which makes all the difference. Still, the water source was installed on the long wall, not a short one, which was a peculiar arrangement and did not make showering easy. The showers are lined in stone which makes keeping the mold away a challenge. The really fastidious traveler might think they are not entirely winning that war, since some traces are visible, but it appeared to me that they were fighting a good fight, and in general I had no complaints about cleanliness. The bathrobes, slippers and sparkling wine and water were nice touches. The beds are VERY firm. I happen to like that, but not everyone does. The location is a bit out of the way, tucked behind the colosseum. As other comments indicate, it is a quieter neighborhood and actually quite restful after a day in the historic center. San Clemente is two blocks away, and should be visited. In theory one can walk anywhwere from this location (we walked from Piazza Navone home one day without killing ourselves) but you can easily take a cab too. Cab fare mid day from the hotel to the Vatican museums, about as far as most tourists would go, costs around 10-12 euros depending on traffic and route. Many cabs will NOT pick up if you hail, so learn where the cab stands are if you intend to use them. And bring the phone number with you too. I phoned for a cab when we emerged from San Pietro in Vincoli and one came in three minutes. It pays to orient yourself with a map while in Rome, because there are cab drivers who will take you for a ride if they think you won't know the difference.
