This is one of those hotels where what you pay probably affects your opinion. I expected very good things based on Tripadvisor reviews, but it did not quite measure up. We paid enough that I was not inclined to overlook the flaws. The other reviewers here either had better experiences, or paid a lot less perhaps.

Reviews.Title: “Good as long as you're not on the ground floor in which case it's awful”
Reviews.Author: Montey_11
Reviews.Content: Do not accept room 105!!!! It's dark and poky and is directly above their delivery bay doors into their basement and deliveries from early hours meant that we got no proper sleep until moved to a high floor room for our last night which was light airy and lovely. We had requested a high floor room when booking our holiday after reading a few comments about street noise but our request was ignored. We were very disappointed as the price and the Cresta brochure pictures suggest better than we got. The same room rate at a london hotel would be a UK travellers idea of luxury but falls vastly short in Rome - which is very expensive all round. The reception staff were helpful, the breakfast excellent and the terrace bar was a great place to chill after lots of walking around Rome. Apart from our specific problem with the ground floor room it was in a quiet neighbourhood so sleep was great once we were moved.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: townerd
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Capo D'Africa. It was a total pleasure. The hotel is beautifully located and wonderfully appointed. We were greeted by a lovely staff, who took the time to orient us to the city and point out all the highlights. Each day we got to wake up to a delicious breakfast manned by a warm staff. The best was leaving our hotel each morning and being greeted by the Coliseum! How great is that! Thanks for everyone at Capo D'Africa for making our stay so memorable. Donna and Rick Towner

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for Rome trip”
Reviews.Author: MikeySmiler
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based upon location and its tripadvisor reviews and most of the previously reported factors rang true. The collection of bags by the hotel porter was so quick my girlfriend was worried they had been knicked. Check in was quick and informative and a great map was given - there was no hard sell of trips although a leaflet was given with some trips but no pressure exerted at all. The room was compact but sufficient for us and the bed was hard which I liked. I did hear some lorry noises early in the morning but I would say that the hotel is in a quiet area. The reception staff did say that they would move us to a higher floor if we found it a problem (as I mentioned the ground floor had some mixed reviews on tripadvisor). The room was very clean, everything worked and it looked fresh. TV choice is lacking for english speaking customers (Sky News & CNN only). The negatives from my perspectives (1) the reception staff quoted me 75 euros to be collected at the airport but my research indicated that this should be a 40-50 euro fare (2) the food is expensive so we did not order anything even when we really wanted to stay in (3) the breakfast staff are quite disorganised with drinks going to the wrong tables, squabbles between staff and I was told by the usually nice young waitress that the incorrect delivery of coffee was what I asked for yet they clearly struggled to remember what orders they had taken (minor issue but irritating all the same to be told that the waitress knows better about what I would like than I do myself). Other than these minor(ish) points it is a good hotel to pick with lots of local restaurants, generally good service, very clean, fresh design and very close to the ancient Rome sites of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Everything was first class; could not fault anything.”
Reviews.Author: Florence2462
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 4 night stay 29th March to 2nd April 2011. First class service, rooms very good, towels and beds changed each day. Staff right through the Hotel were very friendly & helpful. Would certainly recommend this Hotel. it was certainly a 4* with a difference. Would like to thank everyone at the hotel, and would certainly return when next in Rome!!! Jean and Wendy England.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, cleaning needs a bit of work”
Reviews.Author: brownswekile
Reviews.Content: Check-in: Swift process. Reception staff friendly and welcoming. One of the guys insisted on giving me an apple and some candy each day, which was sweet. He'd say something in Italian to me, I had no idea what it was - it sounded friendly so I just said thank you and smiled. Room: A very nice average size room, not big or small. Flat screen TV with CNN (a must for me is some news channel in English). It was winter so the heating was on point, nice and cozy room. The gown and slippers were a nice touch although I'll be honest both gowns in the room had seen better days and could use a fabric softener... Cleanliness: I know for a fact that the bed sheets were not changed for my entire stay. That was 4 days or so. I had slightly soiled one sheet (yes, Im a woman so that happens sometimes) so I took it off to wash the stain. That was achieved. However, when I came back at night, the same sheet was in the bed - damp on one side. So i slept on the other side, no issues. I was scared they'd make me pay a fortune if I complained about changing sheets. Their beds are big enough. But that sheet was on my bed till I left. Well I guess that was punishment from the hotel gods for my bad bad behaviour :)... But I washed it. Breakfast: I totally loved it. The waitresses were very friendly, the room was nice and cozy. On one of the mornings, I managed to get a view from the terrace and I know that in summer it must be a wonder to have breakfast from there. Location: Wow... Its up the road from the Colosseum. Get off the metro and its a 10 minute stroll to the hotel. Its a safe area. I'm a picky eater so I did not enjoy the first restaurant I tried and decided to keep it junk, some soda/crisps and fruits. But there is plenty bars, cafes in very close proximity to the hotel. All in all... I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling... If it wasn't for the fact that I was punished by the cleaning staff/hotel gods, I'd be giving this establishment a perfect 10...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bridget_harris
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location, terrace is lovely, friendly staff. Only criticism was that the staff did not have the latest information with regards to trips ie Vatican City, hop on/off tour buses - when they were closed due to special holidays or other events. This may not have been their fault but it would certainly put me off booking trips through them if I were to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Gerat Location”
Reviews.Author: Bren07
Reviews.Content: Stayed her on a short break with the husband. Check in was good - staff friendly and gave us lots of information, maps and ideas of places to go. You can book tours with them at reception too - we did not as it was not our first time in Rome and had already done the local hop on hop off bus tour. In fairness Rome is not a big city so you really can get everywhere on foot and its more enjoyable that way too - when you get tired you can stop off at any of the lovely piazza's and have an over priced and tiny coffee :-) Rooms in hotel are quite big compared to most european hotel rooms - was impressed with that. its true to say that with noise level and all you should try to get a room high up if you are a light sleeper as you will hear trucks in the morning and bottle collections. Rooms cleaned daily and all common areas very well maintained. The one thing about this hotel is that it does not have a restaurant - this is not a big thing as there are just loads of restaurants around the area to suit all pockets. It does however serve breakfast up on the roof terrace which is very nice - its mainly coffee's baked good, cheese's, fruit and some scrambled eggs - its really was more than I expected we would get so was happy. Staff in the breakfast room are also very welcoming and friendly. They also have a room service menu available but in my opinion a little overpriced that not really worth it and is nice to eat out than in your room anyway. We found a little gem of a restaurant that we ate in all nights (boring as that may sound you will understand why when you visit it). It is all Nau Machia and its just up the street to the right and the food is cheap and cheerful and just so yummy. We had asked for a recommendation for our final night - wanted to try something different the reception recommended a place called "3" or something like that - again just up the road from the hotel. Walked in - decor was not to our taste but not enough to put you off, - however the chef lazily strewn across some chairs chatting and an odd middle aged bleach blonde man playing very cheesy music on a piano was enough for myself and the husband to says thanks but no thanks. We maybe our excuses and vacated the premises - rushing back to your old favourite if they would have us and sorry that we ever deserted them. Check out fine - you are hit with the Rome tax on departure so be aware of that - €6 a night tourist tax for visiting their city.......... here in Ireland they are just glad ya came and would not think of charging you - but in saying that we dont have a lot of ancient sights that needs perserving so we paid and went on our way. Not really a big deal. All in all a good stay - Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff , not the cheapest hotel but with the location you are in you get what you pay for in my book - would stay again if we went to Rome for another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Corkiesx4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The hotel's terrace has views of the colosseum, which is only a few minutes walk away. Our room was great, the hotel was clean, the staff very friendly and the buffet breakfast was lovely. The Li Rioni restaurant was recommended to us by reception and it was fab for pizza - very cosy, family-friendly, extremely reasonable - and just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Fi27
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in Februrary, 4 adults and 1 11 year old. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were lovely and the hotel is in a good location. There are some good local restaurants nearby with great food. We didn't want to leave and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “22 family members cant be wrong”
Reviews.Author: COBrewer
Reviews.Content: We loved it. My father in law and his wife, his six children, their spouses and children, descended on the hotel for several nights prior to departing on a cruise. The beds were great, best sleep i had the entire two weeks. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer. Workout room was a little crowded, but the hotel provides a map with several jogging routes. It was really a great location and i saw a whole new side of Rome as a result. Oh yes and an excellent breakfast at the top of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above many others”
Reviews.Author: Artemus_Gordon
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Read good reviews and it more than lived up to them. Staff is very personable, helpful, and friendly; talk to like they know you, not the usual polite stiffness. Rooms are very large by European standards. Decor is a nice change from the usual. Breakfast was a good version of what you usually see...but the staff was really attentive and seemed to welcome requests. Breakfast was included. Hotel on the outside is really attractive. For the money it was a good value. Had a small room problem when we checked in; moved us immediately and sent a bottle of Prosecco. Everyone acts like they care. Woukld definitely stay here again. Minor drawbacks...the neighborhood not quite as "polished" as some other areas, but seemed safe. Very convenient to the Colisseum and Ancient Rome, but a little further away from some of the other attractions. About 4-5 blocks to the Metro across street from Colisseum. I don't care for the gold carpet in the room, but just a personal opinion. Internet was extra but service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A True Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: cardak1990
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel! The rooms were very clean and the views were great. The bathroom was large and had a nice window view above the tub. This hotel is very romantic and the food was great. My only complaint about the hotel was the front desk staff. They were very friendly upon arrival, however they really push the tours at the front desk that are very expensive. The man at the front desk told us that we would need to wait in a 3 hours line at the Vatican Museums if we did not book his tour that was about 120 euros per person. We kindly denied the tours and took our chances. There were no lines and no waits, I feel as though they may get benefits for selling the tours. Another tip of advise, around the hotel there are a lot of restaurants, many of them were not great. We noticed with our stay that if you ask the people at the hotel were the locals go to dine, your chances of good food is much higher. Since the hotel is so close to the Colosseum there are many restaurants that strictly cater to tourist rather than locals. Finally, I would like to add that the hotel does offer high speed internet but it is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Paul68
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and again a very pleasant stay! The staff is extremely helpfull. Due to a missed flight, we arrived 1 day later. The receptionist helped us with the airport transportation company. Breakfast was fantastic just like the last time. Great choice of food and a very very pleasant staff. On our last day we even left a tip for the breakfast staff. First time I ever did this. My wife forgot her glasses on our return. They were send to our home bij DHL. Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkM77
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Capo d'Africa was fantastic. The hotel is well located close to the colosseum and the Roman Forum and Palatine ruins. It is a 10-15 min stroll into the city centre through the Forum. There are great restaurants nearby and it is close to the metro. The rooms are spacious (for Europe!) and comfortable. Breakfast is great and the staff extremely friendly. The hotel also has an excellent bar/lounge where you can relax after a day of touring. Overall it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, room and stay”
Reviews.Author: doyley1
Reviews.Content: On arrival - The girl on reception was very helpful on highlighted bars and restaurants that are worth going to The room - Big comfortable bed with everything immaculate. Dressing gowns, slippers and skin scrubs were all included Breakfast - Range of pastries, fruits, yoghurts, cheeses, hams plus egg and bacon. The coffee never ran out and the waiting staff were very attentive Location - Just past the colluseum so we got there before the crowds arrived later on. It took about half an hour to walk to the Trevi fountains so it wasn't as far as I had initiallly contemplated. There were bars nearby with a good atmosphere but not too noisy to bother a night's sleep Sleep - Good night's sleep with air conditioning and heating in the room

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Heaven After Train Hell”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_D
Reviews.Content: After having no end of trouble with the overnight train from Paris, our honeymoon was most definitely "back on track" when we arrived in bella Roma & checked in for six nights at the Hotel Capo d'Africa. An amazing hotel with incredibly helpful staff was a most welcome relief after mid-honeymoon hiccoughs! The Capo d'Africa is very tastefully decorated, our room was fabulous, open, filled with light, with a very comfortable king size bed. Both my bride & I had wonderful, restful sleeps (when required, it was our honeymoon!), & the room lock/security gave my wife an extra sense of peace of mind. Our room's air conditioning & having two windows, kept our room very cool & comfortable even though it was late August & early-September & very hot every day we were there. The included breakfasts were plentiful, diverse & delicious. Combined with the amazing view from the rooftop dining area, it was wonderful. The staff, both at the desk & in the dining room were, to a person, extremely personable, polite, courteous, helpful in every sense & fluent in English, a necessity particularly as my Italian is virtually non-existent, & my wife's IS non-existent! While I had been to Rome before (& been rather disappointed by my hotel then), this was my wife's first visit, & without doubt, the Hotel Capo d'Africa contributed greatly to an amazing conclusion to our honeymoon, & we will undoubtedly be returning... hopefully sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL uNLESS YOU WANT TO SEE THE INSIDE OF THE ROME POLICE STATION!”
Reviews.Author: Italiantraveler22
Reviews.Content: We booked this room secondary to all the positive comments on Trip Advisor. On our 3rd and final night at the hotel, we were robbed of almost all of our valuables from our locked safe in our locked room. Being extremely cautious about pickpockets and thieves we thought it would be best to leave some of our valuables in the locked safe (you pick the comination) in our room while going to dinner.We left at 8PM, asked the front desk (LOUIE) for a recommendation for a restaurant in walking distance. We were back at our room at 10PM. In anticipation of our early departure we starting packing. When my husband opened the safe he had locked with our own chosen numbers we got the surprise of our lives...."the Italian Job!" Someone had stolen all of our belongings including a camera with extra lens, phone, ipod, wallet with money, credit cards and my husbands driver's license. We rushed to front desk. They were extremely slow to respond. After yelling to get the police the hotel finally did. My husband went with the police to our room while I cancelled all the credit cards. There was no forced entry. The police officers speaking to each other said it was definitely an inside job. We ended up at the police station to file a report at midnight. This was with our 2 young daughters. It was a total disaster. The hotel management lied to us and told us nobody had the code to get into the safe as the manager and owner were on holiday! They treated us like idiots. The staff had stolen our belongings this was obvious to everyone. The worst was losing the pictures on the disk in the camera we had taken of our Roman Experience. At the police station the front desk worker told the police the story in Italian. He named seven people that had the code to enter our room and the safe and steal our belongings. What he did not know was that my husband speaks and understands Italian. It is 3 months later and we still have not recieved compensation from their insurance company for our belongings. I email constantly. The last email requested that I send my banking information so they could wire the compensation. I requested a check. They claim they cannot send an Internation Check. And by the way, can we send them our tax ID numbers! Are you kidding......????? Perhaps they want to steal more! I have not heard back from them in 3 weeks. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Checking Out”
Reviews.Author: WyattDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during my honeymoon in Oct. Had a great time, have no complaignts whatsoever. Rooftop Deck is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Book early to avoid disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Shane9292
Reviews.Content: Booked Capo D'Africa after confusing it with another hotel I spotted on my last trip to Rome three years ago. Fortunately - no, VERY fortunately! - it was a lucky 'mistake'. Although the hotel is tucked away up a side street about 150m from the Collessium, do not let this put you off. Its location is perfect for all the key sights and quiet enough (apart from the ubiquitous Vespas!) to be properly relaxing at the end of the day. It is surrounded by a number of good quality eating places from the cheap(ish!) to the expensive, so take your pick. The hotel appears to have been refurbished not too long ago and the interior is quite stylish, but not 'over the top'. No complaints about the spacious room (ours was a double deluxe) apart from the same one everyone has in Italy about there being no tea or coffee making facilities. The buffet breakfast was, on the whole, average to good in terms of quality. The choices did not vary in the three nights we were there, so did get a little repetitive. The front desk staff - particularly Massimo, the duty manager - were very helpful and were clearly proud to welcome you to their city. Only down side was that there was no restaurant service in the hotel in the evenings - so you had to go out to eat - which is not good for such an otherwise good quality establishment. Would I stay there again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: fstanuf
Reviews.Content: Nice spot, large modern rooms, very clean, comfortable beds and walking distance to Colosseum, Forum, Pantheon, St. Peter in Chains, Trevi Fountain, shopping etc... Very nice breakfast, cold and hot, and roof-top deck for wine in the afternoon or evening. Several good restaurants very close. Very helpful staff 24/7. Hotel bar is a bit expensive, avoid it. We also stayed at another nearby hotel a few weeks earlier and Capo d'Aftica was by far the better. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: lwingjr
Reviews.Content: Went with my 85yr old father and they could not have been more accomodating. Price, location, great restaurants within 2 blocks and super staff. Handicap accessible. Complimentary breakfast on the roof of the hotel was wonderful. Bravissimo!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Follow the Crowd”
Reviews.Author: RugLord
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a quiet side street, this one time orphanage is now one of the best values in Rome. If you've travelled to the big cities in Europe like we have, you are always looking for a hotel room that doesn't cost a fortune, is near places you want to see, and is bigger than a walk-in closet. Capo d'Africa is such a place. After exhaustive research, we decided to take a chance on this hotel having only seen the pictures on their website. We weren't disappointed. The rooms are spacious for the price. They are quiet, even the ones facing the street, the bathrooms are ample so you are not bumping into each other, and the location was just fine - especially if you like to walk. The hotel is just 3 blocks or so from the Colluseum, so that is a good first stop. No, it is not near the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto, but you can always take a taxi there and walk around with the crowds. We actually walked from the Colluseum, to the Forum, to the Capitoline Hill, to the Pantheon and were ready for lunch. The hotel offers a big breakfast and your favorite coffee drink on the rooftop at shaded tables. One of our favorite restaurants, including the very expensive ones we sampled, was Il Bocconcino, just down the street from Capo d'Africa. The food was delicious and the prices very reasonable - probably because few tourists dine there. Finally, the staff was most helpful with getting taxis, making restaurant reservations and available for general questions and concerns (our air conditioner pooped out for a short time. But it was fixed promptly).

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but not worth 380 euros a night”
Reviews.Author: voyager50
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel was the location - it was near the Colloseum and Forum and was in a quiet side street. It looks impressive from the outside and has a contemporary lobby. The reception staff were not particularly friendly, we were not welcomed on arrival and we were often ignored as we came in and out. However, one receptionist was very helpful and arranged for us to have a two hour late check-out at no extra charge. We were originally shown to a room on the first floor next to the lift and the lobby and knew it would be noisy and asked for a different one. We were immediately shown to a room on the fourth floor which had more basic decor but was quiet apart from the staff using the store room next door who banged the walls every time they were in it. The hotel has the potential to live up to it's four star rating but doesn't quite manage it - it doesn't pay attention to the details. For example - the clothes rail in the wardrobe goes from front to back - you have to put your clothes behind each other which makes them difficult to get to and you can't fit many in. The other half of the wardrobe has no rail so it is a wasted space. The toilet roll holder was not screwed together so every time you use it it comes off the wall and falls apart! The air conditioning didn't really work but you can't leave the windows open instead as they are weighted to close themselves - you can't even prop them open with a chair as the backs are too low! A a previous reviewer stated - there are no spy holes or security chains on the doors which is disconcerting. The roof terrace is lovely and we enjoyed an afternoon reading there although it was spoilt buy the smell of dead rodent which kept drifting across! On the plus side the bed was very comfortable and the maids did a good job. The breakfast staff were friendly and you can eat as late as 11.00am. My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights and got a very good deal of £628 by booking through Thomas Cook - the hotel's usual rate would have been close to 2000 euros and it would definitely not have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: kuhljen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days at the begining of October. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, though the beds appear to be hard they are actually comfortable. The breakfast is good. Really liked the location on a quiet residental street but only a 3-5 minute walk to the Coliseum. Front desk staff is friendly. There is a great resturant only a couple blocks from the hotel called Pasqualino al Colosseo...must try the pistachio pie. Only drawbacks we found: don't cash dollars into Euros at the hotel. The exchange rate was about $10 less than at a currency exchange. Drinks at the bar are expensive! When you order a jack and coke you get charged 8 euro for the jack and 5 euro for the coke. Also, when getting into the bathtub be careful and make sure the bath mat is in place. It is extremely slick. Overall we loved this hotel and will go back on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: BubsandCo
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel. Helpful friendly staff, large rooms in a light and modern building. Quietish location needing a short walk west to the Colosseum an then onto many other sites. The metro is a similar distance east. Do take time to visit the little church round the corner: San Clemente. Very good buffet breakfast, just what is needed for the day of sightseeing ahead. Many small cafes and resturants nearby for day snacks and evening dining.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a good hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: Flaco10004
Reviews.Content: My wife just spent 4 days here with our teenage nephew on a sightseeing trip and has been raving about the hotel. I booked it for them on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews, location and impression. Delivered on every count, and then some, apparently. Whenever we travel we tend to plan it according to expectations and not budget, so are used to higher end hotels and services. My wife is adamant that Capo d'Africa is the best European hotel she has visited in terms of service and warmth of welcome. She did not have lunch or dinner in the hotel (so cannot comment there) but every other aspect was flawless. Breakfast was particularly good, and scored top marks for the friendliness and conviviality of the waiting staff: that makes for a great start to a day and is in sharp contrast to so many other establishments. Location is superb, with the Colosseum a short walk away. However, the hotel is located off the main route and offers a good degree of seclusion and peace. Perfect. Knowing how fussy and picky my wife can be, I can only say that I regret not having gone on this trip, although she is adamant that this is THE target hotel for the next time. A hotel is nothing if it does not offer 'hospitality' - this one leads the way. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for places to visit and places to eat”
Reviews.Author: Sandy22102010
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel as it was near to where some friends had rented an apartment. It turned out to be just what we needed. It is in a perfect location, close to the Colesuem but quite as it is up a quiet street. However it is also in area where there are lots of little restaurents and bars which suited all price ranges and tastes. There was a complimentry bottle of Champagne awaiting us on arrival, the staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was delicious and the views from the roof top terrace were fantastic. I would recoommend the Hotel d Africa to anyone who wants a good quality Hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Serenity”
Reviews.Author: Tezza1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Capo D'Africa at the end of October with my wife and had a beautiful time. This hotel is located about 400 yards from the Colloseum and is a very warm, friendly and very good quality hotel. The staff were polite, courteous and very helpful all the way through our stay. Nothing was too much trouble even down to when we checked out as they organised our taxi to the airport for us. Absolutely excellent and would highly recommend this hotel. There are also a number of restaurants close by, but do watch out for the aggressive style used to flag you down in the street to get you inside. If you want a quality restaurant go to Papagio's. Its in the same street as the hotel simply turn right out of the hotel, go to the first cross road and then Papagio's is located about a further 80 yards on the right. Fine dining at its best. If its a pizza or pasta you are after then right behind the hotel on the first corner is a great place (cant remember its name). Prices and quality are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bunyip08
Reviews.Content: This Hotel lives up to all the reviews here... what a wonderful place. We spent 3 nights here... in a beautiful room on the 4th floor with views of the Coliseum from the window ( that actually opened!) Its is a quiet area, but close to the Coliseum and the Metro with lots of great restaurants nearby and staff who are friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. Breakfast was great with a good choice and the lobby bar was a great place to unwind after a hard day of sightseeing. My only complaint would be that wifi internet was expensive at 5 euro per half hour. But overall, a fantastic Hotel that I would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “My second visit to this fabuous hotel - it did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: luvgreathotels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this wonderful hotel in 2008 and again in October 2010. It did not disappoint the second time around; it was as perfecto as my first stay there. The hotel building is beautfiul from the exterior and filled with funky art on the main floor lobby. The rooms are quiet, large, clean and comfortable. You can access the internet via the TV in the room which was a welcome service. The included breakfast which is served on the top floor veranda is delicious with varied food and fabulously hospitable servers. The front desk staff are very helpful specialmente "Massimo Alto" who tried to improve my Italian and always made us laugh!!! The hotel is in a great location - a quiet neighbourhood on a quiet street with lots of restaurants nearby. It is a few minutes walk from the Colosseum and most of the major Rome sites. I recommend staying at this charming hotel wholeheartedly!!!

Reviews.Title: “TRIP ADVISOR REVIEWS ARE CORRECT - THIS IS A VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: FATPIKE
Reviews.Content: Clean, attentive staff, good location, quite its all been said before ! I made my choice from all the excellent comments made from genuine travellers like myself. I would reccomend this hotel to others based on our experience. Plus points are great continental breakfast large choice, friut ,cheese, meats, coissants, bread etc and its spotless especially the bathroom. There are towling dressing gowns and slippers and the shower gels etc are premium quality. The only negative and its been said before is that the shower pressure is not that brilliant. Great location for the Colloseum Forum. Use the metro from the Colloso its the nearest 5 min walk, Manzonni is ten minutes. Plenty of restaraunts in the area we found the Papagio to be the best, however its not cheap! Rome is a great city and staying at the Capo D Africa certainly made this short break a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcoming home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Judy-Nino
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the beautiful Capo D'Africa Hotel in Rome. Fabulous room, excellent friendly and courteous staff and superb location. We walked to all major attractions in Rome. The Manager, Massimo Piselli was expecially kind, helpful and made us feel at home. We will definitely be staying at this hotel on our next visit to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dvdcrow
Reviews.Content: We were tired and cranky when we arrived at Capo d'Africa after the drive from Sorrento, with stops to tour Pompeii and the Abbey of Montecassino along the way. Our driver got lost in the city and took some time to find the hotel. However, when we finally arrived, our spirits were quickly lifted by the friendliness of the hotel staff. In short order we were checked in, shown to our room, and had reservations made for us for dinner at 3 Scalini, which was a wonderful dining experience. Capo d'Africa is in a quiet neighborhood near the Colosseum. Our room on the first floor was spacious and comfortable, with lots of closet space and a decent sized bathroom with a large soaking tub. Breakfast was quite good, and the service in the breakfast room was outstanding. We also enjoyed our view of the Colosseum from the breakfast terrace, and seeing it as we walked to Rome's many attractions from our hotel. Although not centrally located, Capo d'Africa is within walking distance of most major attractions, and if you don't want to walk, there's a Metro stop close by. The only time we used the Metro, though, was to get to the Vatican. There are several good restaurants near the hotel; in addition to 3 Scalini, we dined at Luzzi (excellent pizza), Na Machie (good pasta), and 313 Cavour (small plates), and we had excellent meals at all three. It was nice, after the hustle and bustle of city sightseeing, to return to an oasis of calm each night, and to have fine dining nearby. After seeing the crowds and congestion of the areas around the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Piazza Navona, we knew we had made the right choice in selecting Capo d'Africa as our hotel. If we go back to Rome, we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: borjeno
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were met at our car by the very helpful good natured Porter who grabbed our bags and took us straight to reception. The slim lady (Should have got her name she was so great at her job) at reception quickly booked us in and then gave us a map on which she circle all of the major attractions and Hotel. We were in our room within a few minutes of arriving and not left hanging around. The room was a good size and very neat, clean and obviously fairly new. The TV also has the Internet available which was handy as we don't carry laptops or stuff like that. We thought the breakfast was great although some might find it lacking in choice for cooked items. The breakfast staff were always keeping an eye out for items running out, empty tables that needed a clean tablecloth or supplying more tea or coffee. Breakfast was 6.30-11 am and we never turned up to find an uncleared dirty table from previous guests. The resturants around the Hotel were quiet different in prices and the Trattoria on the corner about 5 minutes walk away was an experience not to miss with great food. Overall we had a great time the Hotel was friendly, very clean and the staff were always helpful. It is a 5 minute walk to the Colosseum and from there you can pick up the local transport links or jump on one of the Tourist buses which circle the main tourist sites all day.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent base from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: BathCharlie
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and efficient, this hotel was a good place to stay for a long weekend. The beds were good and we had a quiet room - indeed the position of the hotel on a side street means it's generally peaceful. The only irritant was the constant piped pop music, especially annoying on a Sunday morning when you're breakfasting outside on the roof terrace when all you want to hear is the sound of bells! The waiter immediately switched it off when I asked, so don't be shy. Apart from this minor detail, it was a happy stay. Nearby are several good casual restaurants. Beware of having a drink overlooking the Colosseum - exorbitant!! 80euros for 4 drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near the Colosseum with beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: IssyWA73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Colosseum, and we got to it from the main train station by taking the metro to the Colosseum stop then walking to the hotel. You could make the walk from the train station as well. The hotel is also close to the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill. Some walking or other modes of transportation are in line for other sites such as Vatican City and the Pantheon. The room was very nice, clean, and spacious. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and large enough. The bathroom was lacking a tub if that is something you are looking for. The staff was very friendly and helpful with site seeing and dinner recommendations. They were also able to recommend the best way to get to each of these sites.

Reviews.Title: “beware of the maids”
Reviews.Author: pcm2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Capo as the first part of our honeymoon. We were assigned a room on the ground floor which faced the back yard. The room was functional albeit bland. The package was a bit disappointing and not as nice as the four star hotel we stayed at when we returned to Rome in the same month (the Rose Garden). We found the staff unfriendly and the breakfast staff useless -there was a lot of them but they didn't make any effort to offer tea/coffee (their only function for a buffet breakfast) and seemed to fuss over the buffet unnecesarily (how many times can the cereals be re-arranged?!). All in all we would not have any objection to this hotel had it not been for the maid(s) who threw away a stash of our plastic bags (which were not placed by the bin) without our consent the day before we were due to leave. One of the bags contained a tiny container for my camera charger. We also needed the bags to bag shoes etc. When we came back late at night (about 11-12pm) and this came to our attention we approached reception, the man at reception made a 'crazy' gesture vis a vis the maids and that was it! We have stayed in a number of hotels in the world ranging from 1-5 stars and we have never experienced maids who took it upon themselves to throw our belonginsgs away.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but Would Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: tbari
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel itself was clean with a nice lobby area, cool rooftop and proximity to the Colloseum. However, there if we were to do it again we would stay somewhere else: good: - proximity to Colloseum - were able to check-in early (very key as we flew in on an overnight flight and were exhausted). bad: - bathrooms: weak shower pressure, no dryer, small space - we had to switch rooms twice (1st time too close to lobby (loud), 2nd time toilet broken) - eventually settled for the 3rd room although it was smaller than what we paid. - far from other Rome attractions (non ancient rome ruins) - not much going on in the immediate neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: Gomyone
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights here for our very first trip to Rome (and first trip to Italy which included stops in Florence and Venice as well). This hotel was a fanastic introduction to Italy!! The service was excellent (and through my conversations with the desk clerk prior to arriving in Rome) we knew that this hotel was all about making their guests feel comfortable. Beyond service, the best part about this hotel is its location, its very close to the Colloseum and situated in a nice Roman neighbourhood that is outside of the "tourist trap" areas where most of the big name hotels are. Booking here will give you a nice taste of what its like to live in Rome! If you book here, expect a nice modern-styled room, reminiscient of "business-style" boutique hotels in North America. The rooftop breakfast room/outdoor patio is fantastic with wonderful panoramic views of the city (and the Colloseum itself). There is a good selection of items in the breakfast buffet and in the evenings, the hotel also does a nice BBQ (if you didn't feel like trying one of the many amazing restaurants in Rome - some within walking distance of this hotel). All in all, a wonderful little hotel that I would definitely return to!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent - Everything you need to know”
Reviews.Author: lauraleo_9
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband arrived back yesterday from Rome, We went as part of our first year anniversary / honeymoon. We went from Thurs to Mon, so we had 3 full days really. We booked through Expedia - ended up on Thomas Cook's page our flights were with Brussels airlines outbound and Lufthansia inbound. We booked the transfers from the airport fiumicino to the hotel and from the hotel to the airport through thomas cook at the same time, on arriving at fiumicino you enter the arrivals after collecting your baggage - expedia is the yellow desk next to the blue desk, the driver will be stood here. We stayed at the Capo D'Africa on B&B basis, the hotel is gorgeous, we got an upgrade to a junior suite upon arrival. All the staff were extremely helpful, its actually the best service we have ever had. TOP TIPS: Water on tap - I reccommend you buy a bottle of water, then fill it up for free from one of the many water fountains (not the trevi fountain) but these water fountains are all over rome and especially in the main sites except the colosseum - we never came across one in there. The bread they bring you before your evening meal is NOT always included - check on this as sometimes it can be an unexpected cost from 1 Euro to 5 Euro's. Safety - I read lots about pick pockets - and was especially worried about us falling victim's. I think that because i was so aware of it, it made me more conscious of people, so my tip especially if your travelling with someone else is to keep an eye on your surroundings, if anyone gets too close pull your fellow traveller away from the situation and i would mention to my husband when ever someone got too close, the word pockets, to which he would put his hands in his pockets straight away. Anyway we never saw anyone and never got pick pocketed. Travel - Everything is within walking distance, the map looks big, but you can walk around very easily and if you catch buses and other transport you may miss some of the beautiful sites. If you want to go to the Vatican gardens - you need to pre book this before you go, allow plenty of time before travelling. Download Rick Steve's free audio guide Gladiator's - There are many gladiators walking around the main attractions - they want you to take a photo of them and you then they want you to pay for it. If you want to do this then agree a price beforehand - a few Euro's is more than enough. Street beggers - now this is a common problem all over the world in major cities and rome is no different, They lie face down on the floor with their hands out and look old and fragile, don't always be fooled - i saw a few who had exceptionally young looking hands for the portrayal of an elderly fragile lady !!! hmmm upto you. Drink plenty of water and rest in the shade - it's very hot in the sun looking at sites. RESTAURANTS: These are places i am reccommending: Pasqualino al Colosseo, this is on Via SS. Quattro, one street down from the hotel and to the right (they charge for bread 4 Euro's) Ricevuta Fiscale O Fattura? i think this is the name, but it is on the road marked Via Baccina, south east (as you look at the map) of the Colonna Traiana or left of the site S. Pietro in Vincoli - They don't charge for bread and have set menu's we had the roast chicken with fries and salad. HOTEL: I had done a lot of research into this trip before we left, and found this hotel, it is everything we wanted, and i have high standards, and wouldn't stay in any hotel below a 4 star. Breakfast - The roof terrace is beautiful, breakfast is served from 6.30am until 11am, the staff were attentive and proficient in keeping the area clean and refreshed with food and drinks, the breakfast consisted of fresh juices, water, breads, cereals, croissants and other pastries, cakes, yoghurts and yoghurt drinks, fresh fruit, nuts, crackers, jams, honey and chocolate spread, mozzarella balls and tomoatoes... the hot bits were small sausages and scrambled eggs, pots of tea and cups of coffee. Plenty of choice really. TV - The TV has only three english speaking channels, and two were news, not a problem for us as we were hardly in our room. Has and has not - There was no iron or ironing board but would assume you could request one from reception, there was also no tea / coffee making facilities, but we took our travel kettle. However there is a hairdryer - not very fast but dried my long hair with a little patience. There is a small fridge filled as a mini bar - which we used to put our bottles of water in. The rooms were kept very clean and tidy, we had a turn down service each night, and our room had red slippers and white robes There is a fully equiped gym that is air conditioned with fresh towels, we didn't use it but we did go and have a look. The location of the hotel is perfect, we felt safe and there was no noise at night, Everything is within walking distance and i have a knee injury, plus the restaurants in the area are wonderful. PRICE LIST: Vatican City and Sistine Chapel = 15 Euro per person Cupola = 5 Euro stairs / 7 Euro lift per person Castel Sant' Angelo = 8.50 Euro per person Colosseum / Roman Forum / Palatine Hill = 18 Euro per person (Lasts 2 days) Metro = 1 Euro valid for one way per person Tour Bus = 20 Euro for 24 hours / 25 Euro for 48 hours (Hop on hop off) per person St. Peter's Bascilia and Square = Free The Roman Pantheon = Free The Spanish steps = Free (Very crowded) The Trevi Fountain = Free (very crowded) Arco di Constantino = Free Area Sacra = Free (under excavation) Circo Massimo = (under excavation) SITES: St. Peter's Bascilia and Vatican City :- We visited St. Peter's Bascilia and the Vatican City on our first day, we caught the metro and headed towards Battistini,we caught this at Manzoni station (Line A), but you can catch it from Colosseo (Line B) which is marked on the map behind the colosseum, then change at Termini, and you get off at Ottaviano. It costs 1 Euro per person each way, but won't give change higher than from a 5 Euro note. It lasts 75 mins from purchase, and the journey is fast and reliable. Then it's a short walk to Vatican city where at this point you will get asked if you want a tour by numerous people, either ignore them and do not engage in conversation or if you want a tour - ask how much. We did not queue for the vatican at all, even though the tour guides were saying there was a 2 hour wait..... We had downloaded the Rick steve's audio guide from itunes which is free and has many tours for Rome, i would reccommend you buy his book as well, but we just used the audio, You really need to start at vatican city then you go through the vatican to the sistine chapel (Don't sit on the steps, don't speak or take pictures - this is a sacred area) - the cafe is not very good for food in the vatican in my opinion. From there you can go to the Cupola which is the highest dome at St. Peter's it costs 7 Euro for the lift and 5 Euro for the stairs - either way you still have to walk up 320 steps to get to the very top and see the wonderful panoramic view of Rome - Don't worry if you cannot make it up here though (see Castel Sant' Angelo) After the Cupola you end up in St. Peter's bascilia, this church has buried in the main tomb the body of st. Peter, worth a visit even for non believers, like my husband. The magnitude of the place is awe inspiring. From here you enter down the steps to the square, the vatican has it's own postal service, and you may want to use the post boxes here for your post cards, they are in the square as you exit the bascilia on the right hand side. Colosseum:- The main attraction we wanted to see, with such history and splendour, it is a wonderful site to visit. It has been used as many things in it's past from the arena it's well known for to a refuge, a church, and a place for the homeless, until it was brought back to life and partially restored. Sit down and imagine life back in roman times, in this site used to be a man made lake owned by Nero before the colosseum was built. You cannot wander through the floor arena, but you can use your imagination. Lots to read about as you walk around this colossal building that has withstood many earthquakes in it's lifetime. The Roman Forum / Palatine Hill:- This is a very big site to visit - The forum has an abundance of archeological finds, you may wish to purchase the audio guide for this and share between 2, take your own ear phones and plug them into the device - it costs 6 Euro per device for 3 hours, (you need to leave a credit card or driving document, just to ensure you return it - it's safe). The area is very uneven and hilly with lots of steps to climb, but as long as you keep resting it is something you can do. You get to climb to the top of palatine hill and see the beautiful gardens, (this is all connected - so can be a long day but upto you) Castel Sant' Angelo:- I wanted to visit this because i love castle's and love the statues that adorn the bridge as you enter named Ponte Sant' Angelo. The castle is strange - not particularly pretty from the outside and a little unusual from the inside - there is no audio guide, so take a real tour guide or buy a book to make sense - or walk around and enjoy the architecture and make your own story up about the castle. The views over the city from the top are just as good as from the cupola at St. Peter's Bascilia. The on site restaurant is very expensive and takes a long time to get served if you want to sit outside. The Roman Pantheon:- You need to take a step back to fully appreciate this, there is a McDonalds opposite, go to this point and you will see the dome of the Pantheon, when you step inside take a look at the height of the doors and then draw your eyes to the ceiling - it's open and the sun shines straight through, many people are buried here such as Raphael the architect / painter. Piazza Navona:- A very famous piazza, the square has three fountains which are beautiful, and lots of painters who are selling oil painting - if your thinking or buying a painting think about how your going to get it home? you need a tube for it really. But the paintings are outstanding - they look so real, there is some real talent from these people. We didn't stop for a drink, but would of if we had more time. The Spanish Steps:- We walked here and sat on the steps and took in the atmosphere of the area, it is a truly designer street - with all the major fashio designers in the area. You can take the metro from the hotel from colosseo Line B - connect at Termini onto Line A and get off at Spagna - which is Spanish steps. This line is also great for the Trevi fountain, but you can walk to it within a few mintes from the spanish steps. The Trevi Fountain:- We had to go here as it's a must do item. go and throw your coin into the fountain which is supposed to ensure your return to the eternal city in the future, photographers ask if you want a polaroid of you at the fountain - again upto you, we didn't, we thought they were a little pushy. Stay stern if you don't want things but be polite. Well that is about it really, i hope this helps people who are planning trips to Rome, I found our little bits and pieces but would have loved to have known more - all in one place - this has taken some time to write - but if you have any enquiries, i am more than happy to help if i can. Please remember all of the above quotes are solely the opinions of myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great restful base for a busy city”
Reviews.Author: ihatepavelbure
Reviews.Content: This clean, modern hotel provided one of the best staying experiences I've had in Europe. A reviewer earlier commented that it didn't provide the colorful and eclectic experience he wanted--this is true, there's nothing overly unusual with this hotel. It's elegant, understated and restful, which was just what my husband and I were looking for when we arrived in Rome. Some people hate Rome because it is dirty, busy and loud--we absolutely love Rome for that reason, but because the city IS so colorful it was nice to escape into Capo d'Africa at night. The front desk staff was extremely helpful, unparalleled and warm--they were anxious to help make our trip ideal and arranged wonderful dinners every night at great restaurants. The patio breakfast was lovely and has been well-described here. The hotel is blocks from the Colosseum with a great view of the structure, and is right next to Basilica Santi Quattro Coronati, a fortress-like church which has gone through many phases in history. Apparently the original structure was built in the 300s, making it venerable by even Roman standards. In sum, this relaxing hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All the sun and kindness of Italy in one place”
Reviews.Author: BertMaes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, we felt very welcome and the staff went through great lengths to inform and help us. The rooms are not very large but comfortable and clean. The breakfast with a view on the colloseum was great and again the service was friendly. Although the hotel has not real restaurant, we did enjoy the barbecue (it was actually the cheapest diner we had during our stay in Rome). The staff was very helpful in pointing out "original, less tourist" restaurants with great food. Nice hotel overal, add a swimming pool and it would one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lewisbenji
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very disappointed with our experience at this hotel. We have travelled quite a bit and don't go out of our way to complain, however this hotel is overpriced and small. The location is close to the coloseum, however it is not close to the central part of the city (ie all the other tourist attractions, shopping, restaurants), so you need to get transport to get around. Unfortunately we also had a legitimate complaint raised with the hotel and they simply had no interest in helping us. We stayed in another hotel on our last night which was much cheaper, big room, great location. We also didn't look too hard to find something better. I personally would pick a hotel that is more centrally located as once you have visted the coloseum & forum, you will want to be more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Haven after Hotel Celio disaster.”
Reviews.Author: Mauilover_9
Reviews.Content: What a relief. After spending two nights of hell and enduring the most ignorant customer service in my life, the Capo d"Africa was salvation. We had gone from rude customer service to excellent customer service. From cramped, dark accommodation to bright and airy. From pathetic A/C to real A/C, and believe me, this is necessary if visiting Rome in August. From a meager breakfast to a virtual feast. Mind you, you pay for it. Book in advance using the internet. You get gouged when you show up at the door like we did. The hotel is everything a hotel should be. I thought the 35 euro charge for the internet/tv was excessive. But this is a minor thing. The location is superb for visiting Rome's great cultural attractions and an easy 10 minute walk from the subway. When you get out of the subway, you are facing the Colosseum, walk to the left to get to the area where the hotel is. You have to cross a busy intersection and the hotel is two streets over.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: SHChicago
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to be near ancient Rome. It's a lovely hotel with very comfortable rooms and a wonderful breakfast on the terrace. Service was excellent. If you like to discover a city on foot, this also a great place to stay because you can walk to everything. The only time we took a taxi was when pressed for time due to early a.m. reservations at the Borghese and the Vatican. Otherwise, we enjoyed the magical walk past the Colosseum and the Forum every day.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat from the cowds and the traffic”
Reviews.Author: SusanJones30
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, stylish hotel with beautifully furnished rooms which are very clean and comfortable. The terrace on the roof where breakfast is served is very pleasant and has views of the Colosseum and the Domus Aurea Park. Despite its central location it is in a fairly quiet residential area and the rooms were incredibly quiet at night. The quality of the breakfast is good: it is buffet style with plenty of choice. Food is served on the terrace at night, but while we were there nobody seemed to be using it, so there wasn't much of an ambience. The hotel is convenient for visiting the remains of ancient Rome which are 5-10 minutes walk away,,but the centre in terms of restaurants, shopping and other sights is about 20-30 minutes walk or a 10 minute walk and a metro journey. We couldnt work out the buses. As the hotel is in a residential area, the restaurants immediately surrounding it are authentically Italian and the ones we used were good but simple. If you want to eat in an area which caters more for tourists but which would possibly be less authentic, you need to travel to the centre. Finally, the hotel staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I am sure there are better hotels in Rome, but why bother to try and find them!”
Reviews.Author: amanapart
Reviews.Content: The plane was late, the limo was late but none of that mattered when we arrived. A really attractive property in a quiet side street, literally a few minutes walk from the Colosseum. As for the rest of Rome, take a taxi, they are cheap, comfortable and always waiting in the rank at the end of the street. The hotel is clean, the staff are excellent, the rooms are spacious and the free buffet breakfast on the roof terrace is plentiful and varied. There is no restaurant, but why would you want to eat in the hotel when you are in Rome? As a general guideline, avoid the local restaurants around the hotel for the evening and take a taxi (euro10) to somewhere like Piazza Navona or Trastevere. During the day, there is much to see within walking distance and if you have to go to Ferragamo, walk there from the Pantheon via the Trevi Fountain. One negative, and for many not a small one, there is no free internet! You can pay an outrageous price for a wifi connection in the lobby, or a somewhat lesser fee for a connection through the room TV. Don't even bother with the latter, its almost impossible to read the average webpage on a non-HD screen. Oh, and heres a BIG tip. If you are planning to tour the Vatican, and you should, pre-book on their website and you will save yourself an hour plus queuing in line. Finally, no review is complete with a mention for that one special character who makes the stay even more special. Do not miss the opportunity to spend a few minutes talking with the Night Manager Franco. He is an experience you should not miss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_Rome_123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and spent the last 3 days in Rome at Capo d'Africa Hotel. It is a great hotel with a fabulous roof top terrace. Beds are comfortable and hotel is very clean. I would definately recommend the hotel and will stay here the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: AjayBournemouth
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel with very friendly staff and a great room. The location is just next to the colosseum so ideal for exploration and we walked everywhere in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vija23
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for our honeymoon. We booked due to proximity to the Colosseum & because of good reviews on trip advisor. Location is just OK: It is close to the Colosseum & Forum & while you will visit them, you will find you want to be closer to the city & the rest of Rome's other many attractions during your trip. It is also not very close to night-life, shopping & good restaurants so you will need to catch the Metro or a taxi to get around. .Whereas if you are in the right district, most of Rome can be done on foot. The room was OK: Clean, modern but very small. Staff were helpful/friendly. The cost was expensive given the location. Once in Rome, we found a lot of other wonderful accommodation options in better locations for less which we wished we had booked. While the hotel is not good value for money, I would not write a bad review except for what happened next...On the only occasion I forgot to lock the safe, 700 euro was stolen by a member of staff. This happened while our room was serviced. Even the hotel staff admitted to us the theft was by a staff member. Given the circumstances I would assume the Hotel would reimburse us. We followed all of their instructions and made a police report in Rome immediately. We were asked to wait while they resolved this through insurance. .We waited very patiently for over 3 months. The hotel failed to keep us updated unless we chased them. Finally they advise us that we can have a few nights free accommodation only. They know we live in Australia & can't use this which we made very clear to them. I have even checked with the Italian consumer body & the hotel is required under Italian law to reimburse us, however they will not negotiate any further on this. You can take or leave this review for what it is. You can take your chance and hopefully you wont be subject to a theft or complaint which the hotel probably wont help you with. But in all honestly you can no doubt find a better hotel for location and price regardless.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: valSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this hotel to us and we had a good stay at it. We were travelling with our teen age son . Room was spacious and clean although the carpet were a little bit worn out with some stains on it. Bathroom is small but ok. Breakfast was included in our rate and there were many options. My only suggestion would be to improve the quality of the breads offered. Reception staff was very helpful and they provided us with an early check-in which was great since we travelled 12 hours on an overnight flight. The equipments at the gym were not working properly and need maintenance. We could only use the free weights and the treadmill. The location is very good near the ancient rome and of easy access.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rome..”
Reviews.Author: karenc
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day stay at the capo d'africa.It is a lovely hotel with nice friendly staff.The room we had ,207 was nice, lovely comfy beds, a smallish bathroom and good size of closet with in room safe.The breakfast room ison the 4th floor and you can sit inside or out .As the weather was beautiful we ate outside on the terrace every day. The breakfast as most other reviewers say is very filling with a choice of pot of coffee or tea selection. All in all a lovely stay and rome is such a wonderful place that i will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Goonerette
Reviews.Content: At first we thought the hotel was a little out of the way but soon realise we were glad to be off the main streets due to all the traffic noise in Rome! I travelled with my sister-in-law for a long weekend. We booked the hotel through Expedia, all went well with the exception of the transfer from Rome airport to the hotel which took over 2.5 hours and is really only half an hour away!! That was the only complaint for the whole journey. Definitely going back to Rome again and would happily stay here as its clean with friendly staff and good size room – although we had a twin which could have made a difference I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon - clean, comfortable and close to ancient Rome.”
Reviews.Author: T0r0nt0traveller
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel. NIcely located about a block from the Collesseum and other attractions. Close to OK restaurants. Walking distance to almost everywhere. Subway (which I highly recommend - very easy) is close too. Good breakfast (juice, bacon/meat, eggs, croissants, cereal, etc.) Wonderful rooftop terrace. Very clean. Comfortable beds. Polite staff. BIg enough to be private but small. Hair dryer, slippers, robe, room service, electricity converter, minibar in room. My single complaint was a broken air conditioner on ONE night. It was fixed the very next day. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great service”
Reviews.Author: Joodle
Reviews.Content: Our neighbours recommended this hotel to us and it did not disappoint. We stayed in a deluxe double room overlooking the entrance to the hotel on the 3rd floor. Room was spacious and clean; breakfast was lovely, sitting on the rooftop terrace! Reception staff were fantastic, so helpful, nothing was too much trouble. They recommended excellent restaurants to us each night and ordered taxis which appeared within minutes.....I couldn't find any fault at all in this hotel. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fab location, perfect after a long day of sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: Boogie10
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from the Coloseum and the tube, this hotel is great. Very friendly staff in all areas of the hotel. Spacious, clean and comfortable rooms. Very quiet at night which is a real bonus, also a bath & shower for soaking a tired body after walking miles. Hop on hop off tour bus is a great idea to see the city, also the metro is good. Would recommend a proper guided tour of the Vatican museum, Sistine Chapel & St Peter's Basilica. A real must is a Rome by Segway tour, a fantastic way to see the city and such good fun.

Reviews.Title: “Capo has great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: amlee71
Reviews.Content: Capo is a beautiful hotel. The breakfast is top notch for Europe ( eggs, cheese,etc.) Usually, hotels offer fruit and bread for breakfast, so this was a nice benefit! The rooms are very clean and relatively quiet. I found the staff friendly for the most part and kind. It's a bit pricey, but remember that prices are higher if you're near major attractions and the rooms are bigger and more contemporary. The Colosseo Metro stop is a ten minute walk and the buses are about a two minute walk. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Lynnette
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel in April. The hotel is beautiful and very modern. The roof top breakfast deck had a lovely view of the Coliseum. The location was great for visiting ancient Rome and easy walking to the center of town. The bed was too firm for my taste, but all in all a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mark785643701
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be near Colosseum, which is only about a 5 min. walk away. Metro stop beside Colosseum so easy to access rest of city. Hotel rooms were good, but not luxurious. Not a 4 star hotel in my opinion but a nice place. Breakfast buffet was quite good and service was as well. Internet access not available except for outrageous $25/hour charge. Nice wine bar on the corner nearby with a number of other restaurants within walking distance. Front desk staff not very competent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great staff, we would definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: lurvely_Rae
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed at the Capo D'Africa from 22/4/10 - 26/4/10 so have been back less than a week. Firstly let me say that the staff in this hotel are amazing, the friendliest we have encountered. The porters, the receptionists, the maids and the breakfast staff were all lovely and very helpful we had no problems whatsoever. We stayed in room 314, it was exactly as depicted in their photographs. The bathroom is excellent, very good shower, very powerful (and also for all you ladies out there it is a shower that comes off the wall so you can bring it down to wash with which is much better than the ones fixed in the walls ;-) ). The bed is absolutely huge and made to perfection every day by the maid. They had a TV in the room with approximately 9 channels, one of which was Sky News so whilst getting ready for days out we could catch up on what was happening in the World. Breakfast was served until 11:30am which is great as some hotels stop at about 10:00am. There were lots of breakfast staff on hand who sit you straight away and ask if you want tea, coffee, cappuchino etc. Great selection of cakes!! If it is warm enough you can sit outside on the roof terrace at breakfast which we did twice, the second time we had a table with a view of the Colloseum. There is an excellent safe in the rooms whereby you can set a new PIN code every time you use it so there is no way the staff can know your code. There are 4 floors in this hotel (I think a basement too) and a very efficient lift (elevator) if you are like me and want to save your legs for the Palatine. The overall presentation of this hotel is excellent and vey clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We loved it. Great location for Ancient Rome. Very very small negative points (almost not worth mentioning) the beds are firm which is great but verging on the 'too hard' side. The air conditioning was switched off as apparently they only operate it from May onwards and at times the room was boiling hot but im sure this wouldnt be a problem in the Summer once the air con is operational. The hot part of breakfast was reasonable for a buffet but could be improved. Other than those small points which I hope do not put you off, I would say stay at Capo D'Africa!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: houstongal33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-april and had a fabulous stay! The hotel is in a great location- the neighborhood surrounding it had everything we needed. The room was clean and well appointed. The breakfast room was great and all the servers there were so friendly and helpful, not to mention the breakfast was really tasty! Oh and there's a nice workout room in the basement that we used to burn off some of the many calories we ingested! We didnt use the internet service as there is a wine bar right down the street that advertised free wi-fi and happened to serve reasonable, delicios wine by the glass and appetizers!

Reviews.Title: “great location , clean, very good breakfast, internet useless and expensive"”
Reviews.Author: mospat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week here. When we arrived we were told we were being upgraded to a fantastic room with views to the Colosseum , sounded great as we had booked a delux room! We were taken to room 412.......do not stay in this room! It was very small, no wardrobe space , to see the Colesseum you would have to hang out the window and viw it across the terrace. We were given another room 126 which was much better.Normal Internet did not work so we had to use the wireless for 10Euros an hour, tthe most expensive I have ever seen in all my travels. Staff very helpfull. Local restaurants mostly tourist traps but reasonable. We chose to go to Crispi 19 one evening as it is the No1 reccommentd one on Tripadvisor and it did not disappoint , the fish tsater menu was excellent....... The best value of all in Rome is the MetroBus weekly pass. Overall the Hotel was very good, brilliant location, clean , quiet , breakfast was outstanding with all we wanted and more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: obsd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights in March in this lovely hotel. Everything exeeded our expectations. The staff were helpful and polite. Our room was clean, modern, well maintained, turn down service was a nice touch, as well as bath robes and slippers. We slept with the window opened to the quiet street and an old church across. The breakfast room, servers and food were great. Beautiiful terraces on both sides of the roof, with a view of Colosseum. I enjoyed the view even sitting inside! Wonderful location: we walked everywhere from the hotel, even to the Vatican. Night walks were the best: no crowds and full moon over the old ruins... All in all, we highly recomend this hotel, hope to stay in it again next time we are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAS2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa on the recommendation of a friend and we weren't disappointed. It was very centrally located - about 5 min or so walk from the colosseum and very accessible to all of Rome's other main attractions. The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff were very good. There was a mixture of guests in terms of nationality and ages. The restaurant was on the top floor and had a roof terrace where you could have breakfast if the weather was warm enough. You even had a view of the colosseum from there. The breakfast was probably one of the best we've had on a city break - catering for all tastes including Kellogs miniature boxes of cereal! When you arrive in Rome we were approached by a private taxi driver who offered to take us and a few others direct to our hotels for Euro 15 per person. We didn't know whether it was a fair deal or not but having just arrived and not knowing where to go we decided to go with him. On the return to the airport the hotel offered to arrange a taxi for us for Euro 40 for us both but we walked to the main station (about 25 min walk) and got the train direct to the airport for Euro 15 each. We did find out that you could get an open return bus ticket from the airport to the city centre for Euro 11 each but we never did find out where the bus station was and therefore how far it was from the hotel. The hotel reception staff were very helpful and organised our pre-booked tickets for the Vatican museums and St Peter's Basilica - well worth doing for the Euro2 each commission we paid. If you don't pre-book you have to queue outside the Vatican walls to get tickets. We have done the Vatican twice and in September we queued for probably 2 hours plus and on this trip we reckon the queue was about 1.5 to 2 hours again. If you have pre-booked tickets you go round to the museum entrance and queue for about 20 mins. We had a timed slot of 12noon but were 30 mins early but still got in OK. There is a lot to see in the museums, the contents of which are phenominal, including, of course, the Sistene Chapel which is worth the long walk. There is a lovely cafe which surprisingly was reasonably priced and seemed to do a variety of food although we had already bought paninis from a panini bar just opposite the Vatican. Italy is the home of great cuisine and there is no shortage of eateries of all price ranges. We went to one called Naumachie (turn right outside of hotel and first right and it's down on the left hand side on the corner) again recommended by the same friend. It was excellent. Very good food and reasonably priced although not a huge selection. We did try the Royal Art Cafe Hotel restaurant just opposite the colosseum but it was pricey and no better than Naumachie really. All in all this was one of the best city breaks we've had and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally good service!”
Reviews.Author: joanoArmagh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We received a really warm welcome and great assistance throughout our stay. We found the location far enough out of the city centre to enable us to enjoy a quiet restful night's sleep and yet were able to walk in to main centre. It is virtually beside the Colosseum in a quiet street. A small supermarket nearby was useful for buying bottles of water (20cent) and fruit. Our deal included breakfast which was very good standard. Lots of fruit, rolls. scrambled/boiled eggs, hams and selection of cheeses. Everything about this hotel pleased us. Room was well appointed and serviced etc with slippers and bathrobes. included. Exceptionally clean. A word of warning, we had a bank card stolen at an ATM by a clever trickster at Piazza Bernini nr City Tour Bus stop. Obviously waiting for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Capo D'Africa for seven nights. The hotel is located just five blocks from the Colloseo and Roman Forum yet is on a quiet side street. I had a single room on the third floor that overlooked the street and another hotel. The room itself was on the small side but OK for one person. Small but functional bathroom with a rather tiny shower. The bed was very comfortable and the room clean with good daily housekeeping. I generally don't eat breakfast so I can't comment on the included breakfast offered. However, the hotel does have a kitchen and a nice room service menu that is available. I ordered room service several evenings and found the food very good considering the hotel doesn't actually have its own restaurant. There is also a well-stocked mini-bar with reasonable prices. Overall, this property served my purposes well and I can highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet location, top breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sydlonath
Reviews.Content: excellent place to be based in you want some peace and quiet in such a manic city! yummy yummy breakfast, good service and good sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable, well managed”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100
