Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three night stay in this pleasant just-about-four star hotel, sharing a room with our ten year old granddaughter. The property is well located on a quiet mixed-use street, just a few minutes’ walk from the Colosseum, the Foro Romano, the Palatine and San Clemente and it’s connected with the rest of Rome by frequent bus services on a nearby street and by the Colosseum metro. The hotel is a conversion of a large 19c town house. The decor is low key contemporary with some interesting art and some might regard it as bland. Our room was adequately sized and well equipped. However, the (shower only) bathroom was tiny and ‘persons of size’ would find it difficult to negotiate. There is in-room internet access, pay-as-you-go (expensive). The laundry service was good and much faster than promised. . We ate only breakfast in the hotel. This is provided in buffet format in a rooftop room with an outdoor terrace and is adequate, with good staff support, but not memorable. There are several mid-market restaurants in the immediate area All the staff we met were pleasant and helpful and our few requests for help were dealt with very quickly. This is not a luxury or ‘destination’ hotel and it is relatively expensive. But we recommend it as a good base for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “expensive unless you get a special deal”
Reviews.Author: carolineportugal
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time we have stayed at this hotel and it has remained constant in its friendliness and the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms and public areas. However we would not have stayed again had we not received a special deal of four nights for the price of three. I feel that it has become expensive. In most hotels we have stayed in free wireless internet has been available and this would be the minimum I would expect from a four star hotel charging these rates. The hotel is in an excellent area five minutes walk from the coloseum, forum and the underground station. During the past few years several restaurants have opened in the area and most are good value with good food. I love Rome and will return again and again but unless there are good deals to be had I doubt I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with expensive rates”
Reviews.Author: megan222
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and neat. Location was good. Overall our impression was that the rates were too high and we expected more for the price charged. After we checked the ratings and stayed there - we went back and checked the reviews again and suprisingly noticed the speed at which management responded to all reviews and the number of reviews that were single contributions. Figure and read between the lines................ Message - read average and poor contributions as well to get an accurate unbiased account.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Happier with Capo D'Africa”
Reviews.Author: CasterManCorona
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Capo D'Africa for 6 nights (1-18 thru 1-24-2010) and had a wonderful time. The staff was super helpful (especially Enrico) and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. For instance, we would tell them where we wanted to eat and they would happily make our reservations, print us out a map if we were taking the metro/walking, or call us a cab. They also were a good source of information about the neighborhood trattorias/espresso bars. The breakfast buffet had everything we needed (fresh whole fruit, pastries, scrambled eggs, fresh squeezed orange juice, cheeses/meats, etc.). The attendants at the breakfast buffet were also very friendly and would bring coffee, tea, espresso, or cappucinos at a moments notice. As far as location, the hotel is very close to the Colosseum (5 minute walk) and is approximately a 10 minute walk to the Manzoni Metro stop. There is no road/car/street noise to speak of as Capo D'Africa is not on a main street. We stayed in room 214 and were very happy with the furnishings/condition/cleanliness of everything. We looked at a variety of other hotels before settling on this one (Hotel Forum, Hotel Colosseum, Duca D'Alba) and walked by them all during our trip. Capo D'Africa has a better location and appeared in much better condition than any of those. We were aware of the internet policy (all you have to do is email them and they respond next day so there shouldn't be any surprises) and it was similar to the other properties we considered. Definitely not a reason to avoid the friendly people, good location, and the other positive attributes of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Capo d Africa - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quju
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome the week of Christmas and stayed at this hotel. We loved the hotel, the staff and the location. Our bags were lost when we arrived in Rome, and the hotel staff constantly called the airline for updates. The location is great (a couple of blocks from anchient rome) and there are several resteraunts in the area that are great -- especially Gran Caffe Rossi Martini!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: futuresailor82
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, in a fantastic location just a stroll away from ancient Rome. Staff were very friendly, and service was first class. Breakfast each morning on the terrace was wonderful and provide a great start to the day. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, a must stay if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL / DELIGHTFUL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: sov09
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel! - Location is perfect: Just a few minutes by feet from the coliseum and main tranportation lines) - Rooms are clean and decorated in a nice contemporary style - the personal make their maximum to make us feel at ease in the hotel. On my first day at the hotel, one of the lady of the breakfast room discovered to gluten and on the following day she ordered for me a plate full of free gluten pastries. That might seem to be a small detail but that's usually small details that make the difference and make us want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Capo d'Africa was charming”
Reviews.Author: bsh031
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 2 night stay at Capo d'Africa Hotel. The hotel is lovely modern and chic.The lobby has a pleasant bar and we were served around midnight with no problem. The breakfast room was so lovely. The staff was very courteous and helpful and the rooms were well appointed. If you are used to upscale boutique hotels this one is for you. The hotel is convenient to the Colosseum, Palatine, the Forum and the Metro. We stayed one night in a disappointing Colosseum hotel but change to Capo d' Africa and were so glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “A totally joyful sojourn.”
Reviews.Author: Polidori
Reviews.Content: I totally enjoyed my stay at this fine hotel. Everyone was friendly, so helpful, patient, and affable. The room was lovely with a well appointed bath complete with plush terry cloth robe and slippers. Laundry service was fast and well done. The bar is well stocked and very well tended, and the hotel food is well prepared. A short 21/2 block walk to the coliseum and a nearby taxi stand - just 2 blocks away. Some good restaurants and at least on trattoria in the immediate vicinity - no more than 2-3 blocks away. The rooftop breakfast is more than adequate with a variety of breakfast foods - cereals, cold meats and cheeses, breads, eggs, hot meats, fruit, juices, variety of coffee, even soy milk. One can choose to eat in or outdoors. The coliseum is clearly visible. I would definitely return. I have traveled to Rome on several occasions, and this was the best experience of all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Capo D'Africa”
Reviews.Author: sjtenem
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it was clean and very quiet. Rooms not that big but definitely well kept. We really liked the area around the hotel - it was more residential which was nice to walk through after a long day of travels. Also - the road about one block up from the hotel turns into a busy spot at night, good people watching. Of course, the proximity to the colesseo was excellent - I LOVED walking past it every day. Hotel staff was pretty friendly too - helped us out in making reservations for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and best trip/experience of our life”
Reviews.Author: NOWAYPOSSIBLE
Reviews.Content: Combining family vacation to Rome, Italy with a work trip to Heidelburg, Germany, my husband, 19 yr old daughter and I had the best experience of our lives . . .we love Rome and the Hotel d'Africa within viewing distance of the Coliseum was fantastic! It was on a quaint side street outside of the "craziness" of some of the other areas of Rome but we were still able to walk to some of the main attractions such as the Trevi fountain and Pantheon and of course the Coliseum, Forum, etc are right by the hotel. . . of course you must go to the Vatican . . also checl out the Capuchin Crypt in Rome - kind of creepy but very interesting . . The Hotel d'Africa is an art deco very neat boutique type hotel (which is not type of hotel I'm used to staying but we loved this hotel) - make sure at the end of a long day of sightseeing you order a drink/snack to be delivered to the rooftop terrace/patio . . right around the corner from the hotel is a neighbor wine/cheese shop that does "happy hour" tastings, there's also a gelato shop around the corner and a "college age' bar called the Tree or something like that . . .and literally couple block walk to the Coliseum and all the restaurants/little stores around there . . .and definitely take a "tour" of the monastery right at the hotel - unbelievably beautiful and rich in history and current mix . . we were in a room that faced the main street - narrow room but plenty big for the 3 of us -- large double or queen I think and a "twin" size bed for our daughter .. .hopefully we will have the change to go back one day - and I definitely would stay at same hotel. ..

Reviews.Title: “Bad location and not worth how much you pay...AT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: leavingDCforatrip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, I'll give it that. But the location is bad, bad, bad. Out beyond Coloseum and not in historic center which would be much better. And the place is very, very, very expensive for what you're getting. I'm still fighting with the hotel about the charges on my credit card FOUR MONTHS after the trip. And the worst part of it is that the people who work there are so mean! This was my honeymoon and I was expecting much more. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: packersfan5
Reviews.Content: Great room with great service. Surrounding outside restaurants faced the Forum

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: sdgt625
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice 4-star hotel near the Colisseum, this is the place to choose. The rooms are modern and fairly spacious with decent sized bathrooms, and the hotel staff there was all very courteous and friendly. The breakfast buffet at the roof top restaurant was a great way to start off the day during my 3-day trip to Rome in August. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: S123cutie
Reviews.Content: Our group was a doctor, lawyer, finanical analyst, and psychologist--- all from New York City, Manhattan (all in our late 20's). We are probably among the most critical people you will find--- I have never posted, and I'm 2 hrs off my plane from Rome to New York--- I haven't even unpacked because I had to post: This hotel is amazing!!! It couldnt be in a better location. The Colosseum essentially stalks you because you see it from nearly every angle of the hotel (we joked it was basically part of the hotel). Within 5 mins are: the colosseum, the roman forum, palantine hill, crypts/catacombs, baths. That's walking. Within 10 mins are the Tomb of the unknown soldier and other ruins. Within 20 mins (still on foot) are the spanish steps, trevi fountain, piazzas, keats museam, and pantheon. The farthest site was the Vatican--- a 9 euros cab ride, 20 mins. (BTW-- if in Rome, you must go to Campo di Fiore and eat at Carbonaras--- best restaurant in Rome--- they take reservations). Inside the hotel-- awesome! Rooms are beautiful, very clean, marble bathroom, highest quality appliances. You get a robe and slippers every day. The air conditioning as wonderful. We kept our room an ice box, our friends were easily able to adjust the AC downwards. The roof deck is always open, and though the part that overlooks the colosseum was closed during my 4 nights stay, most of the deck is open--- and it's beautiful. There is a bar in the hotel, and many pubs within a block of the hotel. Wonderful hotel and the best choice for Rome (there are a lot of bad areas in Rome---- best to stay in and around the Colosseum area--- this hotel was perfect and safe!). We very highly recommend this place. Also, if vacationing in Venice-- the Hotel Casanova is really nice, and located 1.5 blocks from St. Mark's square--- great price. If staying in Tuscany--- MUST STAY AT TERRE DI NANO!!!! Amazing villas in a CRAZY beautiful atmosphere. There is a pool that is on the edge of the highest mountain there, that overlooks awesome views. This villa is a must see in Tuscany. We did a 9 days trip, one night in Venice, 3 nights in Tuscany, and 4 nights in Rome--- perfect trip, perfect hotels (we researched a lot)--- highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: saffron921
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel capo-de-africa with my wife for 4 days, on our arrival the manager upgraded us to a superior room 203 this was very kind of him the room was fantastic the staff would come in make up the room in the morning then in the evening they would come in & turn down the bed sheets & place mats at the side of the bed all the staff were very friendly & helpful. just down the road 2 mins is a resteraunt called papagios, very nice. we were recommended a resteraunt in a place called trastevere, get a taxi about 12 euros ish to - resteraunt la cisterna, the food is fab & the tour you get of the well after your meal is a total suprise. just one thing dont cash your travelers cheques at the hotel exchange rate is not that good. all the sites are very close to this hotel, the colosseum is just down the road 4 - 5 mins when you come into full view of this fantastic building you are taken back by its size, it is just massive. we did most of the sites but for a few so we will go back again & will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel with Stunning View”
Reviews.Author: MikeYork1985
Reviews.Content: After nights of research, I finally decided on this hotel as a suprise gift for my partner's birthday and it went down an absolute treat. Upon arrival, the door men were straight there to assist with your bags and check in was quick and simple. When booking we only managed to acquire a twin room and before I even finished asking, they had already 'upgraded' us to a double bedroom. The rooms were just right for what we needed. Well decorated and very clean. My only comments on the room would be the confusing switches which after pressing, some turned lights on, some buzzed (don't think I should have pressed those) and others didn't seem to do anything. The shower was low pressure too so showers took a little while longer. Other than the two (rather small) things above, the room met our requirements. Breakfast was your typical international breakfast catering for everyone with cereals, meats, cheese, fruit (which I'd recommend) and toast upon request. The breakfast room is very bright and airey with terraces on both sides. Eat on the terrace on the right if you can for the superb view of the Colleseum while you enjoy breakfast. Reception were very helpful with recommendations and tips for food and attractions. We ended up walking down the back streets and found several family restaurants that were much cheaper than the overpriced average restaurants that overlooked the main attractions.The food was delicious from the family run and often unmarked 'trattorias'. They are worth an extra 10 minutes exploring to find. I was suprised to find the city easy to walk around. The only transport we used was a taxi to the Vatican. We walked everywhere else after deciding which areas we would visit on which day. Overall, the hotel was great and my partner said she loved the hotel and experience of Rome and was a perfect 21st birthday present. I would efinately come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a beautiful roof top terrace for breakfast and drinks”
Reviews.Author: daneasterbrook
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice with friendly and helpful staff and is very close to the Colosseum. Although on a map of the city it appears quite far from the central attractions it is a 10-15 minute walk (including a quick ice cream stop). The room was very pleasant and the services in the room were great including high speed wired internet connection via laptop or through the TV. Also had movies and a mini bar. The air conditioning could have a bit cooler but no complaints with the room at all. The breakfast is very good especially if you can get a table on the side of the terrace which overlooks the colosseum. Although i didn't have the dinner the menu was a set barbecue menu and although conveninet wasn't the most appealing option in a country famed for its cuisine. All in all i'd say that this is a very good hotel and i would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet respite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the location. A 5 minute walk from the Colisseum in a residential area. There are grocery stores nearby. The place is very clean. Some interesting art. The staff is incredibly helpful. Breakfast was awesome and although, I agree the view is over-rated, I did enjoy seeing the Colisseum for breakfast. We filled up daily at breakfast and never needed lunch despite walking everywhere in Rome. The gym had some free weights and a couple of treadmills. This was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with spacious rooms, but poor air conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansDrj
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews found in tripadvisor. The hotel is beautiful with friendly staff. I would say the best quality of this hotel is the large size of the rooms compared to other European hotels. It is very near the colloseum and the walk to the rest of the sites is not too bad. The breakfast was also amazing. The only reason I may not stay here again is the air conditioning in the middle of June couldn't keep up with the summer heat (approximately 80 degrees F in the rooms). The desk staff were very accomadating and showed me other rooms that might be cooler and even provided us with a fan; however for the price we paid for this hotel we should have been able to make the room as cold as we wanted. It made coming back to the room after walking around all day in the summer heat a bit unpleasant. Again, this is a problem I would expect at cheaper, lower rated hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel except for the shower.”
Reviews.Author: gazzerooni
Reviews.Content: The Capo d'Africa is close to the Colisseum so handily situated for the Forum and St John Lateran as well as the colisseum. The underground is nearby and very handy. Its only €1 for a ride to wherever you are going. We used it to go the Vatican museums as well as heading over to the Spanish Steps- a good starting point if you want to go see the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The rooms are nicely done- modern clean lines and the bathrooms are clean too. We had a bathroom with a window and it was very spacious. Our friends on the other hand had an internal bathroom and it was a little cramped I think. Breakfast is served on the top floor in a bright room with two terraces off it. The choice for breakfast was more limited than I would have expected for a four star hotel but it was adequate. the staff serving were all very friendly too. There were two things about our room that I found annoying. It was sweltering in Rome in late May- 32-34 Degrees C- so air-conditioning was very necessary for sleeping comfortably. We both thought our room was quite warm even though we had the air on full-blast. We reported it to the reception but we were told that the aircon was centrally controlled so it was working correctly. After the second night we went to reception again and they agreed to send someone up to check our sir-con. When the guy arrived he took one feel of the airflow and stated that it was broken. When we returned that evening, there was a man fixing the main unit in the wall outside our room. Later when we checked the aircon, it was very cold- perfect for a warm night. It was annoying though how the receptionist didnt check it straight away as we slept badly both nights without the air-con. Secondly the shower pressure was very low so it took a whikle to shower properly. Also the water would alternate between hot and cold which i thought was strange. My friends on the second floor said their shower was working fine so maybe it was our room or our floor. Overall this hotel was very nice but it was expensive at €250 per night-and that was a special internet deal- so you would expect things like air-conditioning and showers to work well. The hotel has a business feel about so the staff are very professional. I would stay here again but I think next time I am in Rome, I would try another area such as Trastevere or Centro Storico to get closer to the nightlife as the area around the hotel is fairly quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel near the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: kittengn
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel and would stay here again. Its not full of character but its small stylish very clean and friendly. Perfect for a business trip or weekend break. Fabulous views from the terrace and a decent breakfast. The rooms are quiet and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location not a four star”
Reviews.Author: houl
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the capo D'africa recently as we were attending a wedding in florence and then decided to travel to rome for sightseeing. The hotel is very centraly located and is a 5 minute walk to the colleseum. The hotel is modern as previous members have said the rooms are a good size with high cielings with good sized beds. Whilst the accommodation dept were spot on as were the breakfast team the front desk staff appeared to have quite a bad atituides and i noticed three rows with guests taking place. Our friends air con was not working to which they were told of course it was, and then when finlay it was checked it was broken took two days to fix not greta in 35 degree heat. The wifi was charged at €5 fro 30 minutes which i found redicilous in this day and age and when I did ask for ice every time i was given a small glass of it when i required a bucket, to be told this is all they can gikve out. These are small things but they are basics in most 3 stars. Woudl be stay here again no, at 270 a night , I know rome is not cheap but am sure we could have got property wich had the above as standard and did have a hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel You May Overlook”
Reviews.Author: iwilladviseyou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo D'Africa in May 2009. This is not what I would classify as a "luxury" hotel - if you want that kind of catering you have to stay at the Ritz - but it is the next best thing, and a very, very nice hotel that is updated, modern and has a really good staff. It's all a very rare find in Rome, even at the four star level. The whole hotel looked like it had been fairly recently remodeled; our rooms had modern furniture and fixtures, and the bathrooms were refreshingly updated. The staff was also very nice (Sergio was best!); they made a lot of our reservations for us, provided us with maps and car service, and were just generally on point, which is not something I can say is common for southern Italy. Also, there were two rooftop decks that were a nice touch; we sat on the deck overlooking the Colosseum every morning for breakfast. My only warning to travelers about this hotel is that it is not in a central location. It is about a 5 minute walk from the Colosseum, on the southern side of the heart of the city. That being said, I am a fairly lazy person and I didn't mind the location. I thought for how nice the hotel was, it was worth it. It's not a very long walk to any of the sites, shopping or restaurants (you could always take the Metro or a bus, both of which can be picked up in front of the Colosseum). I think our longest walk was 40 minutes to the Vatican, which is significantly west of the city. It was about 20 minutes to the Trevi Fountain/Spanish Step area, and we ate dinner there most nights and then strolled back to the hotel. The weather was gorgeous, the Colosseum was lit up, and it was a great walk.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific concierge service.”
Reviews.Author: Maya51
Reviews.Content: There were two couples traveling in our group and we stayed at Capo D'Africa from October 13 through October 19th of 2008. I can't say enough good things about the concierge service. The made all sorts of reservations for us, gave advise, helped us with our Italian. Once, I inquired the name of the medieval church that can be seen from the roof top terrace and the manager happened to be in the Lobby at the time. He was amazingly knowledgeable and gave us a short history of that church and of the churches in Rome in general. Everyone was very helpful, even willing to open the breakfast room a bit earlier to accomodate an earlier tour departure. The roof top terrace was a perfect place to end our busy days. We'd get a drink in the Lobby, or bottled water, bought elsewhere, and we'd go up there and recap our day. The potted plants in the terrace were so evocative of the region with their fruit-laden olive and lemon trees, it was truly a pleasure sitting up there. My only complaint is with the bathtub in our room. Instead of a flat tub floor, it was curved and very slippery. When we arrived home we had several bruises on our thighs and legs. Eventually, we solved the problem by laying a towel inside the tub, because the rubber mat they had there didn't work very well. Otherwise, the bathroom was very nicely appointed. On my next trip, I plan to stay elsewhere, but only because I'd like to explore a different neighborhood. But for our first trip to Rome, this hotel really put out its welcome mat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: MaryMK220
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write, as we stayed here in late Nov. 08. We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel, staff, and the neighborhood. We walked everywhere from this location. The breakfasts were very nice in the rooftop room. There is a great neighborhood restaurant only about 1-1/2 blocks away, but I can't remember the name of it. The hotel seemed to steer us to expensive restaurants, but we like to go where the locals go. If I go back to Rome, I would want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Capo d'Africa!”
Reviews.Author: soxfan401
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days, 5 - 8APR09, at the Capo d'Africa, thoroughly enjoyed it! We were met at the curb by the bellman for help with our bags (up several steps!) and had a smiling reception, as if they'd been waiting all day just for us. The spacious room had a comfortable king bed with a window view across neighboring rooftops. The spotless bathroom was actually big enough for 2 people to occupy together! (Not the case for many European hotels!) Exceptionally clean bath with window, shower stall, marble floor and upscale vanity products. Breakfast was more than ample - fruits, cereals, meats, croissants, terrific coffee! - with indoor/outdoor dining option. The rooftop terrace was a peaceful respite at the end of a long day of touring - drinks can be ordered as you breeze past reception, then delivered to your chaise on the rooftop terrace. The entire staff was extremely helpful - and fluently bilingual (don't expect this everywhere). Fitness center was small - but who needs one when walking all day in Rome? Thumbs up for modern style, efficiency, friendliness, value and location. Thumbs down - no full service restaurant on site, only 2 free English TV channels. Also - unsure where that view comes from with the chaisle lounge with Colosseum behind it; there is no Colosseum view from the rooftop. That aside, this hotel is definitely recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, but dissapointed by service.”
Reviews.Author: MplsJayhawk
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just spent 10 days in Italy and we chose Hotel Capo d'Africa based on the generally positive TripAdvisor reviews and location of the hotel. As promised, the hotel had modern decor, a nice breakfast and a convenient location to many of the major of attractions. Somewhat disappointing to us, however, was the perpetual sales pitch from one of the front desk staff members. My fiance and I were aware that we could make a reservation at the Vatican to avoid the long line, and when we asked the concierge to help us with this, he told us that he could only help us to schedule a tour with a certain tour group, but not to make a reservation for us to tour on our own. After we paid for a WiFi connection (not free at this hotel) to make our own reservations at the Vatican, the staff member was unwilling to print our information for us and the hotel doesn't offer a business center with printer. Additionally, the same staff member referred to a very disappointing restaurant in the area (seriously sub-par food, and we're not picky eaters!) and when we arrived at the restaurant we could see that the only other diners there were also staying at our hotel, which made us think that there was some little payola scheme in effect. Upon our checkout, we discovered we had been charged 2x as much for our internet purchase as we should have been... fortunately we had retained our internet card and had "proof" that we had been overcharged for the internet time we had purchased. And last but not least, the lovely roof top terrace/patio that is featured on the internet, was not lit/ usable at nightime, nor does it have a view of the Colosseum, nor is food served there. The bottom line for us was that the hotel didn't live up to the hype that its website and some other TripAdvisor reviews promoted. In our opinion, there are many other wonderful hotels in Rome for the same somewhat high price we paid for this hotel. We wouldn't stay at the Hotel Capo d'Africa again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SivanL
Reviews.Content: My wife and i visited Rome between the 4th and the 8th of March 2009. After reviewing the hotels in Rome using Tripadvisor we have decided that Capo d'Africa Hotel is the choice of us. 1. The Hotel Location - The hotel is in a great location, about 500 meters from the Colosseum and the metro in a quit street which has many restaurants around. 2. The Reception - When we have arrived to the hotel we reception was quick, pleasant and included a review form Massimo about all the places we need to see during our stay with explanation and a map. As i told Massimo, it was the best reception i had ever. 3. The Lobby - is modernly and well decorated with warm and welcoming colors. 4. The Room - bigger than most hotels rooms in Rome, very clean, fairly accessorized, although the bed is big the mattress was not the most comfortable i have ever slept on,, but i wasn't something that kept me awake at night. The bathroom was very clean and comfortable. The room hold good size closets and a safe which are very handy, you will find robes and sleepers as well. The minibar is well equipped although i rarely use them in any of the hotels i stay. One thing about the room i couldn't figure out is how to set the air condition to a comfortable temperature. 5. The Service - We have always received a great, professional, prompt service. 6. The Breakfast - one thing which is a bit disappointing is the breakfast. The main thing the breakfast lacks in is choice. The are no vegetables but tomatoes, the is a choice of serials, cheese, not to much fruits, dairy, bread, cakes, juices and coffee. All in all, i would surely return to the this hotel next time I'm in Rome. My advice is to check the hotel website before booking this hotel form other websites such as hotels.com, i found a great promotion on the Capo d'Africa hotel which basically if you pay in advance for 3 nights you get the 4th for free.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: mandi2doors
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights in Rome for our 10 year anniversary. We usually stay in budget hotels but, because of the occasion, decided to splurge (we got a great deal though...152 Euros per night). I spent SO much time online researching hotels and reading reviews (mostly on TripAdvisor) and it paid off! The hotel was gorgeous and our room was way bigger than the rooms we usually stay in. Everything looked brand new and the bed was super comfortable...I have a bad back so I tend to notice the beds :) The staff were all very helpful...our Internet connection wouldn't work and someone came upstairs within minutes to reset it for us. Also, it rained almost the entire time we were there and we were able to use the large umbrellas from the hotel instead of running out to find somewhere to buy them. We didn't eat in the hotel at all, so I can't comment on that, but I'm sure that would have been wonderful as well. The best part about Capo d'Africa was the location. We were literally a few blocks from the Coliseum and a Metro station. Being that the Metro in Rome is limited, this was quite a luxury and made getting to the other side of Rome easy when we didn't feel like walking long distances. Even though we were close to everything, we were on a quiet side street and were able to sleep peacefully. There were plenty of little restaurants around the hotel and we ate at most of them during our stay. Our trip to Rome was great, especially since we were there off-season. There were no lines at the Vatican or the Coliseum and we were actually able to sit down in the Sistine Chapel (which I've been told is an impossibility during the summer). The weather was cooler and rainy but it was definitely worth it for the cheaper prices and no wait times!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Excellent Position”
Reviews.Author: jo3316
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we were hoping for - modern, friendly and in a good position yet not too expensive for Rome. All staff were friendly and happy to recommend places near by to eat. Rooms a decent size and with everything you could need. Breakfast included which is a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, had a horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Emann13
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes for this hotel after spending several days researching on tripadvisor and other travel sites, Everything started off fine...were able to check-in early, everyone was friendly, room appeared very nice....then we noticed the ants in the bathroom...thought maybe it was just a few random ants and not a big deal....not until the next day did we realize they were still coming into the bathroom from somewhere. Went down to complain and female concierge said she would get us a new room when one was ready and they would move our bags. Then we went to breakfast, went back to our room and noticed the ants were in the bedroom and in our bags, Went down to complain a second time and magically a room was ready (I guess because we complained twice?). So we were moved to a smaller room, with a worse view and it was a smoking room (we had requested non-smoking). This experience ruined our stay there. We expected an apology? Maybe a room upgrade for the hassle? But no. We basically got a worse room, but at least we didnt see any more ants. DON'T STAY IN ROOM 301....who knows if they got rid of the ants.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinklt1
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We went to rome for a week, my fiance and I and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The staff were wonderful, especially those at breakfast, very attentive and friendly. The hotel was emmaculate with nice touches like slippers and a bath robe in the room! It was a block or two from the colloseum, our favourite part of rome so it was perfect for us. It was quite a walk up to the spanish steps area however so don't stay here if you don't like walking! We loved it and really enjoyed wandering through all the little streets at night. There is no need to go far though in the evening as the best wee restaurant we found was just one street away! Served pizza from 4euros which was amazing and a coke was only 2euros! Watch out for the couple that look onto the colloseum though they are extortionate for drinks. It's better to be in with the locals I think anyway! We didn't use the gym but had a nosey and it looked very modern. We sat out a few times in the evening on the roof terrace as the weather was still quite mild. The only thing is that they show you a view from the roof terrace onto the colloseum (see their website) and that's only one of the balconies which is only accessable from the breakfast room which is only open in the morning! loved it, would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Belcasino
Reviews.Content: Had a 3-night break here at the beginning of December. The hotel looks exactly like its photos on this and other websites, so no surprises. Reception staff friendly and efficient, room nice - quite large, HUGE bed, very comfortable, nice bathroom with great shower, nice toiletries, bathrobe, slippers....there was a turn-down service at night which was nice. Only slight problem was our room wasn't cleaned on the 2nd night, but I'm sure this was just an oversight rather than cutting corners. Breakfast was pretty good, large selection of fresh pastries/bread/fruit/cereal/cheese, etc. It must be a great place in summer, as there are several roof terraces and you really can see the Colosseum from one of them! I would definitely stay here again if I could afford it - we got a special rate with it being "off season" but I doubt we'd be able to afford it at other times of the year. The only reason I'm not giving this hotel 5 stars is that I stayed at the hotel San Anselmo earlier in the year, and it wasn't as wonderful as there! Compared to the San Anselmo, it was almost a little bit "corporate" and maybe a tad bland, but I'm sure this minor criticism is just because I've been spoiled by the San Anselmo....Capo D'Africa is a lovely hotel in a great location and I can't knock it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AuburnPilot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa from November 26-30, 2008 and were quite impressed! We chose it after reading favorable reviews in travel books such as Frommers and on websites such as this. It is truly only a 5 min. walk to the Colloseum and Ancient Rome. The hotel itself is very modern and contemporary... especially the lobby. The front desk staff were very helpful and obliging. They recommended several excellent restaurants to us in the immediate area such as "Three" and "Crab." Both VERY good! Check-in / Check-out was a breeze as was booking on the hotel website. The custodial staff were very good in keeping our room and bathroom clean and tidy each day. The rooms were a bit small but from what I've heard this is not uncommon in Europe. But the room easily accomodated the 3 of us! Our only complaint was that the room did not have air conditioning. It had heat, but no A/C. We were told to open the window to cool the room down and it did in a hurry with the 50 degree night air outside. The rooms had many amenities such as high-speed internet (a tad on the slow side though), pay per view movies, and a fully stocke mini-bar. Also, the lights were interesting to operate. You had to place your room key in a slot for the lights to work! But overall it was a very nice room. The area where the hotel is located is in a sort of residential one that it not too touristy. TONS of restaurants/bars/cafes within walking distances. Don't forget to try the Gelato and one of the many gelateria's in the area. The hotel itself had a very nice breakfast buffet. Many people have commented that it was very basic but we found it to be a gracious plenty. You could have all the ham, cheese, pastries, and fruit you wanted! Overall this was an EXCELLENT hotel! I plan to return to Rome in the future and will definitely stay at Hotel Capo d'Africa.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel..very few service staff..”
Reviews.Author: capo_reviewer
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the capo for our anniversary.. nice overall experience.. decent restaurant recommendations.. do eat at 3 scalina.. nice restaurant.. good service.. advantage of hotel : walking distance to collesseum. the only major drawback.: absence of enough service staff and no hot breakfast meals !

Reviews.Title: “overpriced for what you get, customer service lacking”
Reviews.Author: traveler0510
Reviews.Content: I have to say we were a bit disappointed in Hotel Capo D'Africa. Our last night in Rome on our honeymoon, it was our "splurge" hotel. However, we stayed at nicer establishments during our trip for far less money. Customer service leaves a lot to be desired. As another poster mentioned, we were left to drag our bags up a flight of stairs by ourselves upon arriving, with the porter just standing there watching. We are young and can do this ourselves, but for a four-star place, I would have expected an offer of assistance. We also attempted to have wine on the terrace upstairs. We ordered the bottle and was told it would be delivered shortly. Well, 20 minutes later we were still waiting. The bartender was the only one around and wasn't able to deliver it because he had other customers to serve in the lobby. I offered to bring the bottle up to the terrace myself, but he said we could not do that, so I went back and waited some more. Finally, he came up with the bottle and apologies for the delay. Once again, not a huge deal, but you'd expect more from a place with such high ratings. They also needed to run our credit card multiple times upon check-out because they had forgotten to add the wine, the airport transfer during the first swipe. We actually had to remind them to add it to the bill. This place caters to Americans, and it tries to be like an American hotel (nice decor, robes, minibar) but it needs a lesson in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Capo D'Africia”
Reviews.Author: BallygarvieIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week with my parents and my aunty. I found the staff to be very pleasant and the rooms very clean. Its very near the Colossuem and there are many restaurants in the locality. We were recommended 'Comparone Restaurant' by the hotel. Do NOT eat here. They charged 4 euro per person for bread and then a service charge. The service was terrible and the food not great. I would recommend 'Il Bocconcino' which is a five minute walk from hotel. The meal was lovely and the service excellent. Overall we had a pleasant stay in Rome. Great place so much to do.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon_8
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, which we routinely refer to. (Suite Dreams was booked.) For the first time, we were a tad disappointed. First off, when we arrived, with five small bags, no porter offered to help -- two just stood around and watched. We actually didn't need the help, but to not offer was a tad unprofessional. The room was ok, but a bit small. If you're tall and have a basic room, prepare to take a shower sideways, as the tub is narrow. No one goes to Rome to watch TV, but the channel selection wasn't great. Not what you'd expect from a place that charges well over £100 a night. No hot items at breakfast, and at one point later during our stay, an employee walked straight into our room without knocking! She had the nerve to actually ask if we used the minibar rather than simply apologizing and shutting the door. How ridiculous. Another time at the front desk, when asking about a restaurant, the receptionist answered the phone, which is no problem. When she was done, though, she spent about 15 seconds chatting to friends who were leaving the hotel before coming back to me. Again, it may sound silly, but I don't think that's great customer service. Perhaps staff should consult Locanda Orseolo in Venice for service. We loved the neighbourhood, as it was a proper residential area filled with a pharmacy, supermarket and little trattorias and gelaterias, and it's only a short walk to the Colisseum. Rome was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not terrific”
Reviews.Author: pyri
Reviews.Content: After all terrific reviews I booked this hotel for my wife and myself..I think that many of the reviews are a little misleading. My summary after a nice weekend in Rome is following: Location: Quiet, but nearest surroundings isn't excellent. You wouldn't just go outside the hotel to grab a coffee. Be prepared to walk. Restaurant: Didn't try. The terrass at the roof was very dark and didn't invite us to dinner. Breakfast OK - not more. Excellent coffee though Hotell reception and staff This is a small hotell with friendly and helpful staff. Though the lobby doesn't invite you to sit down and relax. Hotel room: Clean, and strict but it starts to get worned. In our superior room we had a large crack in the washbasin and the silcon at the batch tub had started to turn black. My Summary: Either the hotel standard in Rome is extremly poor and expensive or the reviews of this hotel is outdated. We payed 50% less at Grand hotel in Stockholm and got 50% higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Elliott8
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific for exploring Ancient Rome. Our room was very nice and quite spacious for a city hotel. The Desk Clerk was particularly helpful with pointing out interesting local resturants and with travel arrangements. Having a glass of wine on the terrice with the sun setting over the Colosseum was enchanting.

Reviews.Title: “Central, but off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: sp00kygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spacious for Rome, modern and sits in a location which feels quite central but off the beaten track. It is a couple of minute's walk from the Colisseum. There are plenty of nice neighbourhood restaurants and bars to enjoy nearby. Each evening began and ended for us with a drink on the large, well furnished roof terrace. The staff are extremely friendly and efficient. The hotel was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was fine, though the staff struggled to keep things topped up in the buffet. We had lunch here one day, and it was simple but very tasty. The rooms feel spacious and nicely decorated, if a little bland. Bathrooms are small. Our only complaint is that the shower fluctuated between icy cold and burning hot, regardless of the temperature gauge. Overall, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location for Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: RACACA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is blocks from the Colosseum, but still relatively quiet. It was a great location to take breaks and then go back and sight see some more. Rome has a lot of traffic during the day, and cars did cut through, but the hotel is soundproofed quite well. It has a nice upstairs terrace where breakfast is served and from which you can see the Colosseum clearly. The rooms each had a separate bath. One had a shower and the other a tub shower. The rooms are adequate size. We were able to shut off a hallway door to create a suite of sorts for our 2 rooms, which was nice. We spent 3 nights there and found the staff to be accomodating. We do not recommend the Crab restaurant down the street, however. It was recommended to us by the hotel, but we found it to be overpriced for adequate food. There is a restaurant several blocks away near the sign for "Tratoria" which was excellent. It is on the corner, same side of the street before the Tratoria. The biggest disappointment we had was the Spanish Steps -- just a bunch of steps. Unless you are planning on shopping there, skip it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: rjmRochester
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is very boutique like, modern with great amenities. It has a pretty roof garden for evening drinks or just to sit out at one end, and has the breakfast area at the other end. Staff was welcoming and very helpful. Fabricio the bartender is most gracious. The neighborhood is residential and quiet with a bunch of eating places both expensive and reasonable. Many people on this site recommended Le Neumachie restaurant nearby. It was okay and not too expensive. Our best find was a little wine bar on Via Ostilla nearby called Divan. The place is tiny but they have an amazing wine list and great food too. Very accomodating and attentive owner. One important tip: If you are not a walker, this hotel is not in the center of the city. It is walking distance to the Colliseum and Palantine Hill. We walked all over Rome from there and would stay at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaytrekker
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel. Housekeeping kept the rooms and baths very clean. Came in at night for turn down service. A/C worked well. Rooms were very quiet. Stayed on top floor across from convent. The few cars that did go by we never heard; only know that they went by because we were looking out our window. Beds very comfortable. Breakfast was very nice. Assortment of pastries, cereals, yogurts, fruits and coffees. Has outdoor dining overlooking the Colosseo. Easy walking distance to Colosseo and Forum and Palatine hill. Also easy walking distance to red and blue lines of Metro. Colosseo stop and Manzoni stop. Not too far from Trevi fountain either. On September 11th the management hired a jazz band to play music on the roof terrace in rememberance. Thought that was a very nice touch and very thoughtful. Front desk helpful. They offered to make reservations for us to Borghese Gallery. Went to get tickets at Borghese Gallery and they told us that we were never booked but were able to find tickets for us anyway. I don't believe it was the hotel's fault I believe it was the Gallery's. I believe Rome is very affordable compared to cities in Northern Italy. Local trattorias around hotel were very affordable and much more enjoyable to eat in than expensive restaurants on the Piazzas. Would most definately stay here again. By far the best hotel we stayed at during our 2 and a half week trip through Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FStinnett
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel diectly and got an excellent rate! I highly reccomend this hotel. It was our last place to stay and we loved everything about it everything good is true do not believe anything negative about this property. LOVED IT!!! Look at their website what you see is what you get go to the roof top terrace at night and order a bottle of wine enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gandj50
Reviews.Content: From 24th to 28th August 2008 we stayed at Capo D' Africa to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. We mentioned this to them when booking and on arrival they upgraded us to a super room and presented us with a chilled bottle of champagne! They couldn't have been friendlier throughout our stay. The hotel is cool contemporary and rather slick. It is immaculate throughout and room service was excellent. We never saw the maid but whenever we returned to our room it had been cleaned to a high standard. We enjoyed breakfast on the roof terrace each morning overlooking the Colluseum and enjoyed a nightcap by candlelight on the roof each night. The hotel is next door to a convent and so was in a very quiet area; we enjoyed undisturbed sleep each night. It's just a five minute walk to the Colluseum and most of the tourist sights are within walking distance. Alternatively you can pick up the metro or buses at the Colluseum to take you anywhere in the city. A 75 minute ticket is just one euro. Bus number 87 takes you to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona where you can have a romantic meal listening to musicians and enjoying the fantastic scenery. Alternatively there are plenty of friendly family trattorinis close to the hotel. We had a wonderful holiday and much of that was down to the treatment we received at the hotel. By the way when arriving at the airport you can walk a short distance to the railway station and pick up a shuttle bus which will take you direct to your hotel for 30 euros (for 2).

Reviews.Title: “In a quiet area but close to attractions!”
Reviews.Author: ladyaliena
Reviews.Content: We spend there 4 nights and we had time to realize the hotel is in a quiet area but very close to attractions as Colosseo and Foro Romano. The hotel is charming with wide and clean rooms. The breakfast on the roof terrace was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpurDon
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Capo D'Africa booking to adjoining twin rooms for our 4 family members. The rooms were spacious and light and well stocked with interesting extras, although we found the mini-bar a little too tempting. All staff are welcoming and friendly from those on reception to the breakfast staff, room service and porters. The breakfast served on the roof terrace is plentiful and varied although we felt that more use could have been made of the roof terrace in the evening. The hotel is sitiuated within a few minutes walk of the Colosseum and many other Rome sights with many pleasant restaurants and trattatorias close by. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Garota05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights on our recent visit to Rome. Check-in staff were very friendly and very helpful, eager to show us a map and where we were in relation to the tourist sights. Our room was massive - huge king bed and moderately furnished. As others have said, it is only a 5 min walk to the Colleseum and probably 30-40 minutes from the other sites (other than Vatican City). The breakfast was lovely - plenty on offer and helpful staff. This is a great hotel and would recommend it... The Le Naumachie restaurant around the corner was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of modern luxury in an ancient setting,”
Reviews.Author: kerrl6
Reviews.Content: Having checked out of this hotel yesterday i thought i'd write my review while memories of this lovely place are still fresh in my mind. We stayed here for one week at the end of July/early August having booked based on reviews mainly on this site. We took a train and metro from the airport because i'd been to Rome before and thought i had a good idea of where the hotel was, but after stepping off the metro at the Collusseum and walking around in intense heat trailing suitcases for almost an hour we finally gave in and jumped in a taxi. Five minutes later (and only a few steps from the circle we had walked around in) we arrived to the beautiful facade of Capo d'Africa. A porter met us and carried our cases up the steps and after check-in up to our room. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. Our room was a delux twin (i was with my mother) and was a pretty good size. It was clean and well stocked and the porter showed us where things were and how they worked. We had the room directly over the front entrance and seemed to have the only room which had a balcony (except for the room on the roof with it's own terrce) which was lovely to stand out on and enjoy the sun sometimes. The hotel is modern and light and airy, the room was nice and the beds actually comfortable after long days of walking around the city. There is a panel outside the room showing staff whether or not you are inside which meant that we were NEVER worried about being in the room when cleaners needed in or being disturbed in any way. This was great and i must say that it seemed as if there were elves who came in and cleaned when we weren't around because every time we left the room (even if only for breakfast) something was done without us knowing! Windows would be opened during the day for air and closed later in the evening before bed, a mat and slippers and our pyjamas laid out for us for bed, fresh toiletries during the day if we had run out of something! It was a nice touch and something more hotels should offer. Breakfast was fine. Served in a lovely room with an outside terrace either side if you could stand the heat. A nice selection of food-fresh fruit salad, cereals, breads, meat, cheese and pastries etc, or hot food if you wanted at an extra cost. The lady who seemed to run the place was lovely and greeted us every morning, remembering our room number and tea for two! There was also a roof terrace which was a lovely place to have a glass of prossecco in the evening before heading out for dinner. You just use the phone to ring the bar and they bring up drinks and snacks. In the dark, candles lit all around make it really cosy. The hotel serves food either in the bar (at reception-lovely and cool and modern), on the terrace or in your room. We had lunch when we arrived and it was okay, although not what i would have expected for such a nice place. But that doesn't matter because the very best thing about this hotel is it's proximity to really good local places to eat. Le Naumachie, down the street and to the right is a lovely restaurant (we ate there 3 times!), it's local so full of Romans mixed with tourists, the food is great and very inexpensive (although it does go up at weekends or perhaps for the month of August but not by much) but it was the service we received which really made the experience special for us. Every customer was treated like a friend and welcomed. Much better than the touristy places in the main areas where the food is twice the price and nowhere near as good. There was also a lovely place next door called Luzzi which served great food and was really cheap and packed every night! I recommend them both! There were lots of places to eat near-by so you won't be stuck and this is great because although the hotel is great, it is a good long walk to most of the central areas in Rome and it's nice to have a break! I much preferred these local eateries. So i would definately recommend this place if you want something modern and comfortable with good service and don't mind a walk to the main sights (a taxi is only about €6/€7 to most of the main areas-we got dropped at via del corso, main st, on the nights we wanted to cut out some of the walking and walked around the Trevi fountain/ Pantheon/Spanish steps areas). It's a quiet and peaceful haven in a bustling, busy, wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Capo is a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelchick1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa for three nights at the end of a cruise and loved it. The rooms are large, extremely comfotable and very clean and well kept. Check-in was quick and the staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions and reservations for restaurants and tours. Breakfast was included in our room charge and was excellent with a nice room at the top of the hotel with great views. Everything was clean and fresh. This hotel is steps away from the Collosseum and then further into the centre of Rome for all the attractions. It is situated off the main drag so is also very quiet. We would definitely recommend this nice, small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scadroes
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel was the large size of the rooms. When we walked in I didn’t believe we were in a hotel in Europe since the room and the bathroom was so big. The room and bathroom were also both very clean too. The one problem with the bathroom was that the temperature on the shower changed randomly from cold to hot without warning often freezing us one second and almost burring us the next. The hotel was close to the Coliseum in a very cute neighborhood. We ate at a great restaurant right near the hotel too called Hoseria Isidoro that was wonderful too. Although it is close to the Coliseum it is abut far from everything else. Once we figured out were we were we were able to talk most everywhere, but you are about a 30 minute walk from the Spanish steps. We did take the metro a few times to help us get around. The hotel staff was not very helpful and their restaurant recommendations weren’t great.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: courtneymg554
Reviews.Content: I have stayed other places in Rome before, and to be close to many attractions and in the city, this hotel is great. The rooms were very clean, spacious, and had a nice TV. Lobby was very modern and staff was great. Breakfast was ok nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaDublin
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, its location was just a few minutes walk from the Colleseum. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and well kept. The rooftop terrace was great for relaxing after a day seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon at the Capo D Africa”
Reviews.Author: smurfett11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Capo D Africa upon arrival was met by Mario at reception who even thought it was only 11am checked us straight in to an upgraded room...porter took our luggage up to the room which was grt. 10 mins later a complementary bottle of champagne arrived as it was our honeymoon which was v. much appreciated we drunk this later on that evening on the lovely roof top terrace over looking the Coliseum. Hotel is in a grt location right next to the Coliseum there's a bit of walking involved to get to the other sites in the centre of town..we brought tickets for the hop on hop off bus which has a stop just next to the Coliseum so we got around on that for 48 hrs. You can also book tours at the hotel thru the front desk we booked a Vatican tour which was good bus picks u up from the hotel.Loads of good restaurants nr the hotel and bars...breakfast was very pleasant each morning cereals/cold meats and cheese/Fruit juices and bread/ pastries eaten either inside or on the roof top terrace...also in the evening a grt place to go for a cocktail of three! The hotel also has an adequate gym which my husband used everyday. All in all would recommend this place to anyone visiting Rome...all the staff were wonderful and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: jasperparklodge
Reviews.Content: A little late with this review as our stay was in February however we were very pleased with our choice and the location of the hotel. There are numerous small, good quality and good value restaurants / trattorias within a short walk ( minutes). We were lucky with the weather it was dry and sunny for the 4 days we stayed so walking to everywhere was pleasant. The hotel itself is a very good standard and the staff very friendly. Breakfast buffet was well presented in a pleasant environment with attentive staff. The roof area is a good place for a quiet drink in the late afternoon after seeing the sites. You pick up the phone to order and the barman brings them up with pleasant nibbles. A little expensive for the drinks but its the overall experience thats worth it. Rooms are a resonable size, modern and comfortable. Got a good deal from the hotel website and found it particularly good value at the time of year we stayed. Would definitely recommend this hotel and location as an oasis to return to after the hustle and bustle of the main areas.

Reviews.Title: “Capo d'Africa OK”
Reviews.Author: austravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at Capo d’Africa in January 2008, as part of a world trip. On arrival, the receptionist was very frosty and not very helpful. We had a car full of luggage and received no help from the porters, which I found quite frustrating. As we were moving luggage to our rooms, with no help from the staff, we received a phone call from the receptionist asking us to move our car – which I thought was quite rude, given that we were moving as quickly as we could on our own. Still, there was no offer of help from the staff. There was a limited room service menu, but as we were tired, we decided to order room service dinner on our first night. One meal was forgotten and we had to wait nearly an hour to get this meal, which was frustrating. The food itself was OK. The room was clean but the bath was mouldy. I was about to give up all hope on this hotel, until we had breakfast the next morning. The breakfast was really nice and the staff at breakfast were wonderful. We had the same wonderful breakfast and saw the same staff every day during our stay, and it was great. We spoke to different people at reception and they were very helpful, so I think it was just the one unfriendly person we happened to get on check-in. However, do keep in mind that there are no printing facilities anywhere in the hotel. I asked to print one page at reception and was told that I needed to go to the internet cafe a few streets away, which wasn’t very expensive but also wasn’t convenient. The rooms were modern, contained a TV , had internet access and a small mini-bar, but no tea/coffee facilities (which is quite common in Europe). One big plus with the rooms is that they had opening windows with really beautiful views. The beds were quite hard, but I found them quite comfortable. Each room had its own door bell, which I thought was a nice touch. The location of this hotel is fantastic, particularly for the ancient sites, as it is only 400 metres from the Colosseum. Overall, I have mixed feelings about this hotel – there were positives and negatives. I guess I had high hopes, as I had read many great reviews of this hotel, so my expectations were high but not really met.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, close to most sights”
Reviews.Author: Melissa056
Reviews.Content: Capo d'Africa Hotel is wonderful. The staff couldn't be more helpful, the room was lovely and the breakfast was plentiful. The room we stayed in had a massive bed and the room itself was spacious. Some people have commented on the bathrooms being small but I didn't see a problem, in fact it was bigger than our bathroom at home. The only downside was that the temperature in the shower was varying constantly going from scalding to ice cold within a few seconds.Other than that the hotel was fantastic and I would definately stay there again. Compared to prices in the nearby restaurants, the room service is well priced too. The hotel is minutes away from the Coloseum and Forum (use the Roma Pass and get in both for 11Euros) and is no more than 30 minutes walk away from most major tourist sites in Rome. The only place we needed to get transport to was the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ramsey1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found the rooms and house keeping standards exemplary. Contrary to some of your reviews we found the staff very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was strictly continental with no hot food obviously available. It was sufficient though not very exciting. Our only serious reservation was the location which, although near the Colosseum and Forum, we found to be further from central and northern Rome than we had anticipated. There were local restaurants and we can recommend Pasqualinos.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: HJPofi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Capo for two nights from 6-19 through 6-21. We had four rooms and all were very nice. The location makes all the difference. My last time in Rome I stayed only a few blocks away but those few blocks make all the difference. The view from the roof top are spectacular. The staff was very friendly. And the price, for Rome, was good. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to be in the heart og the action.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: omarito02
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was one of the highlights. unfortunately we had bad luck with everything else. We had a tiny room even though I had booked a superior. But the biggest problem was the front desk. They were so continuously rude and unhelpful during our stay that we left after just two nights. This was my first encounter ever of Roman lack of hospitality. These people shouldn't be working in the service industry. The buffet breakfast is excellent but don't order room service if you want freshness.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel - a little overpriced perhaps?”
Reviews.Author: paulmckelvie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights at the end of March 2008 from Easter Monday onwards. Hotel was well located, only a few minutes walk from the Colosseum. Very clean, and well maintained. Room was fine, but a typical city centre hotel - so rather cramped. Breakfast was included in the room rate and well worth taking, either in the breakfast room or out on the balcony when the weather was fine. Overall, a good choice, but felt a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTales
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. I spent two nites at this hotel. Very quiet street and comfortable. I could sleep with the window open and not be disturbed by buses and traffic. The neighborhood is wonderful with great local restaurants, bars, grocery store and gelato!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarkBearSF
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a charming and stylish gem of a hotel in a spectacular location on a quiet little street right near the coliseum. Very stylish and Italian ...although there were some inscrutable buttons in the room that we never figured out what their purpose was.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for your stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LarryNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Capo d'Africa on April 13 and 14, 2008 after disembarking from a 10 day cruise on the Med. The hotel was in a great location, only about 4 blocks from the Colloseum, and within walking distance to public transportation. The hotel staff was very accomodating and helpful, and the facilities were very ccomfortable. One of the true benefits was that the hotel is in a residential area, so we found a large number of "neighborhood" restaurants just a few blocks away. The food at these restaurants was very good, the prices very reasonable, and wait staff very pleasant. The breakfast at the hotel was good, and eating on the rooftop patio was very pleasant. We would highly recommend Hotel d'Africa without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller008
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this lovely Hotel and would highly recommend a stay here. It's in a great position, in a quiet residential street near the Colosseum. Hotel is spotlessly clean everywhere. Rooms are modern and a good size, beautifully furnished with lots wardrobe space. The bathrooms are also a good size, again lovely and clean. Had a nice view from room. The breakfast room and roof terrace are bright and airey. Food was very nice at breakfast with lots of choice. Staff all very pleasant , professional and friendly. No one would walk past without saying hello. Nice to finish with a drink at the bar in the evening. We had a couple of really nice meals in a restaurant near the hotel.(Turn right out of hotel entrance,go to end of the road,1st right and it's the 2nd restaurant in front of you on the left..You'll know you're in the right place as it has queue's in the evening!) Very popular with locals and great prices. They set up tables/chairs along the pavement in the evening. Rome is a fantastic City. Don't forget to pack your walking shoes!!

Reviews.Title: “a jem in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mimi1951
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 week cruise in Italy. Before our cruise left port in Civitevecchia (ROME), we spent two nights at Capo d' Africa. Located near the Colloseum, it's a small hotel on a quiet street. You can walk to the Colloseum as well as lots of restaurants and outside cafes. The rooms are lovely with big picture windows, nice bathrooms, and very comfortable beds. We had a king sized bed, not always easy to find in Italian hotels. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is included in the price. It was a sumptuous buffet. And, you can see the walls of the Colloseum from your table. What we really liked the most was the staff. They were so helpful and friendly in every way. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody going to Rome who wants to stay in a boutique hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Rather out of the way, but clean and comfortable and I got my money back”
Reviews.Author: MajorMO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not quite as central as some reviews suggest. Yes, it is on the doorstep of the Colloseum, however that's about it. If you want to go anywhere else, allow a 20 to 30 minute walk, or catch a bus (very hot and sweaty) or grab the Metro (about a 5 min walk away, but also baking hot in the summer). The hotel is clean and tidy, although the aircon didn't really work and the room was quite basic (we had a deluxe double and it wasn't at all deluxe - it just had a king size bed). Only one room in the hotel appears to have a balcony. The breakfast is nice and the breakfast staff are good. The coffee is good as well. Breakfast on the back terrace was a bit dodgy though due to pigeons. Breakfast on one of the two tables on the front terrace has a fantastic view of the Colloseum and is a wonderful early morning sun trap. I felt a bit ripped off when I needed to use the internet to check-in my home flight and couldn't find anywhere in Rome that offered internet access. The hotel charged me 5 euros. That made me grumpy. The highlight for me was the surprise email I got when I got home. The chap on reception had over-charged me and I was very grateful for the honesty that followed as I was given a refund and apologetic email. This hotel was OK. Nothing more. I'm surprised by its high rating on this site and think that there must surely be many more better hotels in Rome. If I ever return to Rome (which I doubt as I did the whole place in 3 days), I would stay in a different hotel because I'm sure I could get something better and more centrally located for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ruins from breakfast sitting area on roof top”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravel_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our first trip to Rome Italy in 2005. Our room was fairly good size for a European standard. The service and staff was excellent! The view on top of the roof top was very memorable, that even now I smile thinking about it. The location was very quiet and tucked away from the busy part of Rome. The ruins such as the colosseum and forum was probably only 2 or 3 blocks away. The only drawback of this hotel was that it was a little far from other major sites such as the Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, and etc. It was little inconvenient to walk to these places at night by ourselves without getting a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot..friendly staff..great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: skeeboy
Reviews.Content: After getting screwed by USAir, Capo d'Africa was a welcome end to a horrific 26 hours of travel Staff was super friendly & was eager to help at every turn. Breakfast was great with something for every taste. The cappuccino was especially appreciated. This idea of breakfast with the room needs to catch on here more in the US. Room was more than adequate. Very comfortable & modernly decorated. Not much of a view, but a short walk to the roof will get you a much better picture. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet part of town but no aircon?”
Reviews.Author: GipsyMagpie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find, reasonably priced and just next to the Colosseum. The staff were friendly and the room nice. Only problem was a totally rubbish aircon. Opened the window all the time and that kept it just about right. Breakfast was superb (no need for lunch after that feast!). Location may not suit some as its a little bit of a trek to some parts of Rome (St Peters) but cheap underground service makes up for it. Wouldn't fancy using the tube in the summer tho.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Breakfast on the Roof Terrace”
Reviews.Author: Live-Life-To-The-Max
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days in late March. This is a quiet mid sized boutique hotel with character very close tyo the Colosseum. The room we had was newly refurbished with good modern shower. The room was not huge but had space for a sette, small table and chair. The room and hotel was very clean and well decorated with modern art and pictures. There was a view of the Colosseum from the bedroom although you do need to lean out a bit to see it all. Reception service and Breakfast service was very attentive and helpful. Breakfast on the roof terrace was especially a treat, it was sheltered and warm. The selection of pastries was amongst the best we've had.. and there are nuts and dried fruit to add to your cereals etc. The location is excellent, close to the Colosseum and we walked to most major attractions in 1 day.. Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Vatican/St. Peters. It's about 20 mins walk to the railway station.. OK if you can carry your bags to avoid high taxi charges. We were very pleased with this stay and would positively stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a hectic city”
Reviews.Author: GOMCP
Reviews.Content: A lovely modern Hotel – very close to Coliseum and the “Ancient Rome” Area. The streets around the hotel were very quiet – a joy after the noise and bedlam that is normal Rome streets. We had a reasonably sized room at the rear. The room was very clean and well appointed – although only one chair for a double room – not really a problem as we spent most of our “relaxing time” on the terrace. The room had a safe – always very useful. The bathroom clean and modern – plenty of toiletries, but only one bathrobe provided. We had one (small) “gripe”: the shower pressure is fairly low. But they did provide bathroom scales ( a first for us) which were useful in checking the weight of the cases for the return flight. Another minor gripe – they do not provide a “do not disturb” sign for the room door – the maid tried to get into our room twice while we were in. The only English speaking channels on the TV were CNN and Sky News. The hotel has a roof-top terrace, where you can have a coffee or beer after a day’s hectic site-seeing. Breakfast was very good – a good and varied selection of food. Any shortages were quickly replenished. It is possible to order cooked eggs (e.g. omelette, poached etc) – although this is charged at 5 Euro per portion. Breakfast can also be taken on the Terrace – an excellent start to any day. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there is a fairly large Room Service menu, which we understand can be provided in the bar area also. We did not use this service.
