All the staff were extremely helpful and helped us arrange various trips and tickets for museums. After having an “exciting” trip into Rome from the Airport in a taxi, we decided to use the Hotel Car Service for our return journey – this was much more sedate and relaxing. The car was waiting for us at check-out (no hanging around). This cost 50 Euros and was charged to the room, so there was no haggling. We felt was worth it because the first Taxi Ride was 45 Euros. Getting about Rome was easy – the Ancient City is within easy walking distance from the Hotel, and on one day we did manage to walk into the Centre and back. The Colosseo Metro Station is 10 minutes away – it costs 1 Euro for one journey. We even came back in the rush hour – very congested. There are plenty of Restaurants within easy walking distance from the hotel. Our favourites were: Café Café (Via SS Quattro) – Cheap and cheerful – good food. On Sunday they do a Brunch (up to 4:00pm) – all you can eat from a Buffet (Salads, Flans & open sandwiches) plus a large bottle of water and dessert all for 14 Euro. Il Bocconcino – (Via Ostilia) – Good tasty food – the menu is only in Italian, but the Waiters are helpful. Li Rioni A Santiquattro (Via SS Quattro) – right under the hotel. Turn left out of the hotel, and left again and it is at the next corner. This is a Pizzeria and the Pizzas are excellent. There is a supermarket close by (opposite Café Café) for essential supplies (water etc). Other Comments: We would recommend the Walking Tours (Phone [-]) for the Coliseum and Vatican (Hannah Schneider). We would not recommend the Archeobus – the commentary was poor and did not relate to the location of the bus. The bus moved too quickly past the sites and the map of the bus stops provided was not useful at all – it showed bus-stops that were not used. A very confusing trip.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EnglandPenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during our very hectic sightseeing tour of Rome. It has a perfect location to all major sites with the Colloseum a 3 minute walk from the hotel. We walked to all locations within Rome including the Vatican. The hotel staff were always polite and friendly. We were even given a personal tour of our room with an explanation of how things worked when we arrived. The hotel provide you with an excellent map and marked on all the major sites. The map proved invaluable - especially as our expensive pre-purchased pop out map broke within hours or reaching Rome! The hotel looks fantastic from the outside and is very modern and clean inside. Our room and bathroom were small but more than adequate. (See photos) Within the bathroom they provided you with the usual range of good quality soaps etc alongside a bathrobe. The room had a very comfortable large bed, t.v, hairdryer, mini-bar etc. They provide an evening maid service where they come and put out a liitle mat and slippers by the side of you bed (I loved this!) (See photos). The hotel does have a snack service menu which you can eat in your room or on the roof terrace. We did not have this as it did seem a bit expensive. There are plenty of restaurants in the local area. We chose to eat at LE NAUMACHIE for two of the nights as other reviewers had mentioned it. We thought it was very nice and both the service and food were lovely. One downside is the fact that the menu is quite small and limited. On both nights it was full - they do have additional seating downstairs and at the back. Location: Turn right out of hotel and then take the first right and it is on the left hand side on the corner. For our last night we ate at the cafe/bar directly opposite the above. It seemed to be mainly used by locals. The food was OK but maybe not as posh as Le Naumachie. Breakfast in the hotel is very good. We would suggest that you go for breakfast early as staff do seem to struggle when it is busy. A continental breakfast is served. A choice of drinks are offered. You can eat on the terraces if it is warm enough. From the breakfast terrace on your right hand side you can see the colloseum. We decided to order a cab to collect us from the airport and return us there at the end of the holiday. We used Rome Cabs - they were excellent and charged 45 Euros each way for two people. The hotel had quoted us much more than this. We found the hotel very very peaceful and even slept with the window open and were not disturbed. This is amazing as when in Rome all you hear are horns and sirens. A great location. If we returned to Rome we would stay at tis hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, chic, friendly”
Reviews.Author: rustybucket
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel based about a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum. It has much larger than average rooms for a European hotel and the staff are, without exception, extremely helpful and friendly. I would certainly stay here again - but have a couple of points to add! 1. If you like a big and hearty breakfast, this may not be the place for you. It does a continental style breakfast with no cooked items though they do toast if you ask for it. What they have is ok, but not great. 2. We stayed in room 308 which was directly below the room they prepare the breakfast and if you are a light sleeper you may get woken up by the chairs and tables being dragged around - I did! 3. Although handy for the colosseum, its a bit of a way from the town centre and you may need to walk to the metro or get a taxi which varied hugely in price due to the strange way they charge for taxis. We paid between 8 and 14 Euro for the same trips! 4. There are some good local trattorias and some BAD ones - the manager of the hotel gave us to recommendations - one of which was very good (Crab for seafood) and the other was very bad! 5. They have a small bar by the reception which is pleasant, but EXPENSIVE. Two gin based cocktails cost 22EUR and yes, they do expect a tip as well! The on-line prices of this hotel varied quite a bit, but I got by far the best deal using www.travelsupermarket.com and going with BA Holidays, but I did have to prepay. Rome is just BEAUTIFUL and this is a nice area with good local facilities. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen33
Reviews.Content: We were a demanding group of Grandparents from the US, parents used to nice business hotels and two very active boys of 9 and 11 years old. We picked the hotel for the location near the Coliseum and we were not disappointed. They gave us two ground floor rooms next to each other, each with extra beds for the kids. The rooms are not terribly exciting but were big by Rome standards, squeaky clean and very comfortable. The extra beds were not just cots but were real beds, very comfortable. The breakfast was standard but fresh and delicious, and the staff were so friendly, especially with the kids. We had dietary restrictions (no gluten, no lactose) that were met with no problem -- they offered without us asking to make hot chocolate using soya milk for our son. The front desk people were also very helpful and pointed out several restaurants and other things for us, all of which were just what we asked for. We found everyone to be friendly and very helpful and the US grandparents just could not have been happier or more comfortable, and were especially impressed by the cleanliness of the place. Our son hugged the breakfast waitress (who was the same every day) when we left and told her he would be back to see her again soon!! He actually cried in the plane on the way hope and has been begging us to go back to the same hotel. Definitely a great choice, and at a great price too!!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: EMT64
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed for a week at this hotel in March. It rained every day, but that didn't stop of enjoyment of the city. The hotel was very good, with high quality furnishings and bedding, and lovely bathroom bits and bobs. We had the room with the balcony at the front of the hotel, but the rain prevented our using it. Of particular note, as others had commented, is the breakfast, which was always fresh, with the loveliest staff you're likely to meet anywhere, who were attentive and charming. Although the hotel doesn't do evening meals, as such, it does do room service with very nice salads (and enough bread to open a shop). This was cheaper than eating out! Good restaurants are close and there's a wine shop at the end of the street with wonderful biscuits and pasta to bring home. At the other end of the street, right by the hotel, is SS Quattro Coronati: this is quite a remarkable fourth-century church with wonderful frescoes in an external chapel. Up the road are S Stephano Rotundo--with a breath-taking interior--and the beautiful S Maria in Dominica. There are a couple of things I'd criticise about the hotel: i) we had a double room, but it only had one easy chair (why?!); ii) you have to pay a substantial amount for internet connection, which I think is rather shoddy considering the price of the hotel room; iii) the television is free if you're happy watching only CNN or Sky News (for a week...!). You have to pay a lot for other channels. Apart from those issues, have a stiff drink before getting in the 40EUR taxi to the airport. Ours was a terrifying experience. And last, take an umbrella, because while the hotel has some, it runs out immediately on a rainy day.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay920
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very disappointed with our time at Capo d'Africa. The hotel is very expensive because of its location to the Colosseum, and this seems to give them the right to skimp on other amenities. The room, breakfast, room amenities, and services were nothing more than what I would expect from a Holiday Inn hotel. The most frustrating thing we experienced, however, was the customer service. No one at the hotel seems to have their story straight. My luggage was lost by our airline, and the hotel continued to tell us the luggage would be there in 24 hours. Indeed, this is what the airline was telling them, but it wasn't until we decided to speak to a manager after three days of my luggage missing that this was very common for Alitalia to lose luggage and not tell the truth on the phone. This would have been helpful information earlier. In addition, we needed to mail packages back to the U.S. We were told multiple stories about FedEx's hours and services. After being told FedEx was open on the weekend and then finding out they weren't, we went back to the original concierge to tell him his information was wrong, and he denied ever speaking to us about it. When we were getting directions to FedEx Monday morning, we told the receptionist we were in a hurry because we thought they were open on the weekend, she told us she didn't believe us that anyone in the hotel told us that. We tried to tell her someone did, and she wouldn't even listen to us. She continued to tell us she didn't believe us. It was so frustrating. We also felt the hotel was trying to scam us in many ways. For instance, when we wanted to take a taxi to the airport, the receptionist told us we would have to pay 90 Euros ($135). We couldn't believe the price and told her we couldn't pay that. My husband said he wouldn't pay over 50 Euros for a taxi, and miraculously she found us a taxi for 50 Euros. This is just one example. We felt we constantly had to be on our toes to avoid being taken advantage of at this terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a rome holiday”
Reviews.Author: bob4434
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel for four days food good staff welcoming and friendly hotel facilities fine does not do evening meals allthough staff will tell you of good eating places near bye.excellent and not dear.used the la numnche near bye myself excellent.the hotel is near the cloosseo and other attractions.this is the second best hotel i have stayed in the CLIFF BAY in funchal is still my favourite but this is a very good hotel indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mancman111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend - good location, good room and facilities. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The only disappointment was breakfast - very limited choice especially after a couple of mornings eating the same things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: JourneymanUK
Reviews.Content: I don't know about everyone else but as you get older (we are both in our fifties) there are certain things that you want from a hotel namely - A comfortable bed Clean tidy rooms Clean bathrooms - No plastic shower curtain hiding a shower that won't work A Mini Bar for storing milk in Good service Polite staff Good food Peaceful and quiet Tea making facilities Before visiting Rome my wife and I spent many hours on TripAdvisor going through the various hotels before booking. One comment that kept on coming up was "nice hotel but noisy". The Hotel Capo D'Africa is about three hundred metres from the Colliseum up the Via D'Capo D'Africa. It is quiet and it met all of our requirements with the exception of tea making facilities, there was even a TV, which we aren't fussed about when on holiday. You can have breakfast on the roof, although there is no restaurant for lunch or evening meal. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and the ancient part of of the city is all around you. The staff were courteous and always willing to help with directions, taxis etc. On display at reception is a TripAdvisor award that they won in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Ancient Rome attractions.”
Reviews.Author: croesio
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from recommendations on Tripadvisor and chose this location because we were going to be concentrating on ancient Rome siteseeing. As the flight was arriving at 8.30pm we decided to book ATS (airport transfers) on the EasyJet website. We were met by a taxi- airport to hotel, cost 53 Euros or £40. Same for return. Service was excellent. The hotel was all that was expected from previous reviews. The breakfast room was lovely:-on the roof and even in February we were able to sit outside in the sun. A previous traveller had mentioned the nearby supermarket which was great for bread, cheeses and alcohol if you wanted. It was surprisingly cheap. We had booked a "viator" tour to the catacombs and crypts of underground Rome. This was excellent and the tour finished just around the corner from the hotel at a church called the Basilica of San Clemente. Fascinating. We would not have noticed this church or even have gone in if we had not been on the tour. The church had crypts that went back to 1AD and there was so much to see. It was also convenient to be able to walk about 50 metres back to our hotel when the tour ended. The hotel was about 2 blocks from the Colloseum and Forum. Tours of the Forum were free with English speaking guides. Well worth a visit. There were a number of nearby restaurants to eat at night. The hotel was on a one way street and was quiet in the nights. Breakfast was available until 11 o, clock. The situation was ideal for us on this visit and the staff were very helpful.The hotel map of Rome that we were given was all that we needed to find our way around. It is very easy to walk to most of the major sites in Rome but if you want to take the bus, all journeys cost just 1 Euro. Buses run very regularly. On previous visits we had thought Rome was enormous, but when you walk the streets you find that it is quite compact. We will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of peace and tranquility in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: SamMac17
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a three day break. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was located in a quiet street away from the 'hussle and bustle' but only a few minutes from the Coloseum and Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GBessex
Reviews.Content: Having been recommended this hotel by a friend, we booked up for a short break. It was quite expensive compared to other hotels we had looked at, but having been to Rome, stayed at the Capo, and seen other hotels I would not hesitate to recommend this one. The extra money you will pay will reward you with high quality accommodation in the heart of historic Rome's centre - about 400 yards from the Colosseum. (By the way, the photo of the Colosseum from the balcony has been doctored, it can be seen but you will not get the view shown!) The staff are friendly, efficient and sorted out a problem with our booking (not their fault - details were not passed to them from our agent) without quibble. Rooms are as shown in the photo and of a high standard. The breakfast was a pleasant, high quality continental style - not cheap rolls and jam. If you are arriving at Ciampino airport I would recommend a cab as the easiest way to get there. The licensed white cabs wont rip you off - the standard fare to the centre is fixed - discuss it with them at the time. I would not recommend the Terravision bus. It is billed as an Express service, but once they have your money they will keep you hanging around while the coach driver chain smokes and drinks coffee in the airport canteen. You pays ya money and takes ya choice with Terravision! Back to the hotel - I would recommend a stay there without hesitation. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Perfect location (nice, quiet streets)!”
Reviews.Author: beckymein
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in Rome - it was our first trip there. We stayed at Capo d'Africa and I cannot say enough good things about it. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The room was very nice (albeit small by American standards), but it was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice. Our room included breakfast which was served upstairs - the weather didn't permit eating on the deck they have (from which you can see the Coliseum), but the dining room inside was nice. The breakfast menu was good and the cappucino was outstanding! They also offered fruit, which was nice to take for a snack later during all the walking around Rome. The location was perfect, very close to the Coliseum and there was a metro stop, bus stops and also a taxi stand within 2 blocks. The restaurants in the area were good and very nice to us. The experience with Capo d'Africa was an excellent experience and I'd highly recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel is located on a quiet street, about 500 metres from the Coliseum. Our room was 215, on the first floor at the front: the views aren't great from the room, but you can see the Coliseum across the rooftops from the 4th floor terrace. The room was a reasonable size, with a small seating area, high ceiling and a very comfortable bed, although I found the pillows a bit hard. There was a fridge / minibar. There was a bath as well as a shower, and a good supply of toiletries. The room was very clean. Internet access is available as a package with pay TV, at €29 for 24 hours. Breakfast is served on the 4th floor, in a bright room, with access to the terrace. Breakfast itself is a typical continental buffet, with cereals, yoghurts, fruit, cheese and meats. No other meals are served at the hotel, although room service is available. The staff are very friendly and speak very good English. Like other reviewers, we found the Le Naumachie neighbourhood restaurant, about 200 metres from the hotel, and it is excellent, with great food and fast, friendly service - great value, too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: aubhi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a surprise. We were expecting a standard hotel but instead got really nice one in a perfect location just round the corner from the main attractions. The rooms are well decorated and very modern, staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: meischad1
Reviews.Content: The Capo d'Africa was a lovely hotel with very nice amenities, comfortable modern room and bathroom, and a nice breakfast on the terrace. It is conveniently located with a metro stop not far away, and close to the Colosseum. We really enjoyed dining at a nearby restaurant called Le Neumachie (sp?). My only qualm was that the front desk staff could have been a bit more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: Dannynha
Reviews.Content: First is important to tell that I just booked this hotel because of the comments I read here. The hotel was a great surprise, and I wasn't disappointed, I can even say that it's one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. I booked it by e-mail directly with the hotel, all the time they were very helpful. I also booked a pick up at the airport with them, and it was a great deal, the driver was there waiting for me and my mother and helped us with all. The location is wonderful, just a few steps from the Coliseum (but you can't see it from the hotel) and a supermarket. I didn't know the hotel has a room service, but they have, and it's ok for a quick dinner or some snacks. All the stuff was just fabulous, very helpful and friendly. The rooms are comfortable, with a great space. In the bathroom we can find some amenities like bath soap, shampoo, shower cap and so. In the room you can also find a red slipper, which is great. The breakfast is nice, with some delicious cheese, jams and pies, and one more time all the stuff is wonderful, always asking what do you what to drink, and you can choose coffee, chocolate, tea or cappuccino. No doubt I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico !!!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo D Africa between 17th and 20th Jan 08 for our honeymoon and had a great stay. we upgraded to a deluxe double room and got a great rate. We could'nt find one fault with the room which was huge with a massive bed. The room and hotel were perfect and I could not see a speck of dust anywhere. The staff are all very friendly and polite and speak very good English. I think everything to be said about this hotel has been said in other reviews and to be honest if I visit Rome again this is where I will be staying its a great location and nice and quiet at night. If you are looking for a good restaurant as you come out of the front doors of the hotel take a right then your first right again walk down the street for about half a minute and you will see a restaurant called Le Naumarchie on the left handside of the road. one word Heaven!!!!!! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “A stones throw to the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: The Wright Family
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, new (with modern décor), relaxing, NON smoking hotel. It’s tucked away in the back streets – it’s on the street named Capo d’ Africa (it’s got nothing to do with Africa). It’s a comfortable hotel, but not for the budget conscious. The Colosseum is at the end of the street. We had a view of the Colosseum from our bathroom window. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The staff at breakfast go out of their way to help you. The breakfast is included in your room rate; a hot breakfast is €10.00. It’s a continental breakfast and was great. After breakfast the restaurant closes for the day, so there’s no restaurant within the hotel for lunch or dinner. There is a small bar within the lobby for drinks and coffee. The hotel offers the internet in the room for a charge as well as in the lobby. There are complimentary slippers in your rooms. The hotel is within walking distance to the Metro station ‘Colosseo’ where you can catch the metro to Rome's Termini station to change lines. Don’t be put off by the main station as Rome is nothing like it. There is a supermarket in the street behind the hotel. The hotel is also close to cafés, trattorias and restaurants. We highly recommend this hotel and if we were going back to Rome we’d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: julesy
Reviews.Content: This was the tail end of our month-long honeymoon in (predominantly) Italy. We wanted some luxury to enjoy our 2 nights in Rome and we sure got it.....! OK, firstly (as others have pointed out) if you want an old-school Italian pensione or quaint little hotel run by mama & papa, this is not for you. Capo d'Africa is a very modern, classy and stylish hotel with every amenity at your fingertips. From the wonderfully helpful staff - they could not do enough for you, and always with a smile - to the fabulous breakfasts out on the terrace looking over the Roman rooftops to the Colosseum (all a little surreal!), to our beautifully appointed room with a view, it was all fantastic. As it turned out, I had been very clever booking about 5 months before we got there (this was the first hotel of our honeymoon that I booked!) as we ended up with a great price - E180 for a fabulous Deluxe Double Room!! When I checked their website closer to our departure the rates had increased significantly for the same period, so my suggestion is "book well in advance". The location of the hotel is (as you would know) right near the Colosseum. Those of you who have been to Rome before (as we have) and have done the ancient ruins etc, you will know this approximate location. It's not a sensational part of town, but it is worth it for the hotel alone. Besides, it's lovely to start each day walking past such a magnificent piece of history! And the main thing is, at night it's beautifully quiet and you get the BEST night's sleep on the incredibly comfy KS beds at d'Africa! It's also on the right side of town for a quick getaway to the airport upon your departure.... We managed to walk to a multitude of sites from the hotel - Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. We do love walking but even we were over it each night when we got back to our room with filthy and throbbing feet!!! But it's so gorgeous to roam the streets of Rome (haha!) we just couldn't help ourselves. It was worth the sore tootsies. We took the train to the Vatican the following morning, which was a fabulous idea, and worked our way back from there during the day. There are some great restaurants and trattorias in the laneways around the Pantheon - too many to choose from actually - and we enjoyed a fabulous al fresco lunch there (can't recall the name of the cafe unfortunately). As mentioned in other reviews, a great restaurant near the hotel (if you can't be bothered walking any more - that was us by the end of day 2!) is definitely Ristorante Papagio. Amazing pasta and a lovely outdoor dinner setting. After a day of walking those cobblestone streets and dusty trails through the ruins, nothing beat getting back to the hotel and sitting up on the terrace sipping on one of their many delicious cocktails. You just call the bar from the rooftop phone and place your order, and soon you've got a little snack and some fabulous drinks arriving on your table as you watch the sun sinking over Rome. Pretty spectacular..... So would I stay at Capo d'Africa again? For that price tag I most definitely would - it was a major bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LIZcc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband as a trip for our wedding anniversary. The hotel is very modern so if you are looking for traditional Italian this is not for you. On arrival it was a quick check in and the staff were very helpful and polite ,they gave us a map and circled all the popular sites and instruction on buses ,metro etc. We had a deluxe room on the ground floor which was lovely ,quite big for European standards and it had very high cielings and 3 large windows as it was a corner room. The bathroom was small but adequate and the bath was a perfect size for my five foot two inches and was a welcome relief at the end of a hard day sight seeing. They also frovided fluffy bathrobes and slippers which was nice. The bed and bath linen were changed daily and the room was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was continental but there was a great choice and the staff all spoke great English. The hot chocolate was particularily yummy. The hotel is on a one way street so traffic noise is not a problem. It is a two minute walk to the Colesseum and the Roman Forum and there are lots of nice retaraunts nearby. All in all we had a great stay at this hotel and i would definetly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeorton
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Staff were very helpful and the hotel was quiet, clean and modernly decorated. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: debrajane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after we read the reviews on Trip Advisor. This reminded me of a Hampton Inn (a nice new Hampton Inn) in the States. Nice looking, but not a Roman retreat. The hotel could be anywhere in the world. The bathroom was small; it had a small shower. The room was very large even for US standards. The front desk was only somewhat knowledgeable. We asked about the opera and the woman said she would look in to it. We went to our room with the bell hop and went back downstairs; she left for a break and never got back to us. We were told when we checked in that they would be glad to arrange for us to have a car take us to the airport. We were warned that we could take a cab, but warned that we risked extra charges because of our bags. While I know anything is possible, the rate to the airport by taxi is posted everywhere and cab drivers are not permitted to charge extra for bags. While we did take the car service, I don’t need to be scared into doing it. The bar is in the lobby and offered a decent snack. But the bar was not anything worth making a point to stop at as there was no “scene” or atmosphere. The location is in a residential location, while it is near the Colosseum, it is several blocks away. The streets were deserted at night. We walked outside to look around and see what restaurants were nearby. We decided to go up by the Spanish Steps to spend our last night at a restaurant we loved. The area around the Colosseum clears out after the Colosseum closes. So catching a cab was problematic and we waited by the Colosseum for about fifteen minutes. If you are in Rome for a few days, I would not recommend staying at this hotel. The Colosseum was further than two blocks as the hotel describes itself. Yes, there is a view of the Colosseum. You have to go out to the roof and crane your head to see it. You do have a view during the breakfast buffet. We did have a bite at the breakfast buffet. Reminded me of the Hampton Inn that my parents stay at when they visit us in New Jersey. If you want the type of thing that you can get in the states, you might like this hotel. They encouraged everyone to leave a review on trip advisor so I am. We stayed at the Intercontinental De La Ville in Rome for the rest of our Roman stay. This, in my opinion, is more of a luxury hotel than the CapoD’Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Try the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: mhoehler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last night of our honeymoon. It was a bit of a splurge for us. The rooms were spacious and clean, with many nice touches. (There’s a picture of me in the complimentary pink slippers and robe that no one will ever see.) It's everything you would expect a hotel be for the price We were most pleased with the dining room on the roof. I don’t know if people just don’t know about it yet, but we were one of only two tables there. We ate out on the terrace with the Coloseum in the distance. It was as though we had our own private chef. One of the two best meals we had on our honeymoon, and the best in Rome for us. It was such a nice way to end our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: I see the prices have gone up considerably. In 2006 I paid 170usd a night at this hotel making it an amazing find in Rome. It is a street away from the Coloseum and the train station. There are many cafes, restaurants a walk away. The Capo d'Africa is small but very contemporary and stylish. The rooms have excellent use of space with comfy beds, decent international tv, wifi in the lobby and excellent bathrooms by Italian standards. Breakfast on the roof overlooking the Coloseum was not possible in January, shame. 10 minute taxi from posh shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ConesusLaker
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Capo d'Africa the last week of August. What a great place to stay! The location is great, the staff helfpful, the breakfast filling and the rooms are well appointed. The hotel staff took care of every request with a smile from ordering a taxi to arranging a dinner reservation. No doubt, we will stay at Capo d'Africa on every future trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed on our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: DrRob
Reviews.Content: We chose the Capo for the first night of our honeymoon as we had stayed there exactly a year previous to the day and loved ourselves the first time. We had informed them of all of these reasons for coming back ie. first night of honeymoon, returning guests etc and felt decidedly disapointed that there was no recognition of our honeymoon apart not even a verbal one. When we arrived the hotel staff greeted us with their usual efficiency and they were good enough to book us into a local restaurant when asked. The room was as clean as always and the locatinon is great and the local restaurants are excellent value for money (as long as you stay in the backroads). Even though we love the location and the hotel is fine we did not feel that the Capo was a great place to go on our honeymoon as it is a business hotel and we felt a bit deflated. However on visiting Florence we found out what a hotel can do for you on honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a quiet location!”
Reviews.Author: PiperDougie
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our honeymoon for a bit of luxury after visiting the Amalfi coast. We weren't disappointed! The room was huge and well-equipped, the staff very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was superb. The location was ideal for us too - only a 10 minute walk to the coliseum, with plenty of quality, reasonably priced, restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Echoknoll
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we picked the Capo d' Africa after reading the reviews in TripAdvisor. The location was perfect. Plenty of good places to choose for dinner. Breakfast had a nice variety. The staff friendly and helpful. We especially liked the fact that the windows in the room could be opened. The only down side was the carpet in the room needed to be cleaned. Would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable Hotel with Great Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: knomo
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from Chicago, checking into the Capo d'Africa Hotel was a great start to our first visit to Rome. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, offering right away to make us a dinner reservation since restaurants tend to busy on Friday nights. When we got to our room, we couldn't believe the size of it -- it was huge by European hotel standards. They had nice terrycloth robes and red slippers for us, and a big, modern bathroom. In the mornings, the breakfast buffet was fantastic. We did overhear another American say he was "disappointed" with it (there wasn't the typical scrambled eggs and bacon, but we didn't come to Italy for American food). It did include, however, a great selection of fresh juices, cereal, fruit, breads, cheese and meat, and made-to-order cappucino. If it's nice out, definitely take advantage of the rooftop terrace. While this was definitely the most expensive hotel we stayed in during our trip to Rome, Nice and Barcelona, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: BroncoCountry
Reviews.Content: Capo d'Africa was our base in Rome for two night in September 2007. We booked based on the reviews here at Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. Our room was clean, modern, quiet, and spacious (by European standards) with a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was beautifully presented and the view from the rooftop garden of the Coloseum and Rome was superb. What really sets this hotel apart from most of my lodging experiences is the property-wide commitment to exceptional service. Everyone at the desk spoke English well. More importantly, my wife and I continually felt like they were glad we were there, and they would do anything possible to ensure that we had a great time. And we did! Both restaurants that they sent us to were terrific, and the driver they arranged to pick us up at FCO was on time and very pleasant. Regarding the location, I would have never thought to stay in the neighborhood above the Coloseum, but it was very quiet and seemed safe. Rome is pretty walkable, and we walked from Capo d'Africa all the way to the Pantheon and even the Vatican (a pretty healthy hike, but not bad on a nice day.) We took cabs at night. I would absolutely stay here again. Many thanks to the staff at Capo d'Africa for a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Isak A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Capo d'Africa for two days in spring 2007 together with my girlfriend. It was our third time in Rome, and Capo d'Africa was the best hotel so far. The price is reasonable considering the great locations and standard. The location is superb, just a few minutes from til Colloseum. It's also close to public transport, and several small restaurants and shops. Recommend the small restaurant one block in direction of the Colloseum. The room was of good size, and high standard. Clean and nice. The street outside is quiet - although in weekdays there is some traffic in the morning. Breakfast was good, in summer one could also enjoy breakfast on the terasse - even getting a view of the Colloseum while drinking the first italian Cappucino of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sailwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-October for 5 nights. We thought the hotel was a good value. We did a lot of research before booking and were pleased with the hotel and the price although not cheap price is certainly comparable to 4 star hotels in other major cities. Room was good size, extremely clean and the staff very helpful and accomadating. Breakfast was very good and the rooftop terrace was a nice added feature especially if you are visiting duirng the warm months. We asked many questions, asked the staff to make many reservations and call taxis and every time it was done with a smile. One night we were too tired to go out to dinner so we ordered a light dinner from room service and asked to eat on the rooftop. It was a little chilly, definately jacket weather,and although the staff thought we were nuts for wanting to eat outside they accomadated us without question. The location of the hotel might be a concern to some since it is a little offf the beaten track of some of the historic sites but we found the metro and buses were easy to use and the trade off of a quiet neighborhood worked for us. One slight disapontment was the restaurant recomendations in the immediate area. We took the hotel suggestions on 2 nights and thought both restaurants were average at best. Overall we would highly recomend and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Zazzo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our trip from Italy. We started in Milan and ended in Rome. Staying at four hotels during our trip. The Capo D Africa is an excellent hotel and a great location. The staff is very friendly and professional. They all speak English so communication is not a problem. If you need help booking reservations or a taxi they are there for you. The rooms are clean and a decent size. The bathrooms are fine and the showers are great. I would recommend this hotel. NJ

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan033
Reviews.Content: Located no more than a 10 minute walk from the Colisseum this is a superb modern hotel in a quiet back street. Although the rooms are on the small side, they are beautifully appointed. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace. The hotel exudes class. Best hotel of this type I have stayed in for many years. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fred111
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome several times and have never wanted to stay near the "tourist sites." This time, we were only staying one night after a cruise and figured we would try out the Capo d' Africa. It was the best hotel decision we have made in a long time. The hotel has friendly, professional staff members who go out of their way to help. The hotel and rooms are spotlessly clean and very quiet. The hotel is only a few minute wal to the Colessium and the forum and is easy to get to from anywhere in the city. This is now our favorite hotel in Rome and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Very Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: lolabana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 9th anniversary at Capo d'Africa. A few days before we arrived, I requested an early check-in of 10am. When we arrived a little past 10am, our room was ready for us. I was happily surprised that we actually were able to go right up to our room, especially after an all night flight. After a little bit of a rest, we went walking around for a few hours. When we returned, our room was turned down, slippers put out by the bed and a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us (for our anniversary which was the day we arrived). We had a wonderful corner room that had two windows. The room and bathroom were small (which we were expecting) but it was set up very well. We did not feel cramped in any way. We had plenty of closet space and bathroom counter space fo everything that we brought. The hair dryer in the desk drawer was strange but it was actually nice to sit down to dry my hair while my husband was taking a shower. There would not have been room in the bathroom for both of us to get ready so it turned out great. It was nice that the breakfast went so late for the days that we slept in. I loved the chocolate croissants they had. I did not mind that there was no hot breakfast items, probably because I was already prepared for it. The room was extremely quiet and I am a light sleeper. Our room was on the second floor so we did not hear any noise from the breakfast room or from the check-in desk. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If we ever make it back to Rome, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: audreyandace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week. We were celebrating our 25th Wedding anniversary and choose the Capo D'Africa after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We had the King Suite with our own Terrace- well worth the money. It was FANTASTIC to see the the city and the Colosseum each morning and night from our terrace. The old building we looked at all week from the terrace turned out to be a wonderful old church-check it out. The hotel staff is first rate-very helpful giving advice for tours, restaurants,wonderful at breakfast each morning,etc. We loved the location-we felt safe walking day or night and could walk anywhere we wanted( except the Vatican- a bit too far). Lots of good restaurants nearby ( Il Ronis- best bruschetti I ever had!!). I liked that I could get the internet through the TV and it was inexpensive to use it. October was a wonderful time to come to Rome. I miss it and hope to be able to return and I will be coming to this wonderful hotel when I do.

Reviews.Title: “This is the location you want”
Reviews.Author: FreedomTravel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Roma Termini, we called the hotel and they helped us avoid the sharks trying to scam at the station and got us to the real taxi stand where we had a taxi for 4 plus bags for 20 Euros to the hotel. The quietness and safeness of the neighborhood cannot be stressed enough, it was really key for being in a big city like Rome. We took a nap in the middle of the afternoon after walking 15 miles to in the Vatican and were never disturbed. The front desk staff is top notch and quite funny just to add! The pictures are very accurate and the rooms were on the level of a good 4+ star hotel in the USA. Nice closet, robes and slippers, turndown service, nice toiletries, safe, marble bathroom, it was all top quality. The breakfast staff was nice, but it is more of a continental breakfast but still good. There is no view of the Colosseum from this hotel from what I could find, but it is VERY closeby and this is the location you want to have in Rome. The Metro stop is 3-4 blocks away and we walked everywhere. We loved the restaurant around the corner, Hostaria Isadora. Everything they had was fabulous and very reasonable. We went there 2 days in a row. The drawbacks: We only had a shower, but our friends had a tub so the bathrooms were different. There is no eggs/bacon/toast or warm food for breakfast. There is no restaurant to eat lunch or dinner here, but several in the neighborhood. The high charge for Internet access is the worst, for the price they are charging every night, they could give free internet access like all the other hotels in Europe that we stayed in (and some that charged 1/2 what this one does for a night's stay). The lack of internet really needs to be fixed. I am a US Travel agent and would book my customers in this hotel without question anytime.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Capo35
Reviews.Content: our second time staying here and every bit as good as the first, staff rembered us on our anniversary and took care of us nothing is to much trouble.A first class peacfull haven with first class staff. A special mention to the man at reception who couldnt have been any more profesional, didnt get his name but he is not a fan of kaka. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreSkiBob
Reviews.Content: I did an extensive analysis of Rome hotel reviews on Trip Advisor before narrowing my selection to a few hotels. All things being essentially equal I booked at the Capo D’Africa because of it’s proximity to many sights and room availability. I was very glad I made this selection. Location: I can not stress the value of this great location. It is on a quiet street about 3-4 blocks from the Colosseum, Forum and Metro. We easily walked to the Pantheon and several other sights in 20 minutes. We took the Metro to the Spanish Steps and Piazza del Popolo with no difficulties. A grocery store and plenty of excellent restaurants and bars are nearby for lunch and dinner. Rooms: Several reviews of other hotels complained about street noise and lack of air conditioning. Well I can tell you that the Capo D’Africa rooms were very quiet, clean, comfortable and well air conditioned. Our bedroom was about 22x12 feet with a king size bed. A small foyer led to the bathroom which was a good size. The room had a mini-bar that we used as a small fridge for wine and water (purchased in the grocery store). A room safe was also an added feature. One reviewer mentioned the hair dryer in the dresser drawer (which was strange) but at was not a problem since it was in front of a mirror. Service: The staff spoke excellent English and were very polite, attentive and helpful. When we arrived several hours before check-in (on a Sunday morning) they were very accommodating. They were always ready to answer questions or provide assistance. The breakfast room on the 4th floor had a good selection of breakfast foods and friendly attentive staff. You can tell that service is a high priority with all of the staff. You can reserve bus tours at the front desk which was very helpful and saved us from a several hour wait on line at the Vatican. My only one slight demerit was the fact that you have to pay for internet access. I have been to many hotels and B&Bs that provide internet access as a free service to guests (like an ice machine). I was surprised given the quality of the hotel and pretty high room price that I had to shell out 5 euros for ½ hour of internet time check to my home e-mail. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay there again. We had a very comfortable stay and enjoyed Rome. Since this was our first trip to Rome I can not compare this hotel to others in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Vivi28
Reviews.Content: Room was small but very well appointed and clean. The bed was comfortable by European standards and the bathroom was very nice if tiny. One weird thing is that the hairdryer is in the desk drawer in the room and you have to use it from there (connected). The rooftop bar/seating area was beautiful and it was probably my favorite of the 5 hotels I stayed in during our trip to Italy. The breakfast room is also on the top level and has lovely views and outdoor seating. The hotel is a little pricey but I was very happy with it and would return. One other thing I didn't like was the internet on the TV. We paid 6e for its use for 24 hrs or something like that but it's very difficult to use a TV keyboard mouse! The other choice was to pay 5e to use the hotel's internet on their PC for only 30 minutes. All staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Loved how you can sit on the rooftop and order from the bar on the ground level.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: k0ti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a short weekend trip to Rome. I only stayed for a night. The overall experience was good. I have to admit, I have experienced the same level of service for less elsewhere. The room was big and with a wide open space where I felt a table would fit perfectly fine. Not sure this was not used so that a 3rd bed might be inserted there. A small side table and a desk were already in the room. The bathroom was slightly small and had a large shower wet room and no bath. There was the usual internet/tv/pay tv combination but no flat screen, high tech sound systems etc. A nice touch was the ability to be able to switch lights from a wired remote on the bedside tables. The bed was quite big itself and had one of the best matresses I have ver slept on. The staff was very friendly. The bar and waiting areas were average and quite small. The dining / breakfast area was on the top floor and breakfast on a nice day is highly enjoyable. Overall, a very good experience but would have expected just a little bit more for that sort of price.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location for all the Rome sights”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy'sgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We really liked it and the staff were really nice and very helpful. The only down side was that there was a function going on one night that woke me up at 2am. We had the room right next door to the breakfast room where they held the function. My husband did sleep through the whole thing though!!! The room was very well furnished and had maid service twice a day. The breakfast was a nice start to the day with plenty of staff who were really polite. The hotel was ideally situated for seeing all the sights. We did so much walking. We also went on an open top bus which was a good way of seeing the sights. When we arrived at the airport I had booked a bus to take us to the centre of Rome which was great. We booked it through Terravision, I found it on the airport website. However, when we got dropped off at the termini in Rome we had to get a taxi to the hotel. I had looked on the map and could see that it wasn't that far. We got a taxi and got ripped off by the taxi driver, he charged us 29 Euros for the journey that took all of 8 minutes I expect. When I asked the hotel how much it should have cost they said no more than 15 Euros. When we did the same journey back to the termini from the hotel it was only 14 Euros. The hotel said you did get some bad taxi drivers that take advantage of people new to Rome, so just be careful. I think it is worth asking how much the fare will be before you get in the taxi. We have certainly learnt from this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel. Wanted to stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: richardreggie
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hoel. Just got back from this hotel and have to say we were very pleased with everything this hotel offers. The staff are very helpful and freindly and can't do enough for you, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are very clean and have everything you neeed in a room and are cleaned daily with fresh towels and bedding replaced on a daily basis. There is a roof top terrace where you have breakfast and this is lovely as you can see the colloseum, what a way to start the day. The location of this hotel is great for seeing the city. It is a short walk to the Colloseum and from there you can walk to most of the tourist attractions. We can't wait to go back to this hotel and will be recomending it to all our freinds and family.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Circe509
Reviews.Content: I visited Capo D'Africa in October, and thought the Tripadvisor reviews and photos were very accurate. Pros: -Decent amount of space for urban hotel -Room was clean, well-decorated and furniture/fixtures were in good condition -Good cappucinos at breakfast -Reasonably near metro in area that, while touristy, was not as touristy as other nice hotels Cons: -Front desk was not helpful. Check-in consisted of attempts to sell me tour packages, and restaurant suggestions were terrible. -Bed was uncomfortably firm, but that may just be an Italian thing, not limited to this hotel -Hair dryer was installed inside a writing desk drawer. Why???

Reviews.Title: “Good - but luxury???”
Reviews.Author: Gums
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons we booked this hotel was because it had been awarded the Trip Advisor award for best luxury hotel. After our recent 5 night stay I do wonder whether such a title is going a little too far. True, it a smart contemporary hotel. Our room was large, housekeeping always immaculate, staff friendly and helpful, and the decor fresh (if a little bland) and well maintained. It also scores very highly on the location front being within minutes of the Forum, Palatine and Colosseum yet on a backstreet and so sheltered from the noise of the 24/7 Roman traffic. But there were features lacking which would seperate it from what I would regard as luxury. We forgot our electricity adaptor. The hotel did not have one. There was no written information in the room about the hotel facilities or Rome itself. There was no one outside to help us with bags or hail a taxi (although the hotel would call one if requested). The breakfast was good quality but limited. When sitting in the lounge no one asked if we wanted a drink and we had to go to the bar (which was often unmanned) to get one. There was no restaurant and obtaining food (which could be served on the lovely terrace on the roof) seemed to require ordering at the bar downstairs and making your way up to the roof to seat yourself, the TV had limited international channels, and the bathrooms were cramped. Don't get me wrong, this hotel was a very good four star option and I would recommend it to those going to Rome who don't care about pampering in the extreme but don't be mistaken into thinking that this is a luxury hotel (however boutique) in the mould of the Hasslers, De Ruisse or Edens. A fine hotel but in need of attenion to detail and those little extras if it is justify it's luxury title.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome! Loved Capo D'Africa”
Reviews.Author: suzq22
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-night stay at Capo D'Africa Hotel. The location was great, the Colosseo stop was about a 5 minute walk- very convenient. We had a double room on the second floor - non smoking. Our room was a good size for a room in Europe- it was clean and modern; the bathroom was a bit small but new and clean. The Reception staff was not only great but fun (especially Mario- and he was great with restaurant recommendations). We liked Il Bocconciono (especially the cacio e pepe). For dinner, we especially loved going to Trastevere (especially Ponte Sisto and Glass Hostaria). The cab ride was easy. We had breakfast included in our package (and always had a fresh array of fruit, bread, cold meats, cheeses, etc. The waiters were kind - we loved Luigi's capuccinos. The small minimart down the block convenient for water and wine (which we took up to the terrace-- nothing beats coming back early evening after a busy day and watching the sun set on the terrace!) The Gelato store around the corner (On Aurelio and Celimonttana) was excellent- the best we found in Rome! We did get a tour for the Vatican- which I recommend otherwise go at 1pm when there is virtually no line...the huge line wraps around for hours at 9am! Also you must reserve the Borghese Gallery online. Overall the Capo D' Africa Hotel was a very pleasant hotel in a good location and we would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here on your visit to Roma”
Reviews.Author: andreaonmon
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel largely based on reviews on TripAdvisor and I was definitely not disappointed. The location is brilliant in a rather quiet neighborhood by the Colosseum. I was worried that the area would be too quiet and a bit out of the way but I was wrong (or just a bit ignorant about my knowledge of the city). There are good restaurants in the vicinity, the metro stop, and the various hop on hop off tour buses all stop nearby. And plus, you never tire of the Colosseum view which you can see from the breakfast terrace. The hotel is pretty new and with modern decor. There is a nice space in the lobby for guests to gather. The rooms are not big but spacious enough and have comfortable beds. The bathrooms are small but that is probably pretty standard for Rome. I was not expecting anything bigger. They have room service which is decent and without an exorbitant price tag. Amenities in the hotel include meeting rooms and a fitness room but I did not see either so I cannot comment. Breakfast is included in the room rate and is more than sufficient with a good selection of food although you won't find anything that they cook (besides the hard boiled eggs). It's cold cuts, bread, cereals, fruit, and pasteries. The service we received from the hotel guests was fine, no complaints there. We didn't really have any special requests or needs, though. We stayed on the 3rd floor which is just below the 4th floor where the breakfast room is located. During breakfast hours, it was a bit noisy as you are able to hear all the foot traffic from above. I would imagine you would have the same issue if staying on the 4th floor where there were a few rooms as well. This wasn't a big deal for us but thought I would mention this if you want absolute peace and quiet. Perhaps request a room on the 2nd floor. This hotel definitely attracts a certain crowd who wants a quiet stay: people on honeymoon, seniors .... no teens/back-packers. I didn't notice people with children either. I think I saw one child during my 5 day stay. So keep that in mind in case you want somewhere with more atmosphere within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at this particular hotel in Rome fantastic”
Reviews.Author: judoff
Reviews.Content: (JUDITH & JOHN IRELAND) This is for ROBERTO & CHIARA front of house staff at Hotel Capo d'Africa. We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights recently as we were celebrating our wedding in Rome. Firstly we would like to comment on the friendliness, efficiency and politeness of all the staff, household, breakfast room, reception, front of house, who made us comfortable and very welcome in this establishment. Two staff in particular stand out for us and that is as named above Roberto and Chiara, these two could not have been more friendly and nothing was too much trouble, Roberto in particular did one very special thing for us on our wedding day that we will always remember, so thank you Roberto once again. The decor in the hotel is modern and sleek, linen on the king size beds is of high quality, all rooms have air-conditioning, internet access, and double shower. The breakfast ser ved on the roof top terrace is included in the price of the room, you can eat breakfast with views of the Colosseum and chose from a varied buffet which includes fruits, croissants, cereals, juice, cheese, cold meats etc, oh and creamy cappucino's a must! Overall we were very pleased with our stay at the hotel and its proximity to Colosseum/ Palatine and metro station and several bars and restaurants. Overall we loved the city of Rome and this was our second visit there and second stay at Hotel Capo d'Africa. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to stay as the friendliness and politeness of the staff is exceptional, which unfortunately is not the rule for many other locals in this area that we encountered. We completely understand that Rome is over-run all year by tourists and it was the end of the tourist season but frankly tourism/ vatican are what keep this city afloat. We would like to point out 1 particular incident which occured at local restaurants during our stay, this is close to this hotel and if you are in a group of more than 3-4 people we would avoid and certainly not eat there again and would advise others to avoid also. 3 SCALINI-3 STEPS RESTAURANT This 1 particular place seemed to have a menu for "tourists" and a menu for locals, the ignorance and rudeness of the staff who served our table cannot be understated. We booked a family meal the evening after our wedding which admittedly was a large group, but we were not prepared for the disdain and disrespect in which we were treated, despite paying quite a sizeable amount for service at this restaurant which was: "AI 3 SCALINI" or "THE 3 STEPS" via DEI SS QUATTRO, about 2 blocks from this hotel. We were not given any choice about starters and ALL HAD TO EAT THE SAME STARTER, and we were told what we could order as main courses from 4 dishes again WE HAD NO CHOICE ABOUT MAIN DISH, despite the fact that we were PAYING CUSTOMERS and they had added a 10% COMPULSORY SERVICE CHARGE, we came away with a very bad taste in our mouths, felt ripped off. It was absolutely disgraceful. We have eaten in many places around the world and to say we were embarrassed and angry we had taken our family and friends here again is an understatement. LUZZI'S TRATTORIA-via SAN GIOVANNI IN LATERANO-Cheap and cheerful, nothing fancy, fill your belly type food. Locals eat here we think! Its fine if you are in a small group and most of our guests enjoyed lunch here at one point or another during their stay in Rome. Again avoid if you are in groups more than 4 otherwise you will be fine, or perhaps it was just that one particular waiter that we had the misfortune of being served by on our last night in Rome-no brownie points here for polite service either! I know none of this will put you off your visit to Rome as it truely is a fantastic city, we would highly recommend Hotel Capo d'Africa and the staff will make you feel welcome.... and if you fancy something really special to eat, then take a trip by taxi (very cheap fare) to either or both of the following places: "Restaurant Romantica" via Emanuele Filiberto, 52, 00185.....as for the manager Khaled, again superb food and service, this was were we had our wedding meal, our only regret is that we did not get back to eat here again- all 30 of our guests had no complaints whatsoever from here...and "Trattoria da Luigi" Piazza Sforza Cesarini, 24, 00186, Rome- just off Corso Vittorio Emanuele near Campo dei Fiori....we ate here as a large group-11 people, the service and food were superb, ask for a waiter by the name of Moni....then head for a pint in Scholars Irish Bar, via del Plebiscito...great craic, Irish, Americans, Scottish you name it, and the food here ain't bad either for pub grub. (Judith & John Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Misticat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa on 31 Aug and 01 Sep 07 mainly based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is well situated in a quiet neighbourhood in Ancient Rome close to the Metro. The hotel is spotless. The complementary breakfast is sustaining (a plus - the view of the Colosseum from the Terrace!) The staff is attentive and the service personalized. This hotel enjoys a superb rating on Trip Advisor - and rightly so! We thorough;y enjoyed the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller2408
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel, fantastic location, lovely staff, lovely (but small) rooms, fabulous breakfast. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Four days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ian_and_Sarah
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Capo d'Africa. The hotel is in a really convenient location for all of the major sights without it being in the hustle and bustle of some areas (e.g. Spanish Steps etc). The service from Reception was particularly good - they helped us to sort out the Taxi driver who was trying to rip us off with a 60 Euro fare from the airport (should be 40 Euros), and made some great recommendations. The only reason we didn't score the hotel a 5 is due to our bathroom , which we felt was too small and a bit tired. We'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel, but bizarre area of town”
Reviews.Author: CnDinAZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, classy, sophisticated, and of the best quality. Another major plus, was the bartenders were by far the best at making our drinks....I know it sounds silly, but sometimes we wanted a cocktail instead of wine and many places had no idea how to make them! The only negative I have is the area.....it seemed a little seedy with bars/cafes where bizarre people hung out. It didn't deter us from having a good time, but by the 2nd or 3rd night we unanimously wanted to take a cab to the fancier business-professional shopping districts to start our evenings (near Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navano, and on Via Del Corso). The other MAJOR POSITIVE was this hotel had a gym!!! For us gym rats, this was a major plus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: nat7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 14th – 17th September as a birthday treat for my partner. We wanted a hotel that was close to the sights, but far enough away for some peace and quiet. We thought this hotel was ideal and would certainly stay here again. Hotel – Situated in a quiet side street away from heavy traffic. Our room (314) was clean and comfortable and the bed was very firm which suited us. There was plenty of storage space for two people, a large TV and a bath and shower. A bath robe and slippers were provided, and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and towels. The hotel is modern and bright, and there is a bar and comfortable reception area on the ground floor. There is a Gym in the basement, though we never used it. We found the staff friendly, polite and informative. Breakfast – Good, and included with the room. It was served in a room on the fourth floor that had two terraces, one of which overlooked the Colosseum. A selection of cereals, cheese, bread and preserves, cold meats, pastries juice and coffee or tea. For an extra charge you could choose to have a cooked version. It was possible to have breakfast in your room at a charge of 7 euros for room service. Location – Fantastic, within walking distance of all the major sights if you are reasonably fit. The Colosseum is only a five minute walk away. Should you need to take the metro the Collosseo stop is nearby. There are several bars and restaurants close to the hotel. Getting There – We arrived at Fiumicino and got a train from the airport to Termini at a cost of 11 euros each. The train runs every half an hour. From there get the Metro to the Colosseo stop at 1 euro each, then a 10-15 minute walk to the Hotel. The metro trains run every 5 minutes or so. On the return journey we opted to use the car arranged by the hotel. This cost 50 euros but included luggage and tip. Nice end to the weekend arriving at the airport in a big black Merc! We loved this hotel and thought it offered great value for money for the location. This was our first trip to Rome and we can’t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WareTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just got back from a 3 day break in Rome and stayed at the Capo d'Africa after checking on the trip advisor site, we were not disapointed, we had a lovely room which was large and very comfortable, toiletries that were replenished everyday and a free safe. The breakfast room which had a lovely terrace overlooking the Colleseum it was amazing.The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The hotel is situated within walking distance of all the major sites with the Vatican being the furthest at around 40 minute stroll.It was our first visit to Rome and really enjoyed our stay helped by the Hotel and it's staff, we would stay at this hotel if we come back to Rome with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: tpayne5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected the Capo based on the reviews we read on this website. We were not disappointed at all. The Capo is a very good hotel. The rooms are clean and the hotel has all the amenities one can hope for. The location for us was fantastic. We were able to walk to all the sights in Rome except the Vatican. Our particular interest was in Ancient Rome and the Colosseum was only a 5 min walk away. The best thing we can say about the hotel was the service. he front desk staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. We had a small problem with mechanical noise in our room on our last night. Our room was changed immediately, with no hassle at all. We would recommend this hotel with no reservations whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “It's average”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBrooke
Reviews.Content: Capo d'Africa is a nice luxury hotel, but nothing special. It feels like any other NY, Chicago or LA hotel I'd stay in for business. While it passes all the basic points of entry for a good hotel - convenient, clean, comfortable - I don't feel like they went out of their way to be hospitable or deliver service that was on par with that we got at B+Bs in other Italian cities. Plus, the 'extras' were expensive! 29 Euros for the entertainment package (tv, movies, internet). Next time, I would look elsewhere for something a little more special.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: himselfetc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this average boutique hotel for three nights. Service & quality of rooms as would be expected. Loud music in the lobby from 7AM every day awoke us and no notice was taken of our request to have it turned down. Poor show.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Gem”
Reviews.Author: Captivep
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from the Coliseum and with easy access to the rest of Rome, this is an excellent hotel. Modern interior styling and facilties complement the attractive building and the very friendly and efficient staff. Our room was large, as was the bed - with a super bathroom, reasonably priced internet access (in the room), comfortable robes and slippers... We'd stay there again, any time!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Impressed”
Reviews.Author: jlf278
Reviews.Content: Capo D'Africa was a great value for the money. The decor was attractive and modern. We really liked the location too as we strolled to the nearby Colliseum and then the Trevi Fountain. Our room was great and comfortable. Everything was nice - no disappointments. There's no gym or pool, but it's a large boutique style hotel. We only stayed one night as we were stopping over for a rest before we headed to Capri and the Amalfi Coast. If we hadn't been to Rome before, we could have easily had a great time here for a week. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We really were impressed with everything and sad to leave even after such a short stay. The immediate area has a couple nice and affordable restaurants that we were recommended and thoroughly enjoyed. You are somewhat off the beaten path, so it's not too busy or noisy, but still just a few blocks from the Colliseum. If you really want to see all of Rome, there might be more central locations to stay, but then you'll probably be paying more for a less nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: CAMcF
Reviews.Content: Great location, can walk to many attractions. Staff is terrific, accommodations are wonderful. Decor is definitely contemporary, so if you're a traditionalist, this may not be your best choice, but the fantastic service absolutely makes this an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: OspreyCardiff_Wales
Reviews.Content: I know it's been said before, but the reviews do match the reality. It was spotlessly clean, the rooms weren't huge but were modern, stylish and big enough, the staff were very nice and the location was fantastic! The airconditioning was efficient without being overbearing, and we really appreciated it after a full hot day of tourism! The breakfast room and terraces are delightful, and the breakfast, although just a cold buffet, was really lovely. The bar service can be a little slow, but hey, you're on holiday - just relax! The best restaurant we found was Trattoria Romana - at the end of the street where the big Carabinieri station is. Three minutes walk and lovely fresh Italian cooking - even when busy the service was excellent. Don't be afraid to use the buses and metro - 4 euros a day for unlimited travel. We were glad of the 81 which we picked up somewhere near Trastevere and seemed to go very frequently - drops you by the colosseum. All in all, a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel location and great decoration”
Reviews.Author: NYCoupleOnHoneymoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa for a few days days last year.....we really loved it. We had a suite on the top level with our private terrace overlooking the Coliseum.....so charming with old stones around us. The decoration in the suite was beautiful....the amenities flavoured with green tea in the bathroom just lovely. Then on the morning we enjoyed taking our breakfast outside on the patio....the supervisor on the morning was really friendly with us but I cannot recall his name....all I remember is that he had a moustache. Really, it could not be better to start the day. Give it a try....it is a must in Rome for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the hype ??”
Reviews.Author: STEVEN-SCOTLAND
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August of 2007. Overarching everything I must enforce how much August is not really a great time to go to Rome. There are very few Romans in town, the temperatures are high, and a lot of the better restaurants and shops are shut for the month. Having said that we still managed to have a great time, it's just that we would go back at another time of the year. This hotel is located by the Coliseum and is convenient for this amazing sight and the historic sights within the Forum area. There is also a metro stop at Coliseum that is convenient for getting around if needed. We felt that the hotel was not that convenient to some of the other sights, and specifically to the shops in the Spanish Steps area. There were a lot of hotels around this area that would have been more suitable for us. The hotel is very nice, modern and a refreshing change for Rome in its modern decor and ambience. The room we had was nice, although located on the same floor as the breakfast room meant that there was a fair bit of noise from 6am. Breakfast was in a nice room with a roof terrace. The food was a cold buffet with a hot option an optional extra, one point to note was that they had no idea what I was talking about when I asked for gluten free bread, despite being notified two months before. In general the reception staff were ok and pleasant but I did feel the lack of a clear concierge was an issue. With it being holiday time we enquired about restaurants that were potentially open - they gave me a list and told me to go and look at the individual restaurants to enquire if they are open, not exactly what I would expect as service. Whilst in Rome we saw all the usual sights which were great and it really was a wonderful city. We shopped like it was going out of fashion. We had diner at Imago, the rooftop restaurant at the Hassler Hotel - that was a great experience. Truly a beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. I think in all honesty we would not stay at this hotel again. The service was not what we expected and the location was just not ideal for us. Next time we would stay in Via Veneto/Spanish Steps area.

Reviews.Title: “loved capo”
Reviews.Author: pieConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a couple of days in Rome where we stayed at Capo. What a great find! The room was very spacious, modern and clean with all the amenities one would expect from a high end hotel. The staff was extremely friendly, warm and professional. The breakfasts were divine. The location is great. It's not in the main hub but very close to whatever's going on in town. It's 3 blocks from the Coloseum. There are some wonderful, little restaurants around the block. I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Ashflds
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at the Capo to celebrate my wife's birthday.Wonderful hotel with helpful and friendly staff.It's situated in a quiet side street with plenty of restaurants within walking distance.The roof top terrace is a quiet place to relax at the end of a busy day walking the streets of Rome.The Colosseum and metro station are 5 minutes walk linking you with all the major sites.The icing on the cake would have been a kettle in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: jmmidwest
Reviews.Content: What makes Capo d'Africa a must stay in Rome is the staff. Friendly, helpful, polite and willing to do whatever they can to make sure you are accomodated. The hotel has a cosmopolitan flair without going overboard. The two rooms we booked were finished with cherry wood trim and high ceilings that increased your feeling of space. Though not as large by American standards, they were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet served on the rooftop terrace was not great (though adequate)but after a couple of expresso's we were ready to go. This was our first stop on a 4 stop tour in Italy and my one big question is, What is up with ice? There are no ice stations in any of the hotels. If you want ice, you must ask for it. Though not required, you still feel obligated to one euro per delivery. Also for the ladies, the hair dryer is secured to the desk in the bedroom. ?? The work out room is adequate for a vacation workout and is also finished off with cherry wood trim giving it a really nice look. The location is great.
