Walking distance to most of the things you want to see and a train station stop that will get you to all others. There are restaurants right around the block from the hotel with good moderately priced food. ( only breakfast in the hotel). For a family vacation, business trip or a sightseeing honeymoon, you won't be dissapointed with Capo d' Africa

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: caztelfordUK
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel that deserves the great reviews that it gets. Everything that we want to say has already been said - friendly staff , great location, spacious , clean and comfortable room , lovely breakfast on beautiful roof terrace ... Our only criticism is an insignificant one - the combined shower / bath had no light , making it a little dark in there ! Apart from that a perfect stay . We hope that we are lucky enough to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lived up to fantastic expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-o-phobe
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to all the complimentary comments previously posted. It was modern, unstuffy, staffed by really polite, helpful people. Rooms were large (by European standards), cold air conditioning, typical selection of bath and shampoo stuff (so you don't have to bother with your see-through plastic bag at the airport!), slippers! King size, firm but really comfy bed. Quiet at night. Off the beaten track but as someone else says, Rome is for walking so the walk back to your hotel is not onerous. Mixture of English speaking nationalities at the hotel, and all staff spoke English. Internet access in the basement lobby. Continental breakfast, as much coffee as you can take. A really, really pleasant stay, we would recommend this hotel to anyone, clean, efficient, fantastic! And if you crane your neck, you might just see the Colosseum (sp?) from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome at Capo D'africa”
Reviews.Author: JamesTruro_Cornwall
Reviews.Content: After reading glowing reports for this hotel we were prepared to be disappointed but we weren't. Capo D'africa is a lovely place to stay for several reasons. First there's the location; just ten minutes' walk to the Coliseum and just over an hour to the Vatican. If you don't want to walk, taxis can be booked in reception or you can get bus or tube connections at the Coliseum. Next there's the huge range of restaurants - all within easy walking distance - providing good food at very reasonable prices and of much better quality than those in the popular tourist sites. We tried some of the ones recommended by other travellers and found them all very good. Finally there's the hotel itself. We had a view to the back and found it a comfortable haven of peace. The rooms are air conditioned, well furnished and the king size beds firm but comfortable. Throughout our stay the staff went out of their way to be helpful and the morning breakfast buffet on the rooftop terrace was fantastic. Very attentive service here too. A few tips. Drinks and food in the hotel were on the expensive side (for us at least) but there are good supermarkets close by selling a wide range of Italian snacks and wine. Watch out for badly maintained areas of pavement around Rome and especially near the Coliseum. Health and safety doesn't seem to figure very highly in Italy and some of the cobbled areas are lethal. However, walk if you can as there's so many interesting places to discover which you won't find if you are in a car or bus. If you've not been to Rome before, take an organised bus tour on the first day; this helps to get your bearings and provide ideas for places to visit. The red bus company seemed to be the best. Don't bother with bottled water. Take water flasks and fill up at one of the many drinking fountains you can find in the streets. The stuff out the tap is fine too unless it specifically states it's not for drinking. Toilets! Why are there no toilets seats in most Italian loos and why are they sometimes so basic? Take lots of tissues and wipes if this sort of thing bothers you. Finally, if you enjoy churches, make a point of visiting the one just opposite the hotel. It looks slightly ramshackle on the outside but inside it's incredible especially the beautiful cloistered garden area and the mosaics. Have a wonderful time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltimenc
Reviews.Content: We based our stay on reviews here. Our family of 4 loved the connecting rooms which were gorgeous. The rooftop was beautiful and the staff was perfect. We worried that the location would be too "out of the way" and that maybe we should stay near the Spanish Steps--but that fear was totally unfounded. It turns out the the nearby "Monte" neighborhood is the new happening spot. The Capo D'africa neighborhood was perfect, quiet and very nice residential. There are great restaurants, Il Bocconcino was fantastic. Taverna Romana, wonderful also. Not fancy places, but really good bistro's. Rome is definitely a walking city so if you aren't a walker, stay somewhere else but we loved our strolls, even with the heat. Don't miss the gelato right around the corner. Our favorite in Rome. We'll be back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Floridaonvacation
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Capo D' Africa for four nights. It was one of the most pleasant hotels we've ever stayed in. The staff was friendly and helpful and always aiming to please. When we first arrived, we were placed in a room which smelled of smoke. Since neither my wife nor I smoke, we asked to change our room...No Problem. The front desk showed us three available hotel rooms on the first floor and asked us to pick which room we preferred. No kidding. They aimed to make us entirely satisfied. The hotel breakfast, which was included in the price of the room, was terrific. The waiters were always polite, helpful and always greeted us with a bright "Buon Giorno!" The food was delicious and plentiful. In my personal opinion, you WILL be HAPPY at this hotel. We would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Experience”
Reviews.Content: At first, I was a little worried that too many guests had drunk the kool aide, so to speak, and that there was no way Capo could measure up to expectations. But it did. We had a corner room on the ground floor and loved it. Our room was large, comfortable, quiet, clean and well maintained. The only noise we heard were voices coming from the lobby briefly one night, but we solved that problem easily by closing the door in our external hallway. And then everything was perfect. The breakfast was way above average for continental. A variety of fresh fruits, cheeses, breads, juices, cerials, not to mention a nice terrace or breakfast room to watch the sunrise and take in the start of your day. And the American style coffee was among the best I had in Rome. The gym downstairs was clean and moderately well equipped. A stair master, a few free weights and about three weight machines. I had three good workouts while I was there. The neighborhood was also a welcome retreat from the madness of the Spanish Steps, Campo di Fiore, etc. etc. The local restaurants were good and not expensive. Great outdoor pizza place around the corner. I highly recommend leaving the neighborhood for at least one dinner however. Uno e Bino in San Lorenzo, an 8 minute cab ride or 30 minute walk has fantastic food, a great wine list, moderate prices (15 - 20 Euro per course). One of the best restaurants in Rome. Also, Roscioli. Fantastic antipasto, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, very good entrees. Really good service. Trattoria di Monti was good, but overrated. We went because the NY Times food critic plugged it. A big disappointment. Save your money. And your time. But do have gellato at San Crispino. It will take you to heaven. Especially on a hot summer afternoon. And don't leave Rome without visiting the Borghese. The most important museum in Rome. And do rent the audio guide. You'll miss most of the experience if you don't. The service at Capo was good to excellent. The only mix up was with the car at the airport. The driver was misinformed about our arrival time. It could have been my mistake however. Who knows? And it was not really a problem. We had a cafe in the airport while we waited. Overall, I had an excellent time at Capo d'Africa and highly recommend it. We paid 230 euros per night and would have been happy to pay more for what we got. Crazy. But true. But don't tell the owner. Please.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ccsmyth
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosed a better hotel!!! Great location! Everything was excellent!!! ( Being from Texas we were concerned about the air conditioning....Room was cold!! ) Would definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Capo d'Africa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: armada69
Reviews.Content: The best hotel situated near the Colosseum, the only down side is that it does not have an evening resturant, but with so much to chose from you will not go hungary! Try to stay away from eating at the resturants over looking the Colosseum as these charge top prices and the food is not always the best! also it is recommended that you get up early if you want to view the Colosseum you beat the crowds and have it to yourself before the coaches arrive. Although the hotel is away from the Spanish Steps, Trivi Fourtain areas, a taxi is not too expensive and walking will take approx 1/2 hour depending on how hot is it!. Another plus for staying in this hotel is that the area is a little Bohemian so resturants are cheaper, A whole Lobster around the Spanish Steps area will set you back Approx €65 the one I had near the hotel cost €35, and it was fresh. What to wear? well I was scared off by reports that in Rome people dressed up and this is true to a point around the posher areas, the Colosseum area, jeans and t-shirts were fine, so too were shorts, just wear what you feel comfortable in esp during the day. The hotel itself was great! the rooms although small were clean and there was little noise in the evening. It was lovely to sit on the roof terrace enjoying a drink or to (although a tip is to buy a bottle of wine at the small wine shop just down from the hotel on the corner and bring it back!) much cheaper! breakfast was good, you can see the Colosseum from the hotel only if you breakfast on the small terrace on the left of the hotel roof, unfortunately this is not open in the evening. I cannot really fault this hotel, except to say I wish it had a swimming pool !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel d'c*apo”
Reviews.Author: Lynne_Ilkley
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 twin rooms 4 months in advance of a trip to this hotel. Upon arrival at the hotel we were somewhat horrified to be told that 2 of us were going to have to share a double bed. We were 4 middle-aged women on a weekend away and the last thing we wanted was to share a bed. After some heated discussions the hotel put another bed in the already crammed room. This hotel isn’t cheap so to have to sleep on a put you up was totally unacceptable. Added to this the staff are rude and the overall atmosphere in the hotel is cold and unfriendly. To top it all, we were taken to the airport by a hotel driver who had little regard for his own life let alone ours. Even given Italian standards it was reckless. I booked this hotel after reading reviews in travel guides but this is the last time I will be trusting the info in one of those!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tree101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there as part of our honeymoon trip for six nights. Would of rather just been there for three or four as that's really all you need. Hotel is in good shape, area is nice and they keep it clean (though room carpets are dirty). Be prepared rooms are small and bathrooms are smaller. Breakfast area is really nice however, alot of the food just taste "funny". Since when are hardboiled egg yolks orange? Staff was good overall although we got some attitude once in a while. Wi-Fi was an extra charge though you where able to pick it up for free once in a while. A taxi cost about 40 euros to the airport and about 12 to just about anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: ColinAndLesley
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Capo D'Africa and we can not recommend this hotel enough. The staff were wonderful and the service was amazing. The reviews on this site are spot on. It is really fantastically located for the colleseum and the old parts of Rome, with the rest a simple taxi journey or bus ride away. The local restaurants and pizzerias are also excellent and would recommend "La Riona" and "Il Pasquali" especially. Overall had a fantastic few days and will certainly be returning if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Capo d'Africa”
Reviews.Author: Oakhilltravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two children (ages 9 and 12) stayed at the Capo d'Africa from June 26 to July 2nd. We had two rooms and had a great stay. As other reviews indicated the hotel is a boutique, contemporary hotel in a neighborhood very close to the Colosseum. The staff was very helpful and pleasant, the rooms were clean, comfortable and relatively large for European standards and the promixity to the sites was excellent. The continental breakfast on the rooftop restaurant was good, but not extensive. We walked almost everywhere from the htoel and when we didn't walk we took the subway located about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel near the Colosseum. We also took taxis occassionaly. One recommendation is that you purchase water or soda at one of the small markets located around the block from the hotel. The prices at the markets tended to be half of what we found at the more tourist oriented spots.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Saintrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights nights. On 1st night I was given a room next to the lift on the first floor, on 2nd night they moved me to 3rd floor which was even more noisy as it had the breakfest room above me, but I stuck it out. On the 3rd night the air conditioning was very noisy on the whole of the 3rd floor, they offerd to move me to othe side of 3rd floor but it was more noisy. The hotel and the rooms were very clean, the staff were helpful, the street of the hotel was a quite one for Rome. Keep an eye on your room bill, I got charged for taking peanuts from the mini bar and I can't even eat peanuts! I got charged for taking water, when I had my own water. I had room service breakfest every morning and the one they charged me more for the same breakfest! The room mini bar is ridiculously is over priced... so no treats there... it's not twice the price, it's not 3 times the price, but 4 times the price! No one who values money money would touch it. This hotel seems more for Americans than English.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: marco_mazzei
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice, but I really expect something more from a 300 and plus euro daily rate accomodation. First of all, this is not a true design-hotel; is a design-hotel if you look at it from the street, and in the hall, but rooms are still far away from being design rooms. The rooms are big and clean, but not design. The bathroom is clean, but very little. The breakfast on the roof is ok, and - yes - you can see the Colosseo, but with the taste in building terrace that you can find in Rome, this breakfast area could be better. Anyway, the real problems refer to the Interner connection; in the room (#205) the wi-fi connection was very difficult (I must admit, it works fine from the bathroom). Leaving the hotel, I asked the coincierge if I can print a document from the Internet, a one-minute job. The answer? "Well, there is an Internet point walking distance from the hotel". An Internet point? I've just paid 600+ euros for 2 days and you send me to an Internet point? Bye bye Capo d'Africa

Reviews.Title: “It is as good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneRichard
Reviews.Content: Stayed at theCapo in early June. The reviews on TA are all correct. The staff were first rate. We had two adjacent rooms which were big enough for two adults and three children. The breakfast was great. Get there early enough to be able to sit outside and see the Collosseum. We were a little worried from previous reviews that we would be along way from some of the sites but we managed to walk everywhere (except theVatican were we took an organised tour). The local restaurants were just right for our family. The Capo's greatest asset are the staff (front desk, breakfast, cleaning) all of whom could not do enough to make our stay superb. Already miss being there!

Reviews.Title: “A great Roman break”
Reviews.Author: edgbaston
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great weekend break in Rome staying at the Hotel Capo d'Africa, this was our first visit to the hotel but all the reviews were spot on and it was exactly as we expected A warm welcome from the reception team, we arrived mid morning but no problem in allocating a room immediately, a quiet double overlooking an inner courtyard. Facilities in the room were excellent with quality products and first class housekeeping standards with an evening turn down service A very minor point but with only CNN and Sky News a couple of free to view English language channels would be welcome Everyone has mentioned the roof top terrace for breakfast and if the weather allows please take the opportunity to sit outside and enjoy the experience of gazing over the Roman roof tops. The breakfast team are friendly and are genuinely pleased to see you, there is an excellent breakfast buffet on display We followed other reviewers suggestions for great local restaurants on a couple of nights but beware of mediocre pizzerias near to the Colosseum We walked everywhere and used Angel Tours for an evening walking tour starting from the Spanish Steps at 6pm on Thursday and the Vatican on Friday. If anyone tells you there will be no queues don't believe them - we queued in the sun to pass security and then a long queue for the tickets - 40,000 visitors a day apparently to the Vatican museums. Angel Tours were excellent, friendly and very informative - they have a web site for info There is too much to see and absorb in a short break so do the main attractions if time and enjoy planning your next visit to Rome If you are using Fiumicino Airport be aware that the departure screens are too small and do not scroll round to show all flights leaving in the next 2 - 3 hours so we had to wait 15 minutes for our flight to appear to find our check in desk The security queues in terminal C (international) are horrendous with only 4 x-ray machines - the airport also changes departure gates at the last minute without warning so watch the screens closely Overall a fantastic introduction to Rome and we look forward to returning to the Capo D'Afica very soon

Reviews.Title: “Running around Rome”
Reviews.Author: IVernazza
Reviews.Content: I met my cousin and her husband at Capo d’Africa for a visit to Rome from May 14-18th. Their room was on the 2nd floor (that’s the first for us Americans) and mine was up one more. Capo d’Africa is a very nice hotel. It is located a few blocks east of the coliseum in a quiet area. My room was on the back side of the hotel while my cousin was on the street side. The location is quiet; no tour buses, tourists, restaurants or bars in the immediate area. When I entered my room, I entered a small “foyer” that had a built in closet facing me, the bathroom to the right and the sleeping area to the left. The sleeping area consisted of a firm bed (I think all beds in Italy are firm), a TV console, desk and a sitting chair. I had enough room to easily walk around. The bathroom was a nice side with a shower. Both the bathroom and bedroom had a good size window (no views). The hotel provides terry cloth robes and slippers. Breakfast was good for Italy and was in the upper breakfast room. There is inside seating along with seating on two outdoor terraces with umbrellas. One terrace has a view of an old church while the other has a view of the coliseum. Breakfast was bread, Danish, cold cuts, yogurt, fresh and canned fruit and cereal. They also serve a variety of coffees, juices and water. The hotel has no restaurant but there are good restaurants in the area but the ones along the coliseum are not the best. We ate at three different places and were very happy with our choices. The closest bus and metro station is the coliseum stop on the west side (and across the street) of the coliseum and would take about 10 minutes to walk to. There is a metro stop under construction but will probably be available in 2008. The staff was great. Very helpful with bus schedules and anything we needed and we bugged them a lot! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: ABSH4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Capo d'Africa hotel for one night during a visit to Rome. We were located in a ground floor room beside the lift. This meant that there it was extremely noisy in the early and later in the evening with other guests coming and going in the corridor outside our door. Also a considerable amount of door slamming along the corridor. The room itself was lovey (no view) but comfortable and nicely furnished, and good bathroom. If we had been staying longer then I would have insisted on being moved to a quieter room on a higher floor. I got the impression that we were given that room as we were only staying one night and I imagine it must be their least popular area of the hotel. The hotel is located in a good, safe area with a nice selection of local restaurants. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was 1st class and staff, very friendly and helpful. The receptionist arranged for a limousine to take us to the airport ,and the public areas of the hotel were lovely and well kept. I would return to this hotel for longer only if I was given a queter room next time, and I would recommend it to others (but do ask for a room on the upper floors).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KentChris
Reviews.Content: There are so many good points about this hotel: the location is very convenient, close to the Colosseum and Metro yet at the end of a fairly quiet street. The staff were professional and seemed genuinely friendly. Breakfast is served in a delightful roof-top room or on an adjoining terrace overlooking the city. There is a good range of breads, cereal, meats, chesses, fruit etc. Our room was comfortable and stylishly furnished, of a fair size, kept very clean and effectively air-conditioned. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. (One note: those who find it difficult to climb steps should check first that there is suitable access to the hotel other than through the main entrance, as there are a number of steps to climb).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not great”
Reviews.Author: TexasLonghorn6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Capo d'Africa in April for 4 days. It's a great location for the Coliseum and Forum, less so for the other Roman sites. There is a subway stop several blocks away. The hotel room itself was clean, not particularly spacious though. The staff was friendly and spoke English. The photos and reviews lead you to believe you have a great view of the Coliseum....you don't. From one area on the balcony, you can crane your neck over to see it. Unfortunately, there aren't alot of restaurant choices in the area so your either taking an expensive cab or taking a long walk for your meals.

Reviews.Title: “It is as good as people say!!”
Reviews.Author: UKtog
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre cruise for 2 nights in May and 1 night post cruise in June. The hotel really is excellent. When we arrived we were shown to a lovely quite room, extremely well appointed and spotless. The bellman made sure we understood how everything in the room worked. We enjoyed a lovely drink up on the terrace and although not cheap, the surrooundings and piped music soothed away the stresses of the flight. First night the hotel booked us into Il Bonbodino (sp?) and the second Isodoro, bioth excellent tratorias in adjacent blocks frequented by locals - always a good sign. We loved being able to eat away from the crowds and at a very reasonable price for good pasta. Both places had really good house wine (Vino del Cassa) at around 8 euros a litre. We had two very good nights sleep - comfy beds, spotless bathroom and so well set up and we enjoyed the friendly breakfast service overlooking the view of the Colloseum. We returned on 1 June to be told that our room was already available (it was 10am we had come straight from the cruise). Another lovely room and that night we ate at La Neumache which we had saved for our last night - what a treat mmmm. (The panna cotta is a dream). On our departure day we had problems as the whole area was closed off by a parade and we could not get to the Metro to sightsee or even walk beyond the end of the street - it would have been better if the hotel had warned us the night before as they seem to have known. However, that annoyance was offset by the fact they were so helpful sorting out our on line check in and also we changed our plans and were able to sneak in a lunch at La Neumachie a bonus. It is a walk to places, I certainly would not use anything other than a taxi to arrive/depart with luggage. On the other days we walked - Vatican was about 45 mins Colloseum 5 mins, Forum 10 mins etc. Each day we walked to where we were going but at the end of the day used taxis to get home, 8 Euro from the Spanish Steps and 12 from the Vatican (and we were held up in a delay on that trip) Its a great clean hotel and i am glad it did not have an evening restaurant and it meant we were introduced to these great local eathing places One final thing we have never seen before, as the key system activates the in room power, it also shows the room is occupied so household staff do not knock - and there is no risk of forgetting to put out the do not disturb sign

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel and a great choice”
Reviews.Author: westones
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Capo d' Africa just prior to the US Memorial Day holiday. Overall I was impressed with the hotel - the staff were very helpful and friendly (and most spoke some English), the room (De Luxe Double Room) was very spacious (for a European hotel), clean, and had a very nice interior, and the breakfast was exactly what I was looking for. The only negative (and I'm digging here) is that the carpet was a bit worn. This did not diminish the stay in the least. The Capo d' Africa is located near the Colosseum and the Colosseum metro stop (very handy) is within walking distance. Please be aware that the A line closes at 9pm, so if you're near the Spanish steps or the Vatican, you'll need to take a bus/taxi to the hotel (~10-15 euro). It may not be centrally located (i.e. Spanish steps) but its easily accessible and in a very quiet neighborhood. There are several great Osterias and Tratorias in the neighborhood (Le Naumachie is a personal favorite), important if you're wiped out after a long day of walking and seeing the sights. Should I return to Roma in the future, I'll definitely keep the Capo d' Africa in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKYtrip
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay here to visit the Colesseum and Roman Forum. The location is great because it's in walking distance to these attractions. I didn't rate it as excellent because I'm not sure I'd book a longer stay than a couple days since it is in the older part of Rome and the area is not as nice as the other areas such as Via Veneto & Piazza Barberini. It's not as convenient to other attractions. The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and roomy throughout (larger than most of hotels that I stayed at). The best part of my stay was the continental breakfast that was included in my stay, it was well worth it; fresh fruit, pastries, gourmet cappucino and espresso on the roof terrace with a view. Great hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, maybe overrated?”
Reviews.Author: MarkG604
Reviews.Content: I just returned from four nights at the Capo in late May and have a few comments about the hotel and Rome in general. First, the hotel is very nice, quite modern and chic, and resides in a quiet neighborhood not too far from the Colosseum. It is, however, quite expensive (285 euros per night) and although it is close to the roman ruins it is a fair distance away from other sites. I am not sure I would choose this hotel again if I was returning to Rome (and since I threw some coins into Trevi Fountain, I will return one day!). Regarding location, the hotel is not quite as close to the Colosseo metro station as some reviewers have stated. It is closer to 1000 meters than 200 meters and is a good ten minute walk. Turn left as you exit the metro station and walk along the sidewalk to the top of the hill. Cross the street twice to get to the opposite side, then walk up three or four blocks to Via Capo D'Africa. The hotel is at the end of this street about four blocks along. This is fairly manageable with suitcases although as mentioned the metro is very busy. If you arrive by train into Termini it is easy to find the metro and is only two stops to Colosseo. The airport though is a long way out, about 40 minutes from the hotel and a 50 euro fare by taxi. The rooms are modern and comfortable although they are a bit small (as is normal for Europe). No patio or view. The top floor has a nice breakfast area and the food was fine although much the same as in other italian hotels. There is a small bar area at the front door, but no restaurant. The neighborhood does have several restaurants nearby so that is not a problem. The hotel is perfect for touring the old ruins. I would suggest that you walk past the ruins until you get to the large white old Senate Building on the left. Walk around it then go up the stairs to the main plaza. This is the entrance to the Musee Capitolina, an excellent place to start and a good museum. It also has a great view of the ruins below. After seeing the museum you can work your way back to the hotel by walking through the ruins and then going to the Colosseum. As others have mentioned, you can buy a combo ticket for Palatine Hill (located about halfway through the ruins on the hillside) and the Colosseum at Palatine and save yourself a long line at the Colosseum. Even better, buy a Roma-Pass at Palatine for 20 euros. This will get you in free to Palatine/Colosseo plus one other museum such as the Gallery Borghese, plus give you three days of free metro. And best of all, you can use your pass to go straight into the Colosseo without waiting in line at all. See [--] for more info. However, once you've conquered the ruins, the Capo is a fair distance away from other attractions, such as the Vatican and the Pantheon, Villa Borghese, etc. The metro system in Rome is not that great (and is very busy) and many attractions are a long way away from the nearest metro station. The pantheon for instance is a good 20 minute walk to the nearest station. Next time I am in Rome I might prefer to stay somewhere a little closer to the downtown area, maybe around the Spanish Steps, which is a very lively area. Be careful to check when the metro stations close. We had dinner downtown on Friday night and found two metro stations were closed at 9:30. Not sure if that is normal but we had to take a taxi back to the hotel. The Vatican and Basilica are fairly accessable by metro although again it is a decent walk from the station. If you want to beat the crowds, go to the basilica early. It opens at 7, the dome opens at 8, and the tombs open at 9. We got there just after 8 and walked right in and saw everything in 90 minutes or so, and were out before the crowds and tour buses started to arrive. As for the Vatican Museum, the lineup must have been a mile long at 10am. Unbelievable. I had booked a two hour Vatican tour though at 10:30 (through Select Italy) and so we basically walked in and beat the lines. Very worthwhile, although when we got out there wasn't much of a line left. So maybe going later in the day is a good idea too. If you stay here, make sure you see the Basilica de San Clemente, which is just around the corner from the hotel. Go into the gift shop and then down the stairs into the archeological area where the ruins of a 4th century church and 1st century temple are. Very interesting and we almost missed it. Also worthwhile and a bit more of a walk is the Santa Maria Maggiore church. By the way, the hotel map given on arrival is not very good. Rome is a very hard city to find your way around and we got lost many times. It was maddening trying to find some attractions. Try to get yourself a decent map. Dining-wise, there are a few choices nearby. As mentioned by other reviewers, Le Naumachie is fairly good and reasonably priced. Walk out the hotel and turn right, then right on the first street, and it is just a block or so down on the left. I really enjoyed Papagio, which is on Via Capo D'Africa and about three blocks from the hotel (and right beside an irish pub). Papagio is quite a bit classier than the pizzerias in the area and we had a very nice meal here. White tablecloths, soft music, nice art on the wall, and good food with some nice seafood dishes (we had turbot and sea bass, both excellent). A bit pricier with entrees in the 22-30 euro range. Another reviewer mentioned Luzzi, which was very rustic looking but actually did have decent food. More of a pizzeria though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DougMT
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel ideal for a short break in Rome. Very friendly helpful staff, very convenient for the old part of the city. Room was really clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous in every way possible- gorgeous hotel, friendly staff... Go!”
Reviews.Author: thepeacha
Reviews.Content: Booked this gracious hotel for a post- cruise night and what a treat it was to stay here. Found it on this site and thanks to all who wrote before me- they were right, it is a lovely place. We checked in early, and were most courteously treated by every staff memeber. The room was of a nice size- we'd just taken a transatlantic crossing so we apreciated the space. The bath was great, the bed was comfortable, and the internet access was a breeze. We were a two minute stroll to the Colosseum and its handy metro stop, providing you did not get lured by some tempting morsel of food along the way, alas. Breakfast was nice, and you could certainly see the landmark of Rome as you sipped your coffee. The pictures show the truth here, but cannot come close to letting you know who very wonderful the staff was. Management must be applauded, you can see that a well- treated staff is in operation here, and we give them full marks, from bellman Massimo to every kind soul at the front desk, and everyone in between. The hotel has a nice modern feel, while still remaining very Italian. We did not need plaster columns and cherubic angels to know we were in Italy, and we appreciated the design touches everywhere. We like the grand dames and we like the modern styles too, so we do well most everyhwere as long as it feels inviting. The decor was great, very refreshing. Quick tip- if you do the Hop On/ Off bus, do yourself a favor and only book the red bus. We grabbed the green bus and were disappointed- stops were very hard to find, and it ran over an hour late one day at our stop, no explanation or apology. Four red busses passes us as we waited for our green bus. The hostsess aboard the bus practically tried to talk us out of it and now I know why, so learn from my mistake and please choose the red! My husband loved the hotel dearly, and he is the pickiest- to get praise from him is noteworthy. I loved the location, it was quiet at night so we slept very well, and then a short metro or cab ride to the next site. He thinks in retrospect that he prefers the area near Pantheon but I expect it might be noisier. It was nice to come home late by light of the wonderfully lit Colossuem, and I bet we stay there again next time we are in the eternal city. Many thanks to the wonderful Capo d' Africa, we enjoyed you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sea_Bass_21
Reviews.Content: We chose Capo after exhaustively searching for the best hotel to start our honeymoon at. We could not have picked a better hotel. The staff are all friendly and extremely helpful. Rooms are spotless and good sized by European standards. Rome is a crazy place but our hotel was a quiet oasis with a wonderful breakfast complete with a view of the Colleseum on the patio. We enjoyed having a night cap at the bar and the bartender was always fun to chat with. It is 5 minutes walk to the Colleseum/Forum and the neighborhood is quiet but also has many good restaurants and bars nearby. The pizza place around the corner was excellent and we were the only tourists there. We also arranged a car to pick us up from the airport through the hotel and that all went perfectly smooth as well. Rome is not cheap, but this hotel was worth every penny for the piece of mind we had knowing what a great hotel we picked. I have stayed in Rome many times at various hotels and this one was leaps and bounds above the others. I cannot think of any reason not to stay here and plan on staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ﻿Capo d’Africa”
Reviews.Author: kb
Reviews.Content: ﻿First the bad news. High season (May-October) 2007 room rates were E400 or $570 a night for deluxe rooms. Even with advanced booking Expedia discount, our rate was $435. Standard rooms are less, but standard rooms are smaller. Our Deluxe room was quite large, even by American standards. ﻿Forgetting the price, we have never stayed in a better hotel. The decor is a bit odd, sort of an austere designer modern, but Capo d’Africa was one of the quietest hotels we have ever stayed in. ﻿Four sets of curtains over the windows darkened the room very well for sleeping. The room was so dark at night that the designer thoughtfully provided two night lights, one in the vestibule and one by the bathroom light switch, so we could see our way around if we got up in the night. For the final touch, the night lights had two brightness settings. There was some fluxuation in water temperature in the shower, but not as bad as is often found. The kleenex box provided very skimpy tissues, hardly enough for a good blow, and the box was not replaced after we emptied it at the end of day one of three days. Turning on the TV was an adventure. ﻿The A/C did an excellent job of maintaining a constant temperature, something not often found in hotels. The beds used the preferred triple sheet system, with an obvious tear in one top sheet one day, but it was changed the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: clickums
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights and three days at Capo d'Africa Hotel. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. We originally only had one night booked, but decided to stay an extra night. The staff speak perfect English. Even the cleaning woman spoke English. The hotel is a good three block walk from the Colosseum and other sights. The location of the hotel is on a very narrow one-way side street, which was difficult for our cab driver to find. However, once you get there, you'll enjoy the location for it's easy access to restaurants, shops, and sights. For good food, visit Le Naumachie on the corner. GREAT PASTA and wine! The rooms are spacious with a large bathroom. Both rooms were very clean. It's a bit pricey, but well worth the money. The only let down was the roof top restaurant was not yet open. The should have it open in 4 to 6 months.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean hotel a couple of blocks from the Colesseo. The front desk staff were generally polite and helpful, and the breakfast was the best we had in Italy. While the room was somewhat small it was very clean. If you want to stay by old Rome this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed with the Capo”
Reviews.Author: emmapeel
Reviews.Content: Chose the Capo after exhaustive research on TA and in Rome guide books where the hotel is well recommended. Wasn't disappointed at all and it was a special trip for my 50th birthday. As many other reviewers report, excellent reception and housekeeping, room very comfortable - including the beds. The style of mattress - tempur- shapes itself to you so whilst it feels a little firm when you plonk yourself down on it, we slept wonderfully well. Some reviewers had complained of the rooms being warm or no air conditioning on, the air con was on in April so I didn't need to use the electric fan that I had packed. Stayed for 4 nights 22-26 April, enjoyed breakfasts outside on the terrace, in the sun, with the Coliseum behind us. Perfect! Waiting staff charming and very helpful. Pick the blood orange fruit juice, it was delicious and proper juice, unlike the other offerings in the juice dept. We found the choices fine and to our taste. You can also sit up on the terrace in the evening, we very much enjoyed a bottle of Prosecco up there our first night, taking in the scene. We enjoyed meals at Papagio and - annoyingly - one I can't remember the name of which was just a block immediately down from the hotel, on the right - smart looking with tables outside and crisp white cloths - we ate a lovely lunch there on the last day. We also tried La Naumaucherie , food fine, maybe not so much atmosphere there I thought, but could have been because I was sat facing a wall, at the back of the restaurant (it was a busy night!) We did the hop on hop off 110 buswhich you can catch from the Coliseum. You can buy 2 day tickets as you board. For the last 2 days we took taxis or walked. Taxis are easy to find, they are located before you cross the road to the Coliseum and are then found at ranks by most of the major sights. All trips were 7 to 10eu and well worth it. If you have booked the Capo, relax, you wil not be disappointed. When you see the crowds at the Spanish Steps you will be pleased you are staying in an oasis of calm. Finally, we had a car from Rome cabs (romecabs.com) for our journey from the airport, very reliable cost 45e for single trip to Fiumicino. Friends who travelled separately to Ciampino airport got a cab at the airport (price regulated nowadays), and got the hotel to call a cab for the return journey, all very easy. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CAGRAY
Reviews.Content: Capo D' Africa is a small, boutique type hotel, just blocks away from the Coloseum. There are 60 plus rooms and it was constructed 5 years ago, using the site of a former high school. It used to be a 19th Century Monastery, and during the construction of the hotel, they had to preserve the marble stair cases both in and out. In fact, all of the hotel has mable floors. I am giving the hotel an excellent rating, even though we had a problem, that had it not been resolved, might have made this rating lower. My husband and I always book two rooms with a connecting door inbetween. This request was granted IN WRITING so I didn't bother calling prior to check-in. Imagine our surprise when we were told there were none available and that even our rooms would not be adjoining (that was changed later the first day). We thought about trying to find another hotel, but it was Labor Day weekend and were told it would likely be impossible. The next day, thanks to the Assistant Housekeeper, I was moved to a room next to my husband's, which could be closed off to the main hallway with a locking door. We left our room doors open and it was even better than having a connecting door. The beds are firm but I had no problem sleeping. The bathroom had both toilet and bidet. The shower was in a tub and had the annoying habit of scalding or freezing you just as you felt you were safe! Also, I think for a 4 star hotel they should offer more than shampoo and liquid shower soap. Every morning we went up to the Terrace to have Continental Breakfast. I love Cappuccino's and would have two. The rest of the breakfast was pretty ordinary, but satisfying. If you wanted a hot breakfast i;e bacon, eggs etc. you could order room service, but there was a charge. Before dinner, we would sit at the bar near the reception desk before we went out to eat. Or you could go up to the Terrace and have drinks. The Terrace had a small menu for both lunch and dinner, but there were many great restaurants to eat at within a short walking distance. Ask the front desk and they will make reservations for you at any of them. We were in Rome this time for 4 days following a cruise. In 2003, before a cruise, we found the most wonderful private tour guides, Max and Fabio Leotta, who own Leotta Limousine Service. Max picked us up at the cruise ship dock in a Mercedes van as we had lots of luggage. The following day he drove us on a tour into the countryside in a Mercedes sedan. They both have studied Roman history and are well versed in all Rome has to offer. Contact them at: maxleotta@tiscali.it The employees at the hotel were so friendly and nice that it was hard to say good-bye. If we are ever in Rome again, we will be sure to stay at Capo D' Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service!”
Reviews.Author: texascatcher
Reviews.Content: It’s taken to long for me to write this review. We stayed at the Capo D'Africa Hotel in February 2005. The staff, rooms and breakfast was superb to say the least. I will say that this hotel is not close to central Rome; however it's very close to the Coliseum and some very nice local restaurants. The rooms were very large (American size) and the bathroom was very modern. The best part about our room was that all the windows opened (including the bathroom window). If you looking to be impressed with a hotel and can overlook the walk to central Rome book this one!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, quality position”
Reviews.Author: AAA Trip Advisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 5 night stay at this excellent hotel. I booked it purely because of the reviews I read on this site. The hotel is superbly positioned less than 5 minutes from the Colosseum. If reasonably fit you can walk to all the major sites in the City. It took us about 45 minutes to get to the Vatican. We had a deluxe room which was very pleasant. The bathroom was quite small but more than adequate. Breakfast was served on the 4th floor where you could eat inside or out. As we had wonderful weather we sat outside each day and I must say it was a delight. Sitting looking at the Colosseum takes some beating. We found the staff extremely helpful without being the slightest bit intrusive which is exactly how we like things. It's not the cheapest hotel but we felt it was worth every penny. The hotel is happy to book restaurants either in the vicinity, and there are quite a few, or further into the city. One restaurant to give particular mention to was Papagio's which is about 100 yards along the street from the hotel. This was a real gem. It is a fish restaurant of the highest quality. The prices were very reasonable and I just wish they'd open up local to us. Couple of tips. We arrived late in the evening and were accosted straight out of arrivals by people telling us they'd get us a taxi to our hotel at rock bottom prices. That rock bottom price was €80. Having read comments on this site about this I declined went outside and got a taxi for the stipulated €40. Make sure you hire the audio equipment in the Colosseum. We did this instead of getting a guide and I think this was the best way to do it. With the Vatican we did the opposite. We went on an organised tour and had a guide. We used Presto tours and found it well worth the money. All in all an excellent hotel and a terrific city.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Una1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Capo hotel based on it's Trip Advisor reviews and we were delighted with the hotel. It was our first trip to Rome and as we were celebrating a special anniversary we were prepared to spend more than we'd normally budget for our accommodation - we weren't dissapointed: It was bright and modern and we felt the location was ideal - on a quiet street just 5 minutes walk from the Colleseum. Our room was spacious, and immaculately clean with large comfortable bed and there were nice touches like the Robes and slippers. After a hectic day discovering the sites of Rome, it was a pleasure to return to the relative calm of the hotel. To add to this the staff were super, particularly at Reception - they cheerfully advised on restaurants, travel arrangements etc. and the fact that they all had good english was a huge bonus as we hadn't had much time to brush up on our Italian! If we return to Rome, we'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A safe choice”
Reviews.Author: Blackcherry
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel in a peaceful location - it is in a quieter neighborhood of Rome which is welcome after experiencing the capital during the day! Our room was perfectly spacious and had plenty of wardrobe space. The bed was a little umcomfortable but not too bad, and in general I can't find anything to criticise. The staff were very helpful and pleasant, and spoke very good English. Breakfast is served between 6.30 and 11.30 on the fourth floor and had the usual continental options ie croissants/cakes, cheeses, meats, jams and marmalades, fruit juices and cereals. You can order hot breakfasts to your room (incurring a charge of course), but you don't get the option of having them in the breakfast room! There is a gym in the basement which was always supplied with fresh towels, and there are also two (handy) toilet rooms so you aren't caught short.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: crabbag
Reviews.Content: A nice, well-designed hotel. For a superior room, though, the accommodation was on the small side. Generally helpful staff with a good breakfast - although limited choice. The room was very warm - with no air conditioning available until May. The unhelpful conceirge told us to open a window instead - we did, and couldn't sleep for the noise thoroughout the night. We know that guests in other rooms had the same problem. Minibar prices simply unreal at €4 for a small bottle of water. Small points, admittedly - and reservations which didn't spoil an otherwise very pleasant stay at a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bobby81
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on several hotels on tripadvisor, we decided on Capo d'Africa for our trip to Rome and certainly weren't disappointed. It's a lovely, modern hotel in a great location. The staff were really friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone taking a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding. Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: apaula
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - new, clean, nice location (only 10 min walk to Colosseum Metro stop). Very friendly staff also speak great English. Very nice breakfast buffet on beautiful outdoor terrace. We loved our stay here and would certainly return on a repeat visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: ds6458
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything that has been said by previously reviewers. Great value, great staff, great location and very nice rooms. Extremely friendly and helpful staff from front door to the upstairs restaurant. All speak English well. Let the staff make your tour and private car reservations. Very modern rooms and lobby. Location is close to everything. We walked to all major tourist locations from the Vatican to the Bourghese Gallery. Three short blocks from the Coliseum. The only compliant we had was re breakfast on our first day. We arrived at the hotel very early (and received a room promptly). We then went to the restaurant for what we hoped was a free breakfast. The rooms come with free nice breakfast as advertised. After the restaurant mgr. explained that we could not get a free breakfast on our first day, we agreed to pay for the breakfast. No big deal. Unfortunately, we were charged $15 Euros each person. The free breakfast was a good value, but $15 Euros was way overpriced and we felt a little cheated. That said, everything else was great and very good value. We even got a free bottle of wine on our first day. This is really a 4-5 star hotel value at a 3 star price. Will stay here again. We will be back to Rome and the Capo d'Africa.Thanks again to Luca, Laura and the entire staff. Dick Stevens

Reviews.Title: “A GEM IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: jm54ref
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my wifes 50th birthday having read the reviews in tripadvisor and it certainly lived up to our expectations. We were given a bottle of sparkling wine shortly after going to our room. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable withexceptional service throughout. even the bar man had a joke as three Brits sat in the bar talking(a scotsman,an englishman and an irishman).As for its location we found it excellent a mere stonethrow away from the Colosseum. around the area we found restaurant La Naumachie excellent as mentioned on this ite by many other travellers. There is also a very nice Piano wine bar(IL Pentagrappolo) closeby within two minutes walk.We were however disappointed with the restaurant iL Bocconcino as the staff were far from welcoming and tried to push the most expensive choices on their menu. I could go on for ever praising this hotel. John,Larbert,Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidandpaul
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to Italy for our honeymoon. Our first stop was Rome, and we were more then thrilled with Hotel Capo D'Africa. Just a short two minute walk (literally) to the Colosseum; the location couldn't have been better. The outside facade is stylish and clean, and we were greated by smiling staff. Check-in was quick and the young lady on the front desk gave us a clear and concise explanation of sight-seeing and marked a map clearly with spots not to miss. Cleanliness is a high priority for both my partner and I. Hotel Capo D'Africa excelled in all aspects of this. Our room and bathroom was spotless, as were all communal areas within the hotel. In-room entertainment was easy to use and our room bill was updated daily and accessible through our television set. Breakfast was served each morning by smiling, helpful staff. The buffet was included in price. Fresh pastries, cold cuts and hot coffee was a great way to start each day. We travelled for three weeks in total throughout Italy, and returned to Hotel Capo D'Africa for our last night. We were welcomed back to the hotel by the ever friendly guys and girls of the hotel. We will be recommending this hotel to all our family and friends. Keep up the great work! La Nanauchie (excuse spelling) was a great little restaurant just around the corner. We had MANY meals here!

Reviews.Title: “Carlsberg don't do hotels, but if they did....”
Reviews.Author: Offaly_Lad
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 month old son and myself stayed here for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Rome is a wonderful city and was made even better by our stay here. We picked this hotel after reading the reviews and I have to say that not one review was an exaggeration. From the moment we arrived we felt at home with very friendly staff who seemed pleased to see you and wanted to do everything to help you enjoy your stay. Our room was very spacious and clean as was the whole hotel. The Breakfast room was lovely with plenty of light coming in from both balconies. The staff here would put any morning grump into a good mood with their smiles and infectious good humour. There was a good choice of what to eat and lovely coffee to help you get started. From there the people at the front desk were always willing to help you on your way or give some suggestions as to what to do or how best to do it, and in the evening the bar was just the place to unwind with some nice relaxing drinks. The location of this hotel is perfect for old Rome. Everything else is within a 30 min walk if you are so inclined. Otherwise the metro B line at the Colloseum (5 mins walk) or the A line at San Giovanni (10 mins walk) will get you to most of the major attractions. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as I would find it hard to believe that anyone could have a bad experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Central and perfect for a break”
Reviews.Author: BelfastJester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights. The hotel lived up to its reputation, with friendly considerate staff and excellent accomodation. However I'm not used to paying 20 Euro for two gin and tonics. A couple of general points. There is supposed to be a 30 euro standard taxi fare from Ciampino airport. There are posters throughout the airport boasting of the agreement between the local authorities and the taxi firms. Believe not a word of it. Two taxi drivers who I approached stated that the fare would be between 50 and 55 euros. When I tried to discuss the well publicised agreement ie. 30 Euro to anywhere within the city walls, they just walked off. If you are looking for a first rate restaurant, you should try Ristorante Papagio, which is about 300 metres from the hotel on the same street. A bit expensive, 100 euro for three courses and a bottle of wine for two, but worth every cent. Lots of excellent fish dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlet84
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent ( so very critical :) ) I stayed in this hotel with my mother for a couple of nights. The boys and girls at the reception were very friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean and so was the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was ok, there was plenty of choice. As a travel agent I have seen a lot of hotels, both business and leisure so I can compare. I would say that this is a good hotel for tourist and business travellers. It is situated in an excellent location with good restaurants surrounding it. I will certainly recommend this hotel to my clients in the future ! Keep up the good work Capo !!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Place”
Reviews.Author: thechadwicks
Reviews.Content: Where do you start? Well the hotel limo service was waiting to pick us up. A very sleek black mercedes and suited driver, well worth the 80 euros. On arrival greeted with smiling staff who couldn't do enough to make sure everything you needed was there. As we were on honeymoon the immaculate consierge Luca had upgraded us to the hotel suite, which was out of this world. The location was far closer to the Coloseum than any photo can show, it is literally a two minute walk to there and five to the Roman forum. Each morning breakfast was served on the roof terrace with a great selection of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries. cheese and meats. The espresso was very strong and even the tea was english breakfast or earl grey. The staff were very efficient and always smiling and telling jokes. In the evening, the bar is a little expensive but the drinks are strong and served with snacks, nuts and the most delightful olives. As most of the day is spent walking we didn't want to venture far in the evenings and were recommended a couple of restaurants by the hotel staff that were literally a stones throw from the front steps of the hotel. For pizza, the Li Riona (55 paces from hotel) is your typical italian pizza restaurant and all I can say is miss this and you miss out on not only the best pizza you will taste but the lowest prices too. 2 starters, 2 pizzas, 2 desserts and a litre of wine 37 euros thats including bread and water. Back to the hotel, it was immaculatly clean, with the rooms left spotless every day and the bed clothes turned down at night. All that I have left to say is for me, it is without doubt the cleanest, friendliest efficient hotel I have ever stayed in. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cozsmith
Reviews.Content: Capo d'Africa is a wonderful hotel. It is clean, spacious, the staff is competent and it is close to the Colosseum. Plus the breakfast buffet (part of the price) is great! The location is a little out of the way. It is past the Colosseum so you have to take a cab on ocassion. The neighborhood is safe and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cloudy76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March and it was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. I was on holiday with my mum & we had a twin room which was very spacious with a huge bathroom. Everything in the hotel is very modern - from the light switches to the locks on the door. There are nice touches such as the complimentary slippers & loofahs in the bathroom. The room was very quiet, we didn't hear anything! The room was quite hot though & the a/c didn't seem to work very well, so we needed to have the window open at times. Breakfast was delicious with lots to choose from - from Special K to chocolate croissants and even English preserves. As for location, you couldn't get much better - only a short walk to the Colleseum & from there everything else is pretty much in walking distance - we walked everywhere apart from taking an open top bus trip and a tour to the Vatican museums (which I would recommend as it means jumping the queues - they were HUGE!). I would recommend getting a taxi to the hotel from the airport and then the metro/train back (when you have your bearings). When we got to the airport some guy came up to us offering to take us to our hotel for 15 Euros each, sharing a mini bus with others& that worked out quite well - I'm not sure we would have found the hotel that easily from the metro station! Last but not least the staff were extremely helpful & very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good Roman option”
Reviews.Author: teachers_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Rome is a very expensive city. If you can afford to stay at the Ritz Carlton end, you will be disappointed with this hotel, but the Capo d'Africa is a very nice hotel at a good price. The location is excellent - look out your window and you are looking at the Colosseum, which means you are also at the Forum, the Palatine, the Domus Aurea, the Circus Maximus and a little way from the Piazza Venezia. Front desk staff all speak English and are very willing and helpful. The rooms are on the small side - you're in the Eternal City after all - but clean and well-decorated. This is not the overblown style of decorating - it is quite minimalist but very comfortable. The rooms actually look the way they do on the hotel's website. Beds are firm and with good bedding. There's CNN and pay movies, but you won't want them, there's too much to see just outside the door. The bar is welcoming and the included breakfast is more than satisfactory, including English language newspapers. The terrace is great - unfortunately it rained the entire time we were here - but it would be a very nice time to while away a few hours. The restaurant everyone mentions is La Naumachie, a couple of blocks away, and it is great. We ate here three times during our stay. Food was the best we'd had in Rome, and the management gave us free limoncello and glasses of wine on each occasion. Their pizza is the best we've ever had, and the lamb was terrific. We would have eaten here every night, although Tre Scalini nearby is also nice. We would certainly stay here again. What a find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: espenban
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Capo D'Africa in January 07. Booked a De Luxe room through the website and got a pretty good deal. The room (205 I think) was quite large, clean and of good standard. Bathroom was a little cramped though, but very nice none the less. It had a huge shower :) Breakfast was also great, good selection, freshly squeezed juices and a very good cappucino. Great way to start your day! The hotel crew is pleasant and service oriented. Well organized and always smiles at you. Location is a few minutes away from Colloseum and a good starting base for exploring. Sub is also close (the Colloseum station), but we only used it once to go to the Vatican seeing as everything in Rome is very walkable. A supermarket is situated only a few meters away. Also, January is an excellent time to visit Rome. The longest we had to wait in line was 2 minutes, which was at the Colloseum and the Vatican. The weather was sunny and about 20 C, so it couldn't have been much better really. I have no problem in reccomending this hotel to anyone, they truly deserve every praise they get.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: EilishJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January for 3 nights and it is without a doubt the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were nicely decorated and spacious. There were little touches everywhere that made it special - not least the chilled sparkling wine when we arrived to our room as it was my 40th birthday. Location was hard to beat as you can see the colleseum from the roof top breakfast area and we passed it every day on our way out to see this wonderful city. I have been to Rome 3 times and this was magical and a lot of this was down to the hotel and the staff. One thing I would say is it is very easy to get from the airport to the hotel by train no need for a transfer really. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: billieb
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel. Rooms largeish and bathrooms immaculate. We had a 1st floor room and bathroom window had great views onto the quaint street outside. Brekkie on the terrace nice...lovely city views but get there early in order to get and outisde table. Hotel bar/ restaurant pretty bland but with plenty local trattorias who needs it? (ask reception...they recommended some brilliant places)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: SezHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo d'africa hotel for 3 nights commencing the 18th February. The reception staff gave us a very warm welcome and were extremely helpful and informative. The room was clean, comfortable and had everything we coud ask for, including a robe each and slippers! We had requested a deluxe room in a quiet location and that was exactly what we got. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and it is a short walk to the colloseum and the forum. Other tourist spots can be easily reached either on foot or via the underground (excellent value.) The breakfasts were excellent with a wide range of cereals and pastries and efficient waiting staff. Overall thoroughly recommended! Sarh and Simon, Hampshire, England

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: claire20
Reviews.Content: Everything the reviews said it was. Great location, very helpful and friendly staff. Our room was extremely quiet - a rarity in Rome. Could find no fault and would definitely stay there next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful mini break iin Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ardfield-7
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful, very friendly staff, beautiful hotel, very nice bathroom, great location, fabulous room with view to SS. quatro coronati. Really enjoyed stay and will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't go anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Iain_and_Debs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February and had a fantastic time. From the moment we arrived the staff were so friendly and helpful (even teaching us some Italian). The rooms were very spacious and modern and the double glazing cut out all the noise from the street. The breakfast was excellent and is served from 6.30am until 11am so it will suit all comers. There are many restauants in walking distance or just a short taxi ride (10 euro's at most). We got the staff at the hotel to book us in for dinner and they didn't disapoint. The next time we are in Rome we will definately be taying at this hotel. It is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing :)”
Reviews.Author: andreasmyth78
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay in the Capo d'Africa Hotel, was both mine and my boyfriends first trip to Rome and I have to say that I absolutely loved the city and this hotel. The rooms are beautiful with big high ceilings. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the desk manager even gave us a loan of his umberella one of the days!I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. It's within a 5 minute walk of the Colesseum and if you have a good pair of comfortable walking shoes then I would recommend giving the tour bus a miss and exploring the city by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SimonSingapore
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel at a great location. The reception staff is amazing and always friendly which made the stay much more pleasant. The room was spotless and nicely designed. The hotel and the room were over-heated, we had to close the room heating and open the window to bring the temperature down. Otherwise a great hotel with a big breakfast buffet. It's very close to the Colliseum and the Roman Forum and most sites are within easy reach. The neighbourhood is nice too with some good restaurants to visit. We would return at any time and recommend this hotel warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: gingademon
Reviews.Content: We went to the Capo D’Africa for a three night stay in February. I deliberated for weeks as to whether to book the Hotel Accademia near the Trevi or this hotel. Some reports on Trip Advisor had suggested that this was a little way from the action but this was not the case. It was in a side street but that is ideal as it was quieter and in a safe area with plenty of bars and restaurants in the vicinity. We were five minutes walk from the Coliseum and not much more from the Roman Forum, the Palantine and the rest of Ancient Rome. We walked everywhere from here, even the Vatican should not take more than 40 minutes for a person of average fitness. As for the hotel, well we could not find too many faults. I have to agree with most of the previous reviews on this site. We paid for a standard room, the cheapest, working on the assumption that we would not be spending much time in it. The room was compact but adequate as was the bathroom. The bed was large and very comfortable. If I want to be picky the only faults were a) The bathroom floor needed a wash and was sticky, b) the bedroom carpet could have done with a clean but you do get some nice red slippers to overcome this, c) the mini bar did not get cold, but I did not plan on using it and d) the air conditioning was not terribly effective but being February that did not really matter. The breakfast was ample and good quality being a mixture of cereals, rolls and cold meats and cheeses. The staff were all excellent, very friendly, helpful and polite. It seemed that nothing was too much trouble for them. Massimo, the concierge was extremely helpful in recommending and booking restaurants for us. On our departure we used the Hotels car service to Ciampino Airport which at €50 I thought was quite expensive but it was easy, quick and convenient. All in all we thought that this hotel was great and would definitely recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Rome near the Coliseum”
Reviews.Author: nififer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a lovely three night stay at this great hotel just a few hundred yards from the Colliseum. Everyone at the hotel was so helpful and friendly and recommended two excellent restuarants to dine in. Nothing was any trouble at all. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean - I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: KayWillis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this brillant hotel, exactly as the photos show, staff extremely friendly and helpful, room large, modern, great extras such as robe and slippers, brand new TVs... I'm a travel agent and hard to please but this hotel MADE my visit to Rome. Having seen the locations of a few of my other options on the Nazionale, I was so pleased I choose the Capo , its so quiet unlike the other areas which are busy busy, loads of traffic etc. It was literally a 3 minute walk to the end of the road (which has a shop on, the great restaurant recommended before begining with N!! a tabaconnist etc around the corner) At the end of the road the Colisseum is right there in front of you, breathtaking, a further 3 mins takes you to the Roman Forum/Palatine and another 5 mins up to Piazza Venezia, fantastic!! I walked miles and only used the metro once (Coliseio stop 4 mins walk - linea b) when I went to the Vatican City and then I walked back over the river and took in Piazza Navona, Flori and Pantheon. Hotel breakfast is lovely just as well I walked miles to wear it off!! Terrace was beautiful with plants, lemon plants... can not fault at all, will defo be going again and will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: benji55
Reviews.Content: just back from a three stay at the capo d africa hotel.Lovely hotel staff were fantastic,nothing was too much trouble.hotel is right beside collosuem and about 1 mile from trevi fountain.If u stay here eat at la neaumachie its just around the corner from hotel food, service and price great, we ate there most nights

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic break in a fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bazzone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 friends stayed at this hotel for 2 nights (Friday & Saturday). Like many others who have left reviews I was impressed with the feedback others had left which helped me choose this hotel. It was perfect! The staff were very helpful, booking restaurants for us, calling for taxis, advising us what to visit and when and all this with a smile. Our room was the suite on the 4th floor, which was lovely. It even had a huge balcony with an amazing view over the colosseo. It was clean, spacious and comfortable. We took a taxi from the hotel to all the major tourist spots, apart from the colosseum of course. The most you would spend is 12-13 euros for a trip but is usually around the 7 euro mark. It's quite hard to flag down a taxi so my advice is to book. Buses are frequent and cheap. Just ask any bus driver which bus you need to take. Breakfast had everything you would want from a continental breakfast. I'd advise the cappuccino too! We were sad to leave after spending such a wonderful time in Rome. We’d definitely choose this hotel for future stays in Rome. Well done Capo d'Africa....keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: cikasa
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Capo D'Africa for 1 night on Nov. 23, 2006. I chose it based on other Trip Advisor reviews and it lives up to it's consistently good reviews. The location was great, just steps from the Colesium and within walking distance to most sights. We arrived early, about 10am, but were allowed to check in and shown right to our room. The room was a moderate size by European standards with a modern, minimalist decor. The bed was firm but comfortable. The bath room was well lite and very clean as was the rest of the property. Even though we were in a city, it was quiet. The hotel staff was polite and helpful with maps and suggestions. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the rooftop cafe. It was too chilly to eat outside, by the room is bright and airy. The buffet had the typical selection of breads, yogurt, fruits, cereal,deli meat and hard boiled eggs, not the typical American breakfast, but more than enough to start the day. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: k.p.thorpe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 day break to Rome to celebrate our 50th birthdays. Had a great time and could not fault this hotel. The rooms were spacious with nice touches like the supply of bathrobes and slippers and the room we stayed in on the 3rd floor was very quiet even with the window open. The continental breakfast was superb and everything was fresh. All of the staff from Reception to Chambermaids were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The location was excellent being only a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum Metro Station and had a good selection of restaurants in the area the best of which in our opinion was La Naurmiche where you can get a fillet steak for 17 euros. We also found a great little wine bar in a small street off Via d'Afrique where you could get a bottle of Chianti for 18 euros and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: loopsngeorge
Reviews.Content: Just come back from this great hotel and it certainly lived up to the good reviews on this website. The room was very comfortable, nicely furnished and everything seemed brand new. There was no bath, just an enormous shower but that was fine for us. They do a really good breakfast and it was even warm enough to have it out on the terrace if you wanted! Lots of pastries, ham, cheese, fruit etc to choose from. We didn't try the room service but it did look quite pricey. I thought the location was great as there was quite a lot to see in the immediate area, plus we found several really good simple restaurants full of Italians in the little streets nearby. We only used the metro once, to get to the Vatican. Apart from that we walked everywhere, to and from all the sights. My legs have never ached so much but it was worth it! January was a great time to go - the weather was sunny and in the '60s and although there were lots of people it didn't feel too crowded. I can't imagine what the Vatican must be like in summer though! Can't really add any more to what's been said in other reviews - I'd definitely come back here if I go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordEnglish_bloke
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the second part of a stay in Rome, a 2-day "holiday" part following a "business" stay of 2 nights at the Starhotels Metropole (q.v.). Having read some fantastic reviews (some of which compared it very favourably with our previous hotel) we were pleased to find a deal for a Superior room for about the same price. On our arrival we were thus quite disappointed. The room was much smaller than we expected and did not have such a high level of provision as the previous hotel, lacking even tea/coffee-making facilities. We then found a damp and smelly pillow in the wardrobe; when we mentioned it at the desk, we were met more with disbelief than apology.
