It had been removed on our return from dinner, however, so it is possible that it was more a misunderstanding due to the receptionist's poor English language skills (and our lack of Italian) rather than anything else. After that, things all went OK. The location is great, right near the Colosseum and with quite a few restuarants, etc. The staff were all friendly, the breakfast efficient and in a bright room at the top of the hotel. It had a good selection of "continental" buffet items including a fantastic freshly squeezed orange juice, but no cooked breakfast in the inclusive offerings. If it were not for a direct comparison with the previous hotel, including the relatively high price for a mediocre room and the pillow incident, I would have given the hotel a "4" rating rather than "2".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good service - Satisfied with stay”
Reviews.Author: Catou
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the Capo after reading all the great reviews (and some of the not-so-great reviews, too) and after deciding that I wanted to stay in a hotel in and around Ancient Rome. If you want to stay in and around Ancient Rome, THIS IS THE hotel you want to book. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Colloseum and it was nice to see it at day and a night during our walk-abouts. We stayed at the Capo for four nights in the first week of January 2007. I booked through Expedia and got a Deluxe room for $179 (US) a night. For that price, I believe we got a great deal - I don't believe the hotel is worth spending $300/night on. Good things about the hotel: 1) Great service. All persons at the front desk were always very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. For first time visitors, I believe this is very important. For that alone, I would return to this hotel and recommend others to do the same. 2) Rooms were clean and well appointed, and modern. Sufficient closet space, high ceilings, huge windows and an in-room safe. In all, the hotel is quite beautiful. 3) Great Location. 5-10 minute walk to the sites of Ancient Rome; Palantine Hill, Capitaline Hill and the Colloseum. Colloseo metro station is also right there which is great to take (not during rush hours) to get around. Not-so-great things about the hotel/ inconsistent things from the reviews: 1) BREAKFAST: Breakfast was decent. It is included in your stay after all, but the breakfast is average. Juice, coffee and cappucino is very good. Breakfast room is light, airy, clean. The breakfast patio is also very beautiful but you do not get a clear view of the Colloseum as advertised. You can see a corner of the structure and only from one part of the patio. It's still a great patio to go up to and relax with a drink, though. 2) ROOM: Room is a good size by European standards, but I wished the bathroom had been a bit bigger. The bed is hard, not concrete (but I'm sure that's somewhat subjective) - Wished, like the other reviewer we had better bedding (sheets were heavily starched), and a duvet - but the pillows were nice. Wished we had more towels too! (the reviews say they provide you with a bathrobes and slippers, but all we got were slippers) 3) INTERNET ACCESS: Wished the hotel had free internet in the lobby - (there is an internet cafe a street or two down I later discovered) - wound up buying a $25 Euro internet card for access to Capo's internet. 4) FOOD: Neighborhood where hotel is good (banks, little shops, bars), but stay away from the restaurants that are the closest to the Colloseum as they tend to be more expensive. I recommend going to Trastevere (trendier night area not too tourist-y) and venturing to those restaurants there. The Naumachie that everyone raves about (and recommended by the hotel) was affordable, but I wasn't thrilled with the food. Stick to the basics when ordering there. What we did a night or two (to save on money) is that we stopped at a little pizza shop and a wine store (both all nearby) - got a couple slices, and a bottle of wine and brought it back to our room. It was perfect. FEW TIPS: 1) Like other reviews: don't wait in line to get into the colliseum. Walk up to Palantine Hill and purchase a ticket there (allows for entrance to both Palantine and the Colloseum for 11 Euros per person) 2) Take the metro (if you're sick of walking or want to get somewhere in a hurry), don't take cabs! It's fairly easy to navigate (there are only two lines A and B - the exchange is at Termini) - to get yourself to the Spanish Steps and/or the Vatican 3) If there are long lines at the Colloseum and/or Vatican and an English guide approaches you for a tour - take it - cuts your waiting time by half if not more! I was apprehensive about this: it is legitimate, BUT expensive. For us, we didn't have the patience to wait in line (especially at the Vatican) and it was the best thing we did. Both of our guides spoke english extremely well, were knowledgeable and made our tour super enjoyable and interesting. 4) Wear comfortable shoes (it's hard to do in Rome, after all - you want to be fashionable). We walked everywhere- everywhere (most of the time) and your feet/legs will ache! 5) One or two weeks before your trip, make a reservation for the Galleria Borghese (google and go the official website). This is a must and you need reservations ahead of time before going! It was well worth it -- and the Golden House of Nero, too (unfortunately it was closed while we were there)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for this price.”
Reviews.Author: John.Trip
Reviews.Content: Just returned (Jan 2007) from a 5 day, 4 night stay at the Capo d'Africa Hotel in Rome. We selected it based on previous reviews on Tripadvisor and were delighted with pur choice for this price range. The location was great for us down a quiet lane behind the Coliseum, perhaps 1 mile or so from the main centre. As previous reviewers have commented don’t pick the hotel for stunning views of famous landmarks, except for limited views of the Coliseum from the terrace. However, the views are of genuine little apartment blocks etc. perhaps the real local Rome. Perhaps a 20-30 minute walk to many of the good tourist sites. Others can easily be reached by the Metro (10 mins away) or busses/trams. From the minute we arrived the staff were great, bags taken to the room, with a full explanation of where everything was and how it worked. The Concierge (Mario) immediately provided us with a tourist map along with that special circling of interesting locations, directions, times etc. We arrived at lunchtime and asked Mario for a lunch recommendation, we got 3, from formal 1 hour+, through pizzeria, to bars with snacks. We opted for the pizzeria (Le Naumachie) which was great for food and very reasonably priced. We tried the slightly more formal (Bocconcino) for dinner another night and again it was great and reasonable. Another local favourite of ours was Hostaria Tsidoro (not recommended by the hotel). The hotel was very contemporary and stylish, most fittings, lights, tables and so on seem to be from well known designer ranges. Everywhere was spotlessly clean, with 5* touches like turn down service, robes, slippers and so forth. A large, comfortable bar/reception area offered a full bar and cocktail service. The barman also mixed a perfect Bombay Sapphire and tonic. The breakfast area was lovely with prompt and courteous service (always 3 staff, for a small hotel) with a good selection of continental style fruit/cereals/cheeses/meats/breads. We loved the Capo d'Africa Hotel and thought it represented great value for the money. We would not hesitate to return on a future visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “will return”
Reviews.Author: lazy acres
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to all the sites.Rooms were spacious and well appointed.Breakfast very good although staff could be a liitle bit more efficient at clearing tables.All staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irishtouristgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and very bright and well designed. Rooms were pleasant and good for italian standards. The breakfast was nice and the terrace areas were lovely. It is very central and because Rome is so compact was possible to walk to a lot of the tourist attractions. One area where the hotel could improve on was the restaurant recommendations, we got a recommendation to a restaurant which was very expensive and very disappointing on every level (wrong orders and dreadful service). After that we didn't invite any more recommendations from the hotel. It could have been just that recommendation or the night in question though because the concierge was very obliging and informative other than that recommendation. p.s.Message to the Hotels reading this: Why don't hotels supply conditioner and how could a sewing kit make it into the bathroom ahead of it? It's 2007 and please don't pawn us off with the 2 in 1 conditioner/shampoo (it doesn't work!).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: alpals
Reviews.Content: We spent our three night honeymoon at Capo based on the excellent reviews we'd read on here. It's true, the hotel is very beautiful and situated in a great spot close to the Colisseum. However, unlike other lucky honeymooners, we were never congratulated or treated in any special way, which was slightly disappointing as we had informed the hotel before our arrival that it was our honeymoon. Despite this, we were happy with the room, the breakfast was very nice with plenty of choice and we especially loved the roof terrace. Our only other problem was the barman who completely ignored us in the lounge area. He had no problem serving the other more wealthy looking guests sitting a few feet away from us. In the end we decided it would be quicker to order a coffee from our room which unfortunately came with a 7 euro service charge! All this said, we have recommended the Capo d'Africa to friends as it is a very beautiful hotel in a good location. But for us, next time in Rome we'll go for a more friendly and traditonal family run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: CATCOOL
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a New Year break at this hotel and cannot recommend it enough. All the staff were pleasant and helpful and reservations made for restaurants etc without any fuss. Our room was particularly large for european standards and was kept very clean. Breakfast was also excellent with a great choice. The only problen was with a local restaurant which charged us 20 euros more/person than other diners for a set menu for New Years Eve. We will certainly be coming back to Capo D'Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Cabriolet
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful honeymoon in Rome, made wonderful and unforgettable by this wonderful hotel. We booked this hotel based on the rave reviews and we certainly were not dissapointed. Upon arrival we were given a hearty welcome and congratulated on our marriage. We were brought to our room by a porter who took the time to show us around our room and point out were everything was. A bottle of excellent champagne was left on ice to welcome us, a wonderful touch and very much appreciated. Every thing about the hotel is excellent, the staff come number one, but the cleanliness and comfort come a close second. The breakfast on the roof top is airy and bright, again, everything very clean and nothing too much trouble for the wonderful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a hotel with a bit of class but also if you are looking for a "home away from home" this is it. The only down side to this hotel and beleive me it did not bother us too much, was the room service food. It was very pricey and not very tasty, but having said that edible. I hope to return to this excellent hotel very very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but didn't quite meet expectations!”
Reviews.Author: snowyshome
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe room (most basic room is a superior room) directly with the hotel at a rate of 240 euros per night. The hotel is located down a quiet street, just a few minutes walk from the Colosseum and the location is fine. The building is lovely, especially at night with the lighting. Check in was fine and we were told we had a quiet room. On arrival in the room it was actually nextdoor to the lift! The room was nice and spacious, but I have to say that it did not reflect the pictures on their website of a deluxe room, which I had paid extra for. There were none of the luxury touches shown on the website pictures of a deluxe room. Having said that the room was nice, but certainly did not bowl me over. The bathroom was very small and only had a shower. I did ask whether they had a room we could move to which had a bath instead but they could not accommodate this as I was told they were fully booked. Having come from Venice where we had stayed in a fantastic design hotel for less money, I just wasn't as impressed by this hotel as I thought I would be. The public areas were nice and funky, the breakfast was lovely and the breakfast room really nice, but I still had a bit of a feeling of disappointment with the room as there is nothing worse than something being misdescribed! I did check at reception that we did in fact have a deluxe room as I was convinced they had got it wrong but they informed me that room 223 was a deluxe. Overall we had a lovely stay here and the bed and furnishings etc were all quite nice, but just did not have that extra wow factor which I was expecting, having read all the other reviews. Overall I would probably recommend this hotel, but only if you paid around 150 euros per night for the room we had. It didn't have anything particularly individual about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: wimbrussel
Reviews.Content: Capo d'Africa is a fine hotel, indeed. The reception staff comes in a variety of styles, from slapstick humour over pure Italian charm to cold and to-the-point. Always friendly and helpful, however. The rooms are spacious and clean, and they have nifty hallways to keep the rumour from neighbouring rooms away. Breakfast is not as luxurious as in other 4-star properties but very much OK, especially according to Italian norms. Location is perfect: the Colloseo metro station is a five-minute walk away and there are quite a few good restaurant and wine bar options in the streets around the hotel (just ask the reception staff). I would stay here again BUT only if I could get a decent rate. Rack rates linger around 400 euros per night, we got a promotional (!) deal for 230 euro per night on average. No matter how good the hotel is, that really remains a lot. Add the fact that a cola costs 4 euros in the hotel bar and you know what your wallet is up to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: mat'sgirl
Reviews.Content: I'm somewhat late on writing this review; however I have intended to write a review for quite sometime because I want to contribute to the other positive reviews about this divine hotel, the Capo D'Africa! My husband and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa for 10 nights in April 2005. I cannot state enough positives about this hotel. Our stay at Capo D'Africa contributed to beautiful memories about Italy and Rome that will never, ever fade! This was our first trip to Italy (and to Rome), so we were a bit apprehensive about what to expect. We wanted to stay in a hotel off the "beaten-path" a bit because we did not want to be caught up in tourist traps for 10 days. Capo D'Africa exceeded all of our expectations and I actually cried on the day we had to return to New York! My husband and I couldn't believe how beautiful the hotel and the surrounding neighborhood was when our driver pulled up to the hotel. When we entered the lobby, we were immediately greeted with Italian warmth and hospitality that absolutely never ended! Being of Italian descent, I immediately felt a connectedness to the hotel, the staff, the city of Rome and its people! This was a trip I will never forget! The hotel staff were all wonderful! Over the 10 days, they knew I was studying Italian, so they all chipped in to help me with the language! Oftentimes, my husband and I lingered at the funky lobby bar prior to a night out, where I delighted in "chatting" with the bartender in Italian. It was so much fun! I won't bother to repeat all the positives about this hotel in DETAIL but I will reiterate that the hotel is beautiful, the staff are wonderful, the rooms are immaculately clean with all attention given to even the smallest detail! The decor in the hotel is cool and hip without being overdone or "pretentious." The rooftop brunch every morning (included in the room rate) was SUPERB! The views of the surrounding area are spectacular and the food choices at brunch exceed most "typical" European brunches by offering fruit, pastries, fresh Italian meats, freshly cooked egg dishes, rolls, breads, fresh juices, cappuccino, etc. The neighborhood is about a 15 minute walk to Centro Storico (the "Center" of Rome) and/or a short subway ride to ALL the major attractions of Rome including the Piazza Navona, the Piazza del Popolo, the Spanish Steps, the Vatican, the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, the Campidoglio, the Villa Borghese, the Via Veneto, etc, etc. Additionally, this hotel is very near the Colosseo, which is part of the ancient Roman Ruins that comprise the Imperial and Roman Forums. So the neighborhood is VERY historic (but then again, so is ALL of Rome)! Finally, my husband and I spent quite a bit of time in the neighborhood surrounding the hotel. We frequented restaurants, trattorias, delis, etc and EVERYONE was completely wonderful! My paternal grandfather was from Rome and my mom was born in Caserta Pratella (near Naples), so I felt a true affinity for the people of Rome! The Roman people, including the folks at the hotel, and the experiences they helped us create, is something that will never be forgotten! If you'd like, you can visit pictures of our Rome Italy holiday at http://tonilee2.smugmug.com/ Arrividerci e Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Muffinsmummy
Reviews.Content: I trawled the internet for weeks doing my research and booked this hotel based on the reviews I read on this website alone. We stayed at the Capo D Africa for 3 nights in November and it was perfect in every way. We went to Rome to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We were welcomed by the wonderful staff, and there was sparkling wine waiting for us in our room. We had booked a deluxe room, but the room did not have a bath. We asked if we could possibly move rooms, the next day we were upgraded to the hotel's only suite, complete with private roof terrace overlooking beautiful Rome. All of the staff at this hotel are excellent, the breakfast room is up on the top floor and the service and food are first class. The location of the hotel is ideal if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle and is perfect for the Colosseum and the Forum. Make sure you kick start your stay with drinks at the hotel's bar, they give very generous measures! I recommend a classic Gin & Tonic. Enjoy your stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved the people”
Reviews.Author: Erica07
Reviews.Content: A fantastic stay in a beautiful converted school 2 minutes walk from the Coliseum. You dont go to Rome to spend time in the hotel public areas, but when you do, the hotel is enjoyable as all the staff are friendly and eager to speak great english as well as try and teach you Italian. Its tucked away a little but which is great as we heard no traffic noise or late night noise at all in what is a busy city. Service was great and over a 3 day period we had no complaints whatsoever. Was lovely to spend time in the centre then walk back to the hotel for a drink on the rooftop terrace before going back out for something to eat. Even having a drink in the bar which is in the reception area is ok though at first you will think its a bit open, but the barman converses really well in different languages and is a really fun guy and very knowledgable about wine, tell him what you like in a wine and ask him to recomend something you wouldnt normally try, he offers little tasers and gets it right every time. We stay in 4/5 star hotels usually, and this was a great example of a good informal 4 star hotel. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Solid Four-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael/Steven
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Capo D'Africa Hotel and were very pleased with our experience. The location of the hotel is great for exploring Rome, with the Colosseum a few blocks away and even the Vatican within a reasonable walking distance. We DO like to walk. The rooms are not fancy or particularly memorable but the beds and linens are great and the bathroom was beautifully appointed. The front desk staff was VERY helpful with recommendations for dinner and arranging cabs, etc. Our favorite aspect of the hotel was breakfast. It is a marvelous spread of all sorts of fresh fruit, breads, cheeses, etc. and the room is attended to by an extremely attentive lady who is very cheerful and friendly. She made us smile every morning. All in all, a very good hotel and, given the expense of Rome, a very good bargain. We would recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...great location”
Reviews.Author: NFMac
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a very good location, so long as you know that you'll be a little bit off the beaten track. The immediate surroundings aren't that attractive or anything but they're full of little bars, coffee shops and restaurants. We were given the room next to the breakfast room (412) and we were a little worried that it would be noisy in the morning. We barely heard a thing. In fact, when we went to breakfast we were expecting the room to be empty but it was actually quite full so that shows how good the sound-proofing was. I'd want to give the hotel a 4.5 star rating rather than a 4...it's good but it's not quite perfect. Over two nights (where the hotel was full, according to the front desk) I went to the hotel bar whilst my wife was finishing getting ready. The bar was very nice and the barman very friendly but there was no atmosphere. My guess would be because the drinks were very expensive (6 Euros for a beer or glass of wine...at least double what they were in many of the nighbouring bars...even though they were lovely - particularly the wine) and the service was limited. I think I was lucky in that I was served promptly but one couple sat there for a good ten minutes and walked out without being served. Anyway...that's a small negative for a hotel that I'd definitely recommend. And...thinking about the review a couple of posts down, we're English, don't look particularly rich and the service we received was friendly, efficient and just right. We also got the hotel car back to the airport (we'd got the train and metro on the way in but wanted to maximise the time left on our last day) and the driver was far too fast for me. I wish I'd asked him to slow down but we were too polite to do so! One tip for the hotel...once you know your way around, the hotel isn't much further away from line A on the metro as it is to line B. A short walk gets you to the orange line which serves the Vatican. That seemed easier than getting the metro from the Collosseo station to Termini, and then change lines, to get to the Vatican. Plus, the overland tram 3 takes you to the trendy Trastevere area. Food...we went to la Neaumachie (as everyone on this forum who stayed at this hotel seems to recommend) and it was superb. Great food and service. There's also a nice Irish pub on the Capo d'Africa road which was very busy on Saturday night. Rome's a fantastic city but I can't imagine how busy it must get in the summer or at Easter. November was a great time to visit (and we were blessed with very warm and dry weather) but the place was still packed. Try and go out of season and you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: britishhoneymooners
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel having seen the excellent reviews and ratings here on TripAdvisor. We were in Italy for our honeymoon and booked a week's stay in the Capo D'Africa. We'd read all about the amazing and luxurious hotel, free upgrades that some people got and special treatment; one where the hotel manager was welcoming and hospitable. What a surprise then, to find that the hotel was snobby, pretty standard (and we've never stayed in a four star hotel before) and that everything we had heard about it was just hype. I was so disappointed as we were on our honeymoon and thought that at least the staff would be welcoming and nice to us. The room was smaller than a Travelodge standard room (not very large), not overly clean, the bedlinen and towels had holes in them, the bed and pillows were hard and uncomfortable, the view was limited to the rooftop of a shabby appartment opposite, there was no kettle (something us Brits are accustomed to), and the promised "designer toiletries" consisted of a small plastic tube of shampoo and bath foam - oh and a little bar of soap. Of course, the Americans in the hotel seemed to have a whale of a time and were treated as true guests - all reception, bar and consierge staff fell over themselves to do whatever they demanded from them - but we received none of this hospitality - despite paying equal amounts. In fact, one of the consierge staff held open the entrance door for a couple of Americans but let it close in front of my face as we tried to get in the door. I was disgusted, hurt and very upset. What a shame. I honestly thought that it would be the perfect hotel for our honeymoon but I was very wrong. The breakfasts were okay and the lady who manages the staff who serve the food was very nice - so too were the two barmen we met. But the rest of the staff lacked any form of customer service. We weren't even thanked for staying there and asked how our stay had been!! Instead we were charged for taking things from the mini bar which we hadn't touched the entire weekend (and it appeared that we weren't the only ones either as another English couple had the same problem as they checked out the same time as us). Maybe we should have dressed up to look like we have lots of money or something. We don't know what we did wrong but we do know that we won't be recommending this hotel to anyone. It's over priced and has a totally erroneous opinion of itself.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JA3N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a break to Rome and a stay in the Hotel Capo D Africa. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews of my short listed choices on Tripadvisor, we are pleased past traveller's passed on their experiences and I hope this will help others. I'd emailed the hotel afew day's before we travelled to ask if they could arrange a transfer from the airport, the communication back was swift , informative and the transfer booked! Marco picked us up from the airport and gave us our first experience of Italian roads (we saw our first scooter accident-1st of many) the transfer was worth the money just for the fact you were not waiting around at the airport. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by "Super" Mario, not only did he speak impeccable English it was said with a smile on his face. We were shown to room 226 , the porter gave us a guided tour of the room and left us to settle in. It was very clean,nicely decorated and a huge bed (which turned out to be extremely comfy).We had a shower over the bath, lovely towels and a good supply of toiletries. We'd read so much about the terrace that we went to the bar ordered a snack and drink to take up with us but ended up staying in the bar where we met the barman ,"Amazing" Adolfo,most barmen are friendly but you felt as though he was enjoying being your host. The breakfast dining room is nice and bright and you can eat out on the terrace, the food is typical european fare ,fresh and plenty of it,the staff are pleasant but not as friendly as the front desk staff. Your room was serviced twice aday to a high standard.Overall the hotel inside and out is spotless. Each evening after eating at a local restaurant we ended up back at the hotel bar, purely because of the service and company.I'm extremely fussy and hard to please so this is a great compliment! Rome was lovely but it was sad to leave the hotel. Mario and Adolfo are the hotels greatest asset from a clients point of view, they are a good double act! P.S. Don't believe a word Adolfo tells you about Mario,I'm sure he's spreading nasty rumours !!! We'd like to thank him for the Italian lesson GraatzeeA! Mario- Biaggi for WSB.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ac707
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Capo d'Africa for 4 nights during our tour of italy and my wife and I absolutely loved it. Very clean and safe and very close to the colloseum. Out of all of the places that we stayed in italy this is one of my favorites. I will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: costast
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were only able to stay one night at this beautiful hotel, but we had a great time.. The rooms were nice and clean with a king size bed . The staff was friendly at all times. The location is great ( central and quiet).The metro station is very near which make transportation easy. I recommend to everyone a restaurant Luzzi which locates close to the hotel ( real italian pizza).Recommended if you're staying in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jazzyb099
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 5 nights at the Capo d' Africa Hotel. It was our first time in Europe and found the hotel thru TripAdvisor.com. After reading excellent reviews on the hotel, we decided to book this hotel. It was fabulous! We were on a 3 city trip: Rome, Venice, and London and by far this was the best hotel we stayed at during our trip! The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean. Nice king size bed and the bed was comfortable. I also found that the location was great. The street was quiet, away from the hussle and bussle of the busy city and close to the Colosseum. Breakfast is served on the terrace which is a great way to start the day. We did use the metro while we were there (closest metro station is by the Colosseum, 10 minute walk). It's not the high-tech metro system of London, but it was good to travel on. There are several resturants around the hotel and a food market also. One night we just stayed in and went to the local markent and bought bread, cheeses, and meats and stayed in to rest. After touring the city for 5 days and seeing other hotels, I knew we had chosen the best hotel in town. A few tips about Rome. 1. Lock everything in the safe of value in your room. We felt very safe and comfortable at this hotel. 2. For souveneir shopping, the shops around Trevie Fountain are the best. Also visit Trevie Fountain at night, very beautiful. 3.Eat lots of gilato! 4.Plan your days while in Rome so you get to see everything because there is so much to see. We grouped things that were close together in location to maximize our time there. 5. We did a tour for the Vatican Museum which was a complete waste of money. (GreenLine Tours) There are so many people at the Vatican, that we could not hear anything the guide was saying and we felt rushed thru the museum. Do the museum yourself so that you can see everything and spend as much time there as you want. Beware the lines are long no matter what time you get there! We arrived at 7:30 a.m. and stood in line for 2-1/2 hours! 6.Check your bill when eating at a resturant. It is legal to charge a service charge which most resturants do. However, it is Illegal to charge a cover charge in Rome. We did catch one place that tried to charge us a cover charge and when we pointed it out they said no problem don't pay it. Overall, we had an amazing trip and this hotel was great. I would definately stay here again and recommend to my family and friends. If you don't stay at this hotel in Rome, you miss out!

Reviews.Title: “atmospheric rome - hotel by colosseum”
Reviews.Author: linzilou
Reviews.Content: Stayed in capo d'africa for 4 nights end october. we had a large room which I really liked (211) and it was a very clean hotel. Maid service was excellent and unobtrusive. Wine at the hotel bar not in any way as expensive as in some of the local bars. Staff quite friendly and helpful. The breakfast was just ok - I think they could really improve the offer. It was nice though to sit on the terrace on the fourth floor eating breakfast in the sunshine. The hotel, although close to the Colosseum, was quite a walk from the other attractions but doable. We walked everywhere - take very comfy shoes. The wide road next to the Colosseum was closed to traffic on the Sunday morning and it had a fantastic carnival atmosphere. We loved the piazza next to the Pantheon and particularly the Piazza Trastevere and a walk up the hill for some wonderful views of the city. Rome was full of atmosphere - lots of wonderful old ruins being unearthed even now. We had blue skies for the whole of our stay and it was t shirt weather throughout. The locals all seemed to wear autumnal clothing -jacket, jeans and boots. There were some lovely bars and restaurants near the hotel particularly the Neumachine, and wonderful service at Pasqualino's. I would stay at the capo d'africa again (I would give them a 7 out of 10) but I would like a hotel with a pool or some grounds or maybe a roof terrace where you can soak in the views. Rome is just fantastic. (couple from Lancashire)

Reviews.Title: “overbooked at the Capo”
Reviews.Author: tomdelux
Reviews.Content: Beware that a confirmed and paid in advance reservation at the Capo d'Africa Rome does not necessarily mean the reservation will be honored. I bought my hotel room through Orbitz in February '06. Imagine my shock and bewilderment when the management told me upon check in that I would be sent to their sister hotel, the Visconti Palace--I needed a roof over my head so I unhappily went along with this. I am very bitter because that Thursday evening October 5 I reconfirmed the reservation and the Capo said that they were expecting me. To add insult to injury I witnessed couples checking in at the Capo after me while waiting for the taxi to take me away--two hours wasted. The Visconti Palace was a poor substitute and definitely not an equal--their breakfast is served in the basement and the Capo breakfast is served on the rooftop with an incredible view of the Colesseum. Otherwise, the Capo is perfect in every way if management decides to honor their committments. Who needs a hotel like that ?

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: HKbuddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Capo d'Africa in early October for three days. We arrived Rome from the train terminal. The taxi fare to the hotel costed only 8 Euro. When we arrived, we immediately noted a signage on the reception desk showing "2005 Tripadvisor traveler's choice". As same as previous comments, the staff really provided us a pleasant and professional check-in service. They arranged us a room on the 1st floor (ground floor) near the staircase. The room is large, but the bathroom is quite small (no bath tub). It seems to me that the hotel itself is a typical business hotel. The room is on average: clean but nothing special. I advise not to choose the room #105. The room is close to the staircase, and every morning around 5:00am we were awaken by the noise coming from there. I did not know what happened but the sound is quite annoying! The breakfast was general, similar to what we had in other places in Europe. Besides the professional staff services, I could not find something that we felt surprise. Before our stay, we had read so many superb comments from tripadvisor. However, we may expect too much. The hotel is about 8 minutes walk from/to the Colosseo metro, and 20 minutes to the Palazzo di Venezia. We took the metro once but the metro in Rome is terrible. It may be the poorest in Europe: bad smell, train broken down on the half way between two stations, strange people on the train that made you uncomfortable. Afterwards when we went outside, we would took a bus #85 or #87 instead along the Via Labicana. I suggest anyone who comes back hotel from Plazza Spagna can take a bus #117 in the Via Del Corso. The cutie bus will stop at the corner of Via Del Querceti and Via S. Giovanni In Laterano, where we spent only one minute walking back to the hotel. Although the metro station is not very far, we really felt tired when we carried a number of shopping bags. Besides, we recommend you try a restaurant Luzzi which locates close to the hotel. We had a delicious pasta and pizza there. The price is relatively cheap. Overall speaking, I think the hotel is over price and over rated. My wife likes shopping. I think when we go to Rome again, we will choose a hotel close to the Plazza Spagna.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: YDFreeborn
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a long weekend in Rome staying at the highly recommended capo d'Africa hotel. We couldn't fault the hotel, curtious and helpful staff, spacious room and lovely bathroom. From the roof terrace where you can have breakfast you can see the Colloseum. Breakfast was more than adequate, fresh fruit, cereals,cheeses meats, rolls and pastries. We arrived Friday morning and had booked online a return ticket for the Terravision coach which runs from the airport to the Termini station in the centre of Rome; this saved time queuing at the airport and took around 30 mins. From Termini we took a white taxi to the hotel which was 10 euros. Make sure you use a licenced one which pulls up at the taxi rank. We took a taxi Sat morning to the Vatican so as to be there to join the early queue and this was 10 euros. We arrived there at 7.30am and it opens at 8.45 but at least it then took only 10 mins to get in. We used the 110 red open-topped bus which does the sightseeing tour and you can hop on and hop off but were very disappointed with the commentary. I would try one of the other sight seeing buses. Le Naumachie restaurant, again recommended was fab and we ate there every night! Just round the corner, fantastic food and soooo reasonable!! We had home made ravioli, roasted vegetables, panna cotta, half a bottle of wine, bottle of water and coffee for 37 euros for two. You certainly can't get that in Bromley! We loved everything about our weekend and if we return (we thru' our coins into the fountain!) we will certainly stay at this excellent hotel, 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: SarahJane30
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I have just returned from spending a long weekend for our 1st Wedding Anniversary at the Copa D'Africa, Rome. The Hotel was beautiful - located in a quiet street just 5 minutes walk from the amazing Colosseum. Upon arrival Mario on the front desk upgraded up to an Executive Room and from then onwards nothing was too much trouble for Mario. The room was beautiful with an enormous bed which was so big I could actually lie across (I'm 5ft 7!), a lovely luxury bathroom and the extra touches like slippers, dressing gown and evening bed 'turn down' were great. Breakfast was on the 4th floor which I'm sure is spectacular in summer as there are tables and chairs outside on the sun terrace boasting amazing views for those braving the weather. Choice of breakfast was 1st class and even had soya milk without me having to ask for it! Overall the hotel was fantastic - clean, beautiful, quiet and friendly - but Mario on the front desk made it that bit more special. Upon learning that I was a fan of footballer Paolo DiCanio, Mario found out where and when his team were playing and printed off directions to the stadium & club shop. Nothing was too much trouble for Mario and with his lovely smile, perfect English and wonderful sense of humour he really is a gem for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The good reviews are all correct”
Reviews.Author: Mark 2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 25th anniversary and the staff could not have been more pleasant, the room was excellent and the location was good also, quiet and very close to the Colosseum. We would stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: coyotetraveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the lobby I loved this place. We had a very nice stay at this hotel in Rome. It's a great location in a trendy, attractive neighborhood. We were a short walk from the Roman ruins, and a short cab ride to other sites we visited. The staff were warm, friendly, and very professional. Whenever we had a request the front desk person took care of it promptly. The dinning room is a roof top terrace with great views of the city. You can eat in or outdoors. The breakfast was delicious with a wide variety of food. The service staff were quick, and attentive. Perhaps what I liked best about this hotel is its energy. The colors are light. The decor simple, and elegant. I actually enjoyed coming back to the hotel for a nap or to rest before going off on the next adventure. Also, it was very quiet, and our room faced a side street. It was great to be out in the city with all of the excitment, noise and frenzy and then to escape back to our room. We had a wonderful stay here and I highly recommend this hotel for those doing a Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great but far!”
Reviews.Author: Stephlovestravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Capo for 5 nights. The staff was lovely and the breakfast overlooking the coliseum can't be beat. The rooms were small, but the bathroom was nice and large. The rooms were average size for Europe. The hotel is very close to ancient Rome which is fantastic but it is far away from the city center. We did a lot of walking! All in all, for the $300 a night, I'd think that there was something closer to the city center that was good, however, it was an enjoyable stay and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: yolo
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Rome on Saturday, September 23rd, early morning. From TA comments, we had arranged for the hotel to send us a car instead of taking a taxi. The driver was waiting for us and off we went. 30 minute ride to the hotel. Much to our surprise, our room was ready and we were able to check in at 9:00am. Very nice since we had flown all night and wanted to be able to rest. At check-in we were given a sheet that said the driver was $55.00, however we were charged $80.00. I questioned this and was told it's only $55.00 FROM hotel TO airport because they can just drop you off and not have to wait for you. Live an learn. Our room was nice, really high ceilings, fairly large and nice size bathroom. The breakfast buffet on the rooftop(included in room rate) was nice. We really enjoyed the roof top to relax at the end of sight seeing all day. We would go up there and order wine and recap our day. The hotel is only 2 blocks from the colosseum and other Rome attractions. It's a bit of a hike to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the other side of town, but we walked everywhere. We felt we got more out of the city by walking and exploring all the little side streets. First night, had dinner in restaurant recommended on this site near hotel called Il Bocconcino. Very good and good pick for 1st night in Rome. We enjoyed this hotel, the staff were very helpful, the place was clean and we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: MrEarl
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to Rome for the first time for her birthday and stayed in Capo D'Africa. Rome is an unbelievable, must-see city and Capo D'Africa has got to be one of the best hotels in which to base yourself. Large double room (room 211) with high-ceiling, air-conditioning and very comfortable bed; excellent bathroom with huge marble shower (ask for a room with a bath if you want to soak after walking around all the attractions). Ancient Roman attractions very close by - Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Forum, Capitoline Hill and Circus Maximus are literally a few minutes walk away. We only caught the metro once (to get from Colosseum to St. Peters Square) but it was only one Euro each, very quick and frequent service. Have to mention an amazing Trattoria - Luzzi - only two mins walk from Capo D'Africa on corner of Via S.Giovanni and Via Celino - fantastic pasta, excellent steak, very friendly staff, two starters and main courses and a litre of house red for under 30 Euro. We will definitely return to Roma and definitely stay at Capo D'Africa when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but certainly not excellent”
Reviews.Author: ncyprus1
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel down to recommendations and their web site and on the whole were not disappointed. The staff are very helpful, friendly and smiley and it is in a great location. Great restaurants within a few minutes walk. But......, small rooms, very hard bed (we stayed 3 nights and glad it wasn't more due to back ache) average breakfast, 1 bathrobe (!) and little or no information in the room or the hotel itself. We rate it above average only for the location and reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SMLBARB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Arrived to find our room was ready -and that was the start of a terrific stay at this hotel. The staff was so helpful - they made our visit so easy and comfortable. They readily answered questions about places to visit, terrific places to eat and where to purchase several items. The room and bathroom was very comfortable, modern and well-appointed. Breakfast was terrific - we loved the selection of cheeses, salami, pastry, fruit and they made the best cappucino we had in Italy. We loved the quiet location near the Colisseum. It was a respite after a long day of walking and seeing the sites. But there were lots of restaurants nearby and we liked the feel of a real residential neighborhood - and very safe. When in Rome again I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic - highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: melrose4
Reviews.Content: This lovely modern hotel is very close to all you'd want to see on a weekend trip to Rome. The room we had was extremely comfortable - we're VERY fussy about beds! Buffet breakfast is served upstairs in a lovely light, airy dining room. Everything is really fresh and the coffee is actually drinkable! Service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “I love it! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: NCSUfashion
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone spoke English and were easy to understand. the rooms were a nice size the decor was nice as well. The bathroom is a little on the small size but that wasn't a big deal. The pillows are a little flat so ask for two if they aren't already in the room. The breakfast provided upstairs was good - juices, cerals, pasteries, cold meats, yogurt, fruit etc. We also ate dinner upstairs one night as well. The hotel is on a very quiet street so we had no trouble sleeping at night. It's near all the ancient rome sights. It's kind of a hike to the Vatican or the Villa Borghese but otherwise we had no trouble walking to all the major places we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: boxerfan
Reviews.Content: This was our 25th wedding anniversary trip and an extensive stay in Italy that included this hotel for only one night, but what a night!!! Checked in mid morning to be greeted by a pleasant reception that cheerfully told us our room was ready! Yeah. Very impressed with the whole building: decor, cleanliness and ammenities. When we got to our room, more pleasant surprises: slippers, fluffy robe. The tv had a message greeting us and we used the wake up service offered as well as booked dinner reservations at this hotel. We then walked til we dropped exploring the Colisseum area. When we returned, we freshened up for dinner....oh, my gosh...what a magical evening...we ate on the rooftop in this beautiful setting of white linens and candles and flowing fabric awnings with two other couples...Adolfo was our waitperson, yet much more, as he and one other person ran the whole show from buying the produce to creating the menu and cooking the exquisite food. Porcini mushrooms had come into season, so of course we had fillet with sauteed mushrooms. Before that we had salads that were fabulous. Adolfo suggested a wine and it was a perfect match. Dessert was a fresh made tiramisu. The couple next to us (of which we became quite chatty with) ordered the intriguing "tutti frutti" item which turned out to be the most creative dessert i have ever seen--and delicious according to them! What an excellent way to end a three week anniversary gift to self. There was an outdoor living area on the rooftop as well, that we would have utilized had we been there longer. When we returned from dinner, turn down service had been completed. Oh, yes....due to our extremely early departure the next morning, the receptionist made sure we had a "breakfast to go" bag waiting for us and sure enough, there it was!

Reviews.Title: “Gushing Praise!”
Reviews.Author: markymark1uk
Reviews.Content: I am a Doubting Thomas when it comes to Web reviews, so when I read previous postings about the Capo I was somewhat sceptical about the praise. I am happy to say in this case all praise is entirely deserved. The hotel staff are friendly (without being false), helpful (without being fawning) and extremely knowledgeable (without being patronising). The hotel itself is well appointed, has fantastic modern decor, and the attention to detail at all times puts it up (comfortably) with some of the 5* hotels we have stayed in. The area around the hotel is preferable to many of the districts of Rome, and noise was never an issue. Unlike many cities, my wife and I never felt uneasy after dark - in fact it felt a lot safer than going out in my home town. Local eateries were plentiful and one in particular stands out (Le Neumachie) for it's food, service, and value. If so many locals eat there then it must be good. We would recommend this hotel to anyone unreservedly, and hope your stay there is as good as ours was. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: Cannot praise this hotel highly enough. Excellent room (on 4th floor), beautiful decor, pleasantly modern room and all its facilities, good new plumbing (unusual I find in hotels), good sized room, excellent breakfast, very pleasant and efficient staff, excellent location. Used to live in this area near the Colosseum 25 years ago, not really changed, even Hosteria Ulderico (now called Ulderico I Clementini) was there and still serving good, typical food - restaurant full of locals and we were the only foreigners in there. Other good restaurants nearby. Its a pleasant (and now, 25 years later, safer) area. We'll go back and sooner than 25 years! PS my husband insists I mention the hotel's available comfy red slippers and warm towelling robe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivi2
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i just returned from rome we stayed at capo the first three nights it was great all the Ta comments were right This hotel is great ! perfect staff great rooms and bathrooms breakfast was very good would have loved to stay there at the end of our trip but they were sold out . my advice is to book early capo is a great hotel no compliants at all !!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlechunk
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 5 night stay in the capo d'africa and we will definitely stay there again. the staff are very friendly and helpfull, nothing is too much trouble. the hotel is kept spotless and the rooms are attended to twice a day. there is a great view of the colusseum from the terrace, not just a corner of it if you hang yourself over the wall!! you can sit at your table and there it is, all of it. the hotel is within walking distance to all the sights even the vatican, but you will get distracted by so many things on the way, be prepared to walk alot. breakfast is plentifull, try the cappuchinos, lovely. one or two phrases of italian goes a long way, even if just to say hello, goodbye, how are you? will be appreciated. we used the hotels taxi service which made both journeys to and from the hotel hassle free, well worth it. the hotel recommended 2 restaurants to us which were just round the corner, the boccomcimo and the isidoro, which were both great and one that we found ourselves, which had a view of the colusseum was la pace del cervello,all 3 served great food and wine for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “One word - Exemplary”
Reviews.Author: AirplaneCattleFodder
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels having a previous job with the onerous phrase in the job description 'some overseas travel required' . The hotels varied from very good to bad via mediocre and ambivalent. Reluctantly I've become expert in all the nuances of hotel living sometimes for weeks on end out of a suitcase. Add into the mix holidays taken as well and in my view, hotels can make or break any stay, there are many facets to the hotel experience that can please you or infuriate you. To save you reading the rest of this if you are pushed for time. In short, the Capo D'Africa hotel excels at everything a top-quality hotel should do, in my rating, there's very good and above that there's the Capo. Go there and you will not be disappointed one bit in your choice. Rome itself has plenty of good reasons to extend your stay, staying at the Capo adds one more making saying ciao to this wonderful city even harder. If you are still reading, myself and my girlfriend had a four day stay in Rome for the first time and chose this hotel on the strength of the reviews here. They didn't disappoint, I'm a bit of cynic (see above) and don't recommend anywhere easily but with the Capo it is completely unreserved. My girlfriend has a good eye for detail (show me a woman that doesn't) and she was bowled over by the care and attention of the Capo to their guests. The Capo is an excellent place to base yourself, situated a five minute walk from Colosseo metro station, it is located at the end of Via Capo D'Africa and is quiet and sufficiently secluded (if that is possible in Rome) for a peaceful nights sleep isolated well away from the bustle of the Colosseum and Old Rome yet remaining within easy walking distance of them. On arrival, the exterior of the hotel oozes style. Inside, the reception area is contemporary neo-modernist in decor and art, airy and welcoming. At the reception desk, the staff are simply world-class. They are friendly, very knowledgable and take the time to explain the facilities. They maintain an excellent sense of humour, are easy to get on with and it is clear they love their work. I had contacted them before our stay to specify a double (which was a large king size bed) rather than a twin and also a room in a quieter part of the hotel. They fulfilled this to the letter. During your stay, if you need to know anything about how to get somewhere, out comes a free map, circling your destination and where you are now and advice how to get there. For example, for our trip to Vatican City we expected an early start and long queues, their advice was spot-on. Leave the early start to those that like that kind of thing, if you want to take your time and still see the Museum and Sistine Chapel, the queues die down at 11am so go then. If you need to arrange transport, a taxi is called, arrives promptly and is reasonably priced. Our trip to Vatican City was a fair way and a fair ten euros. It wasn't a one off, another cab ride to Spanish Steps was six euros, perfectly reasonable for the distance. Just make sure the meter is running, not that we had to remind them once. If you want a good trattoria or restaurant but aren't sure where to go, ask the concierge. Every eating establishment they recommend not only fitted our requirement perfectly but also enhanced our stay. They were not tourist traps but had a good representation from the local inhabitants, always the mark of a good restaurant in my eyes. The food was always good, always the real deal. I can add to their recommendation of Papagio especially on a Friday for seafood, the traditional day of the week in Italy to take such a repast. It was some of the best I have eaten, fine Italian food and good service. The concierge will make the reservation for you if you give them a little notice. In the case of Papagio, you will need to book in advance especially to dine al-fresco which is very popular there. In short, the reception staff and concierge service are a model on how it should be done, I know I will be very hard pressed to find a hotel with better. For a hotel with four floors, it has modern lifts, quiet in operation, important for a room close to them and getting to your room with luggage is no problem. The rooms follow the style statement made by the hotel reception, they are very well appointed, stylish, airy and large by European standards, the quality of the fittings is first-class. The beds are comfortable, the linen is top notch and the towels are top quality. The air-con is adjustable from cold blizzard to a literal whisper which didn't wake us during the night. The curtains are layered and offer an excellent blackout from the bright Italian sun. Another nuance that makes a stay just that little bit better. Another hotel bugbear is there is nothing worse than jiggling your keycard in your room lock trying to get in the early hours with some vino collapso inside you. Theirs is credit card sized (nothing unusual there) and fits in your wallet. But the key is a proximity card waved in front of a sensor next to the door and is simplicity itself to operate. Once in the room, placing your card in the provided slot activates power to the room and informs staff outside that it is occupied so no chance of an 8am knock on the door from the maid wanting to clean your room. It's these nice touches that really makes the Capo special. When the maid did get in, it was well attended to and there was no need to get them back to do anything that was missed. All tastes are catered for at breakfast and al-fresco on the terrace is a great way to start the day. The patios are lined with plants, there is shade and plenty of room, one terrace adjoined to the breakfast bar is overlooked by the Colosseum. The staff are friendly and cannot do enough to make sure your breakfast is relaxed; it is open until 11am which makes a lie-in easily achievable. An unfortunate accident with a little red wine required the use of laundry services, this was efficient, easy to use, prompt and the red wine was a mere memory not a stain. The hotel will arrange travel to and from the airport if you wish, we decided to get there under our own steam on the Metro which is fairly straightforward (Take the fast train to Termini from the airport and then the two stops from Termini to Colosseo Metro Station). We opted to take the hotel provided transport on the way home. Efficient and priced well at fifty euro (it's a long-ish trip) back to Leonardo Da Vinci. Leave yourself plenty of time it's a good half-hour drive out in thin traffic. We loved our stay at the Capo and there is nothing to fault it on. The Capo isn't the cheapest place to stay admittedly but it offers far more for the money than you expect making it very good value indeed. To know you are booked into excellent accomodation puts your mind at rest to concentrate on enjoying Rome. We never managed to see everything Rome has to offer, we didn't expect to, mixing sight-seeing with grande dollops of la dolce vita but we know we will be back. We will definitely be staying at the Capo again, Rome wouldn't be the same without it. One last piece of advice, only use the word 'grande' sparingly in Rome. Grande gelato's were a bit embrassing and entertainingly messy but delicious and a grande birra is a full litre (almost two pints) of Peroni in a massive glass..... not that I was complaining...

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: PBond
Reviews.Content: Just had a fantastic 3 night break with my wife. Location was excellent and everyone was exceptionally friendly - not often the case in Italian hotels. Great bar, great food. Hotel is large enough to offer all modern facilities but small enough to care about its guests. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “My Mistake”
Reviews.Author: Iamuzak
Reviews.Content: I made a terrible mistake. I didn't record my cancellation confirmation number. I'm writing this to caution travellers when cancelling. We were travelling with another couple. We changed our plans to arrive in Rome a day earlier. I called Hotel Capo d'Africa to see if they had 2 rooms available the day earlier. I had researched the hotel using TripAdvisor and was looking forward to staying there. Unfortunately, they didn't have rooms available so we checked into another hotel. (Locanda Cairoli, see review) I called and cancelled the 2 rooms and asked if cancelling would be any problem. The lady responded 'no'. Had it been a problem, we would've moved the next day. She gave me a cancellation number and I didn't write it down. When we arrived home there was an invoice from Capo d'Africa stating I had 'no showed' and of course the 2 rooms charged in full. When I emailed them, they had no record of me calling them at all. The only record I have is my friend's cell phone bill that I called them. Visa won't back me up because I have no documentation of the cancellation number. Oh well, egg is on me. Don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: BBR31
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at the Capo D'Africa Hotel. The service was some of the best we received in all of Italy. From the moment we arrived, the front desk attendant was extremely polite and helpful. The breakfast was not as plentiful as the other hotels on our trip, but it was adequate and the service was very good. The bar ended up being one of our favorite spots in Rome for happy hour. We did get the private vatican tour through the hotel and were dissapointed with the tourguide. Her english was very difficult to understand and considering we paid her $75 an hour, she spent way too much time on her cell phone booking other tours. The hotel overall was clean, very nicely appointed and in a great location to see the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld23
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at the Cap d'Africa in early September and we had a brilliant time. The staff were welcoming and very friendly and helpful, the bedrooms quite large and comfortable and above all quiet, the ambience in the rooftop breakfast room was a joy. We had a superb meal on the terrace on our last evening in Rome. Wonderful views of the Colosseum and the food was excellent. An excellentl hotel for experiencing Rome - can't rate it highly enough and would recommend it to anyone young or old as an ideal location to see Rome. A selection of very good restaurants in the surrounding area meant that after a long, hot day in the city you didn't have to travel far for good food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “near Colliseum”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Golfer
Reviews.Content: Right near the colliseum - if your lucky you can get a room with a great view - it was one of the cleanest and most reasonable places we stayed in in all of italy - and were in rome so keep that in mind - rome is not as big as we thought so in fact we were quite central to everything

Reviews.Title: “Capo d'Africa fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: eweiser
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to Venice, then down through Tuscany, ending our trip in Rome at the Hotel Capo d'Africa. We had read very positive reviews on Tripadvisor prior to our stay, but found that the hotel was even nicer than we expected. The service was outstanding, the room was delightful, the bathroom was equipped at the standard of a luxury hotel, and the breakfast was marvelous. In fact, the food was so splendid at breakfast that we decided to try their dinner as well. It was one of our best meals in Italy. And the hotel's rooftop terrace overlooking the Colosseum was a perfect place to unwind and have a great meal. We cannot recommend this hotel high enough... it was a wonderful place to stay and we would go back again happily. Mom and 13-year-old son Chappaqua, NY

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bebby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. This Hotel is very close to the coliseum. As most buildings in Rome it is tight against another building and on a corner. The area was quite. We were on the first floor initially but our view was pipes etc. We asked to be moved. The front desk person was very accommodating and promised to move us to the front of the building the next day. In the morning after packing we went to the front desk for the key. A different person was there. She gave us a key for the third floor but still in the back of the building. It was an improvement, because we were higher up, until we realized we were under the restaurant area. The noise was very irritating. I guess we should have stayed where we were. I suppose somebody has to take the rooms. The rooftop is wonderful for dining with a view of the coliseum and lovely greenery. The breakfast was included and was very basic. Dinners are a la Carte and ranged around 60-70 euro for two plus tip. However we did have a great steak. For the most part we went to a food store in the area and picked up Pizza in the area. I felt uncomfortable in this area. The buildings in the area looked a bit rundown and there was graffiti everywhere. The people seemed a bit rough. I soon discovered there was graffiti in many areas around the city. We bussed to the Vatican, which took about 20 min. I think if we went to Rome again we would stay in an area closer to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Karen
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, witha fantastic location. Without question the Capo d'Africa made our trip even better! the staff and general ambiance of teh hotel were superb, we cannot speak highly enough of this hotel! Dinner on the roof terrace of the hotel, over looking the colluseum is a must if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “What a great honeymoon hotel!”
Reviews.Author: The_Magoos
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 nights at the start of our Italian honeymoon in Capo D'Africa. The staff went out of their way to make it a relaxed and luxurious experience from beginning to end. Our room was on the 4th floor so we were only a step away from both breakfast and the candlelit roof terrace which we made full use of on more than one evening. It was incredibly romantic. It was also the only hotel we experienced in Italy that played music all the time. And the music selection was fab! Capo D'Africa has everything: the sights, the staff, lovely spacious rooms, delicious food and a well-stocked minibar! Honeymoon heaven!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Caples
Reviews.Content: When it comes to value for money, this hotel beats them all! Not only were the staff incredibly helpful and polite, the rooms were very clean, spacious and quiet. The location was perfect (just a stone's throw from the Colosseum and in a quiet road) and the air conditioning was a blessing! A must for everyone: the hotel's Terrace Restaurant. The food was sublime! Well worth the money. We recommend this hotel for everyone visiting Rome, young or old, the staff will go out of their way to make it a perfect stay (I'm not being paid commission - honest! We just had such a great time).

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki7781
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the pleasure of spending July 8-July 12th at the Capo D'Africa hotel. Mr. Rossi and his staff were the most professional and helpful people we have ever met. They went out of their way to help us locate our lost luggage, and went to every measure to help us retrive it before our departure to another city. The rooms are excellent, and spacious. Toiletries are provided in the rooms. The breakfast buffet was superb. Lets face it; where else can you drink a cup of coffee, east pastries, yogurts, cereals, endless cheeses and meats, and savor the view of the Collosseum. Once again, hats off to Mr. Rossi & staff for making our stay an excellent one. Hope to see you again next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Capo D'A-fabulous”
Reviews.Author: The_Penguins
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Capo D'Africa at 12:00pm, earlier than the hotels normal check-in time, which is 2pm. We were immediately offered a room that was already prepared but as it was a smoking room which we did not want so we settled in to one of the very comfortable sofas and had a quick beer, I say quick but we were expecting to have to wait a couple of hours, around 20 minutes passed when the receptionist advised us that our room was now ready but to stay where we were and finish our drinks while the door man took our luggage up to the room. When we did get to the room we were very pleased with the cleanliness, (I suppose it had just been cleaned), and the overall feel of the room, lots of space, modern furniture and an average sized bathroom. The bathroom was a vision in white and marble and had plenty of hotel branded toiletries which we actually found to be quite good quality. The bed was very firm but all in all very comfortable, (and not what you would call small!!!). After our first evening in Rome we were looking forward to a day of sightseeing and felt that a hearty breakfast was in order, however we understood that the european breakfast probably would not consist of a giant plate of fried heart attack, and we were correct there, although you can order various cooked eggs n'stuff from the room service menu at an additional cost. What we were treated to was a large array of pastries, meats, cheeses, bread, fruit, juices and cereal. The quality of the breakfast food was excellent, (we especially liked the custard filled croisants). Breakfast is eaten on the roof terrace but the number of tables with a Colosseum view are limited so you may have to be patient if this is one of your reasons for staying here. After a day of sightseeing and another lovely meal at Pasqualino's trattoria just around the corner we returned to CD'A for a drink on the roof terrace which was quickly and efficiently delivered to us. When we returned to our room the bed had been turned down, a bedside mat had been laid out for each of us and the complimentary slippers were waiting eagerly for our aching feet. On our final night at the hotel we ordered room service dinner which we chose from the small but comprehensive menu. The food was nothing out of the ordinary if I am honest but it did the trick. The location of the hotel is ideal for checking out the sights and sounds of Rome, it is 2 minutes walk from the Colosseum from where you can catch the Metro to most other tourist sights. TIP: buy your Colosseum entry ticket at Palatine, just up the hill from the Colosseum and it saves you the trouble of queueing to get in!! The neighbourhood is quiet and we found it to be safe, there are plenty of Trattorie and bars dotted around the side streets near the hotel as well as a tobacconists, a small supermarket and an acceptable Gelataria. Overall, a lovely hotel which I am struggling to find fault with. I have been asked to add by my wife that the staff were always helpful, polite and smiling...which is true...so I have added it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: monkeybot
Reviews.Content: Great great great location near the Colliisuem but the room we were given was a bit on the smallish side even though we had booked a superior room. Staff were very helpful but there was a distinct lack of information in our room in English about the services the hotel offered. There was a lovely terrace where we had breakfast and I believe that this also turned in to a restaurant at night but we had no information about it. No iron board was a bit of a problem apparrently due to fire regulations although candles burning on their own on the roof terrace was fine apparrently. La Naumachie is a great restaurant nearby - however DON'T go to the pizza place left and right out of the hotel. It may have been the worst meal I've ever had. Very rude staff and completely unedible food. We got the impression that they didn't like the English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: blstrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon and it really was great. The staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the bathroom was too. The A/C worked perfectly. Breakfast is included in the price and is served in a large dining area that has 2 terraces - from one of them you can see the Colosseum. They had a very large variety of food and the fresh fruit was lovely. It is a 3 minute walk from the hotel to the Colosseum and maybe 25 minutes to anything you'd want to see - including St. Peter's and the Vatican. It is on a relatively quiet street too, which is nice. And it has a very nice lobby. I would recommend this to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jo_from_london
Reviews.Content: If your staying in Rome it would be hard to find a better than this. The terrace alone is worth it, especially for the breakfast which should come included. The terrace overlooks the Colosseum so offers terrific views of ancient Rome. The hotel is very modern and trendy yet is friendly. The staff are fantastic and give a 110% and do there best to make your stay memorable. The rooms are stylish, large and are very clean. There are nice touches such as slippers, bed mats, dressing gowns etc. There is also a fitness centre in the basement if you have the energy after walking around the sights. If you do stay here around the corner is a great restaurant i'd also recommend especially if you like fresh pasta and home made sauces. It is called Il Bocconino and it is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel so it's very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Just Excellent - in every way”
Reviews.Author: Weegie1
Reviews.Content: Being an avid user of Trip Advisor as a selection guide to choosing hotels in cities, we chose the Capo D Africa for a base, for our first trip to Rome. After booking the Hotel (easy process direct with Hotel - great English) - I also informed them that it was for our first anniversary and how much we were looking forward to this. I asked if a bottle of something could be placed in the Room for our arrival. Upon getting there, after a nightmare taxi journey (see tip at bottom of this), we were greeted by super friendly staff, whose first words were "Congratulations on your anniversary and welcome to Rome". Maybe its the old romantic in me, but that was nice and personal, a touch lacking in major Hotels around the world. The Desk Manager then proceeded to tell us they had upgraded our room for free and then gave us a quick resume of spots to visit in Rome and dining alternatives. Very quick, very efficient and very informative. The room was big (for European standards) and super clean. The Hotel in general is very modern with nice modern art touches and splashes of colour in subtle ways. Best of all the Hotel exists in a side street away from the Colliseum that is one way. Little traffic passes and thus, in a busy and hustling city like Rome, it maintains an air of calmness. In the room was a bottle of decent Champagne, with the compliments of the Hotel, a nice touch again considering I had requested this and they had every right to charge me for this. Again, just a little thing, but they count. As for location, I had read it was slightly further out from Rome centre than some Hotels, but we figured Rome was for walking and this wouldnt be a problem, altho take a good pair of shoes, because you will walk a lot! However, the compensation for being only slightly further away from the centre is that at night it is quieter. And safe. We walked back every night from either the centre or from the Piazza Navone, which has 20-30 open air restaurants in a large beautiful square and was fantastic place to eat at night and then head into Rome centre or wander the backstreets. The location of the Coliseum is literally at the bottom of the street that Capo D Africa sits on, and what a sight it is. From the Breakfast Room you can see it, and I cant imagine many sights better than overlooking Rome, drinking coffee in the morning and having the Coliseum in the foreground. And finally after a long day walking, to get back to the hotel and go to the secluded roof terrace and relax with a beer and dhakiri (ok, I had the dhakiri and the wife had the beer but hey, we're a modern couple...), that was excellent. To find a quiet roof terrace like that in one of the busiest cities in Europe and to be able to unwind was worth the price alone. I think one reviewer also had this experience and hopefully others will too, as no-one seemed to know it existed as it was always empty! Rome itself was excellent and we found the Romans warm and welcoming. The Capo D Africa was a great choice and when we go back I know that it is the ONLY hotel we will consider booking. I rarely recommend Hotels to friends and family, as everyone has their own tastes and preferences, but I have and will recommend this hotel to anyone who asks. My thanks to the staff and the Hotel. We will be back, without question. Major Tip if staying here: DO NOT take a taxi at the airport - you will be ripped off - phone the Hotel direct before arrival and ask if their limo service will pick you up. Its cheaper, 55 Euros as opposed to the 88 we paid for our "official" airport taxi and they dont drive at 100 miles an hour and are far more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexWright
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel near to the Colloseum in Rome. The staff were friendly and very helpful and the hotel had a stylish and modern decor. The breakfast was top quality but our real tip would be to try the dinner on the roof terrace for a romantic night. The waiter was very knowledgable and the food absolutely first class. Not a cheap option for dinner but well worth it. If you want to dine out of the hotel the staff can help with very good recommendations. There are some lovely little restaurants in the area, but also some terrible ones - that's why asking the staff's advice is a good idea. Finally, for any opera lovers, there is an inexpensive but charming outdoor opera held in a courtyard just round the corner from the hotel. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Capo D'africa is a must stay!”
Reviews.Author: fam_Palma
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the hotel staff at Capo D'Africa! They truly made our family vacation more enjoyable.
