We stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks (only reserved for 4 nights but stayed 2 weeks due to child illness). The staff was very accomodating to our last minute needs and booked us another 6 days at their lowest rate. They adored our 1 year old son and gave him everything he wanted and needed (like free late night bowls of cereal). The service from the front desk personnel to the wait staff is superb and have never experienced such hospitality from a 4/5 star hotel. They are willing to accomodate your every need. In addition, the hotel is immaculate inside and out. The decor is beautifully decorated with modern design (the details are well thought out and high tech) and the ambiance is so comfortable and relaxing with the soft jazz music in the background of the lobby. We loved this hotel and will recommend it to all of our friends and family. It was worth every penny! We hope to be back in the near future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right next to the Colosseum.”
Reviews.Author: Cardician
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor I found this hotel and booked a stay there for four nights earlier this month. What a fabulous hotel. My fiancee and I loved it. The rooms were very nice. The staff were all perfectly polite. Just a few blocks from the Colosseum it is a great location. We could even see the top of the Colosseum from our room. Can't beat that. The rooftop terrace was great for breakfast and the food choices were fantastic. There are also some great little restaurants just down the street from the hotel. We ate at one during the World Cup quarter final game between Italy and Ukraine. Can't ask for a better atmosphere. The hotel has a good location and everything within Rome is walkable. We even walked to the Vatican, though thats a decent hike. It was our luck that the taxi drivers were on strike when we arrived in Rome so we had to take the train from the airport to the Termini station, and then the metro. Fortunately the Colosseum metro stop is just a couple of blocks away from the hotel so it wasn't too bad dragging our luggage there. Really, this hotel is great in every way and has a fantastic location. For the price, its extremely hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo d'Africa for 5 nights in June as part of our honeymoon and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Quite apart from the fantastic location (2 minutes from the Colosseum, shops, bars and restaurants but in a quiet, safe street), the hotel itself was modern, clean, stylish, with good facilities and friendly, attentive staff. Our room was a good size, and we were grateful for the quiet yet effective air conditioning. The room was kept immaculately, as was the rest of the hotel. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was wonderful, as were early evening cocktails in the same spot. We had a wonderful time in Rome, and were sad to leave both this greart city and the Hotel Capo d'Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccatoronto_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at Capo d'Africa in June of '06. We picked the hotel after reading reviews in some travel books, and then reading all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. When our cab dropped us off at the hotel, we were quite impressed- the web pictures really don't do the hotel justice. Our room was lovely- with large european windows overlooking the street. And the room was nice and cold! Helped with the 35 degree weather. We really had no complaints about the room- except when we were looking for a box of kleenex and couldn't find one- but then a box appeared a couple days later. That's a bit nit picky, I guess. Honestly, our room was a great refuge after very long days in the heat. The breakfast at the hotel was perfect. We sat on the terrace each morning, and had our pick of everything you could imagine- fruit, yogurt, cereals, pastries, hard boiled eggs, fresh juices, meats and cheeses, and a nice pot of cofee. I looked forward to breakfast every day. The hotel put all of the newspapers in the breakfast room, whereas I might have delivered a paper to each room...guarantees you get a paper that way. The service, more importantly, was outstanding. The staff was very fun- always smiling, and very helpful. They booked us tours, helped us with restaurant choices, and indulged us whenever possible. We ate lunch several times at the hotel bar- which was a better lunch than we found elsewhere in Rome. I'd recommend the Celio Salad. My husband was a fan of the spinach salad. It was really nice to unwind there with a glass of Pinot Grigio. Didn't get a chance to check out the gym...but who needs to when you're walking everywhere. Oh- and the location was fantastic. The colisseum is at the end of the street! Granted, there aren't the same shops and restaurants as other parts of town, but they are only minutes away and fun to explore on an evening out anyway. And...we found we kept going back to Ancient Rome for so many of the sights, that we were lucky to be staying so close. We loved Capo.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kentucky_Guy
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Rome at the Capo before catching a Carnival cruise. Like all the other reviews here, we had a great time at the Capo. We were in a room right next door to the dining area upstairs and had no trouble with any noise from there. The room was very clean and very large. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast in the morning on the terrace, started things right. The only problem we had was not with the Capo but with a tour booked through them with VASTOURS. The Vatican tour was terrible. Standing in line for 1.5 hours in the heat and into the Vatican with a tour guide that was barely understandable. Next time I think we would tour the Vatican with a private car company. On our cruise ship we heard several couples tell about bypassing the line with their private car company. We booked our transport in Rome through Rome Cab[------] and were very pleased with the service. The rates were 45 euros from the airport to the hotel and 115 euros from the hotel to Civitavechia and from Civitavechia to the airport (all in air-confitioned Mercedes vehicles).

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bosox2004
Reviews.Content: I’ll add my 2 cents to these reviews and say that Hotel Capo d’Africa was the best hotel we stayed in during our 5 week trip to France, Spain, and Italy in September and October 2004. This was our first trip to Europe, and we couldn’t have dreamed up a better hotel than this for our last week in Europe. We picked it mostly because of the favorable Tripadvisor reviews. The location is ideal for visiting the Colosseum, the Forum, Capitoline Museum, Piazza Campidoglio, Domus Aurea, Trajan’s Market, and San Pietro in Vincola. Our room, a standard double, was comparable to a room in any luxury hotel in Manhattan or San Francisco and included thick robes and slippers. The bathroom had an American sized tub, copious marble throughout, a bidet, and high quality fixtures (Grohe). The only English channels on TV were CNN and BBC, but we did get current updates of the Red Sox’ first World Series championship since 1918 (not being able to watch any of the post season games being my only regret of this trip). The breakfast room has a rooftop terrace, and sitting on the terrace while looking at the Colosseum, sipping a sublime hot chocolate, and sampling from a huge assortment of breakfast goodies, including croissants and various sweet pastries, eggs, cold cuts, cheese, fruit, cereals, juices, and breads is an experience not to be missed. As far as facilities, there’s an outstanding workout room in the basement, and the lobby level bar is a great place to chill out with a martini before dinner. There are several ristorantes, trattorias, and pizzerias in the neighborhood, and we enjoyed Isidoro in particular. The hotel’s bartender, Adolfo, made reservations for us at a seafood ristorante a few blocks away, which was superb. Also, Trattoria di Naumachie, about a block away, was very good. There’s an internet café about a block and half away, a grocery store about the same distance, and a terrific gelateria a half block from the internet café. As far as transportation beyond walking distance, there are bus and trolley stops on via Celio Vibenna. Bus and trolley maps are available in the newsstands on the same street, which make it really easy to figure out how to get where you want to go. There’s also a Metro stop across from the Colosseum on via dei Fori Imperiali. If room rates hadn’t gone up so much since 2004, we’d probably stay here again. But at current prices we can find other hotels closer to the center of town (ie closer to Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Campo dei Fiori, Spanish Steps, and Vatican City). So that’s what we’ve done. We’ll be back in Rome this coming October/November, and we’ll be staying between Piazza Venezia and Piazza Campo dei Fiori. We’ll post a review after our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Se perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: Aggepagge
Reviews.Content: Ten trips to Rome over the past couple of years and ten different hotels – finally I’ve found the one for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willowchilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. We had booked a double room and were allocated a twin on arrival but were moved to a different room straightaway with no problems. Rooms were very clean and comfortable but quite small. The staff were very friendly. The only down side to this hotel is the location. Although it is right by the colleseum, when I booked I wasn't aware of how far the colleseum was from most of the other attraction in Rome! It's quite a walk especially if you are doing it a several times a day! If you want to use public transport everywhere you'll not have a problem as it's a short walk to the colleseum metro station.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to kick off our honeymoon tour of Italy. It is in a great location for the colliseum however it may not be as central as other hotels. When you get there you will not worry about it as transport for tourists in Rome is plentiful and quite cheap. The hotel is very chic and the decor is a joy. The staff are helpful and the barman, Adolfo is very friendly and provides great drinks and advice on restaurants nearby. Take his advice, it is unbiased and we had some of the best food of our holiday there. I cannot recommend this hotel enough! FANTASTICO!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the second week of our honeymoon. It was an absolute pleasure to stay there. From the moment we set foot in the hotel, we had a wonderful visit to Rome. The staff are friendly, polite, professional and courteous. They cannot do enough to help you. The rooms are large, tastefully decorated and very clean. The breakfast is extremely good, a large range of food and excellent service. We genuinely could not find fault with the hotel, we were very sorry to leave! We cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clematis1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Capo D Africa where we chose to stay after reading some of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor, we were not disappointed. The hotel was tucked away down a quiet side street which meant we were not kept awake by any traffic. It was only about a 5 minute walk away from the Colloseum in an area with several restaurants close by. Our room was comfortable, spacious and the air conditioning was very efficient, ncecessary when it was almost 100 degrees outside. I had read one review about the bathroom being small but ours was a very good size. Throughout the hotel it was spotlessly clean and had obviously been refurbished very rcently. The hotel reception staff were some of the most friendly and helpful we have encountered but without exception all the staff were lovely. We enjoyed breakfast outside on the rooftop terrace, there was an excellent choice and really set us up for the day. As far as restaurants are concerned, like many other reviewers we found Le Naumarchie to be the best in the immediate area, although they did not have tables outside unlike many of the other restaurants, the food was of a higher quality and there was a good choice. We were surprised at how cheaply we could eat out around the hotel. Our experience of the pizzeria next door to Le Naumarchie (think it was called Lucca) was not a good one, there were a lot of locals there which made us think it would be good, but the lasagne certainly wasn't great, the service was awful and the wine dreadful, one couple were even seated next to a drainpipe and the crates containing empty drinks bottles! We arranged our transport to and from the airport through Viatours by taking a shuttle, cost for the two of us £37.20 return which was far cheaper than taking a taxi, although we had to drop a couple of people off first on the way there which took a bit longer, at least we saw a bit more of Rome and coming back we had the service to ourselves. The hop on hop off buses were also a good way to getting to see Rome without having to do too much walking which was exhausting in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa for five nights in May, 2006. It is an elegant hotel with very attractive decor. It is spotlessly clean with friendly, very professional staff. The hotel is also very quiet. The breakfast was top quality with abundant fresh squeezed orange juice, pastries, rolls, jams, yogourt, fresh fruit, cheeses, meat and coffee. Breakfast is served in a very attractive room on the top floor with tables outside as well, some of which have a view of the Coliseum. Quite simply, I believe this hotel strives to be a perfect place to stay and it is really hard to think of any shortcoming on its part. We were able to pay a little extra for one of the Deluxe rooms in the hotel and I believe the extra space was worth it if you are able to get it for a relatively small amount. The neighbourhood is a real Roman neighbourhood which is becoming trendy. It has some very good restaurants and charming cafes, which are not overwhelmed by tourists. I also had some of the best gelato that I have had in Italy in the neighbourhood. The hotel is close to the Coliseum, Palatine Hill and the Forum. Strongly recommended as well is a visit to the less crowded San Clemente church just around the corner which has fascinating archeological excavations beneath it. All of historical Rome is within walking range (45 mins) and the Coliseum Metro and Hop On/ Hop Off buses are useful and a short walk away when you don't feel like walking. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel....Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: gerardkelly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend three nights in Hotel Capa D'Africa for our first wedding anniversary. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is at the end of a very quiet street within 5 minutes walking distance of the Colesseum. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and almost all had good english. The lobby/bar is very modern and comfortable. The rooms were clean, spacious and very modern. The little extras were a nice touch.....bathrobes, slippers etc. The bathroom was quiet spacious. The only downside was that the shower was a little on the small side...but that was only a small inconvienence. Breakfast was served on the 4th floor in pleasant surroundings. Again the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The selection of food was very good...from cereals to cold meats, croissants as well as omelettes etc. Guests may also enjoy their breakfast on the outdoor terrace with a lovely view of the Colesseum. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel. Although it may be a little expensive it is definetly worth a visit if you feel like treating yourself.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nik-the-stone
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Capo D'africa, we went there as a special treat for our 10th anniversary and we felt had to write a review!!, Im normally of the opinion that reviews must be taken with a large pinch of salt as everyone has different ideals, but all of the raving reviews about this hotel are spot on! Staff were efficient and helpful, the location is perfect for sightseeing and enjoying rome, the rooms are so spacious and immaculate. Not the ideal place if you are looking for old world character as everything is extremely contemporary, so incredibly stylish. really cant emphasize enough how wonderful it is!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel ”
Reviews.Author: rosa99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Capo D'africa for 2 weeks from 3 -17 June. A great little hotel. Polite staff - nothing too much trouble - quick to respond to requests like an extra pillow and an ice pack for my twisted ankle which I sustained whilst out shopping!). Twin room was spacious, bathroom perhaps on the smallish side but not a problem. Everything spotlessly clean. Bed linen and bathtowels changed everyday. Hotel provided bathrobes and slippers which was a nice touch. A very good buffet breakfast was served on the 4th floor terrace. Cappuccinos especially very good. Staff very friendly and attentive but not 'full on'. Hotel a little out of the way from the centre but personally found this ideal because in a less manic location - meant you could get peace and quiet at night. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Excellent & Excellent. Wheelchair users will find staff fantastic and discreet. Accessible via lift at the side and there are lifts inside to all floors. Rooms large, clean and modern. Central location and just around the corner from the Colleseum. Shame that the wonderful rooftop dining terrace wasn't accessible and beware the bathroom floors when wet!! The floor tiles were lethal. However, will definitely return and use this wonderful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cielward
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo d'Africa from 22nd to 27th May and were ver satisfied. The hotel is very clean and the staff helpful. The size of our room was pretty much what you would expect in a "business" hotel in the UK and the bathroom was also a respectable size. No bath though, if you find them essential, but a spacious shower. Towels were changed twice a day and other linen regularly. Aalthough only about 200m from the Colosseum the hotel is in a quiet location but still surroounded by small trattorias serving good food at reasonable prices. There are also at least two slightly more upmarket restaurants within 150m. Continental breakfast at the hotel was more than adequate, boasting cereals and boiled eggs as well as plenty of fruit as well as the usual bread, croissants and preserves and the view of the Colsseum from the roof-top breakfast terrace was quite good. It's not far to walk past (or through) the Roman Forum up to the Victor Emmanuel II monument and from there into the centre of Rome, but there are frequent buses passing the Colosseum all day and evening. An excellent mid-priced hotel that I intend using next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMK142
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May/beg of June 2006. The hotel is very nicely kept, very clean. The rooms were really clean and the maids visited ours at least once a day. The location is very good too, perfect for the Coliseum and the Forum. You can walk into the centre of town - probably about 15/20 mins or get the metro which is situated only 5 mins walk away. You can also get the tour bus 110 from the stop outside the Coluseum - I would recomend that as it is a cheap way to get about and you can get on and off where ever you like. The breakfast on the roof terrace was more than adequate, lots of meats, cheeses, pastries and cereals to choose from. The are a number of nice restaurants within 5 minutes walk as well. Overall, a very good experience and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “LOVED OUR STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: ssp011204
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in late May and enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was great and the room as clean and quite large. We would definitely stay here again and I've already recommended it to friends. Note: A tripadvisor member recommended a restaurant nearby called Il Boccachino (spelling?) which was superb! The prices are very reasonable and the best food we had in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dean Calculator
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights first weekend in June,fanatastic hotel Great location,3 minutes to the colluseum,friendly and helpful staff,beautifully finished decor. We stayed in room 308,nice size room, bath and seperate shower,view of the colluseum from window. Very good inclusive buffet breakfast served on the very attractive roof terrace. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Susan Wivell
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights (25 - 28 May) in room 322 next to the lift and wasn't woken by noise once during the whole visit. I am not a particular heavy sleeper, so perhaps had more considerate guests during our stay. Continental breakfast was good, as was the view from the terrace. Hotel is close to tourist bus route pick up points (five minutes) and is idealy placed for a walking tour of the Colleseum and Forum. I can recommend a leisurely Sunday afternoon in Piaza Navona watching the world go by with a nice bottle of white! Overall, would recommend Rome for a long weekend break and this hotel in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: sueoverend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo for 4 nights from 30th April. We had a room on the ground floor a short walk from reception. Although small the room was lovely - very comfortable with everything that we needed. Tall windows which opened, which was a real benefit and we found the firm beds really comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was great and it was lovely to have a bath after such a lot of walking. Lovely touches like slippers were provided. The staff were great and made dinner reservations, booked taxis etc for us, when we were too tired to walk any more! We loved the location - yes it was a long way from St Peters, but close to the Colliseum and The Forum etc. Wherever you stay, I think you will find you will be exhausted from walking - there is a lot of ground to cover. The benefit of the location was how quiet the room was - never heard a noise at night. The roof terrace was lovely for breakfast and we also spent an afternoon up there which was wonderful. Next time in Rome we'll be staying at the Capo again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely, lovely, lovely,”
Reviews.Author: corkuser
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 night at capo d africa and had a wonderful time. i found the hotel on this site and spent a lot of time reading the reviews and so am pleased to be of help to any one else who is thinking of staying here . Do ! the location we found to be great. the coleseum is at the end of the street about a 4 min stroll. the street is quiet with plenty of local restaurants very close by. the metro stop is just across a busy road at the coleseum and there are plenty of taxis should you choose them for evening. the hotel will call them for you . we were too tired to walk at night having walked literally miles all day! the rooms are not huge but are just fine for a short stay, nicely furnished and very clean . the hotel has a modern minamilistic look. nice reception area with seats and a small bar , equipped with a friendly bar man.very pleasant receptionists, helpful and knowledgable. we were originally given a room next to the reception whch we found to be noisy so on the second night we moved to room 220 . there was no problem with this as they obviously had a spare room . our new room was next to the lift but we didnt find it to be at all noisy. yes the beds are firm but this we liked . the bathrooms are modern, bidet ,sink, toilet ,shower over bath., i mean how much time do you spend in your room whilst holidaying in rome !! breakfasts plenty and varied. balcony wonderful , bring your sunglasses to breakfast with you .. to conclude i would recommend this hotel and would return again. i think the hotel deserves the high rating it gets on this site. enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at the Capo D'Africa”
Reviews.Author: FredSmeggins
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a rather disappointing 3 night stay at the Capo D’Africa. Check-in went very smoothly, but our room (322) was right next to the lift shaft, which meant it was very difficult to get any sleep – especially with some people arriving and leaving the hotel at all hours. I complained at reception at 4am (having been woken up for the umpteenth time that night), and they agreed to change our room - the staff were very apologetic and the change was completed by 09:30. We were lucky that there was an alternative room available. The hotel rooms and bathrooms are on the small side, and the beds are very firm making sleep difficult (although this is a very subjective point). Although we were prepared for a lot of walking, there were times when the hotel location was a bit of a drag after a long day’s sightseeing (especially true after we had queued for 2 hours to get into the Vatican museum earlier in the day). On the positive side, the continental breakfast is very nice, especially if you can bag a spot on the roof terrace with views of the Colosseum. Overall, this is a nice enough hotel but my experiences there cannot justify a high rating. By the way, I would echo the recommendation for dinner at “Pasqualino”, less than 5 minutes from the hotel with good food and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Twin Bed Problem.”
Reviews.Author: MJS/CHS
Reviews.Content: We also had a problem with the twin bed situation. We booked our reservations 7 months in advance requesting twin beds as we are two female teachers on Spring Break. There was no space in our room for a roll out bed. They were not able to accomodate us further. Since it was Easter weekend our options were limited. Be warned, the beds are like rocks. The rooms were small but nice and the staff that we encountered were very nice although we were surprised when the bartender tried to serve us California wine. We had to laugh at that, being from CA. The hotel is in a nice quiet neighborhood with lots of restaurants and small grocery stores and it is very accessible to all of the attractions in Rome whether by bus, taxi, walking, or subway. We loved the roof top terrace where it was very pleasant to unwind with some wine after a hard day of walking. The cold buffet breakfast was nice also. Overall it was a very pleasant experience just be warned about the lack of twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Super Find”
Reviews.Author: RickyBon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo d'Africa at the end of April/beginning of May 2006, and would highly recommend it to all users. It is ideally situated on a quiet and pretty little backstreet very close to the Colosseum, comfortably away from the crowds and the horrendous traffic. This really is a big selling point of the hotel - after a hot and hectic day of sightseeing, it really is like returning to a cool and tranquil oasis of calm (as opposed to a bustling city centre hotel). All of the major sights are within walking distance of the hotel, although I must confess that my legs are still aching two days after returning! The hotel and its rooms are pretty, really nicely designed, and are clean and well thought out. Don't expect huge rooms, but do expect comfort and style. The bathroom was small, but had a great shower cubicle. If you need to relax and stretch out, head up to the beautiful roof terrace and order a drink. The service was on the whole excellent, particularly the welcome on arrival. However, we felt that the breakfast and bar service could generally be improved upon, which is why we are giving the hotel 4 stars (we think that it's roughly 4 and a half). Follow the tips on this website to head to Le Naumachie restaurant for at least one meal in the locality. The pasta dishes in particular were excellent, and the prices were very reasonable. Another good dining option is Vineria Il Chianti restaurant, on Via Lavatoria just up from the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay at Capo d'Africa!”
Reviews.Author: Lin_NewYork
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through TripAdvisor and were very pleased with our choice. Thanks to all those who have contributed their reviews which we found to be extremely helpful. The hotel was quite a distance from the city center. We took a taxi from Termini to the hotel and it cost us Euro 9. Even though I'm a brisk walker and enjoy touring the city by foot, I still found it too far to walk from the hotel to Vatican. Instead, we bought a 3-day unlimited Metro pass which only cost Euro 11. It's about a 10-minute walk from the hotel to the nearest metro stop Colesseo. The hotel was tastfully docorated and so was our room (103). It was in a quiet location. The real noise actually came from the cleaning ladies who were talking very loudly in the corridor one afternoon while we're taking a nap. The front desk staff were friendly except for one lady who seemed to be serving with an attitude. The buffet breakfast had a good selection and kept us full for at least half a day. The two ladies serving in the breakfast room were warm and friendly and made good cappucinos. Room service was efficient too. The staff came in split seconds right after we called. We have read reviews about the beds being too hard but we actually found them to be very comfortable. The pillows were a bit soft though. I also remembered someone writing about the toilet paper not being soft enough. The hotel has actually made improvements on that front. I couldn't say enough good things about their shower facilities - the water pressure was very powerful. We couldn't wait to try Le Naumachie before the trip after reading all the reviews that raved about the restaurant. We ended up having dinners there for four straight nights as they had demonstrated good quality, good quantity and was very reasonably priced. I truly missed their pastas! The hotel arranged a mini van to take us to FCO for Euro 50, including luggage and tips. As long as you don't mind the hotel being a bit off the city center, it's definitely a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Present to remember”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent a memorable weekend in the Capo d'Africa Hotel in Rome, Italy which was a 40th Wedding Anniversary present from our 3 children. We were welcomed by very attentive and friendly staff and shown to our room. A lasting memory will be taking breakfast on the terrace with a wonderful view of the Colosseum. The hotel is central for visiting all the many places of interest in Rome. We spent Friday afternoon at the Colosseum, just a few minutes from the hotel. On Saturday we took a taxi to St Peters Square (10 euros) and visited the Vatican and then with our trusty map we walked back via the Pantheon and the Piaza Navona. It was truly wonderful. The hotel was very spacious and our room was serviced to the highest standard (with lots of bathroom goodies including dressing gowns and slippers)- a nice touch. The staff were wonderful and nothing was too much trouble - especially tea for two in our room after a long day!!! We found a nice restaurant just round the corner - come out of the hotel - turn right and then right again and the Naumachie is over on the corner on the left. The waiting staff were very friendly and the food was absolutely gorgeous - especially the profiteroles!!! I cannot fault a single thing on our long weekend and would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a central location, excellent facilities and really friendly staff. Many thanks for a wonderful weekend to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Italy. I stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Capo d'Africa and loved it. The location has the best of both worlds, it is 5 minutes walking distance to the Colesseum and the double decker tour bus stop and yet it is in a quiet residential neighborhood. Lots of good, small, neighborhood restaurants in the area and a couple small grocery stores to for buying snacks, water, etc. The staff was extremely helpful. My daughter needed to see an eye doctor as she woke up the first morning with an eye infection and they immediately referred us to a specialist. The breakfast is served on the 4th floor on a terrace overlooking the rooftops and the Colesseum. We were fortunate enough to have good weather and were able to sit outside for breakfast everyday. I would highly recommend this small, comfortable hotel and would definitely return here on my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spanishfan
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It's bright, clean and spacious with friendly and helpful staff. Very nice cold buffet breakfast on the top floor, terrace overlooking Colosseum (5 minute walk). Rooms clean, sheets and towels changed daily. Had one issue with the hotel - one of the rooms we had booked was a twin, but we were given a double room (the beds don't divide up). They offered us an extra bed for the room, and changed us over to a twin as soon as they could. No problem. Used diyhols for taxi from Ciampino to hotel. Very easy to book, just pay driver on arrival at hotel. We ate close to the hotel in the evenings as we had walked a lot during the day. Il Bocconcino - turn Rt out of hotel, 2nd left and cross the road. Le Naumachie - turn Rt out of hotel, 1st Rt and then cross the road. Both delicious food and excellent service. Note if you are using Ciampino airport: Very limited facilities. Went through the security check to find only one snack bar flight side and not enough seating. Would definitely return to this hotel. It's not in a central location, but the Colosseum, Roman Forum and Piazza Venezia are a short step away. Rome is not a big city, so you can do a lot of the major sites on foot. We also used the No.110 open top bus (hop on/hop off) and the public buses (crowded but cheap!)

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: DiveInHeels
Reviews.Content: First, Rome is just such an amazing city that I can't imagine even a terrible hotel experience taking away from the pleasure of being in Rome. We did not have a terrible hotel experience during our 4-night stay at Capo d'Africa, instead a mixed review. The cons: -the air conditining didn't happen despite our daily 2 or 3 requests to fix it/make it work -the internet connection was "broken" our entire stay -the cleaning staff seemed very noisy quite early -the bed was HARD AS A ROCK, although a request for extra pillows did help -the bathroom configuration is the most bizzare,the door opens in to the tiny space and you have to edge around it to close it to use the commode -it was a 50-60 minute walk to Vatican area; 40 minutes to Spanish Steps area The pros: -the staff couldn't be more pleasant -it is steps away form the Collusium and Roman Forum -clean and spacious rooms by European standards (small bathroom) -very nice breakfast When in Rome I would highly recommend: -F.I.S.H. restaurant for dinner -Enoteche Costantini near Vatican for midday vino -pizza at piazza campo de' fiori (the little shop at the northwest corner of the piazza..got voted best pizza in Rome and it absolutely is) -a dining experience at La Pergola...dinner for two will run well north of $600-700 and worth every cent -all the little shops along via della scrofa, campo marzio, piazza navona -lunch at Obika, a mozzarella bar (via dei prefetti)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kauailover11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night as a transit hotel. My second visit to Rome in 17 years. The staff is welcoming, very helpful and attentive. My friend and I booked a Superior Twin Room however when we arrived, the room was a Double. The hotel was fully booked but the receptionist immediately ordered for an extra bed to be carried in the room, no hassle. The decor of the lobby is clean and modern but the room could have been (especially the curtains and the carpet)a little updated. Nonetheless the bathrooms were kept spotlessly clean, although on the smaller side with no ventilators so had to open up the windows after taking a bath. A tip if you are taking the hideous Roman taxis from the Termini. You will be surrounded by illegal drivers so beware--look for the licensed city signs printed on their car and check for the meters, if any of it is lacking, DO NOT GET IN. The taxi sign at the station will guide you straight to these guys so do not trust the signs ignore it! Those drivers will even tell terrible lies to you that a huge demo is going on in Rome (yes, suddenly )so I should not ride the metro and so on. Since Paris was on my mind (was there a week ago before entering Rome) I chose that cab. I was charged 30 Euros for a 5 minute drive and the driver was probably too scared to be busted(I complained) so did not pull up outside the hotel but left me about 100 metres away from it. The hotel receptionist told me the ride should have been 12 Euros or so AND THERE WAS NO SUCH DEMO. Anyway, my friend was also charged 80 Euros from the Airport to the hotel which seemed too expensive. We were feeling terrible so asked the hotel to book a nice restaurant nearby which turned out to be excellent. The next day we chose a restaurant on our own around the Colosseum that charged us too much (not only us but the people around were complaining too) so as for my recommendation, just stick to what the hotel recommends and do not go beyond that... If I am in Rome again, I would probably stay at the Capo d'Africa again, but will keep my eyes wide open for all those taxi drivers and the indecent restaurant owners!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simmrouter
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa for two (2) nights in March. We reserved a Deluxe Twin Room that was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast room on the top floor is beautiful, and the food was more than adequate including cereals, fruits and pastries. The hotel location is very good as it is close to the Coloseum and Roman Forum. The other important tourist sites are much farther walking distance away. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, and tour guides. There is indoor parking available at 25 Euros per day. We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Capo d'Africa, and I would recommend it highly for individuals and families.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: getitdonesoon
Reviews.Content: We returned from Rome on 22 March, had a great time having stayed 4 nights at Capo d'africa. Smart, comfortable, modern style hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. We recommend it. Following earlier reviewer's recommendation (thanks)we used diy-hols(-) to book taxi from and to airport, this was excellent,good value and went without a hitch. Rome is largely cobbled and very hard on the feet, do take comfy shoes with thick soles - there's a lot of walking to do!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent qaulity hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from 13 March. The hotel was very nicely decorated in a modern style and was immaculately clean. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were relatively spacious with a big bed, our bathroom had two showers - one over the bath and another walk in, and again both were spotlessly clean. The bed linen/towels were changed daily, and the beds turned down every evening - a nice touch. The buffet breakfast had plenty of choice and was obviously fresh and good quality. Whilst I have no negative comments about the hotel Rome itself is another matter. We booked a 'Terravision' coach (19 euros return through Easyjet) from the airport to the Termini (train station) which was an excellent service and a lot less hassle than trying to make the journey yourself. However when we reached the Termini and were unloading our suitcases we were immediately surrounded by 'taxi' drivers. I knew from the guide books that you should only use a white metered cab so this is what we did - and were charged 31 euros for a 12 euro fare! Word of warning.....when using a taxi make sure you see the drivers 'registration number' (on the back seat of the driver/passenger seat) and keep an eye on them to make sure they aren't discretely fiddling the meter. Secondly beware of drivers pulling up at the side of the road asking you for directions and then offering you a free gift e.g. an 'Armani rep' offering leather coats - believe me the gift is not free and definitely not Armani, they tend to get aggressive when you refuse. We found some of the Romans to be very aggressive and were subject to bad language a couple of times in the street - although they are obviously fluent in English and certainly know all of the swear words!!!! However despite the few negatives Rome itself is an amazing city for archeological/historical sites and I would strongly recommend a visit, and a stay at the Capo D'Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: grangetowers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at this great hotel, and couldn't fault it at all. The room was immaculate, and well presented, with an evening turn down service. The breakfast was a varied buffet in a light and airy terrace restaurant. The location was excellent, with everything in walking distance. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RunningZed
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel after a long search. Two blocks from the colliseum. Excellent location, lovely staff, clean and bright rooms with mod cons and a nice reception/bar area. Great breakfast with a wee terrace that you can even see the edge of the Colliseum from! Recommend this to anyone visiting Rome for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: n1952
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 days in February. What made the hotel for us was: 1.Entrance/Reception was bright and airy and the staff were courteous and most helpful. First impressions are always important. 2.Our room was warm and welcoming and during the stay was cleaned to perfection every day. It was a decent size and very quiet which made for a great nights sleep after a long days sightseeing. My only complaint would be the size of the bathroom - about 4 m2 at most I guess. It felt a little claustrophobic. 3.Buffet breakfast was good and again the environment was bright and the staff friendly. All in all I think this is a really good hotel in a great location. Close enough to many of the sites to be within walking distance yet away from all the hustle and bustle. I noticed a previous reviewer mention a restaurant nearby called Naumachie. We had a meal in it. I do agree it serves hearty roman food - nothing flash or fancy - at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Slugger21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Capo d'Africa for five nights in January. Our room was on the second floor - it was quiet and spacious. The breakfast served on the top floor of the hotel was amazing, and we looked forward to it each morning. The hotel location couldn't have been better. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. Another review on this website said the restaurants near the hotel were not so great. That is true, but it is not the hotel's fault: our guide book told us flat-out that the restaurants near the Colisseum were toursity and served mediocre but expensive food. Although we managed to find a couple of good restaurants near our hotel, we generally took the subway or a bus each night to a different neighborhood to eat dinner, which was more fun anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, modern, clean but cosy hotel. Excellent location for historic sights being 2 minutes walk from colosseum but in a quiet street. Staff welcoming and friendly. Nice buffet breakfast at the top of the hotel with great views across Rome. Would definitely stay there again. Our room was on the lobby level but wasn't noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Base In Rome”
Reviews.Author: nosittap
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed for 4 nights at the Capo I would strongly recommend this hotel. As a frequent traveller I tend to rate hotels by their comfort, the area and the service of the staff. The Capo scores highly on all counts. It is a sleek fashionable hotel which facilitates a good nights sleep and an ideal base to see the sights of Rome. The staff are unintrusive but always on hand to answer queries in a friendly and professional manner. I would also recommend 'Rome Limousines' for travel to and from the airport. We encountered the nightmare of finding we'd left a passport at the hotel when travelling to Ciampino. The driver rang the hotel, organised pick up straight away to enable us to get home. The Capo is a great hotel and worthy of the plaudits of other tripadvisor users.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for my 40th birthday with my wife and stayed at Capo d'Africa for 5 nights. The room was huge with comfortable bed and excellent facilities. Hotel staff were friendly, very efficient and helpful. Breakfast was excellent: take your time, relax, chill out over superb Italian coffee and pastries. Soya milk is available if you have a dairy allergy. The location was excellent: to see the Collosseum you only had to turn right outside the hotel and walk for 5 minutes. Reception will be able to recommend excellent local restaruants within walking distance. Enjoyed our stay tremendously and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal with least cost”
Reviews.Author: munimaya
Reviews.Content: I always thought that Rome was a hard place to find a good hotel for a reasonable price. Capo was not! For 150 euro a night (5 nights in total), my wife and I had the best experience ever had at hotels in Italy for the last 10 years. The hotel stands out in the old-fashioned neighborhood. The room was spacious (about 350sqf) with a balcony. Utilities and furniture are not glamourous but very modern, clean, and efficient. Air-conditioning is very comfortable. Taxi to/from Termini cost about 12 euro, but for other occasions we could walk around to find subway stations or bus stops quite easily. We ate at different restaurants near the hotel costing us around 50 euro for two. Unfortunately, we found none of them was above our expectation. That was probably because the neighborhood is not really the gourmet area and because the number of restaurants is limited. Other than that, I think the hotel is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 2 night trip to Rome staying at Capo d'Africa and would definitely recommend it. I chose the hotel mainly because of the great reviews on this site and wasn't disappointed (the trip was a surprise Christmas present for my husband). The hotel is situated in a quiet location very near the Collosseum and on first approach the street looks a bit dodgy, however it isn't and the hotel itself is located right at the end and looks just as nice as it does in the photographs. The reception staff and bell boy were very helpful, cheerful, knowledgeable and polite and always seemed to be smiling. Our room (323) was very clean and had a powerful shower in the en-suite. The room was tastefully decorated, had TV, mini bar, safe and hair dryer (and lots of mirrors!). The bed was really comfy (firm mattress but that's what I like) and complimentary bathrobe and slippers were also provided. The hotel was quiet at night and we slept well. Breakfast was on the top floor in a restaurant with a terrace (not open in January though!!) Breakfast was fine, selection of meat, cheeses, cereals, fruit and pastries. Location-wise we found the hotel to be excellent. Take comfy shoes -everything is within walking distance. 2 minutes walk to the Collosseum and Roman Forum, and about 5 minutes walk to the nearest underground station. A taxi down to the Spanish steps and main shopping areas cost about 7Euro (although easily walkable distance) and a taxi to the Vatican cost about 15Euro. You can book a taxi to the airport (Leonardo da Vinci) at reception for 50Euro - well worth it as the other option is taxi to the station and then train to the airport. The train costs 19Euro for 2 people. The taxi ride to the airport only took about 20 minutes. One day we took a taxi to the Vatican / St Peters and walked back via the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, shops and restaurants . It took us most of the day as we kept stopping to admire the fabulous buildings (and to eat pizza and drink Barolo!) but was fantastic. Don't miss the Vatican museum! All in all it was a great trip, and it was so nice to return to such a friendly and comfortable (and warm) hotel in the evenings after a hard (and very, very cold) day of sightseeing. We visited from 23rd to 25th January and it was FREEZING with a biting wind, although blue skies and bright sunshine the whole time. We live in Scotland, and (stupidly) weren't expecting it to be colder in Rome than at home, but next time we will bring hats and gloves with us. We would definitely stay at the Capo D'Africa again and would gladly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 4Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, contemporary, tucked in a side street near the colosseum. The rooms were a fair size and clean. staff friendly and helpful. You can see the colosseum from the breakfast terrace. The area around the hotel seemed safe.we walked to all sights from here, but you can get bus tickets and maps at reception. I would definatly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TANGO2222
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the hotel capo d'africa in rome on jan 21st 2006 for one night, i booked it through trip advisor for 135 euro normal price is 360 euro. It is definatly a four star hotel and if you have seen other so called four star hotels in rome you would agree but i would not pay any more than 135 euro. The rooms are large with an entrance hall and a very nice bathroom the breakfast is lovely and the location is great for visiting rome 20 mins walk from termini station (with backpacks!) it is right beside the colloseum with a great restaurant at the bottom of the street (heading back to the colloseum) on the left DEFINITLY RECCOMEND IT (BATHROBES AND SLIPPERS)

Reviews.Title: “Capo D'Africa is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballet_fan
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights. We chose it by looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor. The staff in the hotel were, without exception, courteous, welcoming, helpful and efficient. We arrived before the advertised check-in time and by the time we had enjoyed a cuppa in the bar, our room was ready and our bags had already been taken up. The room itself was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The decor was modern and very attractive. The breakfast buffet was super - I especially enjoyed the red orange juice. We enjoyed the location near the Coliseum and walked everywhere. It was great being able to walk through the Forum each morning to get to Piazza Venezia and onwards. The Forum is free and open till 1630 at the moment. It was the best possible choice for us. There was a super pizzaria just round the corner - a real family run with a wood oven. The pizzas were delicious and so cheap. The tiramisu was to die for. With wine, water and tip - less than £20 for the two of us! Unfortunately we do not know the name! Directions - turn right out of hotel, first right, over one junction and the sign says Trattoria/Pizzaria.

Reviews.Title: “It's been on the BBC holiday programme you know!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from our fourth visit to Rome but our first at the Capo d'Africa. We enjoyed a 3 night winter break and I have to say that this hotel is head and shoulders over the others we have stayed in during previous visits. In deciding upon this hotel, we read reviews of other contenders and formed a short list. One of the deciding factors was that the Capo d'Africa recently appeared on the BBC holiday programme with Lawrence Llewellyn Bowen and wife having stayed here. If it's good enough for the Llewellyn Bowens it's good enough for us! The hotel looks beautiful from the outside, particularly at night and the location is excellent, the Colosseum being at the end of the street the hotel sits on. The street itself is so quiet and the hotel a calming oasis. Excellent, modern decor - the interior photos do not actually do this hotel justice in my view - and the most courteous and friendly staff I have encountered in hotels in Rome. They were wonderful. We slept like logs in the comfortable rooms and who cares if the UK tv channel selection is solely Sky news - it's is a welcome change from BBC World (a baffling station... I'll not go into it here but the content of their coverage defies reason...) We will be returning to this hotel. Rome is wonderful, probably more magical in the winter but wrap up (lovely cold, crisp, sunny days whilst we were there). I would recommend this hotel to everyone - it will enhance your experience of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the Capo d'Africa Hotel on the merits of the reviews on the Tripadvisor site and can add my own positive one now having returned from our three night stay. Situated just 5 minutes walk from the Metro subway station and 2 minutes walk from the Colloseum (where you can conveniently jump on, and off, the circular open-topped tourist bus if you buy a day ticket (13 Euros)) the Capo d'Africa hotel is located at the end of a quiet street. The building is beautiful from the outside and right next to it is an ancient Roman building, full of character. The quiet streets nearby have a few bars, restaurants and cafes on them and there's also a bank autotellar machine and pharmacy. Our double room (108), on the ground floor was very spacious with a separate hall containing a fitted cupboard (with safe) and a separate bathroom with a really-powerful shower - perfect for easing your weary muscles after a hard day's sight-seeing. Nice extras like complimentary toiletries, rooms slippers and towelling robe help add to your comfort. The staff, without exception, were cheery, friendly, extremely helpful (without being 'in your face') and spoke perfect English. When we were shown our room, a few items from the previous guests were still in there but this was dealt with swiftly and with much apology and it really wasn't a problem. Everything had been cleaned and the room was spotless. Breakfast was served in a light and airy room on the fourth floor which has outdoor seating on the terrace with a view of the Colloseum over the rooftops. As we were there in January, this terrace wasn't used for meals but you could go outside to admire the view. Breakfast was great - choice of fresh fruit juices, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, pastries, cold meat, cheeses, breads, boiled eggs and choice of coffee, tea or cappucino brought to your table! Perfectly adequate and everything was fresh and tasty. Only quibbles about the hotel would be that you only have CNN and Sky News as free English-speaking channels on the TV but you have better things to do in Rome - or in your hotel room - than watch TV, let's face it! You can walk to the Piazza Venezia, in the centre of Rome - with the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and many other attractions within ten minutes' walking distance - within fifteen minutes of leaving the hotel. And it's a lovely walk, too, straight down from the Colloseum down past the Roman Forum ruins - what history! All in all, I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel as a base for a trip to Rome and its many, magnificent sights. I've thrown a coin in the Trevi Fountain and hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Capo D' Africa is an excellent hotel. My mother and I went on a 10 day trip of Italy in September 2005. We stayed in the Capo on the first three days of our trip and loved it. Our rome had a view to the little street that it is located on ( which by the way is a very short street, cute). The staff was very kind and spoke excellent english. We ate all types of excellent restaurants in the neighborhood and stopped at little supermarkets also located very near-by. It was very Italian experience walking through the neighborhood. We saw the colloseum every time we left the hotel, which also made it easy to know which way to walk back to our hotel. The Capo D' Africa is the only place I would stay in Rome. We also stayed at a hotel in Rome on the last two days of our trip that was also nice, but the neighborhood and general feel of the Capo is much better. The breakfast on the roof was great, everything was updated and in excellent shape. I have nothing but great memories of the Capo D' Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Facilites, Food and Staff”
Reviews.Author: macymo
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews on Rome Hotels I was unsure what to expect. But the Capo' D Africa hotel is brilliant, really modern light and airy, with a great breakfast room with and good breakfast buffet finishing at a relaxed 11.30am! The rooms are really nice, with firm beds, wonderfull showers and robes and slippers. Really good value. The location is in a sort of residential area but still has lots of little bars, restaurants and the colesuem and forum all within 5 mins walk. The restaurant round the corner called the le naumachie, a real popular place with locals and serving really good hearty rome italian food and wine. Tips for a great visit, walk everywhere, as we saw the best and found places just by walking, the buses could'nt figure out to pay so just hopped up without paying! The tourist bus is 13euros, but is a great point to start and get to see the city and get your bearings. go round at night the bus stops running at 8.30pm, and you get to see all the sites illuminated. The Rough Guide to Rome is also a great companinon for prereading and to take with you.

Reviews.Title: “a bit of sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Hotel contemporary in style. Beds comfortable due to special foam mattresses which are initially firm then mould to your body. Exceptionally clean. Staff were professional and friendly in manner. Enthusiastic and courteous when approached for anything. Calm atomosphere within was good contrast after cities crazy traffic and crowds. A very short walk from behind the Colosseum there are some bars/restaurants around area. Though hotel is not in the heart of most attractions or amongst the hustle and bustle it provides a good base to start and then retreat back to after being part of the herds. Ideal for business or pleasure it is hard to find criticism with this hotel but I suppose it depends what you want from your place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Rome at this hotel and had a great stay. The first plus point has to be how close it is to the Colosseum which you can easily walk to. The hotel was also very clean and the breakfast was good. But the biggest plus point for me was how friendly and helpful the staff were. Whether it be giving you directions to the sights or ordering room service they always seemed to go out of there way to help.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Capo D'Africa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo D'Africa for three nights in November 2005. It is very near the Colosseum(see if from the rooftop terrace) and Forum. A good location if you are interested in many of the ancient sites of Rome, old churches etc. A nice quiet, little neighborhood which felt very safe at night. Four or five restaurants around the corner. Had the best pizza of my life right around the corner from the hotel. A great little neighborhood place with mostly locals. The rooms were the largest we had on our trip to Europe, modern, and very clean. This is a newer hotel which completely meets American standards in every way. The front desk was very welcoming and helpful when we arrived and when we asked for restaurant suggestions. They also arranged a tour of Pompei for us. They sent out our laundry and it was back in our armoire by the end of the day. Breakfast was good but typical....cafes lattes, meat/cheeses, rolls, pastries, hard boiled egss, juices etc. Served in a nice room that also has a few outdoor tables... some with views of the Colosseum. I definitely highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, But Felt Out Of Place”
Reviews.Author: amp94596
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is modern and very well designed. The staff was friendly and very helpful making arrangements. It was one of the roomiest hotels we stayed in during a three week trip and was overall very comfortable. It's a "cool" place to stay and everything works and looks new. All in all a very comfortable experience. The only problem is that we felt, "out-of-it" due to the location. It is in a quiet little neighborhood near the colosseum but not much else. When we visited Rome a week later and stayed in a more central place we got a very different feel for the city. But it is quiet, which can be very, very nice. Just plan to grab a few cabs and to eat near the main attractions and you should get a more well rounded Roman Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for business and spent 7 nights at the Capo d'Africa and really enjoyed my stay. The room and bathroom were a good size, very clean. The breakfast buffet was good with a lot of choice and great coffee. Service was good and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the Colosseo and about a 20 minute walk from Via del Corso (one of the main shopping streets). There are a quite a few restaurants and bars in the area, as well as a few grocery stores. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not worth its excellent rating”
Reviews.Author: Cat8179
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of November for a long weekend. I agree with other reviewers that this hotel is in a good location and the double glazing is excellent and therefore the rooms are quiet. The hotel is very clean and the staff were very helpful. The room itself was a good size and the decor very modern. However, there were 3 problems with our room: 1. The bathroom door wouldn't close, after asking twice this was however fixed. 2. The Air conditioning was useless so the room was extremely stuffy. 3. The mattress had absolutely no give in it. Normally hard mattresses don't bother me, however this was so hard it affected my sleep and gave me a bad back. Breakfast was OK, lots of nice pastries and fruit. Overall this is aesthetically a nice hotel, but as far as having a good night’s sleep (what a hotel is basically for) it wasn't good. I wouldn't recommend it if I'm honest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Jardel33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in early December for five nights at this hotel. Location is great, just near to the colosseum and the roman forum, neighbourhood is quite nice and with a lot of good small restaurants. All other roman attraction are easily reachable from the hotel. Room was quite spacious and modern. Breakfast was average. The staff was quite friendly. I felt the price was excellent in comparison with the prices of other hotels in Rome of the same category. Definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Lcab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during our honeymoon in October. We originally booked 3 nights, but our room was flooded when we arrived so they sent us to their sister hotel near the Vatican. Once we finally stayed at the Capo d'Africa, we were very pleased. The neighborhood is fantastic. A great feel to it with great little restaurants. It's also so close to all the sites. We bonded with the staff and they were all very friendly. One front desk employee even lent us one of his books on Rome. The rooms were very modern and beautiful. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near the colosseum”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler48
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in early December. I really enjoyed the hotel. The location is about 3 short blocks from the colosseum. My room was a single but fairly large for Europe. The hotel itself was fairly new and seemed well maintained. Some other reviewers noted that the location was away from main tourist areas such as the Vatican and Via Veneto, but its very close to ancient Roman ruins which are one thing I really wanted to see. A subway stop is on the other side of the colosseum so its not difficult to get to any major location in Rome. The hotel neighborhood has a lot of small restaurants and bars which aren't touristly (a plus) and the people are very friendly. Breakfast was good, a cold buffet, nothing really special but not bad. I thought the price was reasonable, service was good and friendly, and the location very good. I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel with convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: kmbmommy
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Capo d'Africa Hotel. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in late October/early November and were very impressed with the size and cleanliness of our room. We had a corner room which had windows on two walls which made the room very light and bright. The room also had very high ceilings which made it seem more spacious. The bathroom was a bit small, but the best part about it was it had a shower curtain that actually kept the water in the tub (as opposed to the other hotels we stayed in while in Italy!) The water pressure was good. Our sink tended to back-up while brushing our teeth, but we never complained about it during our stay. They had lovely toiletries, big fluffy towels, slippers (2 pair) and a bathrobe (only 1). The bed was fine, but they did only provide two small pillows. The linens were nice and they double-sheeted. The common areas were very well-maintained. The breakfast buffet was served on the top floor and you could sit and have a view of the Colosseum while eating. They had the most delicious turkey cold cuts at their buffet and everything else was fresh and plentiful. The location of the hotel is very convenient to the Colosseum, the Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, and Circus Maximus. There is a metro stop at the Colosseum which is about a 5 - 10 minute walk from the hotel. We found this to be very convenient for getting to other parts of the city. We ate at a couple restaurants in the area (Hostaria Isidoro and La Pasqualino). They were decent, but not anything to write home about. We were actually disappointed with the food in Italy as a whole. I must also agree that the front desk staff were a bit off-putting when asked for directions/help beyond using their recommended tours. We were given the incorrect bus number for visiting the catacombs. Having done some research before our visit, however, we did not really need too much assistance during our visit. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and family and would stay here again the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the basis of the reviews on the Trip Advisor site and wasn't disappointed. The hotel is a lovely collonial style building on a quiet back street, perfect for escaping the noise of the city. It is only a 2 minute walk from the colleseum and the area surrounding the hotel has lots of really good restaurants, so no problems finding somewhere to eat in the evenings. The Staff were very friendly, the room on the small side but perfectly formed. We loved the roof-bar, perfect to relax and listen to the chilled music and enjoy a drink. The only thing I would advise is not to bother with food at the hotel, it's not great and there are so many good restaurants nearby there really is no need to. There is a really nice restaurant directly opposite the colleseum where you can sit on the terrace upstairs - what a view! I went there for my birthday , wine was excellent and on request from my lovely boyfriend the pianist sang happy birthday to me Italian style!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Capo d'Africa for 3 nights and were very impressed. We were recommended the hotel by friends and the reviews on this site backed up our decision to stay here. The hotel is decorated in quite a modern way - but tasteful. In the vicinity there are a number of good restaurants, so the fact that it's not right in the centre of the tourist district is not a problem. It was quiet, no noise from passing traffic, staff were friendly (especially the barman), room was clean and of an adequate size (bathroom well equipped, good shower). On the roof is a terrace and breakfast is served up here. We loved it and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis amongst the chaos!”
Reviews.Author: Fozzie_001
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 2 nights at the Capo d'Africa. It was my first time in Rome and I had read just about every review on this website before going - so was hoping it would be good but the place excelled all expectations. The hotel is on a non-descript little road just 2 minutes from the Colosseum. The road is nothing to write home about but the hotel is beautiful! From the minute you walk up the steps you feel like you've found a little piece of calm in an otherwise crazy city. The staff were wonderful, whilst they were checking us in one of the reception staff produced a map for us and circled all the places to go to and walking distances involved. They booked us a meal for the first night at the Papagagio (spelling?). (As another reviewer said - it is pretty expensive given it's off-beat location. The food was good, but not amazing). The rooms are lovely and although you can hear a bit of noise (we were on the ground floor - room 105) it's nothing really noticable. Breakfast is great. Couple of very minor things - the beds are very hard! They only give you 2 tiny pillows so ask for more at reception. Also - it was my boyfriends birthday whilst we were there. I'd mentioned it by email to teh hotel before we arrived and apparently it was 'noted'. But there was no mention of it. Even a little note on teh bed saying Happy Birthday would have been an nice touch. Minor details though. Go there! We will go back when we return. Yes it's a little bit of a walk to the 'main attractions' like the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain etc - but having witness the crowds and not seen one hotel we liked there - we feel we got the best out of Rome by staying in the Capo d'AFrica. (And I'm very fussy!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but service with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in Sept. While the hotel rooms were among the best we stayed at in Italy, the service at the hotel was lacking. The front desk woman on duty both nights we were there had a attitude problem, almost to the point of being rude. Other staff would say they would follow-up on requests, but didn't. In addition, I found not all the bell staff spoke English. I couldn't recommend this hotel because who wants to pay its rates for no service or service with an attitude. In addition, other than the Collisuem and Roman Forum, you are a far walk from where most of the restaurants are, near the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Don't eat at the restaurants directly in front of the Colliseum... they are definetly a tourist trap rip-off. You'll see the waiters standing in the street trying to get you to eat there. Don't be trapped. For the price we paid to eat there (with no wine or dessert), we had wine, dessert,entrees, everything for less near the Pantheon. A hotel is more than just a room. It's the service that counts for a lot, and this hotel's isn't up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: NYCandworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Capo D'Africa the week of November 5th through the 11th. As many have noted, some things were quite good. For instance, the breakfast served is impressive, and the rooms are large and clean by European standards. For the most part, the staff spoke poor English. This surprised me based on other reviews, and was a dissapointment. The location is out of the way for most attractions. I usually prefer to be off the beaten path, but in a more lively spot. The area around the hotel is quiet at night, and there are a few very good restaurants nearby. But if you want to head out, it will be a 20-30 minute walk or a cab ride to most central places. The air conditioning was also turned off prior to my arrival, which made for a somewhat uncomfortable experience a few of the nights. Finally, the hotel only has 2 english tv stations, CNN and Skynews. Most hotels in Rome offer satellite service with more stations. This is not a huge issue in that I didn't go to Rome to watch tv, but at times it would have been nice had more been offered. All in all, this is a good hotel but not a 5 star. I would probably pick a more central location upon my return.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel Capo D'Africa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from the 4 november. Everything was as has been reported in previous reviews. I had booked the hotel through BA hotels and about a week before we left I emailed the hotel to make sure I had a double non-smoking room and if I could upgrade to a superior room and what the additional cost would be. Well, I received an email confirming this and the upgrade to a superior room cosy me nothing, superb. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and big. 5/5. The surrounding area is quite and has lots of bars and places to eat, and at reasonable rates as well. Le Naumachie was only 7euros for a litre of wine. The last night we went to the ristorante papagio at 26 via D'Africa, the bottom of the road, and we had some excellent seafood and i would recommend the risotto. Although the final bill would have fed us for 3 nights it was well worth it. One tip is that there is a bar around the corner where you can buy beer,water, sandwiches etc for a lot cheaper than the minibar in the room. Rome itself is a wonderful city, both ancient and modern. Also, most places speak english although it is worth the effort to try and speak a little italian as it is appreciated. We went to the football on the saturday night and missed the last metro, but we got a taxi who took us back to the hotel for 12Euros, which is not bad for a midnight on a saturday.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goonerbern
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from visiting the beautiful city of Rome between 4th November and 9th November. We stayed at the Capo D'Africa after reading the reviews on this website and were certainly not disappointed with any aspect of the hotel. The previous excellent reviews were totally accurate in every respect. The hotel was very comfortable with a warm friendly atmosphere whilst also being clean and a convenient base for walking to all of the major attractions. The Vatican being the furthest away was reached after a leisurely 40 minute stroll whilst the Colloseum was reached within 5 minutes. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful during our stay. The breakfast was excellent and in the evenings we dined at the local Trattoria ( turn right on leaving the hotel, take the first right and it's situated on the corner on the left hand side with a green illuminated sign above) which served lovely meals. It was busy every evening confirming it's popularity with both tourists and locals. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anybody seeking a holiday in Rome and would like to thank all of the staff for their help and advice which made our visit so memorable. At the end of our stay the hotel arranged for us to be driven to Ciampino airport in a Mercedes at a cost of 50 euros. Do not be afraid to use this facility as an ordinary cab from the airport cost us more on our arrival,and we had to wait for nearly an hour before securing one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traimartin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Capo d'Africa for 3 nights in October. This was our first time in Rome and this Hotel really made our break special. It's modern, clean, the staff are friendly and the breakfast is plentiful. We were advised (by our Italian friends living in England) that the Capo d'Africa was too far from the main tourist sites but we walked to them all. Admittedly, the leisurely walk beside the river to The Vatican took us an hour but we got to see more of the city. My advice - go early to all the attractions. The queues for The Vatican and The Colosseum were long even at 10am. Ice cream from street vendors is expensive. Rome seemed to have a problem with beggars. I nearly had my panini statched out of my hand by one women.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Capo Di Africa”
Reviews.Author: fccrunch
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel week of October 31st. Great Hotel. My wife and I first visit to Rome. Hotel is bery nicely decorated inside and out. Very stylish and chic. Room was modern, mid sized, with a queen bed. Bathroom had a nice size tub with a shower and a bidet. Staff was fairly friendly, by Roman standards, which means they do not fall over themselves to be attentive. Exception was the front desk person Ciara. She was a doll. Always smiling, very warm. Breakfast Buffet was typical Roman style. Cheeses, slice cold meats,(Turkey, Salami, Ham, good quality) boiled eggs, Bread,(sliced bread, rolls, packaged toast), fresh sliced fruit, Great Pastries, and cereal, juice, and yogart. Nice selection. You also get cofee, although if you want more than one cup you have to chase down the server. The city of Room requires hotels to turn off the A/C on Nov 15th.
