This hotel did turn their's off on Nov 3rd without notice so the room became hot and I woke up in the middle of the night since the A/C was blowing out warm air. They could have told us so I would have opened the window and turned off the A/C unit. The bed was a bit firm, no bounce at all, and the hair blow drier was installed in the tummy drawer of the desk by the bed, which meant we had to pull the curly cord out of the desk drawer while sitting down drying our hair and the drawer kept on springing open, which was funny and annoying at the same time. The hotel is located a few blocks off the Colosseo so if you like ancient ruins this is the place for you. If you are looking for shopping ie Spanish Steps area, or fountains, like Trevi or markets like Campio de Fiori, it is a bit of a hike from the hotel or about 10 Eur by taxi. They are very good about calling one. 5 min wait every time. Overall we paid 200 Eur a night including taxes for 6 nights and I felt it was a good deal. Be careful of the mini bar since prices are high. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having such a nice hotel really made the trip for us. The rooms are modern, clean and spacious. The staff were friendly, spoke English and couldn't do enough for us. As soon as we arrived, they offered us a map of Rome, pointed out the locations of everything to see, suggested additional tours etc. We asked them to book taxis, make restaurant reservations, requested additional items for our room - and all were done quickly and efficiently - the only thing they couldn't manage to secure for us was tickets to the opera, but that was because the showing was cancelled ! The roof top terrace is great for a brandy and cigar at the end of the night - and whilst the breakfast terrace is a little small - it's only a matter of timing to get a seat on there. Service at breakfast was good - they did run out of things, but when we mentioned it to the staff, they soon rectified the situation. The only downside to the hotel is that it is at the bottom of the city, and most of the attractions are a bit of a walk, but to compensate you get a really quiet hotel with a good nights sleep. This wasn't the best hotel I've ever stayed in, but it was a good one and definitely value for money and had all the elements that I find important in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic four night stay”
Reviews.Author: Sezza71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo d'Africa for 4 nights in June '05 for our first wedding anniversary and enjoyed every moment. The hotel has excellent bedrooms & bathrooms and a nice bar. Breakfast on the terrace was great and the choice of food very good too. The location is suited to those who do not mind walking 20-30 mins to many of the attractions - and who could complain about walking in such a beautuful city anyhow ??? The Vatican is easily reached by metro and the Colosseum is obviously on the doorstep. We would recommend the Trastevere area for great food & atmosphere. As long as you do your research into the hotel's location, I would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a combination of Expedia and TripAdvisor we chose this hotel for our 3 night city break in Rome. We being 34, 30 and 5 year olds! Everything about our trip was first class with The Capo d'Africa being the icing on the cake. Modern, clean and a welcome oasis of tranquility after the full on noise, hustle and bustle of a typical day in the city. The room was a good size with a huge queen sized double and a z-bed for our son. The room was cleaned every day plus a turn down service in the early evening. Yes, our bathroom was small but the shower was double size and powerful and anyway what do you need acres of space in there for anyway!? Reception staff where more than friendly at all times with a ciao or bon jorno each time we came in or went out. I must say that having a 5 year old son in Rome is like having a golden ticket, Italians love children and will bend over backwards to help you. People gave up there seats on the metro and were very welcoming everywhere we went. I think it helped by using polite greetings, thankyou's etc in italian. This courtesy seemed to be very appreciated, note we had never spoken Italian or been to Italy before this trip. All the sites are reachable on foot, though you will need to be fit to cover everything. We used the Metro which costs only 1 Euro to reach the Spanish Steps (15 mins door to door) and Vatican (25 mins). Walking back via Pantheon, Trevi Fountain then along the Forum to the Colloseum was a delight. We did this day and night, e.g. after eating at Edy's near Spanish Steps we walked back at 11 o'clock at night, via the floodlit Trevi in around half an hour. We felt safe the whole time and did not encounter any trouble on the whole trip. Bare in mind I wouldn't walk around my native Newcastle at night with my 5 year old!! We took a taxi (arranged by reception, came in 5 mins) to Piazza Navona at 10 Euros then had dinner at Tre Scalini. Soaked up the atmosphere of the piazza (very Covent Garden) then strolled back via The Pantheon, again about 35 - 40 mins as a slow walk, including ice creams. The best pizza tratoria we found in Rome happened to be 50 yards from the Hotel, just around the corner! Le Namouche (not exact spelling) was full of italians, atmosphere and good cheap food. Thanks to an earlier reviewer who recommended this place! Rome felt safer than any other city I've been to, though it has more tourist scammers than any. Flower sellers, fake designer label sellers, fake gladiators charging 10 Euros each for a picture taken on your own camera, etc. Don't make eye contact and don't accept anything 'free'. Ignore them though and they dont hassle you. This year we have been lucky enough to visit Nice, Paris, Geneva, London, Boston and now Rome. The Capo d' Africa Hotel will be the first thing we book when we return, which judging by the amount of coins thrown in Trevi fountain by my son, will be very soon indeed. Hope you all enjoy your own trips as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Caps raised to the capo”
Reviews.Author: rugbyman63
Reviews.Content: Stayed back in the summer and meant to review the hotel when I got back but time drifts away - I was prompted to write by some of the negative feedback from some of the more recent guest. Having stayed in a number of hotels in Rome and other capital cities the capo gives you an oasis of calm. The rooms have excellent soundproofing, great air-conditioning and plenty of facilities and space if you are using the hotel as a base for exploring this incredible city and do not intend to be closeted in your room for much of the day. The breakfast is great with a fabulous choice and one half of the patio does look over the coliseum, obviously not everyone can sit in the prime positions but is this not the case in any facility. The capo is a modern designed hotel which does have a bar area for drinks plus it has a fabulous roof terrace which can be used for dining and has waiter service until 12.midnight. Indeed my one complaint is that this is not highlighted more, as we were usually the only guest using the terrace on our stay. I found the service excellent at all times with the desk and bar always staffed with English speaking assistants, though maybe the night porter may not have been fluent it is surely not in his job description and the night desk manager was always present when we returned. Indeed as we were travelling independently the staff spent ages sorting out our train journey to Sorrento. The location is surprisingly quite given its vicinity to the coliseum and is surrounded by some fabulous local restaurants which are packed with locals. Of course if you want to eat opposite the coliseum then be prepared to be exploited as a tourist just like anywhere else in the world. Admittedly the hotel is not bang in the middle of the main tourist destinations but you can get a tube from outside the coliseum (about 1/2 mile away) costing 1 or 2 euros and get off at the Spanish steps and walk back to the hotel via the trevi, pantheon, piazza navone, etc (sorry about the spellings). All in all the capo is a fantastic hotel and I would not think of staying anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.......”
Reviews.Author: SueDeal
Reviews.Content: It took a lot of searching to find a hotel in Rome that offered everything we wanted and we certainly weren't disappointed with our choice. From the moment we arrived we found all the staff at Capo d'Africa to be friendly, attentive and extremely helpful. The room was bigger than we expected for Rome and, even though the bathroom was a bit small, the standard of the accommodation certainly matched the hotel's star rating. The housekeeping in our room was excellent........we even had our towels changed twice a day and all supplies were kept fully stocked. The breakfast on the roof top terrace was particularly magical, overlooking the Colleseum whilst eating your cornflakes is something special!!! When it came to eating out in the evenings the barman was a fount of information and pointed us to some wonderful family-run restaurants which didn't cost the earth but served fabulous Roman cuisine. (Incidently for anyone interested the barman learnt his English in Geordie Land, so obviously has a strange accent!). This hotel really made our trip to Rome even more special and although it is slightly out of the central area of the city we wouldn't hesitate to stay there when next in Rome on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: LLKTL
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 4 nights here in August, found staff to be cheerful, courteous and very helpful with any info/help we needed. Great modern decor, lovely roof terrace to enjoy on an evening. Room wasn't huge, bit of squash walking round bed, but nevertheless was immaculate, extremely clean and comfortable, with fine en suite facilities. (Sound-proofing between rooms excellent - couldn't even hear our friends' phone ring in next room to us!) Would certainly recommend and return. Is in a great location near colloseum, taxi rank and metro nearby and plenty of good places to eat in nearby streets.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it is cracked up to be....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Rome for 4 nights; the beginning of our 2 week vacation in Italy. I read the reviews for this hotel and thought it sounded wonderful....until we actually checked into the place. I was very disappointed at the room size, especially the tiny bathroom in our room. My husband and I could not be in the bathroom at the same time...there was no room for the both of us. The cleaning ladies were SO LOUD in the morning that they were our unwanted wake-up call! Unfortunately, our room was right next to the maids closet/cleaning room on the 2nd floor, so if you stay there try not to get that room! The staff were nice and the breakfast terrace had a nice little view of the colosseum. One morning the hotel's electricity was out for a few hours! Lastly, an outlet that the t.v. and small light plugged in to was not working. I had to tell them 3 times (in the course of a day and half) to get someone to fix it....until then we had no t.v., light, and no blow dryer (and a girl needs her blow dryer!) I liked staying near the colosseum area, but like another reviewer stated, the restraurants around the colosseum are WAY overpriced and the quality is not too great! All in all, Capo D' Africa was WAY overpriced for the stay! When my husband and I return to Rome, we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they said was true!! -- Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jphjordan
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome for the first time in September with a friend before we embarked on a 12-day cruise of the Meditarranean. I decided on the Capo D'Africa after extensive research of the previous reviews posted on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is situated about 3 blocks from the Coliseum and a cab ride or subway ride to other attractions. The Hotel itself was wonderful -- very modern and immaculate with a European Art Deco design. The rooms were very comfortable (especially the bed) and had all of the well appointed amenities i.e., mini-bar, bathrobes, slippers, toiletries, bidet, safe, cable television. The continental breakfast served on the rooftop was extra special with a good selection of breakfast items. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. They assisted me even before I arrived in Rome through emails arranging for our transportation by private car from the airport to the hotel. You cannot go wrong with selecting this hotel for your Rome experience. I will stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Stoddardhowell
Reviews.Content: Even though this review is a little late - I was prompted that I hadn't sent one in. Our stay at Capo D'Africa was a wonderful experience. Great location - easy walking distance to all attractions and simply a haven to come back to after walking around Rome. The staff are so helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. Drinks in the evening in the foyer were great and canapes an added bonus. Room Service was fantastic as well. The rooms are spacious, clean and simply the best in Italy! The reviews on Trip Advisor were valuable and enabled us to make a decision to stay here. We would stay here again. The limousine service of the hotel was another great feature - being picked up at the airport and dropped off was worth the money. This took away any frustrations with travelling in and out of Rome - thank you Capo D'Afrcia - great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluezdoc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice/Florence/Rome. Capo by far the most modern of our hotels, nice lobby and amenities. You can actually only see the colosseum from one side of the terrace on the fourth floor. The breakfast was the best of our trip. As stated, the hotel is a little distance from the central district i.e. Pantheon/Trevi area, but it was nice for a change to be outside the main tourist drag. Certainly they were within walking distance, though we did take a taxi to the Vatican one morning, and Borghese another. We would then leisurely walk back to Capo. On the other hand, the hotel is right by "ancient Rome", with wonderful views of the ruins and the colosseum. Hotel staff very friendly. Major plus- actually a fitness room with treadmill/stepper/bike/some weights. Beats running on uneven cobblestone streets and dodging Vespas! Picked this hotel after positive reviews on Advisor; our carpet was slightly stained, otherewise room was clean with modern bathroom. Overall excellent staff, luxurious from what we've seen of most hotels in this price range, would highly recommend. We did have advance reservations for all the major museums- Uffizi,Accademia(David),Vatican, and Borghese-these are imperative to save hours waiting or get in at all!

Reviews.Title: “TRULY PLEASANT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After researching for weeks to find a hotel that didn't have any negative reviews I came across the Capo D'africa which did not disappoint. The hotel is not right in the heart of the City so noise is at a minimum, a problem with many other hotels in the City, but it is still near to everything. It was literally a 3 minute walk to the Colisseum and a leisurely walk or short bus ride away from all the main attractions. Although this was a fairly expensive Hotel you had the benefit of some lovely tratorrias just around the corner from the hotel which were unbelievably well priced considering everyone had said how expensive Rome is. The Naumecherie for one was excellent, we had 2 main courses, a bottle of house red, a bottle of water and a basket of bread all for 20 euros and it was delicious authentic Italian cuisine. When we ate nearer to the tourist spots the food was very basic but twice the above price. So the money we paid for the hotel was balanced by the cheap but splendid restaurants nearby. The hotel itself was clean and beautiful with extremely good rooms and helpful staff. The breakfast was continental with a great choice of breads, cheeses, meats, cereals, yoghurts, fruit, pastries etc. And what better way to start your day than to eat on the roof terrace surrounded by lemon trees with the Roman sum beating down. My one bit of advice for a visit to Rome is to beware the taxi drivers. We got a taxi to the theatre from our hotel and it was 20 euros, the same journey back was only 6!!! He'd taken us around the houses obviously so he could rip us off. Note that the Hotel provides a car which will take you to the airport for 50 euros so you haven't got the worry of being ripped off. We only found this out by accident but were relieved that we didn't have to be subjected to the Grand Turismo journey we'd endured on the way. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Despite my mother and I having our purses pick pocketed on the first day near the Trevi Fountain - another thing to be EXTRA VIGILANT about - I could not fault Rome. It is the most interesting, beautiful and breathtaking place I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: C&DLowe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa from the 24-26th September. I chose the hotel based on the many positive reviews written on this website. It is absolutely stunning, beautifully decorated & very clean and spacious. Only slight criticism was that our room was next door to the restaurant, so we were disturbed a little first thing in the morning....not too bad a thing though, as we got up, enjoyed a delicious breakfast and started out to explore the sights nice and early! The location is great. Nice and quiet, tucked away in a peaceful residential area, yet only 2 minutes away from the colloseum, which is awe-inspiring! We were lucky as all the major tourist attractions are free to enter on the last sunday of every month, so we only had to pay 4 euros each for an audio guide! Word of warning about the traffic...drivers have no regard for pedestrians whatsoever..even on the crossings...you generally just have to walk and hope for the best that they will at least slow down for you..(they don't stop!!)... We tended to use the underground metro system for longer journeys, such as to the Vatican, but we walked just about everywhere...the mix of old and new architecture is unbelievable and the locals are so lucky to live in such a beautiful, vibrant city...If you don't enjoy your stay in Rome, you simply haven't lived!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad of the Capo”
Reviews.Author: Hofmeister
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I chose to stay at the Capo D'Africa during our trip to Rome. The staff at the hotel were friendly and spoke very good English. They were helpful in pointing out which things to see, and restaurants in the vicinity. At check-in they even had a map ready for us, and took a great deal of time explaining to us how to get from place to place, the location of major attractions etc. The exterior of the hotel is beautiful and the lobby is held in a minimalistic/modern style. Very tasteful. The room, however, was smaller than expected and in our opinion slightly overpriced even by Roman standards. The carpet was dirty, worn and spotty. This may seem like a minor thing, but at 300 USD a night, this is unacceptable. Looking at the fire escape plan in our room, it looked like we had gotten the smallest room on the floor, so we might have been unlucky. The hotel is located very close to the colosseum in a very cultural/historical part of the city. We found out during our stay however that we preferred the area around the Pantheon more due to the nicer restaurants and the more lively atmosphere there (this of course isn't the hotel's fault, but we will be staying in a more central location if we come to Rome again). As another reviewer recommended, do not eat at restaurants in the near vicinity of the hotel. We ended up in what appeared like a charming restaurant, but the food was mediocre. The restaurants in Trastevere and near the Pantheon were much nicer. All in all, a pleasant stay: very nice service, but room slightly disappointing, and had we known how long it took to get the the 'center', i.e. nice restaurants and a more lively neighbourhood, we would prob. not have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Inksllinger
Reviews.Content: Just adding my rave review to the others for Capo D'Africa. Room was modern, well decorated and very, very clean... and the king size bed a welcomed sight after our long flight from JFK. Staff was friendly and helpful...directed us to a nice little cafe for dinner. The a.m. breakfast buffet far exceeded our expectations and the rooftop terrace cafe was scenic and romantic. Very convenient to the Colisseum but a bit out of the way for the main attractions. But, we thought the taxis were reasonably priced so that wasn't a big problem for us. I thought for the money this was an outstanding smaller hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the honeymooners...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, what can i say! This hotel was fantastic. We planned to stayed here during our first week in Italy for our honeymoon and after a 30 minute taxi ride from the Rome (Ciampino) airport, we were ready to check out our hotel. Opon arrival, we were really impressed to see a fantasic looking, immaculate building, which apparently is only 3 years old since a complete renovation! We entered the building into a beautiful, architect's designed foyer - all open plan, which comprised of a modern bar to the left and a soft seating area to the right, comprising of a series of colourful leather sofas and very modern artwork, which was all over the walls. We were then warmly greeted by the staff who showed us to our room. The concierge then delt with our cases. The room was a Double Deluxe which was large. It was extremely comfortable and the modern theme of the hotel continued into the rooms, it had all the amenities you would require, all of which were of a high standard. I liked the large walk in marble shower - which was better than any I have had before. The breakfast room was fantastic. It was housed on the roof of the building in a contemporary, two sided glass room which had french doors either side out on to two large terraces.(from one of the terraces you had a view of the coloseum!) The breakfasts were of the highest standard of service and quality. Incidentaly, all the staff, I must say were excellent and so friendly. Especially the lovely Juliette! She made you feel very welcome each morning and made the best cappucino in Rome! The Hotel is set in the old, quiet area of the city just tucked out the way on some side streets (via capo d'africa), two blocks from the Coloseum and the tourist buses, which take you around the city. It also has several good restaurants situated locally where locals and tourists alike eat. A cracking, quiet, modern designed hotel. Which we loved. If we ever have to come to Rome again - we will definitely stay at the Hotel Capo d'Africa. It was immaculate - well done guys!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to our magical honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Again (Like Ai Mori D'Oriente in Venice) we chose Hotel Capo D'Africa from its rating and reviewson this site and again they were completely justified and the hotel exceeded expectations. We stayed for 5 nights at the end of a fantastic honeymoon. From beginning to end, the service at the hotel was superb - couldn't fault it. From receptionists to chambermaids to the breakfast staff - they were all so smiley and friendly. The room was brillliant and we got very lucky. Pay for Room 308 if you can!! It is a large suite with hallway and deluxe bathroom and open the windo lean out and you can see the Colosseum!!! A total bonus and so thrilling! The room was perfect, serviced daily with fresh luxuries. Best of all is breakfast. Gorgeious pots of coffee or chocolate, cereals, breads, yoghurts, fruits, desserts! and best of all the most DELICIOUS filled croissant!! We sat out on the terrce, one side of which has a fantastic view of the Colosseum - its just incredible. The hotel's location was a real winner for us. After hearing stories of many hotels either being in the mucky suburbs or in a noisy street in the city centre we chose the Capo D' Africa becuase of its quiet location near Ancient Rome. Boy we we pleased, such a quiet street but yet so close to many good resturants and 2 minutes from the Colosseum, therefore 5 minutes for Domus Aurea, Fora, Palatino and then on into the city centre. We LOVED the walk to these places and you just keep walking and 20 minutes later you're at the Trevi Fountain! (Thats if you can stay moving past the awesome sights!) Rome has so much to offer and apart from the odd smell and very many immigrant sellers its a fabulous place to spend time and lap up the history. Can't wait to go back - we shall be trying to stay in Room 308 at the Capo D' Africa!! I need that chocolate croissant, and delicious pot of coffee whilst gazing at the Colosseum! Great hotel, thouroughly recommended. Nice bar and lounge area downstairs which we didn't have time to chill in as we were so busy!

Reviews.Title: “Capo D'Africa a Winner”
Reviews.Author: Jane from Spokane
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here in August for one night pre-cruise. We had two rooms, small by American standards but very comfortable, clean, quiet, and nicely decorated. We especially enjoyed the breakfast on the beautiful top floor terrace. The location was great - we easily walked to the coloseum, forum, and pantheon. Staff was very helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Exceptional and Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Superlatives are not enough to describe this hotel. This hotel was fantastic. We had a deluxe double room. The room was large, clean and modern. The bathroom was large with a window and very clean. The hotel also offered a turn down service which made the stay that little more personal. The hotel staff were exceptional. We had booked a table at "Les Etoiles Restaurant" at the Atlante Star Hotel (word of warning - do not go there -overpriced and very pretentious staff in the restaurant). We were running late but the reception (Chiara) rang the restaurant to let them know we were late and also printed off directions to the restaurant so we could find it. They were also very helpful in suggesting places to go in Rome that were off the tourist trail. Breakfast was excellent although my only comment is that no-one at the hotel told us we could also order dinner there (as we would certainly have eaten there). Location was fantastic. 5 minutes walk to the Colosseum and Metro station. 117 bus stop (which takes you to Via Del Corso - the main shopping street and all the tourist sights) around the corner from the hotel. One day travel card costs €4 which can be used on trains and buses. Hotel is also in a very quiet location. No noise outside which was excellent. We threw our coin into the Fontana Di Trevi, so when we return to Rome, we will definately be staying at the Capo D'Africa.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa recently and were extremely pleased. The room was lovely and definitely large enough for the two of us, with two twin beds, as requested. The beds were very comfortable. All of the hotel staff were extremely accommodating. The front desk staff arranged a guide for us (with only a few hours' notice) as well as a relatively inexpensive taxi service to the airport. Breakfast is served from 6:30 am to 11 am, and the meal itself was fantastic - beautiful fresh fruits, delicious pastries, etc. The rooftop terrace was delightful; we had drinks up there both evenings. It was very relaxing. The fitness room was a real plus, as I had been away from home (and had not worked out) for a week by the time we arrived in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: capitalstereo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are modern, large, well designed, clean and comfortable without any reference to the bad touristy kitsch so often seen in italian hotels. I would definitely stay again. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. The location is good for tourists - near to the colosseum and all of the main sites. The one note of caution I would sound is that some of the restaurants nearby are definitely for tourists only overpriced and with awful food. I would recommend la pasqualino, which is one street over if you must eat near the colosseum. The food there is authentic, good, unpretentious and served with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Bella hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything more than the posts below. This hotel is excellent in all aspects. Book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: tcfranco28
Reviews.Content: This hotel receives a lot of praise on this website, and it deserves it all and more. We arrived on August 4th and stayed for two nights. The location is outstanding, 2 blocks from the Colosseum and the Forum. The reception pointed out great places to see, and were extremely friendly and helpful with answering all of our questions. The rooms were quite large (we had a deluxe double), and the beds were very comfortable after spending hours and hours walking around this amazing city. The air conditioning helped make the 90 degree days a bit more tolerable. The breakfast food was fine, but the view of the Colosseum from the terrace was unreal. In all, you will be very happy staying at the Capo d'Africa while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: p169649
Reviews.Content: We went during Spring break with our 2 teens and we all loved the hotel. Nice rooms-the beds, linens, showers were great. The lobby is nice with a lovely bar. The bartender was very entertaining and great with the kids. There are lovely restaurants in the neighborhood. The colloseum and forum area are a stone's throw. Great value for the money. Great breakfast. The staff was so friendly. I would definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in Rome staying at this hotel. Booked it following reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. Lovely hotel in an excellent location, walking distance to the Colosseum, trivi and spanish steps. Quick taxi journey or long-ish walk to the Vatican. Hotel was excellent, room was good size and very clean. We loved the roof terrace for breakfast and a drink in the evening. This hotel is the best keep secret in Rome, we would not stay anywhere else!! Book it now!!

Reviews.Title: “very, very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: danmar169
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel, which we booked based on trip advisor (best deal we found was via alpharooms). Its hard to pick fault with anything. Staff were freindly and helpful - particularly the breakfast team and the bar/wait staff. Location is great - short stroll to the Colesseum - and a really good neighbourhood with lots of good places to eat (the hotel itself has an excellent menu and bar tho' service involves calling down to reception from the terrace). Views are lovely from the terrace - the colesseum at breakfast and the church/convent behind at night. Rooms - modern, clean, comfortable, spacious. All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If in Rome - this is where you want to stay”
Reviews.Author: Beechburn
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels in Rome. It is extremely central being only 3 blocks away from the Coloseum and yet is in a quiet area which does not suffer from the noise which other hotels might do. The staff were extremely helpful with nothing being too much trouble. Advice on where to go, how to get there, booking taxis and resturants etc was always keenly given when asked. Very good bedrooms of a high standard and well air conditioned - maybe the bath being just a bit small for someone 6 foot and above. The breakfast terrace was a treat every morning. Food was excellent with the views over the nearby rooftops to the Coloseum and St Peter's an extra treat (see picture). Recomendation would be not to miss this one - you'll not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: winds22
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days at this hotel and it was great. The hotel is very clean and tidy, the staff are are all friendly and polite and willing to help with any problem or query you may have. The hotel is in a quiet road but within a few minutes walking distance of the Colosseum. When we suffered a rain downpour we were allowed to take the hotel umbrella for the day incase we needed it. The room is tidied and bed remade upon your return later in the day. We must also praise Rome shuttle limousine who provided the most fantastic service. They quoted by email 35 euros from airport to hotel, the quote was prompt. They were waiting at airport even though we were a little late, we were taken to the hotel doors. On our day of departure they arrived on the dot to pick us up and take us back to the airport. They were polite, punctual, well presented it was a plaesure to use such an efficient company. We had a wonderful stay and were sad to leave Rome it was a beautiful place to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms for Italy standards”
Reviews.Author: Koochers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in July 05. Read reviews on the internet and hoped they were true. The Were and more! Great breakfast, great staff, great rooms. When a taxi was required the staff at reception would just have to push a button and one would arrive within five minutes. Only mistake we made was to walk with suitcases from nearest metro. In the hot july sun was not a good idea. If I have one complaint it was that you had to pay for in house movies at 12euro a pop which is a bit steep! Stay at this hotel if you have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Capo - for $140 Euro a night. It was wonderful - very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast is wonderful - it is included and a huge bonus - our room was always made up perfectly - our bed was made twice a day. About a 5 minute walk to the Colusseum metro stop - very convenient and in a quiet neighborhood. The roof top terrace was also very nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “How a Hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghMan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to the Capo D'Africa with a family group (who all know how to be fussy!) and found it to be probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Yes I have been in others with better breakfast and cheaper drinks, these two small issues apart the hotel is superb and if you are unsure about whether to book or not, then have no fear - go for it. The hotel is located at the far end of a street that leads directly to the Forum and The Coloseum. The location is quiet and in our time there we encountered no unsavoury characters at all. The staff are excellent, especially the desk staff and nothing is any trouble. They even greet you warmly when you return from a hard day sightseeing. The rooms are quite big for a city hotel and are spotlessly clean as are the bathrooms. Are there any downsides? Well, not really, at least not any that would make me even consider not going back. The breakfast is typically European, juices, cereal, pastries, fruit, cheese, yoghurt, tea/coffee (fresh)cold meats, bread and jam. Now this list looks quite long, but if you are used to a large 'traditional' Irish/British breakfast, well it will take you a little while to get into the Italian swing of things. The Breakfast Room has a very nice outside terrace. Perhaps the staff could replace the items that are most popular a little faster, but really that is a very trivial criticism. My only gripe is the price of the drinks. I'm sorry but no dram of non-specialised after dinner drink is worth 9 Euro, no matter the hotel. That said drinks in the bar are often served with dishes of olives, nuts and other nibbles. In spite of what I said about the price, if you go, be sure to take a night cap on the terrace at the back, it really is atmospheric especially with the candles and old convent buildings that overlook the terrace. I saw the hotel here on TripAdvisor and everything that was said was true. I saw a bargain on a web based site but phoned the hotel to check if I could have a third bed in the room for my daughter. The person said of course I could and that she could also offer a special rate that undercut the already good web rate by a further 20%. So, be sure to get the best rate you can on the net and thn give them a call, you never know your luck. I found the area a little less well served for restaurants than others have suggested. The pizzas served at Trattoria Luzzi are for nothing, and if you can accept the less than sumptuous surroundings then after a long day it can be a very nice place to go for a simple pizza and delicious bruscetta. Another restaurant Il Buccincino cost about 200Euro for 6 people with all courses, three bottles of wine, 2 bottles of water and some beer. There is a nice ice cream parlour one streep up (Via Marco Aurelia) and it serves about 40 flavours. A Taxi ride to the Vatican is about 12 Euro, and that is probably as far as you will want to take a taxi. A taxi to the airport is about 50 Euro, however the Hotel can organise a large taxi for groups of 6 (90 Euro) or 8 (100 Euro). All in all Capo D'Africa is a knock out. I will go back, hopefully again and again and would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: IR1
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the previous reviews and pictures of the hotel on the web site. All in all it didn't fail to impress. This is a bright, modern, stylish hotel which has been finished in contemporary decor to a very high standard. Perhaps the most impressive aspect however was the attitude of the staff. I can say without hesitation that at all times the staff were courteous and attentive whilst being relaxed- entirely the right combination. This hotel deserves to be in the top 10 for Rome. I will almost certainly use it the next time I visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The design aesthetic of the hotel was modern and comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly and helped us make dinner reservations, and train bookings to get to our next destination. The view of the Colloseum at night from the terrace is breathtaking. We walked everywhere during the day, and took cabs at night when we went to dinner in different neighborhoods. I'd definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Capo DAfrica for 4 nights in July 05. We thought the room was excellent (and quiet), breakfast was good and the gym was modern and fairly well equipped. The location is good with Colossuem, Forum, Palatine etc all within 15 mins walk. The Vatican is the furthest distance , the walk took us an hour (go via Campo Dei Fiori market for some superb fresh fruit on the way). You must visit San Clemente church just near the hotel, a fantastic experience of ancient churches. We booked via Expedia as their rate was good. We travelled with Ryan Air form Liverpool (£37 each incl taxes). You can either pre-book coach transfer tickets or get them on the plane (same price). THe coach transfer takes you into Termini station. We got a taxi from there to the hotel - 20 Euros, not too bad as we had baggage. Don't try and walk to the hotel from Termini it's too far. Hope you have as good a time as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, wouldn't hesitate to go back!”
Reviews.Author: arightcat
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel, which we booked based on the reviews we'd read on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is stylish, spotless and the staff could not be more helpful. They gave us sound recommendations about where to eat in the vicinity, and helped us to find shopping areas, gave us advice on buses etc for getting around the city. Breakfast was lovely and the rooms had good aircon - an absolute necessity given the temperatures in Rome while we were there. The rooms are a good size, and well furnished and comfortable. This hotel is ideally located for the main archaeological sites in the city, it is a couple of hundred yards from the Colosseum, and close also to the Forum and Palatine Museums and Domus Aurea. Its a good walk/bus ride to the main shopping area near the Spanish Steps, and for the Vatican Museums. We wouldn't hesitate to come here again - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Capo D'Africa for 4 nights in April for our honeymoon. We booked through Cresta and got 4 nights for the price of 3, and paid for a large chunk of it with Tesco Clubcard deal vouchers! So we could afford to splash out a bit more on our citybreak, we wanted something a bit special for our honeymoon and were not disappointed. The location is great, near the colloseum therefore in easy walking distance of all the sights. It is down a quiet back street out of the way of the busy road and bars around the colloseum though. The view from the room was terrible (an empty courtyard and a wall...) however the view from the breakfast room and sun terrace more than made up for it! The breakfasts were fabulous. It was April but really warm so we could sit outside and stuff ourselves silly on the most fabulous pastries, fruit, meats and cereals, not to mention 6 different kinds of fruit juice and of course the coffee. The rooms were really nicely decorated, very modern. Huge comfy beds and great showers, the slippers were a nice touch too. The toiletries were nice! We are still using the soap 3 months later anyway! The room wasnt very big but it didnt matter. The reception area and bar were really nice too, great cocktails but a bit pricey. I would highly recommend it if you can afford it, but by Rome standards seems very competitive anyway, probably because its a bit off the beaten track. Go to Rome stay at the Capo D'Africa you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela719
Reviews.Content: Perfection!! Stay here if you can - location is wonderful, rooms are fabulous - overall was just amazing. Staff was so helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust73
Reviews.Content: Located a stones throw away from the Colosseum, Capo D'Africa far exceeded our expectations. The rooms were large even by North American standards and in great shape. The staff was very helpful. Its close to 2 metro stations and a 5-10 euro cab ride from other major attractions. The breakfast buffet was excellent. This is the place to go for people looking for comfort and style and a hotel thats away from the hustle and bustle after a long day of touring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mv99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa Hotel for five days in June. The hotel was perect. Excellent location, very clean, nice rooms, good breakfast and bar, very friendly staff. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean value for money”
Reviews.Author: edinweegie
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this hotel is the "bangs for your buck" factor. The rooms are large, clean, modern and cool. The A/C works, the soundproofing is good, our room was quiet, the sheets were cool crisp white cotton and the location is pretty good. Breakfast was included in our rate and the terrace views of the Coliseum are a great way to start your day. Cool, is important in the Roman summer and it was such a pleasure to come in to the room in the evening after wandering around Rome. Remember, although this is not a 5 star hotel, it is way better than some 5 star hotels in Rome and way cheaper than most. I've stayed in a few more expensive hotels in Rome that are tired and warm and unfriendly and busy. Set your expectations clearly and compare to other price comparable hotels, and Capo D'Africa will beat all of them in the same bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SR06/05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa Hotel on the first few nights of our Italian Honeymoon. What a wonderful hotel!!! Location is PERFECT -and it eased us into European life with this very modern and american-like hotel. The breakfast they offer is wonderful - yougart, fresh fruit, toast, juice - just what we were looking for - and sitting out on the terrace in the beautiful sun in Rome, what could be better?? When we go back we will be staying at this lovely hotel again. *sigh* I miss Rome and the lovely Capo D'Africa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouln't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: FoodiePam
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa for 7 nights this June and were thrilled with our experience. The rooms were nicely sized and comfortable; the style was modern. Air-conditioning--thought not of the freezer variety found in America--was adequate and was quite refreshing after a long day of walking in the very hot sun! Breakfasts were amazing--such a variety of food and such a friendly, hard-working staff. The quiet rooftop terrace was a treat; it was fun to call down to the bar for drinks and be able to enjoy them and a view of the city at the same time. We had dinner one night in the lobby bar; while expensive, it was a great people-watching opportunity and the bartender was sooooo friendly--and made a point of speaking with us a few mornings later when he was working in the breakfast room. The location was wonderful. Yes, it was a walk, taxi or metro ride to get to many places, but how can you beat having the Colliseum only 3 blocks away? Every morning I walked to the Colliseum and back after breakfast; every morning I was awed by it. The neighborhood is quiet and relaxed; there are markets, restaurants and gelateria nearby. Out of curiousity, my mother and I did check out the Radisson SAS--Es hotel near the Termini. We LOVED the style of the hotel--very modern and chic but decided that the neighborhood didn't have the same appeal. We missed the Colliseum, the area didn't feel as friendly or comfortable, and it was noisy. As a hotel, the Capo D'Africa "works" as a great place to stay. What struck as most, was that EVERYONE who worked there seemed to enjoy working there and was proud of the place. The genuine smiles and friendly greetings we received throughout the day certainly added to our experience.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: headache
Reviews.Content: This is one beautiful hotel, near the colleseum, The bedrooms nice size, bathrooms all mable tiles, very clean hotel, All the staff very polite and helpful. The bar prices a bit expensive , But what the hell your on holiday. Taxi from airport is about 48 euro from the metered taxis outside. And when your leaving the hotel after your stay, The hotel can arrange the hotel car, for a fixed fee of 50 euro +tip 5 euro = 55 euro. I would stay stay here again no problem. This is a 4 star hotel. give them another star they deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: Lolly26
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Capo D Africa for 4 nights from the 9th June. We found the hotel perfect for our needs, it was clean, bright and modern with extremely helpful staff (they even arranged inprompto Eurostar tickets to Venice for us). Our room was great, not huge but definitely big enough for us to be comfortable. The room was lovely and quiet and unlike some of the other reviewers we did not experience any problems with our air conditioning, we were always cool enough. Breakfast was fine, mainly pastries, yoghurt etc, sitting on the rooftop enjoying our breakfast was a brilliant start to each day. The hotel is very central but in a nice quiet street which is the perfect place to unwind after a hectic day of sightseeing. We spent most evenings in Rome in Piazza Navarro which reminded us of Covent Garden in London. When we return to Rome we will definitely be staying at Capo again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: knocktophernights
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Capo D Africa for 4 days in May of this year. The Hotel was spotless, the standard of hyigene very high, the staff very pleasent and friendly, especially the bar staff, with the exception of 2 staff members at reception . The first morning of our stay at the hotel , we had no hot water in the bathroom, the only member of staff to ask if the hot water was returned to the room was the Supervisor in the Breakfast room! The Breakfasts were excellent, and of great variety. We have stayed in numerous hotels in Ireland, and various parts of Europe, but this was the only hotel, that never asked if our stay was enjoyable, when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff were so nice and very helpful. Room was comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was plentiful and food was excellant. Loved the view of the roof top terrace and it was the perfect spot for an afterdinner cocktail. I liked the location as it was in more of a neighborhood and you could easily get in some great restaurants. Excellant value. Only con was that they turned the air off at night (at least while we were there - they said they kept it on full time starting in June for summer months). Would definately recommend and we hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Capo d' Africa and were most pleased. The hotel is located on a quiet street approx. 3 blocks from the Colleseum. There are city bus and train stops nearby and Termini Station was a short cab ride away. The rooms are nicely sized and very current in terms of furnishings. There's plenty of closet space, in room safes and a refrigerated mini bar. Our room faced an inner courtyard and was very quiet. We were able to sleep with the windows open. The staff is very pleasant, helpful and they all genuinely seemed to enjoy working at the hotel and interacting with the customers. All were fluent in English and I heard German spoken by some as well. Our package included a continental breakfast which is served up on the roof top terrace. Our favorite feature was the Terrace Bar. A nice place to enjoy a nightcap under the stars. Highly recommend and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJEnglandUK
Reviews.Content: Capo D'Africa is a modern, well maintained hotel. Efficient check in. Bags and selves taken to room and shown around. Nice big comfy bed with nice linen. Reasonably spacious bathroom with good quality shampoo and shower gel (no moisturiser or conditioner though). Rooms serviced twice a day. Biggest downside was the very inefficient air-conditioning - very noticeable as was very hot. Breakfast unvast - nice orange juice and good coffee, but rather uninspiring food - croissants, bread, pastries, fruit. Smoke free though which was excellent. 5 mins walk to colleseum and supermarket (stock up as mini bar very expensive!) Close to hotel: 'Collosseum Bar' very good place to eat and drink - day and evening - had excellent lasagne and carbonara. Place to avoid - 'La Pace del Cervello' - hard sell to get you to sit down (more staff touting for business than serving!) Luke warm lasagne (rather like supermarket 'Nice Price' range), very unstuffed calzone, tomato and onion salad prepared with no care (onion skin, mostly cheap onion with few bits of red onion, no dressing), black pepper even in grinder was 'ready ground' and tasteless - asked for parmesan and didn't get any. Asked for recommendation for nice full bodies red as not familiar with Italian wines - got served a bottle for 18 euros which was not full bodied and was on sale in supermarket for less than 4 euros! Just don't go there unless you like being ripped off and like unappetising food & poor wine! What ever you do, don't forget your comfy walking shoes! Everywhere is walkable, but seems a long way when very hot. A taxi back from St Peters cost us around 10 euros and was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: esb
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from Italy and spent 3 nights at Capo while there. I have nothing but good things to say about our experience. Capo d'Africa is located near the Colosseum but is on a quiet street...no noise at night. Metro stop is just across from the Colosseum. No restaurant but some close by. Staff friendly. Breakfast in the morning was a real delight on the rooftop patio. Standard fare but good... cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit, meat & cheese, pastries and breads. Nice little bar in the lobby. Style is modern. Room was decent size with in room safe, hair dryer, ac. Hotel has elevator but you do have to walk up 10-11 steps to get into the hotel. Linens were very nice in bed and bath. Entire property very clean. Asked for extra pillows and were immediately delivered to the room. Mostly English speaking staff. Going to Rome again next year and will definitely stay at Capo again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my husbands 40th birthday treat, for a period of 3 nights. You could not fault the staff on the desk, apart from one older gentleman who was a little snooty! We thought the room was fabulous, calming colours and a tranquil place to rest our heads after a hectic days tramping around the city. The negative aspects were that we ordered the hotel car to pick us up from the airport however it did not turn up, we were not given an explanation why, we stayed at the airport for twenty minutes looking for someone holding our name on a card but to no avail. The girl on the desk apologised and rang the driver but did not say what had gone wrong? I also emailed the hotel prior to my visit and asked for a bottle of red and white wine to be in the room for my husband as he doesn't like champagne, there was a bottle of white but only a half a bottle of red in the minibar which was usually available to guests and not what I asked for. The white wine was charged to us at 33 euros so it was a little extorionist. Apart from these two little misunderstandings we loved the hotel and would reccomend it to others. We do wish we had known about the military parade held on the 2nd June as the whole of Rome came to a standstill, all shops closed and you were forced to walk right out of the way to reach Via Corso, up and down alleys avoiding the crowds. You can forgive them their military pride though as their city is so beautiful and worth the effort!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, yet reasonably priced, stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: markhap
Reviews.Content: What a truly gorgeous hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in March after using Trip Advisor to find a good hotel. We were extremely impressed. Not only was the hotel extremely stylish and beautifully detailed and furnshed, all the staff were extremely considerate, thoughtful and willing to assist and ensure our stay was enjoyable. Breakfast in the superbly appointed restaurant, on the roof terrace, was always a joyous way to start the day...in fact sometimes it put some of the rest of our days in Rome in the shade ! I would thoroughly recommend staying at the Capo. It's a superb hotel and ideally located to explore Rome on foot, with easy access to the Colosseum and other major tourist attractions. We hope you enjoy it there as much as we did !

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent and you will not be disappointed. The rooms are v. spacious and the bathroom is too. The A/C was not the best though. Make sure you have breakfast on the roof terrace where you can see a view of the colleseum. The hotel also has a gym. One thing I would mention is that the drinks in the bar are very expensive - also the mini bar - so I would buy your own. One of the barmen spoke excellent English and reccommended a restaurant to us that he takes his girlfriend. He ordered us a taxi and told the driver where to drop us - we would never have found it if it had not been recommended - the food was delicious - "Osteria Der Belli at the Piazza Apolllonia. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, but no A/C at night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Europe and Capo D'Africa is an excellent choice for a hotel in Rome. The rooms are rather small but are clean and modern, which is really important in a city known for its old hotels. The only problem we had at Capo D'Africa is that they turn the air conditioning on from 11 AM to 11 PM. I tried to get the manager to explain to me the reason, but he said the owners decided that at night no one needed the A/C, and since it is a centralized unit, you could turn your control on, but only warm air would come out. Since the first night we felt the room was warm and opened the window to get fresh cool air, the only problem is that you are in Rome: A city filled with motorcycles and, as any other major city, with night traffic. We never could get completely comfortable in order to go to sleep. We even asked for a fan, but they didn't have any. So, it is a great hotel with great location, if only they turned the A/C on all the time and let the customers decide if they need it or not.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!!!”
Reviews.Author: bunchtravel
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for 4 nights and were v impressed! The service was excellent and the hotel itself was superb. The staff were very helpful and friendly - in particular, the barman, and head waitress at breakfast. They made us feel welcome and were always ready to help. Some days the rooms were serviced twice, which we thought was a bit of a rarety! The room was a good size, very modern, with lots of extra little touches. Everything you needed was there - good if you're on business as access points everywhere. Breakfast was perfectly ample - continental style buffet, and nice terrace if you fancy sitting outside. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel as there are so many good restaurants nearby. Don't miss Luzzi's - it's very good value, and the food is delicious!!! The location of the hotel is obviously not central - but then it depends on what you want from your accommodation...After a day of walking around seeing sights, feeling very tired, we felt that the quiet location was just perfect. It was nice to get away from all the tourists for a bit ; ) Saying that, it only takes 5 minutes to walk to the Collosseum and the Metro station if you want to go further afield. Nothing is that far away in Rome and it's very easy to get around. Taxis from Ciampino is 50-60 euro at night, taxi to airport was 50 euro in the day(booked by hotel). Rome is definately a place to walk around - you get to see everything this way and when the weather is hot, you don't want to be stuck on a sweaty bus! It took us about 45 minutes to walk to the Vatican - at a leisurely pace - and that's the furthest of the main sights. Attractions are around 10 euro each to visit, but well worth it. All in all, excellent hotel, lovely staff, and beautiful city... One word of advice though - take some comfy shoes!!! Enjoy! : )

Reviews.Title: “you'll be happy to come home to the capo!”
Reviews.Author: travelaurPa
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, well-lit rooms, but typical small size. Fabulous location only a 5 minute walk to the Colosseum and Forum and public transportation. The Capo has a nice breakfast which is of better quality than other Italy hotels I stayed in. What a good value. Concierge was very helpful and made dinner reservations for us. We had such a pleasant stay, you will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of all worlds”
Reviews.Author: Abbots43
Reviews.Content: Location - short walk to the Colosseum and its attendant Metro station and within a reasonable walk or taxi ride to all major attractions. But what is particularly good is that it represents a peaceful haven from the noise and crowds of all the major attractions. Service - on arrival (earlier than the published check in time) allocated a room straight away and shown it with clear instructions on the room features, breakfast arranagements etc. On top of this, and it may seem like a minor point, we were issued with a really useful map of Rome and were then taken through exactly where we were in relation to the major sites; a great way to start. Every other contact with any member of hotel staff was extremely friendly. Room - nice size, air conditioned and cleaned several times a day, what more do you need? Breakfast - enough selection to fill up each morning ready for the day ahead plus the very pleasant option of the terrace to get some air a gaze on the Colesseum. Local restaurants - several very good places close by (particularly Naumanchie) with the hotel always willing to help with information. Overall - superb balance of location, service, room and price that definitely enhanced our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome boutique hotel in the Lateran area”
Reviews.Author: kiwiwannabe
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a room in Capo based on Tripadvisor reviews via Expedia. During the trip we realized that we had another day in Rome and tried to book another day but unfortunately no rooms were available. So we booked at the 4-star Presidente Hotel (Best Western) a couple blocks away. What a contrast. The Presidente is your standard European metropolitan business hotel - small rooms, worn furniture, somewhat operational appliances, crowded breakfast areas, etc. Capo on the other hand was beyond expectations. They were able to check us in before 10am and the friendly but professional staff was a model of efficiency. The rooms and public facilities were very tastefully decorated and very clean. I guess the location is a matter of "perspective" - if you're more interested in the Roman ruins you're very near the Colosseum and the Palatine. However you are quite far for a walk to the Vatican. However we were within range to the shopping areas along Via de Corso. We found the breakfast to be above average for standard European breakfast fare and you can enjoy it on the rooftop terrace. After traveling for many years one of the things you remember about a great hotel is their staff and Capo was no exception. As another reviewer noted the bartender was truly a character you should take a few minutes to meet. Also the waitress and espresso "king" were memorable. We will definitely stay at this quiet boutique hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We had a great time and the staff couldn't be friendlier. This hotel is spotlessly clean and very modern. Yes it’s true your room gets cleaned TWICE a day.......... It is not in the centre of Rome but it is a glorious walk to the centre which we done every day ... you get to walk right though the Colosseum which I found a real treat. Watch out for the traffic in Rome.... all I can say is its CRAZY!!! The small local restaurants serve great food at reasonable prices so I recommend you check them out... It’s a great hotel good location with excellent staff. Enjoy your stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fair location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel but not very convient for sight seeing. We just got back after 5days in Rome. It is very far from most attractions (Spanish steps, Piazza Navona etc) For limited travel, maybe a 2 day stay it would be fine. The rooms very great, hotel service and breakfast could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great comfortable room. Excellent breakfast with a friendly staff. I felt like one of the family. The bartender is also a riot requiring at least one drink while you are there. Slightly off the beaten path near the Coliseum but I would stay there again without hesitation. We found several decent small local restaurants in short walking distance. If you want more gourmet, you'll have to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a couple of things to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: Magpie1862
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other great things said about this hotel however a couple of things you may need to be aware of:- Firstly the hotels location, which is a 5 - 10min walk from the Colosseum and The Forum, and at least a mile from the other major attractions, shopping centre, and restaurants. This was not a problem during the day where we were able to walk to all the attractions including the Vatican and Castel Sant’ Angelo. However in the evening it did limit our choice of restaurants and nightspots unless we were prepare to take a taxi to and from the centre. Secondly the hotel does not offer great views, you can see the top of the Colosseum and the rear of Santi Quattro Coronati from the roof Terrance, which is nice, however our bedroom offered a view of the rear of some rundown apartments and someone’s washing. Finaly the breakfast choice is very limited, with any hot food being a chargeable extra. I know this all sounds a bit negative however I feel it just balances some of the other views, and I would have no reservations in staying at this hotel again if I return to rome. One final tip I know Italy is famous for it stylish footwear, however if you plan to walk around the sites take some walking boots :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - sleek and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The modern accommodations at this hotel, including a sleek entrance and nicely decorated rooms, made our stay feel luxurious. The room was large by European standards and very clean and comfortable. A continental buffet breakfast is served in a dining room with a lovely rooftop terrace. The hotel is within walking distance to many sites, as well as a subway station, which makes it very conveniently located. We truly enjoyed our stay here and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to the number of hotels in Rome, we relied on the reviews on Trip Advisor to make our choice. Thank goodness we did. This is a lovely hotel, modern and clean with very friendly staff. Although for some people it may be a little out of the way, being the near the Coloseum, we didn't find this a problem. There's a metro station close by but we still managed to walk everywhere. It took us only about 35 minutes to walk to the Vatican City, which is probably the furthest away main tourist attraction. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but I can highly recommed the trattoria Pasqualino's on the next street over. The waiters are friendly and the food very nice and reasonable. I would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days and it was just perfect. Staff were very friendly, rooms were spotlessly clean and must have been serviced at least twice a day because we had fresh towels after taking a shower during the day due to the rain. Breakfast area is bright and again staff were very friendly and the buffet was regularly topped up. If you're looking for a good Pizzeria restauarnt try "Gusto" - nice trendy restaurant, great food and reasonable prices. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, we got married in Rome (Irish Couple) and stayed here for a week. Everything was perfect, breakfast, room the whole lot was brilliant. Would recommend it to everyone. Friendly, Clean and overall a very nice hotel has to be one of the best, I've ever come across. Very central, beside the Irish College for our wedding, and next door to the Colesseum, couldn't have asked for better. Book in and enjoy it a lovely hotel. Lots of restaurants around to enjoy and a great buzz of atmorphere on the streets in the evening time, altogether a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful Roman Holiday to Remember”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. From the Reception Area, The Bar, The Lounge, Our Room and Breakfast Terrace was absolutely perfect. We are just back on Wednesday from our 5th Wedding Anniversary Trip and we couldn't have picked a better hotel with a perfect location. The staff were very helpful with advising were the best places to go. There is a few good trattorias near by, one in particular - Luzzi's. Alot of sites are within walking distance and the metro system is pretty easy to use. The next time I visit Rome I would book this hotel again without any hesitation. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarleyH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon trip in Italy and the Capo D'Africa was, by far, the highlight of our hotel adventures. We absolutely loved the hotel! It was beautiful, sparkling clean and comfortable. We were very pleased that the very courteous desk staff checked us into our room when we arrived at 10:00am. We were able to get cleaned up and head out for a day of sightseeing without hassle. The staff was nothing but helpful during our stay and provided us with 3 top-notch restaurant recommendations. The rooms were decent size with very comfortable beds, sheets and pillows. So nice, we felt very much at home here. We also enjoyed the plentiful breakfast on the rooftop terrace...what a wonderful way to start the day! The location was good, we either walked or took the metro most of the time and took only a couple of taxi rides at night. Our fares were never more than 6 or 7 euro. We would highly recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again if we had the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Warmly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: mlawther
Reviews.Content: An excellent Hotel which fully met our expectations. Wonderful staff and very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but excellent and good value”
Reviews.Author: L00ps
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a deal for a one night stay that is nearly 50% off their rack rate. Very modern; very clean; good attention to detail; new installations/furnishings; good sized, bright and spacious room and pretty good service (English no problem at all). Good decor, both in the lobby and in the rooms. The lobby is very popular with hotel guests in the evening. Though beware! Bar prices are a bit high. Wi-Fi access throughout, therefore very useful for business travellers. A smart, well presented act and would definitely recommend the Capo d'Africa. Breakfast is served on the fourth floor terrace and includes freshly squeezed fruit juices. Absolutely lovely on a warm, sunny morning. Location is central, though tucked away at the end of a quiet street leading away from the Coliseum. Lots of eat places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: nrchamp
Reviews.Content: I cant' say enough positive things about the Capo D Africa! After reading reviews for months before we left and thinking our expectations might be too high (and we would be disappointed) we were not! I echo every single postive comment posted here and would only like to add a few... The walking is no big deal! Wear comftorable shoes and clothes and you will be fine, Rome is a walking city. The fact that the hotel is just outside the main touristy part of the city means that you can enjoy quite nights with your windows open and not have to listen to any street noise...it was perfect in my opinion. There are a ton of restaurants in the immediate area (some posts said they were few and far between so we were a little worried), but there were plenty and they were filled with locals who were so kind and the food was amazing. Other than that, I would like to say that the Capo D Africa will always be my home base when I stay in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent by European Standards”
Reviews.Author: pennstate
Reviews.Content: I really don't have anything much different to add to what other people have been saying about this hotel for the many months that I've been reading these reviews. My wife and I just got back from a 5-night stay. We have been in four European hotels within the past six years (Paris twice, London, Rome), and Capo d'Africa was the best hands down. It was a delight to come back to the hotel after a tough day of walking, and walking, and walking. My wife "folded" a number of times during the stay, and we had to spend more time in the room than I would have liked. The room was so nice that the lost sightseeing time was tolerable. I think that you'll find the location of the hair dryer interesting. We really liked the firm mattress. As nice as this place is, keep in mind that we're all comparing it to the typical European hotel. I would put this hotel in the Holiday Inn category in terms of quality. If I came back to Rome, I'm not sure I would book this hotel again, due to its location. I say that only because of my wife, who was reluctant (and complaining) to walk the two miles, or so, to places like Piazza Navona and the Spanish Steps. For me, that was no problem, and I liked the "roaming around" process. For someone who doesn't like to walk, the metro doesn't necessarily solve the problem because it is not extensive like the one in Paris. Further, the "A" Line is being shut down rather early at night (9:00 to 10:00 pm) for repairs. We got caught with that problem after eating at the Hard Rock Cafe late one night. The metro shut down, so we had to walk the 2.5 miles back to the hotel (I did no previous study of the bus system, so we didn't mess with it). For me, that was okay, and a chance to walk off the meal. My wife was not happy. I particularly liked the idea that we pretty much had to walk past the Colosseum every day to get to anywhere we wanted to go. If you have to walk past anything all the time, then that's what you want to walk past.

Reviews.Title: “Fully meet our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Capo D Africa certainly lives up to its billing! My wife and I have just returned from staying the weekend there and we were very impressed. The hotel has a contemporary style, is very clean and has friendly and helpful staff. Our king sized room was spacious, quiet and well presented. The hotel certainly does merit the praise it’s received. Regarding its location… well it couldn’t be more convenient for San Clemente and the Coliseum. It’s about half way between two metro stations, each approximately a 10 minute walk away. Generally though be prepared to walk or take a taxi. All in all the Hotel Capo D Africa gets a big thumbs up from us!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RKJP
Reviews.Content: Having been on their website and read a number of reviews of this hotel, we booked 3 nights in March. I had high expectations and they were met. The hotel rooms were modern, a fair size and very clean. the bed was firm and large. the rooms were serviced 2-3 times a day. they also had nice little extras in the room which made for a comfortable stay (hair dryers, shoe cleaners, back scrubbers and everything was branded). Don't expect the jazzy colours in your hotel room (as shown on their website) as I am sure they only apply to the suites. The rooms were still kind on the eye and very new. The location is quiet but very near to a number of sites (the forum, palantine, circus maximus etc). there are a significant number of restaurants, bars, ice cream shops, wine bars etc within 200 yards of the hotel. the area was very safe, welcoming and clean. There are also a number of parks and open spaces near by to have a morning/evening walk around. Having breakfast on the sun terrace every morning was a bonus - you can even see the coliseum in the distance. the breakfast was substantial and you can have it from 6.30 to 11am. Breakfast is a leisurely affair with plenty to choose from. The staff were excellent - always jolly and willing to please. The modern art throughout the hotel also made the hotel look fresh and new. We flew into Ciampino - get the Ryanair bus to the Train station (£9.50 return) and get a taxi to the hotel (expect to pay 10-12 euros depending on time of day and number of bags). I can't understand why there is any negative feedback on this hotel - either people with unrealistic expectations or plain bonkers! Don't expect boozy nights - expect culture, spectacular sights, open spaces, nice people and great food. Coupled with a quiet retreat, clean, modern and comfortable hotel to go back to each night. It is worth the extra Euros!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCHeretic
Reviews.Content: I selected Hotel Capo D'Africa after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. My boyfriend and I spent five terrific days at the Capo D'Africa. The check-in was the warmest and most welcoming that I have ever experienced at a hotel. The clerk spent several minutes reviewing a map of Rome and answering questions. The room was spacious, clean, and well-appointed. A bedside console allowed for easy control of all lights in the room. The television also served as a radio, which could be broadcast into the bathroom. The breakfast room was delightful and the food good. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major sites and the neighborhood felt safe at all hours of the day and night. There are a wide array of restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel. I would readily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Havlat
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Capo D'Africa was beyond compare. It was a fabulous hotel. Very clean and great staff. We were upgraded to a room on the top floor with a fabulous walk out terrace that overlooked the colliseum. The breakfast staff were wonderful, although I had better breakfasts at other hotels in Italy. We found a lot of restaurants in the area and all were good. It is almost three blocks to the colliseum and the forum, and very close to the metro. I would definetly stay at this hotel on my future visits to Rome. And for the price you can't beat this place!

Reviews.Title: “You'd be crazy not to stay here...!”
Reviews.Author: brian6u
