Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned yesterday (3/16) from a week in Italy. Capo D'Africa was the first stop in our trip and we stayed for three nights. To be blunt, it was utterly, completely perfect from beginning to end. The staff was excellent, the rooms immaculate, the breakfast delicious, the location (near the Coliseum) ideal. If you book this hotel, go to the Utell web site as their price was the cheapest by far of anyone else...and we got the room exactly as we had hoped (unlike Expedia which always disappoints). If you stay anywhere else in Rome, you're wasting your money. I am a seasoned traveler, business and personal, and I worked in Europe so I know the drill. I've seen it all in my 30+ years on the road and this is virtual perfection. And for 150 Euros a night with breakfast, well what more can I say!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: vallelde
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Capo D'Africa in August, 2004. The room was lovely and very modern by European standards. Plenty of space, nice large bathroom and a balcony overlooking the street. Roof top cafe served breakfast daily which was included in the room rate. Lovely breakfast choices and a wonderful view of the colosseum. Small lobby bar was wonderful and the employees accomodating. The front desk would recommend a new restaurant every night and even made our reservation for us. The location was very central and we could either walk or be a short taxi ride to anywhere. Would definately recommend and would hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit in Rome. We recommand this hotel. pros: Hotel is quiet, and well situated near the archeologic area. So it's ideal for historic tourism. The price is fair. The decor of room is relaxing. Colors and lights are soft. The staff is professional. I'd like mention specially the breakfast staff who makes the beginning of morning very pleasant. The metro station is not too far away. Cons: The hotel is not in the very center of the city, so prepare to walk for going the plazza spagna, for instance. For us, it wasn't a problem because we like to walk, and cross the forum every morning is fantastic. There is not a large choice of restaurants in the area despite that those we've tried are corrects and quite cheap. miscelaneous advises: From the airport Firminio to the hotel, taxi guys will be your first contact with romains. Impossible to avoid a so calling fix-priced. It seems that the meter doesn't exist. So, we prefered take the railway to termini station, then a taxi to the hotel. in the taxi, check always that the meter is ON. Otherwise, the prise will get out of the hat ! The rest of romains are regular humain beeing !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sue058
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel March 2005. The hotel staff and rooms were excellent. The hotel was in a good location.......lovely and quite at night however, be prepared to walk. Next time I would take my walking boots. We ate locally of an evening as after a days trek around the city that's all you want to do. The hotel provided fluffy towels, bathrobes and slippers with some great bubble bath for that long soak each evening before venturing out again. The barman was a character, so enjoy a drink before you go out. The breakfasts were great and the breakfast room had good roof top views. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This an excellent hotel in the heart of Rome yet in a charming and quiet neighborhood! The staff was excellent from the doorman, bellhopes, front desk staff, and especially the breakfest staff! Everyone on the staff was helpful and friendly. The front desk personail made WONDERFUL dinner recommendations and were always helpful and acurate with directions. The Capo d'Africa is a modern hotel that blends modern design with old world European charm. You cant beat the location either. While staying here you feel like the Colosseum becomes home and so does the charming and quiet neighborhood. The neighbourhood is loaded with wonderful little restraunts from family run trattorias to fine dinning! The room as spotless and very nicley decorated. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job cleaning. They changed the sheets and bathroom amenities daily, like you would expect in ANY high class hotel. This is truely a place were you can relax and feel like you are at home, truely it feels like home. Again the staff made it wonderful and enjoyable. I can't thank them enough, this little hotel's staff rivials that of some of the world's finnest hotels!!!! I would especially would like to point out the head breakfest waitress, Julia!! She made breakfest everymorning a wonderful treat. She was the greatest and became a true friend and was helpful with all kinds of questions, from weather to the best kind of Limonecello! Thank you Julia. I can not praise this lovely new boutique hotel enough, I recommend it to everyone!!! There is only one tiny complaint, you need to be early at breakfest to get an English newspaper but it was no big deal you can always get one at a newstand!!! LOVELY HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Great time, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lexlaw69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August and again in September 04. Staff bent over backwards to help me. I can see how some people might mistake the quiet professionalism of the staff as unfriendly....but it really isn't (it is a quiet hotel...not party central). Everything I needed was provided in a luxury setting, the hotel was in a great location if your a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “some people must be hard to please !”
Reviews.Author: lynnecf
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from the Capo D'Africa - and i thought it was a great little hotel ! have read through some of the other comments and i really can't fathom some of them...we found the bellhops to be pleasant & helpful, the reception staff (and we dealt with 3 of them) again to be friendly, helfpul and good at recommending restuarants.... for the cost of the room you can;t beat this hotel for the rooms, breakfasts and definitely the location......nice and quiet at night, and in walking distance of everything.... i have stayed at plenty of five star hotels in the UK and i have to say i thought this little hotle could show some of them a thing or too ! the room was very big, the bed was huge, bathroom also very nice and everything was spotless.... i guess you cant please everyone all the time but it did please me and on my next trip to rome I will be staying there again !

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: nosescott
Reviews.Content: I used my Amex points to fly FC from the US and decided I wanted to go BIG. Not knowing ANYTHING about Rome and going on a lark, I came here to read reviews. Maybe I'm too much of a hotel snob but I was let down by the reviews. The decor was decidely modern but not at all comfortable. The beds were sagging and fely like a bad version of those TempurPedic beds. HOWEVER, I needed food and the bar manager whipped up some delicious snacks for me. The in-house porn wasn't that good either. GREAT location to the Colliseum and Palatino. Nice secluded street. VERY quite property. I stayed in several properties this trip and this one was my least fav.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis Near Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCT
Reviews.Content: The quietness and contemporary charm of the Capo d'Africa was so restful to return to after a full day of sightseeing in this hectic, noisy, magnificent city. It is a big plus that the hotel is located in a residential area, yet is so close to ancient Rome--you can have dinner in the neighborhood and avoid the tourist traps of other areas in town. Getting around is easy, since the Colosseo metro stop is close by; you can also get on the #3 tram, which takes you to Trastevere. Everything else is within walking distance, more or less. The hotel is small enough to have personal service, a friendly lobby bar, and a lovely breakfast room, but no full-service restaurant--as if anyone cares, surrounded by all the dining choices of Rome. The maids' cart seemed to be parked in the hallway all day, and whenever we left the room they refreshed towels, tidied up, etc., so the rooms are impeccably cared for. The value of a good night's sleep in Rome can't be overestimated, and here is the place to get it--almost no street noise and a soothing atmosphere. Very tasteful design, helpful staff, and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Generally very good but a few short comings”
Reviews.Author: Andy_West_Sussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel between 19th - 23rd February. Stayed on the second floor in an comfortably sized room. Bathroom very nice, shower excellent (powerful). Hotel was very quiet and breakfast very good but was getting a bit bored of it by the last day - although there was some variety. On the downside on the only day the breakfast room was very busy the staff seemed to struggle to cope and some things ran out! It was soon sorted but I would expect pre-emptive action to be taken to avoid this. The air conditionning was turned on in February which was a refreshing change. Obviously you could turn it off if so desired. Bathroom well stocked with robes, shower gel, shampoo, shower cap, shower mitts etc - all the usuals really. Bedroom lacked some of the usuals. No tea or coffee making facilities and very surpisingly no booklet covering hotel services. Do not know whether this was a one off or standard policy. Location wise, very good for the colosseum and the metro. If I went to Rome again I would probably try to find a quiet hotel closer to the spanish steps as for me this is where the better restuarants are located. However, this is my second trip to Rome and the first time I stayed in a narrow lane near the Trevi fountain and even that was noisy. If this review comes across negative it shouldn't as generally the hotel was really good with excellent staff. I think the major plus points about the hotel are: - Modern decor (I think most rooms are less colourful than the ones you will see picture of on the hotels website but no floral patterms which is good!) - Peaceful Location (which is the major point as far as I am concerned, particularly given that Rome hotels are notoriously noisy) Major down side - Location a little bit out, (and I mean a little bit) but it really isn't too bad unless it is raining! - Bed was a little firm for my liking

Reviews.Title: “Capo D'Africa”
Reviews.Author: whaqatac
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Capo D'Africa for four days at the end of February. Our train arrived from Venice at 6:30 in the morning and we arrived at the hotel just before 7am. The receptionist explained that the room we had booked was not ready but upgraded us to a room that was available straight away at no extra charge. The room we had was excellent, the overall housekeeping and upkeep was very good. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was refreshing with a shower with a choice of soft, normal or massage settings. No matter what time we had a shower there was never a shortage of hot water whether it be at 7am or 8pm. My only criticism of the room would be the lack of English speaking channels on the television, only CNN but that is being slightly petty! We found the Continental breakfast service very good too. There was a good selection of cereals, pasties, breads and rolls, sliced cheeses and meats, etc. There is no restaurant in the evening just room service but there are numerous restaurants within walking distance from the hotel so this never affected us. Overall we found the experience of the Capo D'Africa very pleasing with the staff being polite and helpful at all times. If we ever return to Rome then we will definitely stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish and handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macmillan
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely few days here last year. The hotel's very near the Forum and you can get around easily on foot or there's a bus stop just round the corner. There are a good number of good cheap restaurant within wlking distance but the hotel's in a quiet side street, away from the hustle and bustle. The hotel is modern and very stylish with smallish but extremely well equipped rooms with nice touches like robes and slippers. You have breakfast on a very pleasant roof terrace and there's a lovely cool lounge area on the ground floor. The staff were very helpful and friendly - particualy the barman who'd spent a year in Newcastle and spoke excellent English!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fab Hotel! Stayed here for a long weekend for my birthday, and I really don't see what you could complain about. Having stayed at hotels all around the world, Capo D Africa is up there with the good ones. The reception / bar area downstairs looks great, neutral colours, dark wood and polished surfaces. If you like tradtional hotels this may not be for you, but that is a matter of taste. Room on second floor was impressive, not huge, but with modern decor and lovely bathroom this did not matter. Everything in the hotel was spotlessly clean. Our room was at the back (216) and overlooked what seemed to be residential flats, but there was no noise from them. It is a residential area, but having never been to Rome before I would HIGHLY recommend it. I suppose the location is a pro or con depending on the individual, as it is probably a 15-20 min walk ( all flat ) to the Sp Steps. We were so glad to be out of the city centre as it can be (like all big cities) noisy and crowded. You can walk to most areas of interest quickly and easily,( Colisseum is 3 mins, Roman Forum 5). I think the furthest is probably the Vatican and that is still maybe 30 mins. You could easily eat locally in the evening as the local restaurants look excellent and are not the high prices you pay for eating in the tourist areas. There are also a few bars, a pharmacy, supermarket etc locally so you would not need to venture far if you needed anything. Reception staff are very helpful, and were very accomodating if we needed anything. One point I would note, (and this is not a criticism but an observation,) is that they do not allow irons in the room, so you would either have to iron everything before you go and hope its still wearable, or pay for laundry service - I think its about 7 euros for a shirt. As I said, it not a criticism, but as a fussy girl, I like all my clothes be ironed when I get there! Another tip, we flew into Ciampino, and were overcharged on our taxi by about 20 euros. The hotel will book them for you for a 50 euro flat rate ( including tips etc) so if you want a taxi transfer it may be best to contact the hotel directly rather than rely upon the honesty of locals! To sum up -For the price - exceptional hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walked in on Feb 17th and immediately got hit with excellent service ... The young lady at reception provided us with maps, pointers on what to see, restaurant recommendations (go to Restaurant 34 - it was excellent), bell hop was right on hand etc. Amazing what a great start will do. The room was of good size with nice little unexpected extras, very clean and room attendants cleaned the room very thoroughly and timely. The room was modern with excellent sheets and towels. The water pressure was great but one morning (upon sleeping in - 10 am ish) we ran out of hot water. It gets really cold in Feb. The immediate area of the hotel is not upscale but the colloseo is within sight and the hotel is very conveniently located near the metro and the roman ruins. The Rome bus and metro are an adventure during rush hour and if you don't like the Rome Cab Driver's driving then stay off the sidewalk. The complimentary breakfast was nicely presented and included all the expected foods. Service was very attentive and polite. Out of Dolphin Square (London), Le Meridien (Paris), BW Hotel Galles (Milan), the Cap D'Africa was my personal favourite on this trip which is saying alot because the others did a great job too. - MMA Toronto, Ont. Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bob1949
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at Capo D'Africa. An excellent location, quiet, very near to the ancient ruins and a silent night's sleep. Rooms were average size and spotless with nice touches such as slippers and bathrobes. Breakfast was very good (go for the freshly squeezed orange juice), the breakfast room was light and airy and the staff very friendly and accommodating. It was easy to get everywhere in the city on foot and the transport links were also good. It was a joy coming into the warmth of the hotel after a day walking the sites, Rome happened to be very cold the week we were there in mid Febrary. Restaurants in the area were also good, like everyone else we made 'Le Naumecherie' our first port of call. Bruschetta, Pasta and a dessert for two plus two bottles of wine all for 32 euros!! The waiting staff weren't particularly friendly but with food at those prices and locals queuing up the stairs for a free table it has to be worth visiting. Another find was 'Residenza di Ripetto' just off the square of Santa Maria del Popola. An excellet lunch time bottle of wine with nibbles in the bar of a stunning hotel cost 6 euros. All in all, a first class visit to Rome staying in a first class hotel - very modern but spotless and welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo D'Africa Hotel over New Years. This hotel is located a few blocks from the Coliseum. Our room was unbelievable. Everything was brand new. It was very large, much larger than typical European rooms. It was quiet and the bed was comfortable. There were speakers in the bathroom so you could listen to the television when you were in the bathroom or showering. The decor of the hotel is very modern, which is different from any other hotel I've ever stayed in. I work for an airline and do lots of traveling. I absolutely loved the rooms, the decor, the bar, the entrance, everything about the hotel. The front desk staff were pleasant but didn't go above or beyond like the bell hop and bartender did. I found the bellhop to be their best employee. He was funny, helpful, always had a smile on. The bartender was very helpful as well. My one complaint would be that I thought the internet was free but they were secretly putting charges on my bill. It was one level below the front desk. Everytime I went downstairs, the front desk saw me walk by and put 5 euros on my bill. When I checked out, my bill was an extra 40 euros. I felt like I was being spied on or like they thought I was trying to steal. I would have appreciated if the person at the front desk would have asked me if I was going down there to use the internet and let me know that there was a fee involved because one of the times I went down there I was looking for the hotel gym but got charged for using the internet. Breakfast was served on the top floor and they really put out a nice spread. This was a great hotel that is reasonably priced. I would definately stay here again. It's in a good location but a better location is by Via Veneto/Spanish Steps area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsBearChester
Reviews.Content: Had some very nasty surprises in the past booking hotels over the internet. However, I was most impressed with the Capo. It exceeded my expectations and at just over £100 a night it was well worth the money. Great location - Set up a quiet street & walking distance to everything Clean - Never been to a hotel as spotless of this - everything clean & fresh Room - (2nd floor) Medium sized, all new modern furniture, bright & airy Breakfast room - Friendly staff & views from the terrace of the Colosseum Nearby - Little local restaurants, not there to rip you off, but just to serve you great food/wine

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jonahleon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best all-around hotel my wife and I stayed in Italy in December 2004 / January 2005. To begin with, I would ignore the occasional bad reviews because, if you look at what these people complain about, it is obvious that they are just odd themselves. I mean, who goes to Rome to watch TV and wake up at noon? In addition, you have to realize that you are in Europe. You are not going get scrambled eggs with a continental breakfast. You are not going to get a lot of English TV channels. However, even if you had those unreasonable expectations, this hotel has enough to make the most negative person take notice. First, the hotel’s location is outstanding. It is so nice to be near the trees and airy part of ancient Rome instead of near the crowded, graffiti-covered parts of the rest of the city. Second, the rooms are quite large by European standards and very well decorated as long as you have modern tastes. Third, the breakfast in the morning is really outstanding and the breakfast area is incredibly cheerful and pleasant. Finally, I found the front desk staff to be the absolute best during my stay in Italy. They were always welcoming and full of helpful suggestions. The only faults I have with the hotel are that (1) heated towel racks would be nice to help dry the occasional round of self-done laundry and (2) it would be nice not to have to push the elevator button twice to get it to work. Of course, if that’s the worst thing I can say, I think you can tell that this place is pretty awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbiestothert
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand people who moan about this hotel. Myself and my daughter stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of January and it was marvellous. Very clean and neat. I admit that the TV channels weren't up to much, but hell - who goes to Rome to watch TV?? I found the staff friendly and warm, the location excellent and the whole experience a wonderful oasis it what can be a very hectic city!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but nothing too special”
Reviews.Author: HW
Reviews.Content: The number of positive reviews posted on this site led me to booking a recent 6 night stay. I felt assured that I was making the right decision in selecting this hotel, but the experience I had was quite a contrast from what I read. Do not get me wrong as I think the Capo d'Africa is a decent place, but from my own experience it became evident that flaws in this property do exist. During my next visit to Rome I would consider other alternatives first. One upset had to do with the housekeeping staff - they were loud and extremely noisy in cleaning the rooms. Each morning it felt as though I had woken up in the middle of a construction site! I tried several times to communicate to them how I did not want to be bothered until a specific time (around noon), and to not come and clean my room any earlier than that. My efforts failed. They would buzz my door at around 9-9:30 AM and then simply enter while I was still in bed. One time the same thing happened much earlier at 7:45 AM. I will say that they are very intrusive, and did not help make my stay any comfortable. An odd cleaning agent is used on the elevator which smells like crap, literally. My room was small and not all areas had been completely cleaned. On my first day when I began unpacking, I laid out some of my clothes into the closet, only to later find out that it was filled with dust which left many stains on my clothing. Instead of relaxing, I spent my evening before bed doing laundry. It is a common understanding that European hotel rooms are not as large, but for the money I spent I expected much more, especially considering I had reserved a deluxe room. I would advise future guests to avoid getting a room on the third floor under the breakfast room - you will find that the area is not well insulated and footsteps from the people above can be heard, along with the screeching of chairs being dragged forward and back. Also, if you look at the floor's safety plan layout you can get somewhat an idea of how large your room is... apparently I was put in the smallest one. None of the rooms really have a view of anything, with the exception of the Junior Suite which slightly overlooks the Colloseum. There is limited television programming, with about 10 Italian channels and two in English (MTV/CNN). PayTV is available but only 4 movies play constantly throughout the day, reception on these channels were also not too good. €12 I paid gone to waste. Breakfast on the other hand was something I was actually pleased with. There are enough pastries, breads and meats/hams to fill you up. Various juices are available, although a tad warm after sitting out for so long. Go ahead and ask for a cappuccino as it should be included in the breakfast rate. Front desk staff can be quite helpful, and are kind and welcoming. Any time I brought in a late night super or snack the bartender was able to provide me with cutlery and ice. Use of the minibar is expensive, room service prices are perhaps average. The location of the hotel itself is convenient; 4 blocks from the Coloseum and just a bit further ahead is the Colosseo Metro station (which comes 2 stops after the Termini station). Restaurants are close by within the surrounding blocks of the hotel. I ate at a few of them but would recommend going closer into the historical centre of the city to eat. Two 'supermarkets' are in the vicinity. One of them is called GS and you can get prepared sandwiches there for less than €2. No other shops of much interest for me to mention (the area is mostly residential), but be careful when you cross the street as the area becomes busy at times. Watch where you walk as there will often be some droppings left by dog owners on the sidewalk. Despite all the problems I had with the hotel I wouldn't completely rule out staying here again, and would still offer it as a recommendation to others. Just make sure to complain when something goes wrong. The hotel Capo d'Africa is again a decent place, they have to continue to work on improvements however. From my experience I cannot support its 4 star ranking.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: caviargal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late January. The hotel was lovely and very clean. Our king bedded room was spacious, clean and comfortable with a great bed, crisp linens and a separate entryway. It was very peaceful and quiet, especially considering its central location. The hotel decor is minimalist and contemporary and the public rooms are inviting and well maintained. The terrace must be lovely in the warmer months, with its view over the Colosseum. The breakfast room was very pleasant and the breakfast itself offered a wide variety of foods. It was very good. Metro and tram collections are in close promixity to the hotel. The only downside to the location in my opinion is that, due to the touristy area, there were few dining options that met our tastes. But the easy connections to Trastevere and the rest of the city - when it was too cold to walk - made this a small inconvenience. We will stay there again when the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: KKHarris
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this web-site, we chose the Capo D'Africa for our three night stay in Rome. It was an inspired choice. What a truly lovely hotel with exceptional staff (a special mention for Chiara on reception and Alessandro behind the bar who both made us particularly welcome). Our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Location is great as it's only a few minutes walk from the Collosseum and the Roman Forum. All the other major attractions are within walking distance or a short cab ride away. The last time we went to Rome, we came back raving about the sights and the city. This time, we're also raving about the hotel. We'll definitely be going back to the Capo D'Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Can a Capo d'Africa please open in every major city?”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: Having spend a whole week in Rome and having passed by several hotels, this one seems really to be one of the nicest. Modern, but not too designish, central, but quiet location. Housekeeping and room amenities are very good. Breakfast buffet (overlooking the Colosseum) and breakfast staff are great. Front desk and bell staff range from really nice to bored. All in all, I would be happy, if a hotel of this standard would open in every major city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Capo d'Africa. The rooms were modern and clean, and the staff was very helpful. From helping place international phone calls to recommending local restaurants, the service was unending.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right: a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paul68
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after having read the reviews at Tripadvisor. I also found some very negative reviews suggesting that all the positive ones were posted by the hotel itself. They were wrong. We arrived with a party of 6; having three different rooms. All the rooms were OK. Clean, large enough and complete. The staff was very friendly even remembering your name at breakfast. The location is perfect; two minutes from the Colloseum and the walk to the old town is not too long because there is so much to see. Yes, I do recommend this hotel. When I come back, I'll book this hotel again. Paul Wilms, Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Don't be Scared Off--A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo D'Africa for four nights in late December, and we were thrilled with the hotel! We were nervous going in due to some of the comments posted, but the hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and extremely helpful, and the location great for navigating Rome via the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: soo
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay. I chose the hotel from reviews of previous guests and I was not dissapointed. Yes the hotel is of modern design so if that is not of your taste then it's not the hotel for you. Some people have mentioned the rooms being on the small side, ours was a lovley size with an entrance hall leading to the bathroom and bedroom. I think that it generally seems to be people from America that mention the small size of rooms! Clean linen everyday and all the facilities you could need, although my partner would of liked coffee making facilities, why make it yourself when you have room service I say. The hotel is situated on a quite street though only a five minute walk from the collosso. This hotel was execptional for the price we paid and being a regular traveller i have had the experience of bad hotels.

Reviews.Title: “can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have to agree pretty much with all previous reviews had read which was reassurring and prompts me to write a little feedback myself. Pleasant and friendly check-in, with map provided to explain location and main sites. Large clean modern room with high ceiling in converted appartment block in residential area. Quiet location in narrow side street with very little through traffic. Basic but ample continental brekfast on 4th floor with patio doors to terrace- closed as winter! Approx. 200 yd. walk to colosseum/metro stop and forum next door. Apart from Vatican all major sites easily within walking distance and Vatican only a short 6 stops on Metro via Termini. Amazed at how close the major attractions are concentrated around this area. A number of small bars and restaurants on local streets (and ATM) mostly full of locals. Can also reccemmend the Naumachie restaurant just around the corner but well worth booking as really was packed on Saturday night, full of boisterous locals and even had to wait 20 mins for table after arriving on time for reservation. Having said that service and food good and very reasonable (5 euro for bottle of wine!)-that many locals can't be wrong. One piece of advice though-dont pull the cord above the bath!!-its not the fan but an alarm!! Very loud and prompts a call from the front desk to check you're ok-very embarrassing. Heard next door do the same the next day so must be quite a common occurrance. Felt welcome during stay and staff always pleasant and helpful (left luggage etc). On the whole can't fault it and if you intend to be out most of the day sight seeing etc. then its ideal. ps from Termini station it should be 8-10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent five days exploring Rome with Hotel Capo d Africa as our home base. The hotel was very stylish and had an extremely helpful staff. We got a lot of great dining tips from the bartender and returned home to Sweden somewhat heavier but very satistified with the wonderful Italian food. The hotel is ideally located near the Colisseum but we heard absolutely nothing from the traffic in our room. This was our fifth wedding anniversary and I am pretty sure that we will be celebrating our next one in the same city and at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back after staying for 4 nights at this hotel and it has to be one on the nicest hotels i have ever stayed in. The location was good (being close to the metro and the tram system was really good) and the hotel was in walking distance of all the major attractions. The hotel were a;ll very nice and very helpful and overall a nice place to stay while in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given Italy's tendancy towards conspicuous oppulence, it was nice to find a hotel offering clean lines, simplicity and comfort in an understated but stylish fashion. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. Fabulous location, literally a stone's throw from the Colliseum, yet very quiet. As seasoned city-breakers, the combination of Rome and the Hotel Capo D'Africa will be very hard to match.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned for a a three night break at the Capo D' Africa, having booked it on the recommendations of existing reviews. It was our 25th wedding anniversary and our son (19) and daughter (21) insisted on coming with us, not wishing to miss the opportunity to visit Rome. !!! The hotel exceeded all our expectations. it is only a few minutes walk from major historic sites and easy level walking distance to the city centre. The rooms were to a very high standard with king size beds or two singles, depending on your requirements. The hotel staff were extermely friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. The buffet breakfast was more than we expected and with a good selection of fruit, cereals, etc. The staff also advised on where to eat on an evening. All restaurants were of a high standard and good value. The Naumachie is recommended, only five minutes from the hotel. In our opinion there is not a down side to this hotel. We cannot praise it, or its staff enough. I am not one for singing praises unless I believe they are well deserved. I have no reservations in highly recommending the Capo D' Africa and will go back there when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the excellent reviews. But when I get there I was disappointed. The room was nothing compared with beautiful pictures on the web. It was all beige, boring and dull, not a trace from colorful ethnic design I expected. Another unpleasant surprise followed: the room has not internet connection although I checked with hotel before I booked. It turned out that they can not tell the difference between telephone line and internet connection!!! And for that price and class I expected scrambled eggs for breakfast, but it was not included. But I confess they make the best cappuccino I ever tasted, and cream on top was heart-shaped!! So, I think next time in Rome I shall try other hotel because I think there must be better offer for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also chose to stay here after reading all the reviews. We just returned from Rome after staying ten days from 12/26 to 01/6. We must tell you that the few reviews that say that all the good reviews must be fake, is absolutely FALSE! This hotel was very (I mean VERY,VERY) clean. The room was a good size for european hotel rooms. The bathroom was spotless. The cleaning staff was great. One day we left the room for the breakfest at the hotel (which was very good) and returned to find our room was cleaned. We left for the day and returned that evening to find the room was cleaned again. The desk staff was very helpful and everyone spoke decent english (but it is good to know some Italian). The location is fantastic. It is tucked away in a little corner just blocks from the Colloseum, which made it quiet. The outside of the hotel is beautiful. Every inner city attraction is within walking distance and the Metro is on the other side of the Colloseum. You can walk to any part of Rome within the Roman wall very easily (just take your time, like the last reviewer said) The restaurants in the area are all great. Check out the Royal House, in front of the Colloseum for homemade pasta and if you want a great pizza check out the Pizza Forum, just two streets over from the hotel. We would definately stay here again, if we return. We had relatives staying in other hotels during our stay and none were located in such a great spot as this one and not as clean. As a side note, if you like Rock music from 60's to todays rock tunes you must go to The Rock Castle located in the Jewish Ghetto just around the corner from the Vittorio Emanuelle Monument (which is a great reference marker when walking) the clubs address is Via Beatrice Cenci, 8. Check out the website at www.rockcastle.it. If you go there, ask for the owner, Claudio or the bartender Fay and tell them that Paul and Lisa from USA sent you! Stay at Capo d'Africa, you will not be disapointed. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel over what is the Thanksgiving weekend in the US. We had booked through Expedia and the rate for the rooms was fabulous. We loved this hotel. It was exceptionally clean, the room sizes were generous for European hotels and we found the staff friendly and helpful. It was so close to Ancient Rome! What a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having recently returned from a fantastic New Years break in Rome and stayed at the Capo D' Africa Hotel, we felt it would be rude not to share our thoughts on this fabulous hotel. The staff were very friendly, efficient and could not do enough to assist us during our stay, including booking much sort after evening reservations at one of the nicest restaurants in the city, and recommending others for other times during our stay. The location is just minutes away from the awe inspiring Colloseum and Roman Forum, and generally a comfortable walking distance away from all the famous landmarks. Our rooms were exceptionally clean and modern, with toiletries, bathrobes and hairdryer all to hand. The downstairs bar and lounge was as reasonably priced as many city centre bars with the added advantage of courteous staff to help with luggage or booking taxi's. We will definately be visiting again and recommend to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After researching Rome hotels for some time I finally decided to choose the Capo D'Africa - and I was not dissapointed. This is possibly one of the best European boutique hotels I have stayed in. The entrance is amazing (very dramatic at night - palm trees all lit up at the door). The location is superb - right in the heart of ancient Rome. The Colloseum is literaly minutes from the hotel and indeed we covered every major toursit attraction on foot. The furthest away is probably the Vatican but again we walked there at a leisurely pace in around 40 minutes. The rooms are clean, modern, and well equipped with a turn dwn service. Service is excellent. Buffet breakfast is very good provided on a rooftop restauarant where you can see the Colloseum from the balcony. Overall, this is a modern, clean hotel with an excelent location. When leaving ancent Rome and heading towards Via Del Corso and the 'biz' of the city I found Rome to be very dirty and polluted and was glad to get back to the Haven of Capo D'Orso in the ancient part of the city. There are also some fab restaurants tucked away in the quiet side streets - I cannot reccomend enough Le Nauamachie - go there!!! When in Rome - stay at the Capo D'Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great, great!!!”
Reviews.Author: DCS
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. If you're into the old historic part of Rome, this is definitely the place to stay. Right down the street from the Collisium. Very clean and staff were nice. Breakfast was outstanding for a European style breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It is NO FAKE!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an 8 day visit to Rome with 7 nights spent in this hotel. It was an EXCELLENT choice, one based primarily on the comments from this web site. How anyone could not have good things to say about this place is a mystery to me. The location is great, close to many attractions and a few minutes walk to the Tram and the Metro which will get you almost anywhere a "tourist" would want to go in Rome. The staff were very friendly and accomodating, the place is spotless and the rooms are much better than you will find in most European cities in the price range. The breakfast was very good with lots of choice and the breakfast room was comfortable. Highly recommended! A & F Bennett, Toronto Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance of many of the major attractions which will save a fortune in taxi costs! The staff are very friendly, knowledgable and helpful and nothing seems too much trouble. Our flight didn't leave until 8:30 pm but the hotel arranged a taxi for us and stored our bags even though check out time is midday. The rooms aren't especially big but they are very comfortable. There is no restaurant but food is served at the bar by the very friendly barman and it was pretty good too, though with so many restaurants on your door step, why would you want to eat at the hotel anyway? I haven't stayed in Rome before so I can't compare this hotel with others in the area but I can say that it was a very enjoyable and comfortable stay and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It was vary nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Capo D'Africa Hotel in October 2004, for a long weekend. It was vary nice hotel in a great location. The continental breakfast was excellent. The room was comfortable after the air conditioning was fixed the next day. The only complaint, we left in the evening and were in the lobby, when I realized I had forgotten my watch in the room. I went back to the room and found the maid on the bed using her phone and the bell man sitting on my pressed trousers. They apologized and left.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here in August for my birthday weekend. Had a fabulous stay, very romantic place. Hotel was ideally situated, very classy styling. The rooms are very spacious and very comfortable. Liked it so much we are going back there for 3 days this Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “The excellent Capo D'Africa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise66
Reviews.Content: As a result of other TripAdvisor reviews, we stayed in this hotel during early December 2004 and found it to be as excellent as everyone said. It was perfectly situated by the Colloseum and close to the Metro Station. This modern hotel was welcoming, well-maintained, beautifully decorated and clean - definitely living up to my high expectations. The only slight down-side to the hotel is that they only provide breakfast and bar/room service meals - there is no restaurant. Having said this, there are many good quality restaurants/cafes close by that we used for lunch/dinner during our stay at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly stay there again the next time I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a fake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: clean, but not well managed, too expensive, bad mannered, too much noise from other rooms and staff while at work. rooms were small not checked often. we booked this hotel becuse of he great reviews it got but now we think they asked their friends who never even stayed there to make the wonderfull omments, examine them more close. avoid this lace at all costs. Tom and Family

Reviews.Title: “Did they move this place overnight?”
Reviews.Author: Croxley-Hopper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for three nights in early December 04. We were welcomed by a very friendly helpful member of Staff who took time to provide us with a map and circle the places of interest. The room was clean, spacious, with a well stocked mini bar and a silent yet efficient air conditioning. The style of the room is modern and minimalist, I found this a refreshing change from the usual cluttered chintz, but it’s a matter of taste; make up our own mind. This hotel is situated in a quiet road, an important consideration in Rome. The television could have done with another English-speaking channel, not just the ubiquitous CNN, but I suppose in the end you do not go to Rome to watch the idiot box. The breakfast was an excellent continental breakfast buffet. A choice of cereals, juices, fruits, pastries, bread rolls, ham and cheese. There is plenty of it and it will set you up for a days sightseeing. Using the hotel bar is not exorbitant and the service efficient and pleasant. Eating locally is very reasonable and the food first class. Just ask the hotel for their recommendation it was always spot on for us. Right, listen you lot! If you are a visitor to Rome and wish to see the sights of ancient Rome then you cannot do much better than this hotel, unless you manage to camp inside the actual Colosseum. This Hotel is a five-minute walk to the Colosseum, The Forum, Trajan’s Column and the Palatine hill. It is also a two minutes walk to the church of San Clemente, which is a little jewel. Being very close to the Colosseum means that this Hotel cannot be so close to the Vatican or the Spanish steps, although we still walked easily to both, I am afraid that is just the way things work in this time continuum. To sum up an outstanding hotel, with friendly staff, a good breakfast and well situated. What are you waiting for?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After months of research, my husband and I chose to stay at Hotel Capo d'Africa on our recent (11/2004) trip to Rome. This is a wonderful hotel in a terrific location. The people were very friendly and we had a great time. Be sure to say hello to Adolpho, the bartender, who is so nice and lots of fun! As far as we are concerned, we found a home and look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BagpussBee
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Rome with my boyfriend. It was very important that we stayed somewhere nice because I'd read several reviews of bad hotels in Rome on Tripadvisor so we decided that we'd pay a little extra to make sure our trip wasn't ruined by a dodgy hotel. Well, to be honest, its not that much more expensive and judging from some of the bad experiences people have had elsewhere, its well worth it. The Capo D'Africa is a lovely hotel situated at the far end of a street right opposite the Colosseum - and that's a sight for sore, weary eyes when you see it lit up at night - stunning!! The hotel is very tastefully furnished with lots of pieces of modern art, minimal but still not too bare. The staff were very friendly and only too happy to help - for instance the porter, on our way to check out on Monday, insisted on wheeling my suitcase for me the short way to reception! Our room was spacious with a wonderful view of the very old tower across the road and every morning while we were at breakfast, the Room Fairy came to tidy our room up for us and replenish our stocks of soap and shower gel. We even had our own bathrobe and slippers to wear. Breakfast was a buffet style affair and it would've been nice to sit out on the terrace but unfortunately the weather wasn't too special. However, we still enjoyed breakfast so that didn't matter. The hotel is perfectly situated for those who don't mind a walk, and really, its not far to the Colosseum and the Forum, other things take a little longer but there are so many lovely things to see, you don't notice the walk. Or there is a metro station just opposite the Colosseum, so however you want to get around - the hotel is not too far away. And there are plenty of places to eat and drink in the surrounding streets so I would highly recommend this hotel to make your stay in Rome perfect! PS - Go to the Trevi Fountain at night, its beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: linstustulin
Reviews.Content: Booked as a result of comments on Trip Advisor, excellent hotel with friendly staff also in a quiet area which made for a good nights sleep after a busy day sightseeing. A few fellow travellers on the flight home complained of hotels on busy streets and traffic noise which kept them awake all night. Plenty of restaurants in the area which were pleasant and good value for money which surprised me as I had been told Rome was expensive. The only downside was the torrential rain for most of our stay. Would certainly return to this hotel which is also within walking distance of most of the tourist attractions (take comfortable shoes). Highlight of trip was the Pantheon and Sistine Chapel

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was stylish yet unpretentious and relaxed. The staff were friendly and attentive and the room itself was exquisite (deluxe room, second floor) - Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Rome”
Reviews.Author: lawhergril
Reviews.Content: Very modern very nice hotel. The staff was EXCELLENT and we did not find them to be aloof at all. Of course we did at least try to speak a few words of Italian which always goes a long way and helps shed that ugly American English- is- King attitude that rightly offends many locals (if someone walked up to you speaking french in the USA and expecting you to understand, I think you would undersand)...Anyway, the location is excellent and it was very easy for us to get our bearings during our five night stay. I must admit at first I thought that while it was a very nice boutiquish hotel, I could not understand all the hype but as we walked about Rome and I saw other hotels in the area, I immediately understood and was greatful that we had chosen Capo D Africa for our stay. Very very highly recommended... I do want to add a word about one of the reviews below that accused the hotel of overbooking...it is telling that that Out of 63 reviews only one mentioned this problem and while I understand the posters frustration, I think it extremely unfair to assume that the hotel as a whole regularly overbooks simply because it happened once. I would think there would be several posts stating the same if it were in fact a regular practice of the hotel...okay got that off my chest....if you are looking for a stylish hotel central to the sights, this is an excellent choice. Thank you Tripadvisor for once again helping me pick the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location for wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we recently got married in Rome and stayed at Capo D'africa after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel is modern and welcoming with a lovely roof top breakfast room and a wonderful terrace where we all enjoyed a pre dinner drink while watching the sun set. Katia was so helpful in arranging our wedding meal in restaurant Al Tre Scalini just around the corner. Marco there ensured we had a good time, which we did. The food was fantastic, and later on we strolled down towards the colloseum at the end of the road. It was a great location with hairdressers, florists, lots of restaurants nearby. A hotel I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern Hotel with friendly and Professional Staff. Ideally situated in quiet area of Rome but conveniently located for sightseeing (5 mins to Colloseum which you can't see from Hotel!)Rooms Modern,very clean and very well presented as rest of Hotel. Staff suggested very good local restaurents for dinner. Great Buffet Breakfast on 4th Floor.I would stay here again. When getting from airport to Hotel use Hotel Courtesy car (Mercedes E-Class) as its 20euro's cheaper than Taxi and a damn sight more comforable.

Reviews.Title: “When In Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Capo in October 2004 and had a great time. The location is wonderful and convenient to Ancient Rome. The staff was friendly and helpful. They made really good suggestions of where to eat in the neighborhood. The rooms are bright and clean as is the breakfast room. The hotel is modern and the lobby and bar are inviting. The rooms were spacious and ours had a king size bed which sometimes is hard to get in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: mlaessig2
Reviews.Content: First of all, the positive was the location is wonderful just a few blocks from the Colosseum and the Forum ruins. However, we were underwhelmed by the service, in particular as related to a problem we had. Specifically, the air conditioning was not working in the hotel and it was quite hot. With it being in a busy area, opening the window for air circulation made it difficult to sleep as people and cars buzzed by. I spoke with the concierge about them not having A/C, and I was told that it was broken, but they offered no assurances that they were trying to fix it (which they didn't fix). All I got was a "it is not usually this hot this time of year," and an attitude that it was too bad for me. For a 4/5 star hotel that is quite expensive, I expect a working air-conditioning. If it isn't working, I expect an apology and a discount to make the apology real. But neither were offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great value. Staff at breakfast was friendly and warm. Room was small, very clean (although - not in brand new, excellent condition). Dining recommendation from front desk was below average. Overall - amazing location for a first time tourist in Rome, lovely staff and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: sdbrick
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews we read on this site and we were not disappointed. The hotel is new (about 2 years old) and in a great location -- a 5 minute walk from the Colisseum. It is also on a quiet street w/o a lot of traffic, which is unusual for Rome. This hotel is decorated with very modern decor, but it is also comfortable. The room was small but sleek and updated. There was granite and marble in the bathroom with a good shower. Everything was very clean and in good condition. The breakfast was very nice and was served on an upstairs terrace. I thought it was a very nice hotel, especially for the price, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. It is very centrally located near the Colloseum, yet it is on a quiet street that has some very nice restaurants. The staff was not particularly helpful, but the modern rooms and all the other modern conveniences of the hotel made up for some of the service shortcomings. The breakfast is particularly good and the terrace with the excellent view makes for a nice way to start the day. The rooms are also larger than average rooms in most European hotels. We would recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for seven nights. Staffs were very nice to me and the room offerd was very clean. Nice breakfast and very convenient access to the Colosseo, Foro Romano,... etc. If you simply need a confortable accomodation in Rome, go to this hotel. If you need more, go to Hotel Eden.

Reviews.Title: “Really Lovely”
Reviews.Author: shiv06
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, well worth a stay. Staff ultra helpful and friendly. Great roof terrace (and no you can't see the Colliseum but what the hell). Lots of good restaurants and bars nearby. Can recommend 'Tree Folks' bar for some good German beer on same road as hotel. One tip in Rome for all you animal lovers - go to the cat rescue sanctuary at the ruins in Torre Argentina. You will see some amazing ruins and help secure the future for some really needy cats. The rescue centre is run on a voluntary basis and all donations (no matter how small) are welcome. See www.romancats.com for more info. The rescue centre itself is tucked away at one end of the ruins and you are more then welcome to have a look around and give the cats a much needed fuss!

Reviews.Title: “don't spend more”
Reviews.Author: steve62
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights in Oct. location-2 blocks from Colosseum,mostly residential with a few sidewalk cafes,quiet and safe room-new,fresh and good size. bathroom all new with western shower that keeps the water in instead of all over the floor,a little cozy hotel-great lobby with bar and plenty of room to spread out staff- the BEST! from the bell staff to the front desk they were eager to please and are in the right business If you want ancient Rome at your feet without living in ancient Rome this is your spot.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a night during October 2004. We liked the the very helpful staff. We had a room in front and it was very quiet at night in this residential neighborhood. The room was excellent generally, with pretty much all the features you could reasonably expect, though I would have liked a little more control over the room's A/C. There is at least one decent restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Capo d'Africa is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuldJock
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four day trip to Rome with three friends staying at the Capo d'Africa Hotel. The hotel was excellent in every respect with very friendly and helpful staff. The bar service was a bit slow, but hey, when in Rome.....! Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The most impressive part of this hotel is that they had a room for us when we arrived at 7.30am in the morning. I had written requesting them to see if they could accomodate an earlier check-in and they had advised that they were fully booked so might not be able to. So it was a pleasant surprised when they had one last room available for us, albeit the first room on the lobby floor. Given the close proximity to the lobby/ bar, we were surprised at the quietness of the room. Nice, modern furnishings, very good bathroom and shower. The breakfast room was very nice - very bright and sunny with a terrace. Food was the standard continental affair - you get bread with hard boiled eggs together with cheese, ham/ proscuitto, yoghurt, cereal and juice. Serivce is good. About 10 mins walk from Colesseum Metro Station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: LilCo
Reviews.Content: We just stayed three nights at this hotel in late August and start of September. This hotel was our best and made it very easy to visit sites by walking to them. What I notice here is that it is getting four star ratings probably because the prices went up significantly in September. When we booked our trip to Italy, I noticed this price increase at all hotels not only in Rome but also on the Amalfi coast in Italy. In August we paid just under $150 a night but in September our room rate when up to just under $200 (all fees and taxes included) at the Capo DAfrica. Why this is so I don't know. I would have thought September to be cheaper than August but this was not the case!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed It”
Reviews.Author: Thaitraveller
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 4 nights staying at this very nice hotel in Rome. We booked it as the reviews on this site were so positive. We found the hotel to be in a quiet location, with plenty of places to eat close by and within walking distance of all the major sites. The furthest site was a 45 minute walk to the Vatican, but this was fine as you saw many historic sites along the way, plus it helps if you stop for coffee! Our room was tasteful decorated in neutral colours, very clean (housekeeping came in twice a day, to include a turn down service), and had a wonderful shower. The staff were pleasant, in particular at breakfast, where a very nice buffet breakfast was provided. The hotel was quite pricey, however we would recommend it to anyone as we enjoyed ourselves here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jxl36
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at this hotel in the first week of September after reading the reviews on this site and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is located in a quiet street with the Colliseum literally two streets away. The hotel is spotlessly clean and our room had a huge bed and fantastic bathroom with a great shower. There are some wonderful little touches too, such as the bathrobes, the maid turning down the bed etc. The staff are helpful and polite. The buffet breakfast was wonderful sitting outside on the roof terrace. It was quite expensive to stay here but all in all I think it was worth the extra. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A cool, elegant oasis close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here during a late August heatwave, and I just can't imagine that we could have enjoyed Rome as much if we hadn't stayed at Capo D'Africa! First off, a small criticism: the hotel is not actually "in the shadow of the Colosseum" as the advertisements would lead you to believe- it's actually about 3 blocks away. However, it is tucked away at the end of a very quiet street, which means restful nights away from traffic, noise and crowds. The hotel is beautifully decorated in a style that is ultra modern, yet still elegant and welcoming. We were given a very large corner room that had 12 foot ceilings and four huge windows (including one in the bathroom right beside the tub!). It was very comfortably furnished, immaculately clean, and included excellent amenities (plush robes, terry slippers, premium bath products, luxurious towels). The airconditioning worked beautifully!!! Which was very important given our condition when we returned to our room after trekking around the city for hours on end in 34 degree heat! The staff was professional, polished, helpful and discreet -- almost like one would expect at a Four Seasons. The rooftop terrace/breakfast room was a beautiful spot to start the day, and we often brought a bottle of wine up there again after a midnight stroll. This will definitely be our home base whenever we return to Rome! (Although I'm worried that all of these glowing reviews will make it even harder to get a reservation than it is now!).

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!!”
Reviews.Author: skydiva
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome before and pretty much knew where I wanted to be, which was around the Piazza Navona and Campo di Fiori (great areas for dining and libations). However, after having read the write-ups on this hotel I chose to stay here. I am not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful! The terrace where breakfast is offered is stunning. Breakfast is yummy. There are some restaurants and bars around the hotel. We did not try them though. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Colliseum, Forum, Pallantine Hills, Circus Maximus, Piazza Venezia, and more. It takes about 3/4 day to see all of these if you are up early. By the way I fully recommend getting a tour guide for the Colliseum because you get to cut the longest line in the history of the world, plus the tour includes the Forum. You do not need a guide for the catacombs, when you get there one is provided with your entrance and a cab ride is only like 10 euros. The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori are all a 5 minute cab ride away and all within walking distance from one another. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. However, next time I go I may stay at the Hotel Pantheon only because now I've seen the Colliseum and location, location, location.

HotelInfo.Name: Capo d'Africa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: via Capo d'Africa 54, 00184 Rome, Italy
